description:
Franchino is a wonderful little place in North Beach near Chinatown.  We got there a bit early as we had a large group and they don't take reservations.  I guess this is a family owned place which you could definitely tell.  The owner/host was so friendly, as well as the waitress.  We were treated very well.  Good service, great food, decent portions.  A nice little neighborhood place.

We shared a bunch of appetizers.  
Carpaccio Di Salmone - smoked salmon with lemon & capers
Bruschetta - toasted bread with tomatoes, basil, olive oil and garlic
Cozze Marinara - mussels with a spicy red sauce

I had the bruschetta.  It was very tasty.  Nice tomato flavor.  The others enjoyed the mussels and salmon.  

For my entree, I had the Prawns Picatta - prawns sautéed with butter, lemon & garlic. The prawns were nicely cooked.  Good flavor.  Sauce was  light and tart from the capers.  Came with a nice side of grilled veggies.  The rest of the group had a variety of items - different pastas and meat dishes.

We had some nice wine.  I had the house pinot grigio which was very good.  Also bottles of merlot and chianti.  All good.

Definitely a great little neighborhood spot.  Good food.  Wonderful service.  They make you feel like family.
author: Karen C.

description:
Plunked down in the middle of blocks of tourist-friendly Italian eateries, Franchino's is the real deal: Family-owned and operated, everyone there is either a mother, daughter, sister, cousin......

We have no idea if this is the best Italian in SFO since we have not even come close to sampling every joint in town but, the food here immediately transports us back to southern Italy where the Franchino family roots permeates each dish.

The restaurant is small and the service casual and efficient. The dining room feels like home (if home had ten dining tables) Every time we have been here it has been full with fun loving, local diners.

But how is the food? As good as anything we have eaten in Italy. On our last visit to Franchino's we had:

The gnocchi pesto was sublime. The dumplings pillow soft, the sauce smooth and perfectly balanced.

The arrebata was a wake-up call to my mouth. Zingy without being overpowering.

The Caesar was basic but what set it apart was the super high quality anchovy filets gracing the salad. We are convinced the reason people don't like anchovies is because they have never had quality fish. This will change you forever.

Finally the chocolate cannoli, made fresh to order can easily be shared but you won't want to.

Unlike the tourist places whose business model is "one and done", Franchino's depends on local repeat business and the experiences we have had here shows.

Obviously we like it. Our only misgiving ...how long it will take us to come back
author: Elwood P. D.

description:
Unfortunately, mediocre food but good atmosphere. I tried risotto and a pasta and both of them were unbelievably heavy and creamy. The food was completely swimming in a pool. 

Also, I understand the bread and olive oil are complementary and may be seen snobby to ask that to be good. However, whenever I don't have fresh, somewhat warm and soft bread, meaning, whenever they serve a bread that's super dry, that leaves a bad impression on me. It's a small detail, but that's the first thing your customers are putting into their mouth. Why would you not let that experience be a good one?

This place could be local favorite if they were priced reasonably. However with those high prices ($20+ for pasta), they are playing the "fancy" restaurant game which, apparently, they are losing.

For me it's another, not so good Italian food in our Italian neighborhood.
author: Gokhan T.

description: This is probably the best Italian place I've ever been to. Such a cute little restaurant with friendly staff. I got the Alfredo fettuccine with grilled chicken and oooo super good! Creamy and the noodles seemed homemade which made the meal even better! I also tried my friends meal and hers was delicious also. I cannot remember what she got exactly but when we ordered our server mentioned some specials they had and she chose one of those which had mushrooms and beef. It was my friends birthday and I'm not sure if they normally do anything for birthdays but when got our desert they put a little candle and sang happy birthday to her even gave one of our deserts for free for her bday! Absolutely love this place! I've been craving it again ever since! Here's a photo of my friends tortellini :) unfortunately I forgot to take a photo of mine and the mushroom beef pasta.
author: Jaylene C.

description: Oh my.  Where to begin.  On a busy street in San Fran they care.  Talk to you.  Ask about you.  Serve to your wants.  Wow.  Built a dish just for me.  Phenomenal.  You will not get better in downtown Sa Francisco !!!!  Period
author: Ryan F.

description: My friend and I were originally trying to go to a restaurant down the street but there was too long of a wait, so we came to Franchino because my friend had come once before and remembered it was good. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated quickly. They had an extensive menu and gave us some time to look at it while we munched on the bread they brought to our table. Honestly, there were so many options on the menu and too many words that I personally didn't understand, so looked through yelp and basically ordered through a photo that was uploaded of the tri colored pasta. They said it wasn't on the menu but they could do it for us and it was SO GOOD! Service was amazing and it seemed very homemade and authentic. Highly recommend!
author: Jacqueline H.

description: Small family owned restaurant with GREAT food!! Highly recommended if you're in SF and looking for authentic Italian food.
author: Valerie G.

description:
After wandering around Chinatown and Nob Hill area of SF on a Sunday evening and working up a good appetite, Franchino was decided for dinner. I'm happy to report that this wasn't a regrettable decision, in fact, I want to share my wonderful experience.

Apparently most people have reservations for this place, but luck was on my side for a table of 2 around 7pm as a walk-in.

I ordered the linguine con vongole, which is basically clam linguine with small bacon bites sprinkled in the dish. I loved that the pasta wasn't dry, the light sauce didn't make me feel guilty or sluggish after the meal. I also ate the Pasta Primavera with chicken. I'm not sure what's in the tomato sauce, but it's not your typical tomato sauce, I was licking my plate. The chicken was also very tender and everything paired well.

The restaurant is small in size, big groups might be difficult, but the setup is easy for conversations. Service was excellent, ambiance was great, restroom was clean, I hope to come back again soon!
author: Jean L.

description:
Yum! This is a great mom&pop restaurant in north beach. I visited with my family on a sanfran weekend trip and would definitely come back. 
Service: 5/5 
Restaurant: small, expect a wait if in a group 4+ and at peak hours; they take limited reservations each day
Food: 
Clams in garlic sauce: 4/5 delicious broth, good amount of clams
Pappardelle with sausage special: 5/5 This was the favorite of the table! The pasta was fresh and sauce was mouthwateringly delicious
Gnocchi: 4/5- we asked to get the three sauce version which was perfect so we could try all three types of sauces!
Penne amatriciana: 4/5- I've been obsessed with this dish since visiting Rome and this was delicious but not my favorite iteration
Pro tip: if you're hungry and waiting you can order appetizers/drinks while you wait!
author: Monica C.

description: Enjoyed this restaurant following a recommendation of a local. Very small family owned establishment.  Food was fresh and well prepared. Portions were generous. Not a fancy place at all or "trendy" just good food!
author: Deb N.

description: Absolutely delicious food and great service from the warm and friendly family who run the restaurant.
author: Alex R.

description:
This is a family owned Italian restaurant with home made recipes and operated by the actual family.  The pride that the family takes in both the quality of the food and the excellence of the service is immediately evident.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are generous.  We asked about the history of the restaurant and were treated to an inspiring story which was the quintessential American Dream come true.

Don't be fooled by the modest appearance-- some of the best Italian food that I've had and a warm welcome awaits you.

An excellent value, great food, and superb service.  We'll be back.
author: Dan R.

description:
We had dinner here last night for my 50th birthday, and it was WONDERFUL!   The food is great, the restaurant is quaint and charming. 
 The family who runs this is so attentive and kind.  They have an extensive wine list from Italy and California.  They came around and gabbed with us for a few moments, making things personable.  The food was outstanding.  We had the house chianti, my husband had the prawns in tomato sauce, and I had the manicotti.  Sooo good.  Then, as a surprise, I was given a heart-shaped tiramisu with a candle, and the entire restaurant sang happy birthday to me.  I usually do not like tiramisu, but this was outstanding.   Absolutely perfect birthday!  We will be coming back to this restaurant, guaranteed.
author: Lori B.

description:
This place is a true Italians dream. The pastas are fresh, the pancetta is authentic and the sauces are made from the heart. 
It's family run and it shows. They have so much love and appreciation for their patrons and it shows. Including the basket of bread to dip in evoo and balsamic while you wait for your mains to be perfectly crafted! 
We came in on a Saturday night around 5pm and only had to wait about 15 min!! Then, the carb list was handed to us and we started to induce our carb coma from heaven. My friends got the chicken parm (perfectly thin!! And breaded, with the perfect marinara) and the meat lasagna (perfectly layered with sauce and cheese and meat).
I had the fettuccine franchino. There's something inside me that compels me to order whatever dish on the menu that is named after the restaurant and it did not disappoint! The velvety sauce, the perfectly crisp pancetta and the veggies all come together to make this plate superb! If you're in the area, you must stop by!
author: Rachel S.

description: Amazing Italian food! My roommate and I came here for dinner during our visit to San Francisco. We were impressed! This is a small, family owned restaurant that gives off such a warm, traditional feel: The staff cater to your every need. This place was recommended by our Airbnb host: He was spot on about the food being fresh and delicious. Also, it should be noted that the pasta is hand made. I had the House Salad, Tortellini with Tomato Sauce, and a glass of Prosecco. Excellent food and service: I highly recommend this place for great Italian food :)
author: Lisnel V.

description: It was the worst of times, ''twas the best of times. Let me explain. I came to SanFran on business; weather was terrible so I ordered UberEats delivery from another restaurant and it was an hour thirty before I  was informed they needed to cancel because they couldn't find a driver. Really???  You are Uber right wtf? So I decided to brave the elements and head out to a local restaurant and the concierge steered me here. He was spot on! A local family owned gem that salvaged my worst of times dinner experience .Anytime I come to SF in the future I will be sure to stop in here again! Grazie!
author: Waiel A.

description:
Usually I try to patronise local moms and pops places. As a rule of thumb they give you good food at reasonable price and you proofs of supporting local business. 
This place is the rare exception. The portion size is miniscule. Usually you will get the appetizer of same place in any of places. Food is average homemade  taste (dont expect anything ground braking here) I but based on  the portion size is overpriced. Meat is literally sliced to the condition you could watch the other person through it. 
Lovely to experience once but never again.
author: Victor B.

description:
I like the idea of supporting the mom & pop spots in North Beach.  There's a bit of old-school charm to it.  The expectations are set, expected, etc.  Overall, we had a good experience.  There appeared to be the mother and her two daughters working the restaurant.  If you're hankering for pasta, this is the place.  No pizza is served here!  Service was fine and the food came out at a decent pace.  So, why just 3 stars?

Well, it really comes down to pricing and consistency of the food quality.  First, their website needs to be updated.  The prices listed there are $3-5 less than what is on their current menu.  The Caprese salad was small for $13.  The Linguine con Vongole was so-so in flavor and smaller in portion compared to the Spaghetti alla Carbonara and the Fettuccine Franchino.  The table next to us had the Tiramisu, which was equally on the smaller side of the portion scale.

They do seem to do a brisk amount of business, always being full and having a small line of people waiting.  Maybe I'm missing something...
author: Gene D.

description:
Came here for dinner, and it was a wonderful experience! This place is a small and family-owned, and it has such a warm atmosphere! We were promptly seated, and our waitress was super friendly- she said her mom was the one cooking everything! Also, someone in our group ordered a small bottle of pelligrino, but they only had the big bottles, so they gave her a big one for the price of one!

Now to the food- we started with the prosciutto melone. It comes with 4 slices of melon wrapped in prosciutto. I think for the price I would've expected a couple more pieces, but it was tasty and refreshing. For entrees, I got one of the special pastas, rigatoni with Italian sausage, mushrooms, and a sauce with a touch of blue cheese. It was supposed to be served with fresh pappardelle instead of the rigatoni, but they were all out of the pappardelle! The dish was delicious though! Other dishes we ordered were the special ravioli filled with braised beef and spinach, the chicken piccata, and the veal parmesan. We all loved our food! The only thing I'd ding them for is the specials were on the pricey side for the portions ($22). Regardless though, we all really enjoyed our dinner here and would definitely come back!
author: Rachel D.

description: Excellent homemade Italian food.  I love the chicken picatta which has a great balance of tangy, caper, tender chicken goodness!
author: Jenna R.

description: Josephine the owner knows how to bring the feeling of the old country to the states. From the trattoria style corner restaurant to the last bite of desert with your coffee! Wow! This place is a hidden gem. The food is fresh. Prepared properly and served up quick. Not to mention. In my opinion, you get a 5 star meal for a 2 star price. This place simply has things figured out. I went the last two times I was in San Fran and I will be back every time. Love it! Keep up the great work!
author: Brian W.

description:
There are so many Italian restaurants in North Beach and especially on Columbus. My daughter found Franchino on Yelp and we called to make sure they were open on New Year night. Luckily for us they were open. 

We walk in and it's a nice small restaurant decorated with wine bottles, Christmas lights and a bunch of family pictures. I love family own businesses. Nice fancy tables. Some of the tables are pretty close together but I just loved the Italian vibe. 

We started off with the Bruschetta. They give you four pieces on a bed of lettuce and green olives. They stack up high with diced tomatoes and olive oil. I thought it was pretty good. Not great but good. 

I had the Veal Marsala with grilled vegetables. It came with three thinly sliced veal covered in Marsala sauce and mushrooms. I thought it was pretty good. Sauce was okay and the veal was cooked perfectly. I loved the grilled vegetables. Cooked just right. It had Brussel sprouts, carrots, green beans. Really good. 

My wife and daughter shared the Spaghetti Al Ragu with a sausage sauce. They both really liked it. Wasn't a very big plate but enough for them. They were both satisfied. 

My son got the Linguine Con Vongole which is basically with clams in the shell and he added chicken. He was raving about this. Really liked it. He wasn't happy about going out for Italian tonight cause he wanted sushi but after he had this dish he was really happy. 

To end our meal, I got a cappuccino and we decided to share a Spinoni. It was dipped in chocolate, had a cherry on top with an Italian flag on top. We asked if they made this and the lady said that this was imported from Italy. I got to tell you this was so good. It had chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla. I know those are basic flavors but it was really good. Melt in your mouth goodness. So good. 

So overall, the service was really good. Really liked the older lady serving us. Nice lady. The food was really good. Outstanding. Then the Italian family vibe. Really liked it. Could hear the staff talking with some of the customers and you can tell they have a lot of regular customers. If I lived here I would be one of their regular customers too. So enjoy. We did
author: Doug T.

description:
Another review that is long overdue. 

The word that describes this place: family. A warm, homey atmosphere that never disappoints when it comes to comfort (Italian) food. The restaurant is family run as well so you always see familiar faces, which is always a thumbs up in my book. Plus everyone there is extremely courteous and friendly, which makes service even better. 

The quality and freshness of its ingredients and the skill of the kitchen staff is absolutely 5-star, and I consider it to be the best Italian restaurant of all in SF. 

Try it once and you'll be a regular like me, I guarantee it.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
I have to say, one of the best places in North Beach that I have been to.  As far as bang for your buck.

Some friends and I stopped by here after drinks and ate 3-4 dishes and some dessert.  The service and the food was pretty good.  This place gives in pretty decent quantities too.  

I'd have to say the venue is pretty small, but I guess it is SF and its a smaller mom and pop place.  And it does have the small town restaurant feel to it.  But the food was awesome.

We had dessert too and the NY cheesecake was off the HOOK!
author: Cliff S.

description:
My wife and I ate dinner at Franchino this evening and I don't know where to start with my compliments. We had the great pleasure of meeting and speaking with the owner Josefine and her daughter Monica. 

The food was absolutely delicious. After beginning with Caprese, I had the Veal Primavera and my wife had pasta pescato. Since we were celebrating our 32nd wedding anniversary, Monica brought us a heart shaped piece of Tiramisu like we've never tasted anywhere or ever before, wow.  

We'll return to see Josefine and Monica the next time we're in SF and I encourage anybody looking for phenomenal home made Italian cuisine to dine at Franchino, it's like eating in Josefine's kitchen, motherly love included at no charge :)
author: Aaron G.

description:
This review is long overdue. I discovered Franchino over the summer and this place has quickly become my go-to Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Franchino has been family owned and operated for over twenty-eight years. Located in North Beach, this is a restaurant you should add to your dinner list. I've tried several dishes but lately I've been sticking to my favorite which is the house salad, Fettuccine Franchino (I substitute the fettuccine for pappardelle) and limoncello dessert. The salad is basic but very good. The pasta is to-die-for! It's simple but perfect. The Alfredo sauce is made to order and the pasta is always fresh. The limoncello dessert rounds out this perfect meal with a light and refreshing finish. 

There are not tricks here. Everything is made with love and the service is just as outstanding as the food. If you're lucky mama might have a special you can try.
author: Valerie D.

description:
"My mother made fresh Pappardelle this morning." 

Few things make me as excited as hearing those words. 

I decided on Franchino because of their quaint family oriented vibe and their years in service in San Francisco's North Beach neighborhood. The wait staff are the original owners and their family, Mother and daughter were amazing hosts and answered any questions we had about the menu. 

I decided to go with the Special, the fresh handmade Pappardelle with Italian Sausage. It originally came with a tomato sauce, which I asked to change to a "Pink Sauce".   Which is a blend of the tomato and the cream sauce. 

The accommodation for sauce was not an issue at all and the food came out piping hot within 10 minutes of putting in the order! 

Momma was over immediately to offer some Parmesan cheese, which I wish was freshly grated. But was instead ground up in a container. 

The first bite was heaven!! The sauce was perfectly tangy with a rich creaminess to balance out the acidity. Every bite following was equally as incredible. The chunks of Italian sausage were delicious and flavorful and the Pappardelle was perfectly cooked. 

Over all I would give Franchino a 
5/5 for service 
5/5 for food and food quality 
5/5 for adorable family ambiance. 

Found out they are celebrating 28 years in business and want to make sure they celebrate many more! 

Chin chin
author: Parisa P.

description: So disappointed! Yelp led us here based on the reviews. It must have been an "off"night for the chef. We had a party of 6 and ordered 6 different dishes. Only two were noteworthy. The veal and seafood pasta were ok. The clam linguini was supposed to be in a wine and garlic sauce, but other than a couple of burned cloves there was no flavor. They definitely forgot the wine. Ordered al dente...nope.  won't return or recommend.
author: C P.

description: This place is amazing. I went out to San Francisco with my family. I was craving good Italian food or should I say more of a feel at home food. Their food is delicious and we got great service. 5 starts for the whole ambiance and food.
author: Dc B.

description: Maybe my favorite Italian spot in the city. Owned and operated by the Franchino family, it's an adorable little restaurant with nice ambiance and laid back vibe. Something for everyone, from an amazing pasta list to some great Italian meat dishes. Plus great specials and nice bread with olive oil and vinegar as you wait for entrees. Good portions for the price, and made daily by Mama Franchino herself! A refreshing choice right on the main tourist strip on Columbus.
author: Abby H.

description: Hands down BEST GNOCCHI I've ever had. Warm and friendly staff, definitely a family restaurant. This is the type of food you want to eat slowly to be able to savor all of the great flavors.
author: Isabel O.

description: Could not recommend this place enough! Every dish we had was absolutely delicious and the staff was incredibly friendly. The homemade pasta is perfection. This is the place to go, if you're looking for excellent authentic Italian food.
author: Kate M.

description: Last year, my mom and I went to Italy for our birthdays. We ate ridiculously well! This year, my mom visited me in San Francisco and I wanted to take her to get Italian food that matched our experience in Italy. Enter Ristorante Franchino! I found the place online and was engrossed in Franchino and Giuseppina Nozzolino's story. My mom and I had dinner here and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD! We shared the caprese salad and prosciutto and melon appetizers. I got the gnocchi and my mom got the lasagna. Both were fabulous, but if I had to pick, I'd say the lasagna was better. Everything is homemade, and we even got to meet Giuseppina and her two daughters who were the servers. We literally felt like we were back in Italy. If you are in SF and want legit Italian food, go to Franchino!
author: Shawna M.

description: Really, skip it. The very positive reviews / mythic story of a family-run business are misleading. Extremely mediocre food and very expensive considering the poor quality. Watery sauce, underwhelming seafood. Super bummer. Go to Fiorella in the Richmond if you want to drop $17 on pasta. Theirs tastes much, much better.
author: Scarlet C.

description: The chicken marsala here was wonderful. I really like this restaurant - the charm, location, service and food are top notch. It's a great date spot and a place to bring parents visiting town as well. Definitely recommend!
author: Rachel G.

description:
This is a North Beach gem.  It is family owned and run, and you can taste the love in the food.  The ambience is warm and inviting, has lovely pictures of the owners on the walls. We had a beautiful antipasti plate to start, and shared the risotto and home made lobster ravioli which was delicious and cooked to perfection.
We topped the meal of with tiramisu and a heavenly limoncello dessert that I will be thinking about until I return soon.
If I could give more than five stars, I would.
author: Heather B.

description:
"What's fresh today?" That's what my tall, part-Italian date asked as soon as we sat down. This spot is one of his favorites in town. And as the server listed off all the fresh pasta of the day, I absorbed all the feels of this place. It has small, family home feel that's so welcoming, you can't go wrong with anything you get.

I forgot what I ordered but I remember my date's lasagna. Whoa, how can I get more of that without getting enormous from a carb overload? Definitely the right pick when you want to say "forget it" to your diet.

Grab a bottle of wine to share and call it a perfect night!
author: Nitar L.

description: My fave spot for Italian in the city by the bay!  The ravioli is wonderful!  This place is small, quaint and yet divine!  Love the family effort put into the great service!
author: Gene M.

description:
After a long day in San Francisco, my girlfriend and I were craving some quality authentic Italian food.  While walking around North Beach we came across Franchino's small little restaurant which was packed with people.  We figured that had to be an indication of how good this place was so we decided to make this our choice for dinner. 

Ambiance:  A very small and dimly lit restaurant, Franchino definitely creates a friendly and comfortable atmosphere.  Although you are practically shoulder to shoulder to the tables next to you, Franchino's set up really makes you feel as though you are in a family members kitchen.  You are surrounded by an amazing smell of food, wine bottles all over the wall, zany paintings and other fun decoration which make you feel as though you really are in someone else's home.

Food: They have a decent sized menu with a variety of simple classic Italian dishes.  My girlfriend ordered the vegetable lasagna while I ordered the veal marsala and some bruschetta as an appetizer.  The bruchetta was very tasty with the nicely toasted bread, bright tomatoes, basil. garlic and olive oil.  My girlfriends lasagna was layers of delicous cheese, sauce and veggies.  My veal was perfectly cooked and topped with mushrooms and a rich and flavorful marsala sauce.  Overall the food here was very good and my girlfriend and I will be adding Franchino towards the top of our lists for great Italian food in SF.

Service:  The restaurant is family run and you can very easily tell throughout your meal.  Everyone is so polite and helpful when it comes to your meal.  They all very genuinely care about making sure you are taken care of as if you are guest in their own homes.  

Overall Experience:  Franchino is a great restaurant with amazing Italian food with a wonderful staff.  I highly recommend stopping by if you are in the area and need a place for a nice dinner.
author: Nathan N.

description: Love this place! Discovered it many years ago and I just came recently and it's still just as amazing. I ordered the spicy penne arrbiatta pasta and it was perfection! The waitresses are the daughters of the owners and the mom is there working as well. Love the family feel of this place and service is great too! Can't go wrong with this place, look forward to coming back!
author: Nessa H.

description: Walking all over San Fran for great Italian food and stumbled upon this gem. Home made pasta cooked al dente. Great service with a visit from mama who earlier that day made her own pasta. Finished the night off with panna cotta topped with a strawberry sauce and a glass of Port. I very rarely write reviews but this place deserved one. I really enjoyed my dinner and down time with my family after a day of sightseeing. Thanks Franchino!
author: Tami R.

description: The food was fantastic, the staff was warm and friendly and we left happy and full. I even was able to speak to the cook/owner which was a pleasant take from the busy restaurants you experience today.
author: Melissa P.

description: Looove this restaurant!  The best Family Italian Restaurant in SF in my opinion!
author: Karri Mae B.

description:
Awesome pasta with the veal! Atmosphere here is ITALIAN. Lovely Italian ladies are serving delicious food!

Seafood risotto wasn't so incredible I would go with pasta here!
author: Alina B.

description: We were underwhelmed. The bruschetta seemed premade and the cheese on the lasagna was poor quality.  Unfortunate.
author: Nancy A.

description:
I'm married to an Italian.He is picky about his Italian food and what tastes authentically Italian.We always wander the North Beach district when we are in SF looking for the hike in the walls that look family owned.A few years ago we were walking down Columbus and encountered a man in a suit and fedora outside his restaurant calling out to passersby and bursting into opera.That got our attention.

We were quickly seated and introduced to his wife and daughters.I ordered seafood pasta and hubby asked for whatever she wanted to make him.She chose homemade sausage dish.It was pure,pure, awesomeness and now we never ever go anywhere else for Italian food when we are in the city.I wish that they were open for lunch.
author: Clare F.

description:
Review #950

You had me at homemade pappardelle w/sausage. That was the special that night that we came and boy was I a happy camper. 

The sauce was robust and flavorful but did lean towards the saltier end. The addition of the sausage helped to amplify the dish even further. My only call out would be that the noodle was overcooked and veered on the softer side. 

Side note, you can order the gnoochi dish with sauces half and half. Gnoochi was well made, lite and airy with a toothy bite

Seating is limited and tight but it is fitting with the charming ambiance they have created

Overall Thoughts

Feels like a mom and pop Italian restaurant transplanted straight out of Italy
author: Eddie W.

description:
Whoa, that was a delicious experience! Out of the many options in the area, we thankfully landed here.

Two of us shared the Bruschetta, tri-color Gnocchi Della Casa, and the Veal Marsala. I can try and describe the experience but you really must try it; like I've heard of soft, pillowy gnocchi but tasting is another story.

The brushcetta was bright and flavorful, gnocchi was smooth and we enjoyed being able to try 3 of their sauces, and the veal marsala was fireeeee. The marsala wine sauce was so succulent we almost forgot about the tender veal.

Overall, it was a great experience. The restaurant is small but has a comforting vibe and the service was great. I'm convinced that anything out of that kitchen will be just as good.
author: Raymond L.

description: Wow, this place is great! A cute, small, family-owned gem in little Italy that's not to be missed. Their pasta was fresh, homemade and delicious. I had the gnocchi which was light and fluffy - the way you want it to be. My boyfriend had the spaghetti carbonara and it was the best he's had - made with egg, pancetta, onion, no cream! Definitely worth a stop.
author: Molly H.

description:
If you are looking for an amazing, hole in the wall, family run Italian restaurant in Little Italy, this is it!  We knew we were in the right place when the waitress said, "push my mom aside to get to the table."  (Mom makes all of the pasta!)

We had the lasagna and the pappardelle with Italian sausage - you can't miss it!  The pasta was perfectly al dente, the sausage was flavorful and the lasagna was rich and delicious.  We topped it off with a reasonable and great bottle of the house Chianti.  A great SF find!
author: Wendy v.

description: Most amazing meal I have ever had. We went for a birthday dinner and all servers were SO INCREDIBLE!!!!! Such a special place.
author: Nichola R.

description:
Wonderful Italian restaurant !!!
If you are in San Francisco , a must stop for dinner . Owners will treat you as family and the food is delicious !!!
author: John I.

description:
Really overpriced, although it's a cute restaurant.
Dishes weren't that spectacular as everyone raves. About ~$25/pp.
author: Hanna M.

description: The only better Italian food I've had was in Italy. I enjoyed the "gnocchi special" an off-menu dish that was essentially gnocchi ravioli stuffed with cheese and mushrooms. It was so rich and delicious I would definitely make another trip to the city to try other menu items. Even the coffee following the meal was perfect, rich and smooth, not bitter at all. Best Italian food I have had in the US hands down
author: Sarah B.

description:
Easily the BEST Italian food I've ever had at a restaurant and that's saying a lot, given that I'm Sicilian. Seriously, the food is as good as my grandma's cooking was. After eating at quite a few Italian restaurants in North Beach, I can comfortably say that this is now my go-to place. The pasta is freshly-made, the appetizers (try the grilled, marinated vegetables!) are amazing, the sauces are always delectable and the customer service is second-to-none. The three wonderful women who run the place are ALWAYS friendly, full of suggestions and make you feel like you just stepped into your grandmother's home for Sunday night dinner. I look forward to going to San Francisco JUST so I can eat at Franchino! Don't let the high prices at other restaurants trick you into thinking their food is better. At Franchino, they're able to serve delicious, homestyle food at affordable prices.

Just writing this review makes me hungry for Franchino. Can't wait to visit them again when I head up to San Francisco this weekend!

P.S. If you're craving dessert, ask for the bomba. You won't regret it!
author: Vincent P.

description: I went here for a work dinner with a few of my colleagues.  It was recommended by a friend who swears by it.  I reserved judgement but looked forward to trying it out.  The place is small but that is part of its appeal.  It felt like I was eating dinner at a friends home, due to how welcoming the staff was. The appetizers we ordered were fantastic.  Prosciutto melons, red pepper mozzarella,  Caesar salad, and gnocchi with pesto sauce got us started!!! Everything was great.  I ordered lasagna and my friends ordered the lobster ravioli and the shrimp rigatoni. This was paired with 2 great bottles of wine and followed by tiramisu.  I am considering going again tonight based on how good it was and how many new things I want to try.  Consider this place a slam dunk and go!!!
author: Andy R.

description: Food here was excellent. Had the scamorza as an appetizer and it was soooo good. Had the chicken parmigiana with pasta and tomato sauce and it tasted amazing. Everything here tasted so fresh, definitely worth coming back to
author: Victor V.

description: First time here and I love the atmosphere and the family that owns and runs this restaurant. The bread was a a little ordinary to start -- just too basic. But the Insalate Della Casa was spot on with a homemade dressing. My wife had the prawns in garlic which she loved and she doesn't even care for garlic. I had the special. I wish I could tell you the name because it's not on the menu. It was homemade flat noodles with red sauce and homemade sausage. Amazing. So, the lesson here is that if there is a special, just get it.
author: Roger H.

description: Best eggplant parmigiana I ever had. I actually had a very good vibe once I entered the restaurant and was greeted by the Nona (Italian grandma). My first thought was: oh, man, this is going to be some bomb Italian food! I was right. My husband chicken dish was accompanied by Alfredo pasta and the sauce was AMAZING! The Alfredo sauce was actually way better than the one I had at the Alfredo di Roma restaurant, the restaurant that actually created Alfredo sauce. My eggplant parmigiana was so tasty, cooked to perfection and accompanied to delicious pasta with homemade tomato sauce. The prices are a bit expensive for pasta but totally worth it. Very small restaurant, I would recommend making reservations prior to arrival.
author: Mahozina E.

description:
Had dinner here Saturday night. A nice family owned sweet little place. Has a few tables and walk ins only. Call in a day earlier if you want to make reservations.

We started with the bruschetta, minestrone soup, prosciutto with melons, and a special that consisted of buratta cheese with eggplant. The best bruschetta ever. The minestrone was flavorful but light on heat. The eggplant didn't look or taste like eggplant and I am not complaining. 

The appetizers turned out to be pretty filling, so we got 3 entrees to share among 4 people. We got the risotto with salmon, the gnocchi with pesto, and penne primavera with veggies. All were awesome. My favorite was the risotto. I loved that the salmon wasn't overpowering. Portion sizes are pretty good, and sharing worked for us.

We ended with an icecream dessert- a chocolate icecream with a filling of vanilla and hazelnut icecream. It was spectacular. Loved everything
author: Dee V.

description: Don't go to any of the touristy places.   Trust me.  Go here.  Fresh pasta made by the mom in this family owned business.  Great food, served by the daughter.   You want real good food and authentic atmosphere in a family owned business.  Go here.
author: Gregg F.

description: So so good! A wonderful family vibe( as the mom cooks everything). The food was delicious and creative( not your standard marinara, lasagna etc as you'd find in other restaurants nearby), and the waitress even made sure to give us extra bruschetta for the whole table( I believe the regular serving was 4 but she gave us 6 because there was 6 of us, for no extra charge). And don't get me started on the dessert, that tirsasmu and that cannoli were amazinggg.
author: Katherine M.

description: Authentic Italian family owned restaurant.  Very friendly owners and staff. Quiet atmosphere for date night. The portions are perfect and truly great location in North Beach. Very attentive to you needs and makes you feel at home.
author: Erick H.

description: Small but very authentic Italian restaurant. The owners are right there seating you, bringing you bread, taking your order but most importantly they actually make their food fresh. Gnocchi was fabulous but couldn't decide on what sauce, so they put all 3 on my dish. Delish!
author: Tonya C.

description: Went here last night as a celebration with my guy. We were just walking around after the original place we were going to go to didn't seem that great and we decided to stop here after not being able to make a decision on anywhere else. I had the Italian sausage special and it was AMAZING. My guy had a chicken something with noodles and he loved it as well. The bread was delicious. The salad was amazing. The staff was friendly and fun. It felt like they actually enjoyed having us there. They recommended an excellent wine to pair with our meal. It took me a good 45 minutes to find on a map where we went because I didn't remember the name but I wanted to make sure this small family type restaurant got some credit for being absolutely lovely.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I like to think of myself as a food snob. But then again, I am one of those people who thinks Olive Garden is a great destination for "authentic" Italian food. After my experience at Franchino, Franchino has replaced Olive Garden as my measurement for delicious Italian food. 

I have walked through Little Italy, SF many many times in my lifetime and I never knew Franchino existed until my 10,953th time this past Sunday. The restaurant is a bit hidden and easy to miss. There's no giant sign in front of their restaurant like Calzone's and there's no restaurant hosts gawking at pedestrians to come inside. Franchino is a little secret in Little Italy, like that there are no advertisements for it...

I don't want to ruin anything for you Yelpers but if you want a true Italian culinary experience, you have got to come inside Franchino and experience it yourself. This is the place to be if you want to be treated like family!
author: Philip M.

description: Great Italian restaurant in the heart of North Beach in San Francisco. This place has been around since 1975! I think it's family run, think I saw the owner running around from the photos on the wall. Very good quality food. They have a good red sauce marinara.
author: Peter K.

description: Absolutely delicious Italian food and great service. Ordered the Fettuccini with pesto and chicken and the Penne Arrabbiata with chicken. The Arrabbiata was supposed to be spicy but had no heat to it, otherwise it was delicious!!!
author: Katharina M.

description:
I stepped in here for a very early dinner at the recommendation of a SFPD officer. He said this restaurant was the last of the old mom and pop restaurants and he was right!! We ordered the appetizer sampler which I don't recall being on the menu but since we wanted to try a little of everything our sweet server happily obliged us!

I had the clam linguini as I always do at an Italian restaurant! It's my go to dish and register of how good an Italian restaurant is. Anyways, the homemade noodles were amazing! They held the white wine and olive oil so well. The clams were all fresh and I would have ordered a second to go had I not been getting on a plane!

The best part of this restaurant though, was the mother and owner of the restaurant. She was very friendly and made us feel welcomed! 

I took their business card with the hope that I visit and eat here again!!

Delicious!!
author: Veronica S.

description: I wandered into this quaint and unassuming place off the street. What a great experience. This family-owned and -managed gem is perfect for a cozy, comfort meal of a Italian and Italian-American favorites. Prices are good and portions are generous! The family/staff are all about making you feel at home - the kind of place where they might pull up a chair with you. Good wine list. Only 14 tables. Definitely save room for dessert. I had their tiramisu and was not disappointed. Yum!
author: Daniel B.

description:
Wonderful place to go  
Great family environment 
With a History of authentic Italian food for many years
The  ingredients are fresh as possible with the best  high quality Italian products  when you're there you feel at home with a  great homestyle dinner
 I highly recommend it
author: Giovanni L.

description: Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The food is amazing, the ambiance is fantastic and the family interactions are great. I've brought my entire family here from all over the world and they agree. Definitely don't miss this place while you're in North Beach! And ask for food recommendations, they won't steer you wrong.
author: Ellen M.

description:
Really good family owned Italian restaurant.  It looks like somewhere the locals go, and not as much catered to tourists or the younger crowd.  Restaurant is small and quiet.  Felt cozy with the dated decor.  

Service was attentive with only one server running the floor.  Food came out faster than expected.  Capellini and lasagna were both amazing.  One of the best lasagna I've ever had.  Prosciutto appetizer is plain, and not worth the price.  For $16 you get three thin slices of prosciutto over some cantaloupe and that's it.  I expected more than that.  

Entrees were awesome but only four stars because the restaurant smelled bad and bread wasn't good. It was like waking in a small apartment that had a big dog.  There were no signs of pets, but it definitely smelled like it!  For the bread, server brought out a basket of old pre-sliced bread she pulled from a stack against the wall.  Fix the odor problem and serve fresh bread please!
author: John L.

description: Wonderful experience! I'm in the city for business and staying local to little Italy. I was walking the streets to get a feel for what restaurant I, being alone, would feel comfortable. I passed this little place and read the review saying it has great sauce, local ownership, real Italian cuisine. I went in and found a perfect spot for 1 looking out the window to people watch. The owner and her daughter were so diligent about check in on me, I had my order in no time. I got red wine, insalata mista, fresh bread w oil and vinegar, then the amazing photo attached! Sauce was great and I even somehow had room for desert. I had a decaf cappuccino w tiramisu--delicious. The owner came by and checked in, also very considerate asking if I was from around here. I told her my story and she was very relatable and genuine. Celebrating her 29th year in business! Go here if you can. I know there's many choices but you can't go wrong here.
author: Heather B.

description: Went to franchino last night with a few friends who are big big fans. It's an adorable family fun place with a very cozy vibe. Ordered the spaghetti con calamari and my husband got the risotto in tomato sauce. Both were absolutely decadent. Our friends had the fettuccine Alfredo which was delicious but too creamy to my liking. The special gnocchi was delicious. Like little pillows of heaven. Ended with the tiramisu which was alright. Sweeter than most. I wasn't a big fan. The servers (the daughters of the lady who cooks) were wonderful. They very carefully explained the special, the veggie alternatives they could do and the pairings. It was all in all a great place. One of my favourites.
author: Ashmita V.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city and the only place outside of my Grandmother's house where I will actually clean the plate of all sauce as well as pasta. I have tried numerous Italian places throughout San Francisco and it has never been topped. Everything here is fresh made and incredible. Owned (and run) by an Italian family who does the cooking. Their hospitality is excellent and the food is out of this world. Order some wine. Order some pasta. Order some dessert and coffee. Enjoy the small intimate setting and the perfect ambiance. And forget, just for a second, that you aren't actually in Italy.
author: Sara H.

description: A personal favorite since it's opening. We always try and return to this quaint family run place on Columbus. Nice selection of pastas and seafood. Worth a stop.
author: Nick N.

description: We have been to Franchino every time we've visited San Francisco over the last 5-6 years. It is a family owned business and the food and service is always exceptional. Sadly, we discovered today that the old proprietor who used to regale us with Ole Sole Mio passed away a few months ago, but the food and ambience was outstanding. The gnocchi here is the best I've ever had. Enjoy!
author: Tom W.

description:
This is quite possibly the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to in the States. I had the Spaghetti Carbonara, but dining with others I sampled their dishes. The Carbonara is very tasty, simple, straight forward. 

The lasagna had the best cheesy crust and amazing combination of flavors. The Mushroom risotto had a wonderful earthy taste and creamy texture with perfectly cooked risotto. 

The Fettuccini Alfredo? The best I have ever had, hands down. It gave me chills. Don't tell mama, this Alfredo is better than hers. 

Stop here. The space is small, the wait may be long, but you will not have such an amazing meal anywhere else. Wait, no matter how long the line. 

Review summarized: Amazing food, better than your mama makes it.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Franchino was delightful, the food was delicious, the service was pleasant and the ambiance was perfect.  This is not one of those tourist-trap restaurants where they herd you in from the streets.  This is family owned and operated with a thoughtful and plentiful wine list and a menu chock-full of so many delicious dishes, that it was really hard to choose.  
We brought our own bottle of wine, their corkage fee is steep at $18, but it was worth it to share the special bottle that my boyfriend and I brought.  

We ordered the bruschetta, and although tomatoes are out of season, the grill flavor on the bread leant a savory and very interesting flavor to the dish.  Part of what I mean to say is that if I were vegetarian, I might not order this dish, the bread tasted like grilled meat residue - which I liked :)

My man ordered the bistec and it had an intense flavor of rosemary.   I imagine they must marinate it for quite some time to achieve that.  It came with a side of pasta in his choice of sauce (he asked for meat sauce) and he loved it.  

I ordered the house gnocchi which you can choose the sauce.  I had a dish at a Sapore in Burlingame where they mixed their gorgonzola sauce with their meat sauce 

http://www.yelp.com/biz/sapore-burlingame?hrid=GsiYxQR5oFDMCuYm6bPcRw&utm_campaign=www_review_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)

It wasn't on the menu, but Yelpers gave me the insight.  It was incredible.  So I asked our server at Franchino if they would do that and she said no.  She said they wouldn't recommend doing that because the gorgonzola sauce was so intensely gorganolza-y that she didn't know what would happen (lol).  She offered, somewhat hesitantly, to split the plate with gorgonzola sauce on one half and meat sauce on the other.  I ordered that and mixed it all up and it was PHENOMENAL!!!!!  Do not miss this dish you guys!!! And Franchino, please consider adding it to your menu.  Just try a bite of it, I think you will agree!  But you'll need to name it after me.  Call it Gnocchi ala Emmiliana *kisses fingers in the air* 

If you're in North Beach and want a quaint, quiet, authentic Italian meal, pass the strip and dead over to Franchino.
author: Emma H.

description:
We just stopped here after Cobbs comedy club.  The food was great and the service was excellent! We will be back for sure. 
Canneloni wasn't on menu, but Chef made it (@9:30 pm!).
Eggplant parmigiano was excellent, as was their spin on spumoni.
Waitress was adorable (owners daughter)
author: Kelley K.

description: Don't let the modest exterior fool you! Although this smallish place is overshadowed by flashier neighbors (you'll know to whom I'm referring looking at Franchino from across the street), it's really what you want in terms of good food and  family orientation. The interior walls, on the other hand, sport a huge wine rack to the rafters (not sure how they actually retrieve the bottles) and a nice balance of mirrors and Renaissance-ish paintings. Each front door panel holds a simple watercolor flower imprint rather than bare glass.  The mother-daughter duo engaged in good-natured, mock family "discord" which fooled no one. Admittedly, I had a simple dish - grilled vegetable antipasto - that may not translate  to pasta, flesh or seafood, but my dish was well-executed and not done by rote. I'm glad I took a bit of a chance on Franchino. Opens 5 pm.
author: Bruce B.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in SF!!

This is as close to homemade as one can get. We always bring our out of town guests and they love. 

Friendly, family atmosphere. 

I love that the whole family works at the restaurant.
author: Tammy F.

description: An excellent restaurant. Comfortable setting and great authentic tasting Italian cuisine. This homemade pasta is a stand out and among the best i've had EVER. I originally started this review in 2013 and forgot to click submit and found the draft. Ooops! But these statements hold true today as i've yet to have a better Italian dining experience since. Memorable place.
author: J P.

description: Great Italian food in a simple yet beautiful restaurant. Service was excellent as well. Ordered the homemade gnocchi with tomato sauce and it was delicious. The sauce was one of the best I have had in a while. Tables are a little too closely spaced for my liking, the ones by the window offer more privacy.
author: Meghna G.

description: Not sure why it's a 4-star spot with high amount of reviews. Unsatisfying and overpriced food. Don't recommend.
author: Wentao L.

description:
Oh my goodness!!! I have no idea how to explain to you how amazing the food is at this place. I got the house salad, bruschetta and the chicken alfredo with chicken and broccoli! Definitely coming back to this place anytime I make a visit to San Fran. 

Location is great, it's a very chill place and very authentic. The staff was great and I highly recommend anyone to try this place when you're in the area!

Grazie!
author: Sarge M.

description: Incredible pesto gnocchi and eggplant parmesan! Lovely service too! This charming vintage Italian, family owned restaurant won't disappoint. Their home made pastas and sauces transport you to Europe with their fresh and flavorful dishes.
author: Lara I.

description:
Franchino is a cozy restaurant that makes you feel as if you've walked into someone's home for dinner. Signora Franchino is so welcoming and makes all of the pasta from scratch. The pasta is fresh and super tasty! Ask for the special - it was a sure thing! Cannot wait to come here again and try more things from the menu!

I was transported to Italy during this meal and came out so happy!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: We just left this welcoming and unpretentious restaurant in North Beach.  What a great meal! My husband's parents are from Italy so we have had many authentic meals, but this was truly special. I had the papardelle  pasta with sausage (home made by the mama of this family restaurant): so delicious, not too much of the sausage flavor to overwhelm the superb  pasta. We shared the grilled vegetable appetizer with an added dash of balsamic vinegar - perfecto. A lovely meal.
author: Betty D.

description: One of my top two restaurants in north beach. Real Italian family, serving real Italian food. All five of our pasta dishes were amazing! The gnocchi in pesto was a star! All the different sauces were spot on. Not a crumb left on any of our dishes. Prices average about $20.
author: Scott M.

description: Family-run restaurant trying to find it's place in North Beach. I had their chicken parmigiana and I can only describe it as chicken covered in Chef Boyardee sauce.
author: Brandon R.

description: The best little ma n pa in North beach. Fresh noodles, quiet candlelight, kind service. We love this lace.
author: Disco B.

description: Lovely traditional Italian cuisine in the heart of North Beach.  Wonderful homemade pasta dishes, etc. in a setting that appears very Italian and full of tradition. Great artwork and decor, and very friendly family like service. The only negative was the dipping oil could have been better, but this means I saved the bread for dipping in fantastic sauce.  That clam sauce is to die for.
author: Bay Area Guy L.

description:
Linguine con le vongole... W the red sauce.  Bombdiggitydiggles

Quaint, warm, family atmosphere ... Loved te vibes here.  

Finished w tiramisu and the owners daughter specifically explained the meaning of the carry me up cake being traditionally custard.

Wonderful!
author: Mark K.

description:
I love this restaurant to death. My friend and I ended up here after The House told us there was an hour wait. Ain't nobody got time for that! Yelp guided us to better. So far my favorite Italian restaurant, it's too bad I live in LA. 

We were seated right away. But do beware seats get filled up quickly as well. We got lucky with timing. The interiors super cute, classy but comfortable, with a welcoming feel. Good to come with family or date. They have a wide variety of wines to select from. 

I ordered the eggplant Parmesan with a side of veggies to go with something on the lighter side. First time I've ever ordered eggplant Parmesan anywhere but it was delicious. It's not like a thick slab of eggplant with cheese but it seemed more like very thin multiple layers condensed together. And the cheese was perfectly melted nicely balanced ratio. My actual favorite part were the grilled veggies. They were cooked and seasoned to perfection. Not burnt or soggy or dry or bland or salty. Just perfect. 

The service was awesome. Servers came by to assist with recommendations and fill our water cups frequently. Making sure everything was good. Definitely will be coming back my next sf visit.
author: Jane K.

description: Really cute good food and amazing service loved the pasta and bread wine was in point
author: Sinay P.

description:
This place sucked! We didn't even have the opportunity to sit down or look at the menu because the hostess started closing the door in our faces as we approached the entrance. She still had the nerve to rudely ask "can I help you" clearly we came to eat. 

Terrible first impression.
author: Meyvi M.

description: Excellent homemade pasta and tremendous service! Perfect date night with my gf, Sara.
author: J. M.

description: This is a family run restaurant with great service. All the pastas are really good and the seafood pasta is a must.
author: Ash M.

description: This place was amazing... a mom and pop shop with only a handful of tables and traditional Italian dishes. My husband and I had a 20+ minute conversation with "momma" who had just finished hand-making the pappardelle noodles for the special that evening. Ordered the pappardelle special, which was MIND-BLOWING, and the gnocchi (dressed 1/3 wth tomato sauce, 1/3 with pesto sauce and 1/3 with the best and lightest creamy sauce that I've ever had). Truly an awesome meal and an even better experience! Will be coming back on our next visit to the City!
author: Ali M.

description:
Great meal with friends visiting from out of town. Always cautious in this part of town to not totally fall into a tourist trap. I think this place avoids it. Family run, great food, great service.

To start we had the prosciutto and melon starter. Totally fresh and good.

Mains of a few different kinds of pasta. I think at least the gnocchi, if not all of it, is house made? It was excellent. Perfect blend of sauces and seasonings.

Cheesecake for dessert. Eep. Not a fan of this. Too fluffy and not enough taste.

Charming space, fun experience.
author: Ryan B.

description: A friend took me here and I was so thrilled to discover such a delightful family run restaurant. The pasta is hand made. The wine list, small, but perfectly crafted. Ask them for a suggestion of a perfect pairing. You have to get the ravioli with meat sauce to begin with and then expand out from there on their menu. I've had their Chicken Marsala which is also a delight. The place is intimate and you get real service from real people. Who make real Italian food with love. I always look forward to any excuse to go back there.
author: David A R.

description:
Run by a mother and her daughters this small little Italian hotspot is super cozy and offers some of the freshest pasta dishes in the City.

A very traditional food option of great Italian dishes, we selected the Tomato and mozzarella salad along with our main course of specials.

The very best dish was the meat ravioli with mushroom sauce.  Perfecto!

We will always grace our presence here.
author: Susan C.

description: This restaurant is actually still run by the family.  We were waited on by the daughter and mama.  If you like gnocchi, this place is for you.  Luckily, mama had made fresh mushroom and ricotta stuffed gnocchi that day.  Literally the best pasta dish i have ever had.  The tiramisu wasn't too shabby, either.  Come here for the best homemade pasta and support a super nice family.
author: kathy a.

description:
Amazing food. Friendly service. 

This place is intimate, clean and the service is amazing. 

Great date spot. 

Try the Alfredo anything and the Nutella cheesecake.
author: Adam S.

description:
We found Franchino on Yelp and we're SO glad we chose this place!! My husband, 3 kids (15,13,10) and myself all had a fabulous dinner!! Awesome Bruschetta and Caprese. My husband and I both ordered the special, Pappardelle with sausage, mushrooms, and more with a touch of Gorgonzola.... Oh. My. Gosh. If we ever get back to San Francisco this will be our first stop!! 
Not only was the food wonderful but the service and ambiance was excellent as well! 
Thanks for a great evening!!
author: Lisa T.

description: Came here a few weeks ago while hanging out in north beach.  It is a small little place, put our names in at the door for what we were told would be a 45 min wait.  It only ended up taking about 15 min, lucky us!  Asked for recommendations on wine, as I like full bodied spicy and peppery reds and ended up with a lovely Italian red Montelciano D'Abruzzo which was superb!  I ordered the special, and the lady ordered fish, both dishes were excellent,  and I wish I would have ordered two specials and had one to take home.  Service was excellent, and I definitely recommend stopping here if you are in the mood for authentic Italian food.
author: G V.

description: I took my girlfriend here for her birthday. I got the meat lasagna and she got some seafood dish. The food was amazing and the service is was quick and courteous. Unfortunately, we didn't leave any room for dessert. We will definitely be back again.
author: Tyler M.

description:
I can't say enough great things about Franchini. A small and welcoming restaurant, we came in from a cold and windy night to find a warm place both in temperature and spirit. The smell coming the kitchen was amazing and we knew the food would be too. 

We were staying in North Beach and looked ahead of time for an authentic Italian restaurant. Seeing the great reviews and proximity to our place made this an ideal choice. 

We started with a bottle of Sangiovese and had bruschetta for the table. So good!  No other starters - we went straight into the main course.  Three at the table had the homemade pappardelle with sausage. So good. I had the gnocchi Gorgonzola and I was in heaven. 

The food was great, yes, but the friendly family service was the best. We felt like we were a guest in their home. In fact we were the last to leave with Buono Serra all the way around. 

I would go back in a heartbeat!
author: Steve W.

description: I love this place! We have been coming here for over 12 years and Josephine and her daughters are as always very sweet and loving to our kids. Everything on the menu is great! This is a wonderful place to eat.
author: Celia O.

description: Love this place, love the food, and love the family. Boyfriend loves italian and we really should be more adventurous... but we find ourselves coming back to Franchino over and over again. The restaurant is really small, with just a handful of tables, but we've never waited more than a few minutes outside. The service is so wonderful, and the family who runs this place is beyond sweet. They are half the reason we come back! My go-to is the pappardelle special. The sausage is amazing and I always have leftovers. Boyfriend has ordered so many different things I have a hard time keeping track, but he always loves what he orders. We've tried dessert here and it's good, but we really like taking a short walk to try dessert at other places-- our way of branching out since we keep coming back to Franchino for dinner!
author: Chloe M.

description:
The food is so good here that my nonna would probably slap me across the face for praising it more than her own. Every time I come to SF I have to plan to eat here at last once. The exterior is not flashy so it is incredibly easy to pass by this place without giving it a second thought. Don't be one of those fools.

You really can't go wrong here. The last time I was here for my birthday I got and my boyfriend got the chicken Alfredo. He said it was the best pasta he'd ever had. My mother, who lived in Italy for a few years, also boasts that this pasta is some of the best she's ever had. Definitely the best in America. The only thing I thought was kinda meh was their caprese. Don't get me wrong it was good, but I've had better at mediocre Italian joints.
author: Angelica F.

description: I really enjoyed this place. The food was the perfect portion, not too much and not too little! The fettuccine Alfredo and chicken parmesan are both great choices. Only improvement is that the waitresses did take a while to get us drinks or even acknowledge us but I'll say it's because they were busy. The waitress also gave my husband and I a free dessert since he was military and they didn't do military discount.
author: Kelley W.

description: The pasta was fresh and extremely flavorful! The ambiance was just like being at a family restaurant in Italy! We will definitely come again next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Michelle R.

description:
Very small dinning , but very welcoming ! 
We had 4 different dishes .. 
lasagna : was recommended as a favorite , but honestly taste just like stuffers ! Very disappointing.   
Spaghetti carbonara : it's was "okay" 
Spaghetti : I mean you can't mess this up! So it's was up to standards . 
Fettuccine Alfredo w/chicken: so good ! So creamy and the chicken was just perfect! 

Great services over all ... but not authentic
author: Diana B.

description: I have dined at many North Beach restaurants but this place is the BOMB! OMG! Don't walk by this restaurant! You will be making the biggest mistake of your life! Seriously! I had the Fettuccine Franchino and my beautiful wife Kerri had the parppadelle special. Both dishes were to die for. The cook is a gift to mankind!
author: Dan Z.

description: My husband and I are there last night. This is a smallish family-owned restaurant that serves delicious Italian homemade pasta and amazing dishes. The service was friendly and amazing. These owners truly care about their guests. Definitely a hidden gem!
author: Roberta S.

description: Food and service is excellent.  Little pricey for the portions but it's SF.  Small family run place lovely people!
author: M K.

description: Been here three times now. We are from Southern California an this is our favorite spot when we come up here. The Cippino is amazing and my favorite. But everything here is delicious. If you live in the area or just visiting come for some food and a amazing time with this family owned place.
author: Ricky E.

description:
The food at franchinos was really good. Me and my baby cakes started with the bruschetta which was really tasty. She ordered gnocchi with two different sauces. One was gorgonzola which I was like aww yeah. The other was their traditional sauce. The waitress didn't recommend to mix the sauces but obviously she didn't know who she was dealing with.
We mixed those two sauces like some rebels and the outcome was phenomenal.
I had the bistecca which was really flavorful and juicy. I was already sort of full after the appetizer plus sharing my boos food along with my own so I didn't get to finish it but it was succulent. 
The wine we paired with the meal was exquisite except for the fee for them to open the bottle. Like Ummm I have hands y I has pay you?
author: Chris L.

description: Every single time we come here, I'm blown away by the quality of the meal. Fantastic veggie options, fantastic service.
author: Sandhya S.

description: Best Italian food Ive had in a loooong time! Ravioli was creamy and savory. Caprese salad is a must! The tiramisu is creamy and fresh. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Edna B.

description:
Technically I'd give this 3.5 stars.

Yummy food - my friend's grilled veal was tender and delicious. I got the shrimp scampi; shrimp was fresh, and It came with grilled veggies that were charred the perfect amount. We got a bottle of red that was good and reasonably priced.

The bread was awful. Stale and not worth eating.

The part that leaves a bad taste in my mouth  is that although I made reservations, we still waited a long time. They said they wouldn't seat us till we were all there, and two folks in our party of six were late. But even after everyone had arrived, we waited for another 30 minutes! What was the point of making a reservation? 

I will probably come back because the food was good, but never again in a group.
author: Jaching H.

description: I want to give it 10 stars! Everything we are was fantastic! We had walked by this place several times and questioned it because it want very crowded.  However, we trusted Yelp and took a chance. I am so glad we did! Do not miss out on this place!  And get the tiramisu or you will hate yourself forever!
author: Tommy W.

description:
I cannot begin to describe how much I love this place--  I've had four dishes here so far, they were all super excellent.

Risotto Porcini:  the perfect risotto, creamy and tender, rice is not over cooked, flavors are rich and fragrant without being overly oily or heavy.  Can't go wrong with porcini mushrooms with a bit of a tender bite to them.

Vongole Pasta with White Wine:  Nice pasta, sauce could be stronger or more well distributed with pasta/tossed.  The white wine broth is very fragrant.

Pasta pescatore: tomato based pasta sauce with seafood.  Nice spaghetti pasta, generous amounts of seafood made perfect with a generous spoon ful of fresh Parmesan.  Tomato sauce is thick, chunky and almost a bit creamy.

Great tiramisu and coffee as well!!
author: Alice S.

description: This place was recommended from a friend. So glad I went. There was no wait so we got seated fast. The food was sooooo good! I had the chicken piccata, one of daughter had lasagna and other daughter had the pasta pomodero. We all cleaned our plate! We finish our dinner with the lemon custard and a Spumoni ice cream.  All fantastic! I will definitely be back!
author: Melinda H.

description: My all time favorite restaurant. We just took my step-son here for his 18th birthday and as usual everything was perfect! The staff is absolutely wonderful and the food is delicious! We drive from Redwood City to San Francisco in weekday traffic just to eat here. I'm completely in love with the family who owns/runs the restaurant. Eat here and you won't regret it... you can thank me later!
author: Dawn H.

description:
this is the. BEST. italian restaurant.  ever.  
we have been coming here for yeeeaarrrrs and it will always hold a special place in my heart.  so many wonderful lifetime memories celebrated here.  

while I highly doubt they could make a bad dish here if they tried, my all-time favourite is the fettuccine alfredo with salmon and peas.   though the specials always make me reconsider being predictable.   

i love how this is a for-reals, mom and pop restaurant, with the daughters and grandkids dishing deliciousness, dad inviting you in and moma cooking awesomeness in the kitchen and making guest appearances when she can.   

come here enough, and you too, will feel like family!
author: Briana R-k B.

description: Great family run business. Momma makes her specials of the day. Truly authentic Italian food. Never ever have had a dish I didn't like. Every time my brother in law and sister come from Philadelphia this is their first stop.
author: Maryann M.

description: My sister & I stopped in for an early dinner and had the best time, the owner and her daughter were absolutely delightful.  The veal saltimbocca with Fettuccini Alfredo was the best we've ever had!  All their recommendations from the wine to antipasto to cannoli were fantastic.
author: Sherrie C.

description: Amazing Italian food! Been to Italy before and in my opinion this is very authentic and close to the real thing. The place is super small. Only fits about 12 tables or so, so you can wait for a while to be seated but it is well worth the wait. The service was amazing and you can tell that the people working there were all family running this small, humble, family owned restaurant. Will definitely be coming back!
author: PiscesGirl A.

description: Authentic Italian food. I ordered the gnocchi and it's delicious, gorgon zola sauce. The lady owner is very personable.
author: Lenny L.

description: Absolutely wonderful. Delicious, authentic Italian food. It's nice to see a family owned business and they are very courteous make you feel at home.
author: Lucia P.

description:
Tiny place, family owned. The food I had was absolutely phenomenal. I had Fettuccine Al Salmone and it was absolutely awesome. It blew me away. 

Very nice and super attentive staff. I definitely want to come back here. I only write reviews when a place leaves a real impression on me and this place absolutely did.
author: Steve F.

description:
I loved this restaurant! I was trying to figure out where to go while in Italian town and was pulled into Franchino's by the owner. I thought, hey! If he is literally going to pull me in a may give it a shot. Went inside and felt like I was family. The owners mother came over and told me about the specials and his daughters were the servers. The dim lighting and the small homestyle feel made a fantastic experience. 

The specials were fantastic. I would suggest to do what their daily specials are versus going for something on the menu.
author: Aron H.

description:
Updated** I love that this restaurant is a mom & pop's style family restaurant & the family is hustling and bustling making sure everyone is taken care of. Food is SO GOOD! This is my 2nd time coming here and I ordered the vegetarian Lasagna (big serving!) 
I appreciate that this place is nestled between chain restaurants and has been open 27 years - what a testament to the food and owners!
author: G G.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in San Fransico never a bad meal.  Must stop in when in town
author: John M.

description:
Casual cozy family run Italian restaurant.  Greeted upon entry by our server, she was polite and said a couple of Italian words.  Seated at cozy table near Windows , great for people watching.  We were offered water, and bread with olive oil and balsamic at the table.  Friendly staff, our server said her mom made the daily special which was squid ink pasta with seafood.  We went for the linguine with seafood with tomato sauce. My date had the capellini pasta with seafood.  Both were good.  Lots of seafood. Pasta was cooked just right.  Tomato sauce was flavorful, not too sweet.  Atmosphere was good. A few patrons chatted with the two servers as if they knew each other. An elderly woman emerged from the kitchen, I'm assuming it was Mom.  She had a dish of her squid ink pasta.  It looked good, I almost wished I had ordered if.  Our food came quickly, and our sever was quick with the grated Parmesan. She gave a generous dose. Food was excellent.  Our server kept the glasses filled and checked on us throughout the meal.  
Place looked clean and classic Italian decor.  Paintings in wall, white tablecloths, good ambience.  Would come here again
author: Maria A.

description: This is one of the best places to eat out here. Good service and atmosphere is amazing. Food and wine was great. I would definitely come back. If I was able to give them 10 stars, I would be glad to do so.
author: Maz A.

description:
Burrata cheese is wonderful, and highly recommend it.
Valpolicella Classico 2012 to wash it down.

Spaghetti Alla Carbonara
Capellini Mare e Monti
Chicken Saltimbocca

all three were ordered at our table and were very tastey, but I'm a sucker for prosciutto so everything with that on it is delicious to me. The Burrata cheese was honestly our favoriter part but everything was good.
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Fabulous Italian food. Walked in with a friend without a reservation on a Sunday evening. We lucked out and got a table without waiting. This is a small, intimate restaurant, and you can tell it's family owned and run. Waitress was super friendly and enthusiastic about the food, and really sold us on the two specials. We had the tortellini in Alfredo mushroom sauce and the sausage tomato pasta. Pasta was handmade and so, so delicious. We each had a glass of the house chianti, which was a great recommendation from the waitress. 

Tiramisu for desert might have been my favorite part of the meal. So light and fluffy and not too sweet. This is a must!! 

Would highly recommend and look forward to coming back when I'm in the area!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Franchino's is our absolute favorite. We've been coming here for years. The food is excellent. The service is genuinely from the heart. 

I have so much respect for the owners, Franchino and Giuseppina. This is a family-run business; you can see it the moment you walk in. The place is nothing fancy at all. It's just a down-to-earth, family operation. Franchino's wife is the one who's behind all the food that is cooked. And let me tell ya... it's consistently amazing!  Gnocchi, Risotto al salmone, Risotto Con Porcini, Fettucini Al Pesto, Linguine Con Vongole... believe me, we've tried a good portion of their menu. Everything was delicious. Simply the best! 

You step in and meet the man himself, Franchino. Actually, you'll most likely meet him out front. Then, you step inside where his wife runs the kitchen. You'll then notice his daughters working the floor. They continuously provide friendly service as they move from one table to the next. They're fantastic. 

This is a hard-working family. If you frequent this place long enough, you will notice they do they're best to really take care of their customers. They don't take this business for granted. They genuinely care that you're a patron at their restaurant. 

If you're thinking of just one place to dine while in town, this is a must. If you're going to try multiple places, put this at the top of the list. 

Without a doubt, FRANCHINO'S is our all-time favorite. 

Cent' Anni !
author: DG B.

description: The service was terrible!!!!!! Don't make the mistake of going here. The night started off with them giving our table away after we waited for an hour (which was supposed to be less than 30 minutes). The waitress was rude and told us to wait another 30 minutes, after our table was given away. She said one of the men in our group told her to cancel the order, which was false, for he was with us the whole entire time. The people in front of us had the same issue. We also heard many customers complaining that the food was cold! Please reconsider if you are thinking of going here for food!!!!!
author: Ricky W.

description: Amazing food and service. Portion size just right. We had a table of 5 and all enjoyed. Highly recommend!!
author: Rick G.

description:
