This place officially holds a special place in my heart. We were greeted by the owner when we walked in and were immediately seated by his wife. Love how home-y it feels. Awesome atmosphere- bottles of wine and paintings line the walls. 

After ordering I had barely enough time to eat a piece of bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar before they brought us our meal. 

THE GNOCCHI IS AMAZING. I didn't think it was possible, but each bite was better than the next. The grilled chicken and mixed vegetables was also A+. We had the franchino wine which apparently constantly changes because it comes from a small Italian vendor who buys different cases of wine from small wineries throughout Italy. It paired really perfectly with the meal. 

Lastly, the homemade tiramisu. Oh. My. God. Yum. 

Such a nice place! Perfect for a date or dinner with the family.
author: Steph D.

description:
A truly euphoric dining experience. The most authentic Italian dinning experience I've had on the west coast. The Spaghetti Con Calimari was a perfect balance of briney Calimari, peppery red sauce and expertly cooked pasta. My wife enjoyed the Capellini Mare e Monti which was a flawless execution of land meets sea with a delicate aurora sauce. Dinning here was the
highlight of my SF trip. A MUST for anyone visiting!
author: Chad P.

description: Food was good. My husband and I were in San Francisco over labor day weekend and this was the best food I had while we were there. The staff seemed like family and were very welcoming. I got the gnocchi in a gorgonzola sauce, which I really enjoyed. I highly recommended giving this place a shot.
author: Angela B.

description:
Although we waited 15 minutes on a busy sunday night; the owner came to greet me -  he was very cool. He made me feel welcome.Gotta like that.

I ordered the veal saltimboca and received salmon saltimboca; choice of pasta or grilled veggies. I opted for the grilled veggies, which were al dente and tasty. 
I can forgive this honest mistake. My salmon was mouth watering and so tender, the cheese was so soft and yummy, combined with the prosciutto, it was a combo made in heaven.

The house Chianti is a Toscana variety and tastey.

They start you out with some slices of dry crusty bread.

Parking: public or drive around!

Bathroom: clean

Customer service: very good.

It's crowded on a Saturday and loud as can be; we had a great time.
A new fav.
author: Bert K.

description: This is a "must" for us every time we visit San Francisco...small family-run restaurant with authentic, amazing Italian food and very warm atmosphere. Super nice daughters serve their mom's wonderful dishes. My faves: homemade pasta (marinara sauce is especially delicious), eggplant parmesan, and of course tiramisu
author: BeachMonkey J.

description: I got the Chicken Saltimbocca, and it was REALLY good.  This is a pretty homey restaurant, family owned, and the daughter of the owner waited on our table.
author: Michael E.

description: Nice little (emphasis on little) family joint. Great food. Great service. Good choice on a block full of ristorante. 5 starts but for the tiny, scary restroom.
author: Mike J.

description:
We made a reservation for a busy Saturday night recently.  And we were really pleased!  We were greeted by one of the owners, the mother, who is a really lovely lady. Then one of her daughters sat us at a nice table and welcomed us.  She was really friendly and jovial taking our orders efficiently.  We were given bread with olive oil (on the table already) and a bottle of balsamic vinegar.  Many reviewers have criticized the bread as tasting stale and being cold.  It didn't bother us that the bread was cold, and we did not find it to be stale.  It was fine and it was replenished without asking.

The clam appetizer was great:  Plump and juicy Manila clams sautéed in a simple garlic, white wine sauce that went lovely with the bread. In fact, our son recalled that the clams reminded him of the ones he had when we were in Rome. One of us ordered the minestrone & one can tell that it is homemade.  So much different than at other restaurants where their minestrone tastes watery and lacks ingredients.

Our pastas were fantastic.  The prawns and mussels were fresh and tasty as was the marinara sauce seasoned well and included fresh basil.  One can tell that the sauce was homemade.

Desserts were also very nice although we preferred the tartuffo slightly more than the tiramisu.  However, the tiramisu contained a nice flavor of Amaretto liqueur as should be.  The desserts are a bit small to share though.

We had a simple pinot grigio & followed dinner with a port.  Both were fine accompaniments to our meals.

This is a simple, family owned/run restaurant with simple but authentic cooking.  So if you are looking for trendy and gourmet then look elsewhere.  For us simple & authentic are all we desire.  Thus, all in all we felt that we made a great choice & will return soon again.
author: Luisa T.

description:
This restaurant is so good! Me and 3 others went for dinner on a Sunday and I was so impressed. It's a bit small and in the heart of little Italy. We were seated right away and given water (after requested of course). This restaurant is family run and the daughter of the owner was the one who took our order. 

I ordered the pasta pescatore and it was so good! The seafood tasted fresh and the pasta was al dente. The servings were also huge so I was able to take some home. 

I definitely recommend Franchino. I left feeling 110% satisfied. Word of advice to anyone planning going in a bigger group and need to split the bill, they only accept 2 cards so make sure to bring cash.
author: Erika T.

description:
Everything here is as good as it gets. It's true love in each comforting bite. Here, you experience the combination of feeling like you're in an exceptional restaurant and you're a special guest in a friend's home, with the host being one of the finest but least pretentious chefs; she even took time to have an honest conversation with us! You get the sense that your meal was made by hands of someone who takes great pride in their work. 

Highly recommend any of their three gnocchi sauces, with the gorgonzola being a stand-out. Also had a lasagna that was pure magic. Somehow it managed to make an ordinarily dense dish seem spectacularly light.
author: Mike B.

description: Good Italian food in North Beach. Since my friend is a big Italian fan, this place was within walking distance from the Saloon, so we hit it up after a few drinks. Very small place, and bathroom is downstairs. You're given the standard bread and olive oil before, which was fine, nothing memorable. I was really hungry, so wanted the most bang for my buck and went chicken parmigiana with ziti. Hard to screw this up, and they didn't here. Comes out super hot and it's really good. The meat sauce wasn't too salty, and very flavorful. Definitely reminds me of a spot in Little Italy NYC with its ambiance and layout. No complaints here. Reasonably priced as well, and no wait on a Friday night.
author: Dan M.

description:
This is a fantastic family restaurant tucked away in plain sight on Columbus on the edge of North Beach.  Mama, Papa and at least two daughters waited on us.

We had the cheese tortellini, the pesto linguine and the veal saltimbocca.  All three plates were clean at the end of the meal.  

And then we moved on to the main course:  the cannoli's!  Chocolate with pistachios and then the traditional plain.  My daughter finished hers, but two of us failed to finish.  Not because we didn't try though.

This goes on our list of San Francisco favorites.
author: Greg C.

description: Fantastic choice for quality Italian dining. The vegetables were fresh and tasty, I can't get enough of the tomatoes! The gnocchi was delicious, as was everything else everyone else at my table had. The atmosphere is classic SF, a little converted townhouse, top-notch! I totally recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good, authentic Italian with a casual vibe.
author: Alex N.

description: I was disappointed with this restaurant. This was my first meal in San Francisco and after reading all the yelp reviews I was so excited to try this restaurant in little Italy. First of all the bread served was old and cold. You MUST serve warm fresh bread, that's a given! I ordered the fettucini Alfredo with chicken. Now I'm a chicken lover, but this chicken was disgusting. It tasted cold and under cooked. I just ate the pasta, which was ok but not out of this world. The only good thing about this restaurant is the service. Very sweet server, and very attentive. This is the only reason for the 3 stars. Would never return.
author: Vanessa R.

description: Really good privately owned Italian food restaurant in Little Italy. The place is small but that makes it more intimate dining experience. I had the chicken with lemon and capers and wifey had the chicken alfredo. Both were really great dishes. You could taste the homemade recipe that the owner put their personal touch in to each dish. I really liked it!
author: Steven H.

description: Extraordinary italian homemade food. A local family business where they make you feel like you are part of their family. The best ever eggplant parmigiana, where they slice very thin pieces of eggplant, dip in flour and egg and grill before stacking into the parmigiana. Simply divine, my favorite dish, if I have to pick just one. My husbands fav is a special, pappardelle (wide noodles) with sausage and mushrooms. Other specials are spectacular too, gnocchi stuffed with gorgonzola cheese or porcini mushrooms - both are fantastic. We have been going here for almost 20 years and the quality is still as good as the first time.
author: Vicki S.

description:
Talk about a hidden gem! This family owned and ran restaurant had authentic, made to order food that tops most Italian restaurants I have been to. The service was exceptional! 
Highly recommended restaurant!
author: Sara P.

description:
Really enjoyed the food, and restaurant - great service and waitresses. Very friendly. 
Food was like Italian home made high quality fresh food. Probably the best lasagna I had. 

Wife and kids had great food as well. 

Thanks!!

As well the deserts were great!!
author: Sander H.

description: This was the best Italian food I've ever had in my life. I had the gnocchi special which was a potato gnocchi stuffed with truffles and truffle oil and a rich truffle-cheese sauce. I absolutely loved this and could eat it any time of the day. The service is also great! I recommend this restaurant to anybody who loves food and wants to explore.
author: Emmett W.

description:
Went bridal gown shopping and was looking for a restaurant in little Italy to dine afterwards. I pulled out Yelp and read some solid reviews. 

I can attest that the reviews did not disappoint. I had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. It was fresh creamy and not too heavy. Perfect portion sizes. My mom had the special of the day which included sausage and mushrooms in a tomato sauce, I forget the name. But it was truly delicious. It's family owned and operated. Maria was our waitress she was very personable and friendly. We met her mother who does all of the cooking. 

It was a great dining experience. If you have the chance to go, please do treat yourself. All of the other patrons were raving about their dishes as well. Oh and save room for the desert. We had the Bomba (sp). It has Spunoni (sp) ice cream covered in a dark chocolate shell. Very well done.
author: Cecilia J.

description: We had a great dinner here last night.  Service was warm, friendly and very efficient. The place is small, clean and had a homey feeling.  The veal piccata was outstanding, a generous portion sautéed in butter & white wine with a lots nice capers.  The chicken Amalfittano was also delicious, with a very flavorful sauce and mushrooms.  The spaghetti Carbonara was also very flavorful with lots prosciutto and eggs, no cream which was great but a tiny bit dry.  Highly recommended this family run Italian restaurant.
author: Valerie V.

description: Small restaurant - very quaint and you can feel the family atmosphere!  It's like being invited into their home for Sunday dinner.  Food was amazing and the service was good.  Pricing is a little high, but well worth it.  Gnocchi is one of the best I have ever had.  The best part is getting a hug from the owner on the way out.  If your in the bay area - I would definitely make one dinner here.
author: S. G.

description: This italian restaurant is authentic as it gets. Family owned business with a warm feel. Menu has lots of choices with pasta, fish and meat choices and all are reasonably priced. Pretty good wine list as well. My gf and I ordered the lasagna and fettuccine w/ prawns. Followed by a ricotta cheesecake suggested to us by the owner, which isn't on the menu. Ricotta cheesecake definitely not  as filling as your standard cheescake. Good choice for sure! Overall this is a cute, quaint dinner spot with food made with love just as the Italians do! Bon Appétito!
author: Deanna A.

description: Amazing amazing amazing and amazing did I say it was amazing? This place is so good it might be the best pasta and Italian food I have every ate. It is fresh and home made and great service. MUST TRY IF YOUR IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Andres L.

description:
With so many places to in SF and great Italian restaurants around North Beach. I keep coming back to Franchino for great food. I've been coming to Franchino since 2005 since I've moved her from LA. From the moment you walk to the door and get greeted by the owner with a smile and a song and the great service by the wife and kids would almost be enough to keep me coming back. Even with this great family, the food is the superstar at this restaurant. Everything I've tried there has been AMAZING. All the people that I've been to this restaurant with always talks highly about there experience at this place. My friends that I bring here from LA always call me for the name so they can recommend this place to there friends too.

I know I'll be coming here for many years to come and always excited when I know I'm coming back.

Parking is a challenge but its SF so there no shock to that.
author: victor j.

description:
Rating: 3.5


This is a tiny restaurant, located next to the Stinking Rose. There wasn't a formal process or sign in sheet to wait for a seat. My sister talked with a waitress and the waitress said that our party of three would get seated within 10 to 15 minutes. After 10 minutes, we were seated. However, it was odd since we sat down before other parties who arrived before us. 

We shared the following dishes: 
- Calamari salad - Not the typical fried calamari, but it was good. I liked how the fresh calamari was paired with greens and had a nice citrus dressing. 

- Pesto gnocchi - Really good pesto sauce. 

- Cappellini Mare e Monti - Shrimp & Chicken with Aurora Sauce - I saw rave reviews, but the dish was okay. 

The service was okay. The waitress wasn't too friendly to us. There are better Italian restaurants in North Beach.
author: Jackie S.

description: The most amazing, freshest pasta you will ever eat! This is a hidden gem in North Beach!! We go anytime we are down there. Family owned and ran, nothing is better than this place.
author: Jackie S.

description: Rowdy atmosphere but dim enough to be a romantic dinner ... I wouldn't recommend big parties though..we waited an h our for 8 people gnnochi pesto is good but gnocci Iis too thick and filling in general .. the fettuchini with large prawns is pretty good but my favorite was the veal masala and secondly the veal sac..something lol the bruchetta appitzer was nice and refreshing .. wine is so so here maybe because the food was over powering.. we had the shriaz and cabernet full bottles
author: Juila L.

description:
The place was cute,  clean, and small. 

I got the pasta pescatore. If you're a seafood lover, get it. It's soooo good. 

My boyfriend got the gnocchi in meat sauce. He said it alright; needed more fluff.
author: Victoria B.

description: My favourite for special  occasions. My husband and I have celebrate so many things but the food is the real star. Nice Italian family with homemade food and family  atmosphere
author: Carolyn B.

description: Best Italian I have had, so amazing!! I ordered the capanelli with Alfredo. Life changing!!
author: Casey M.

description: Delicious pappardelle made by mama. Close your eyes and you would swear that you were in Italy. The waitress, one of four sisters work here, is delightful. Highly recommended.  We had eaten a late lunch, so we shared the special and a salad, you will want to order more of mama's delicious food. Ask what their specials are.
author: Jess P.

description:
Having never been to San Francisco, I had no idea where to eat in Little Italy. My boyfriend and I wanted to find a good Italian place that was nice but also affordable. This restaurant was totally perfect, and so authentic. 

It's the perfect spot for a date, and the food is delicious. In fact, now that I'm writing this review, I'm craving it.

Great food, great service, cute place. 

Definitely recommend!
author: Katie K.

description: Fantastic Italian food in a family atmosphere! We had the veal pizzaoli, salmon, and pasta pomadora. The tiramisu was fabulous!
author: Tracey T.

description: Owned and operated by an Italian family. Our prawns piccata came with homemade noodles...delish!  Their spicy red sauce in the mussels and some pasta dishes was very appetizing. Friendly, efficient service. Place is small but comfortable and charming, right on Columbus. This is probably my go-to spot in North Beach for high quality, authentic Italian food at a relaxing place, decently priced with sincere, personable service. Note: place is not fancy/upscale. Come here for food & service, not frills.
author: Alice A.

description: Wow!! Give this place 5 because it's well deserved.  little restaurant  with authentic food.  The service was amazing as she was so polite.  Had Gnocchi in tomato sauce, probably best I've had.  Would definitely recommend if you want real Italian homemade.
author: Pani M.

description:
A very lovely setting. Pastel blue tables, lots of "Italian" paintings/items, and clean plates/silverware. 

The staff was very patient in letting us decide what to order since we had no idea what the fancy terms meant haha. 

I got homemade pesto linguini with chicken. Very fresh noodles - thick and not soggy. Pesto was creamy and just right in taste. At first I thought there wasn't a lot of chicken but they're randomly placed throughout the noodles. Chicken is super juicy and fresh unlike some of the wet meat I've tried at other places. 

My friend got the seafood risotto. Very cheesy and delicious. Seafood was bouncy? Idk the texture was nice. 

Portion size is pretty large unlike some of the pictures I saw. We both couldn't finish. 

Also, we had the bruschetta for the appetizer. The bread that comes with dinner is pretty dry and tasteless(although the olive oil and vinegar is bomb.com) so we thought the same of the bruschetta. To our surprise it was perfectly toasted and soft in the middle and seasoned superbly. A great way to start dinner! 

For dessert we got the Tartufa and Tiramisu. 

The Tartufa is a rich chocolate gelato with hazelnut/vanilla in the middle. Really creamy and full in flavor. Works perfectly with the heavy amount of cocoa powder. 

Everyone likes the Tiramisu so we tried it and it was alright. Creamy and soft. The bottom breaking is drenched in coffee so it's very soggy. Not too sweet. 

Our meal was $70.96 which is pretty pricy for two people.
author: Christine D.

description:
Straight to the point: pretty good authentic Italian food, very small restaurant, good customer service, finding parking is hard but there's a parking garage a few blocks away.

Came here on a Saturday night with reservations, but arrived early and good thing we did because the place was soon packed with a line of people waiting outside. I've never been to Italy, but everything about this place made me feel like I was in a small town in Italy. As we walked in, a man who was sitting outside at a table followed us in and asked the waitresses to seat us. Turns out he was the owner. 

Looking for a cozy atmosphere? Come here. We were seated right next to cash register, literally right smack against the side of it. Didn't mind it too much because it was part of the "experience". It was loud and busy and felt a little rushed due to all the waiting patrons. 

We ordered the bruschetta for apps and it was delicious! For entrees we had the gnocchi with tomato sauce and the seafood cioppino. The gnocchi was a tad bland but both dishes were pretty good! Had the cheesecake for dessert, can't go wrong with that. 

Overall, good Italian food if you're in the area.
author: Sammie B.

description: Great food served by a wonderful family. It's so nice to have the owners come out and speak to you while you're eating. The food was really good, yet simple. I highly recommend the Gnocchi with Gorgonzola Cream Sauce. Delicious!
author: Chris H.

description: This was the best Italian food I've ever had, and I am from New York and the Northeast US. I can't say it's possible to order something you won't like. Honestly. The best.
author: Mark J.

description:
I have been to Italy twice now and the meal I had tonight blew the boot out of the water ;)
Operated by a familia of Italians with mama in the kitchen and her daughters working the floor; you feel at home the moment you are greeted. Cozy little place. No more than 20 tables in there, tops. It was packed the entire time we were there. The waitresses were kind, prompt, super funny and sweet. We decided to try one of the specials, truffle gnocchi as well as veal Marsala. Both dishes were Devine! The gnocchi was the best I have ever had. Light and fluffy pillows of creamy truffle delight. The veal was excellent as well. Light and full of flavor. Both meals tasted so decadent but neither had a heavy feel we are used to from Italian restaurants. It was amazing! We ended with the home made  tiramisu..which the server so clearly was proud to state that mamma made the 'true' tiramisu...not the 'frenchified layer cake junk'. She was right. It was an an amazing light yet creamy custard a top a coffee bed of goodness. We will be making this a regular visit when going to SF. 
Go, splurge, enjoy. We promise you will not be disappointed!!!!
author: Eve K.

description: We stumbled into Columbus Ave on our first day in S.F.  This family-owned place is excellent.  My boyfriend's chicken saltimboca was really good.  I had a pasta with marinara. It was perfect. The place is small and we were lucky to find a table.
author: Maria S.

description:
My friend and I had an amazing time there. It's a really cozy and small place. For appetizers, we couldn't decide between mussels or clams so the older lady put in an order for 1/2 and 1/2. We both preferred the clams. 

For dinner, we split a Capellini Mare E Monti with the Aurora sauce. The chicken pieces were insanely delicious but a wee bit dry. The shrimp was divine but maybe throw in a few pieces more? The pasta/sauce was amazing too.

The service was great. The two ladies working there were obviously invested in running the restaurant. They were fuss-free and very down to earth.

The wine was pretty standard but I am no wine connoisseur. All in all, it was a lovely time.
author: Hina A.

description:
Service is great! Food was excellent! This place is a hole
In the wall and should stay that way! A local standing outside told us that this place was great as soon as we were going to yelp them. Say no more, locals will know the best!
author: Mack M.

description: Went to SF for a family vacation and was thrilled to find Franchino's.  After falling in love with this family owned nook, my daughter begged to return the next night.  The food is amazing and homemade by the "mama" of the family.  We all had something different and no one wanted to share. We did share dessert, however and the cannoli is to die for. We can't wait for our next trip to SF so we can come to Franchino's again!!
author: Stacy T.

description: Best meal of our 10 day trip to California. "Mom" makes everything and it is awesome!!!!
author: Don G.

description:
Fantastic! Food was excellent! Veal cutlet outstanding as were the pasta dishes. Grilled veggie appetizer was really good
Affordable wine list with well rounded selection. Family oriented with warm ambience and personalized service makes for an enjoyable dining experience.
author: Larry L.

description:
My new favorite hole in the wall Italian restaurant. 

Initially, I was a little disappointed with the bread which was cold and seemed purchased from another store but soon the meal easily made up for it. 

I had a Capellini Mare e Monti which was a seafood combo. The portion was the perfect size and the delicious sauce well complemented the fresh seafood. 

The final selling point was the marvelous Tiramisu. Beautifully decorated and rich, it was a pleasant desert to top off the evening. 

Cozy restaurant and friendly staff, will be retuning soon.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Seeing as there are endless places to get good Italian food in little Italy, it can be hard to decide where to go. We chose Franchino because the menu looked good and the wait was short. And we lucked out - this place was awesome! 
It's a total mom and pop kinda place. I got the feeling that everyone working there was family and I even heard some Italian so you know it's gonna be good.

My boyfriend and I decided to split a couple things. We got a Caesar salad and the special - a homemade pasta with a meat ragu. The salad was great - just the right size for two and the dressing was flavorful without being overpowering. It also had big slices of fresh parmesan which is always good.   

The pasta was delicious. The noodles (fettuccini style) were cooked perfectly, the meat sauce was good and chunky, lots of tender, flavorful meat. I'm not always a big fan of tomato-based sauces but this was an exception. It was a sop it up with bread kinda sauce for sure.

The service was friendly, the atmosphere was homey and the food was fantastic. A good choice for sure!
author: Holly R.

description:
Somehow we got sucked into a tourist trap!

A friend of mine who lived in SF for 9 years raved about how great Franchino is so we had to try it. The boyfriend and I headed over with another couple on a Saturday night to check it out.

We waited in line (not a problem, I understand the place is very small) and about 20 minutes later we were inside and seated. We ordered and our food came out pretty quickly. I was astonished at the size of each of our meals; they were incredibly small for the price! One of us ordered the Penne Arrabbiata, for example, and we could not believe that they charge $18 for such a tiny portion. Pasta is not expensive... they could at least put a bit more on the plate. This isn't one of those trendy tapas style places, this is Italian... and Italians serve generous portions.

The food itself was just ok. My boyfriend is 100% Italian, so I've been exposed to great Italian food and I am sorry to say that this isn't it.

The only reason I am giving more than one star in this situation is because Franchino himself was VERY entertaining. We asked him to sing so he dimmed the lights and sang for all of us. Unfortunately, when we got the extremely high bill we felt as if we were paying more for the show than the food.

Sorry, but we won't be back. Sodini's still has my heart.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Absolutely delicious! Good prices for the area! All fresh pasta and good portions. Ordered the special pappardelle with sausage and red sauce. Family owned and everyone is super friendly! Nice quiet ambience. Homey and delicious!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Wonderful family owned, hole in the wall restaurant in Little Italy! The food was simply delicious as was the dessert. The minestrone was also amazing! Wish I had taken photos of the food but we ate it too fast. We will for sure be back! The service was great and super personal. Highly recommend!
author: Lisa B.

description:
Great food, very shady buisness!

Our hotel recommend this place and it looked good.   Dinner was good, not the best in the world, but very good.   We left our camera case there (our fault!)

Our hotel called and we were told to come back the next day at 1:00pm.   We rearranged our whole day on vacation to do this.    We did.  No one was there.

The hotel called again.   My husband was standing outside and they said they would not open the door and to come back at 3:00 pm.  This was an hour walk for us to get there!  

Oh, and now they are not sure they can find our camera case anymore?!?!?!

Great food, but something shady is going on......

This turned into one very expensive and annoying dinner.
author: Helene W.

description: Cozy place with great atmosphere and amazing Italian food. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. The food was brought quickly and there is a large selection of dishes to choose from. I would definitely recommend this place and we will be back next time we visit San Francisco !!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Beautiful and quaint old world ambiance, excellent food and attentive service.  Stopped in on our way back from City Lights and so glad we did!
Started with the bruschetta- tiny bit too oily. For dinner, my husband had the homemade pappardelle and sausage while I had the spinach gnocchi in Gorgonzola sauce.  Both were knockouts! It is hard to make a Gorgonzola sauce that does not overpower the rest of the dish, but they did. Gnocchi had a nice firm, but creamy texture.
author: Colleen M.

description: Service was outstanding: very attentive and friendly. They were accommodating of, if puzzled by, my request (pesto alfredo fettuccini ) and another person's special request (capellini pesto) and both dishes were excellent. Smallish restaurant, reservations recommended.
author: Larry E.

description:
I believe that nothing bad can come out of a kitchen when the waitress starts off by saying " for today's specials my mom has made..."  
Amazing food and wonderful atmosphere   I had the bruschetta and the pasta special.  I'm picky about my red sauces and this did not disappoint
author: Katherine H.

description: It was our first time visiting Franchino and must say it was some of the best Italian food we've ever tasted.  Restaurant is small and quaint located within walking distance of Beach Blanket Babylon and some of the North Beach comedy clubs.  It's totally old school. All pasta and sauces made from scratch.  Family owned and reasonably price.  Good choice if you're looking for good, no frills quality Italian food.
author: Russ O.

description: I chose Franchino's based on the reviews and health grade and we were very happy. The ladies are very welcoming and polite. The food was delicious and they have a decent wine list. I had the veal parmigiana and I have to say that the sauce was great and the veal was super tender. My husband was very happy with his Alfredo pasta dish and we shared a Tiramisu that was amazing. Overall, it was a great meal and I would definitely recommend picking this place over many of the other Italian restaurants in the area.
author: Joann K.

description:
Great date spot in Little Italy. You can't go wrong here if you're craving authentic Italian flavors. The service is top notch and I love how the owner and his family treat you just like family... everyone was so warm and attentive, even on a busy Saturday night. The place itself is small and low key, but very charming.

We ordered the brushetta (yum!) which I'd give 4/5 stars. Minus 1 star because it was a little too oily for my taste. But the garlic and fresh tomatoes went well together.

I got the fettuchini con gambino (shrimps) which was also good, a solid 4/5 as well.

I wish I had room in my stomach for dessert because they all sounded soooo good! Ahh, definitely next time. I will be back!
author: Leigh R.

description:
Great cozy place. Ate there twice on our SF trip. Brought friends the second time.
Family owned and operated for over 20 something years it is great for traditional southern Italian food but they also have the usual pasta dishes as well if you prefer food from the north. All pasta is hand made so it's great. Keep and eye out for the specials. 
Make a reservation if going during the weekend or be prepared to wait a bit.
author: T C.

description:
My boyfriend loved you!!! I loved you and my friend Matt loves you guys too! This was the most amazing stuffed gnocchi I have ever had and I used to work at an award winning Italian restaurant!

The cream sauces are so incredibly distinct but the daily gnocchi special was fantastic! I can not wait to eat here again! The owners were so kind and helpful!


 
Try the smoked mozzarella, tortellini stracciatella stew was different but I can imagine myself craving it the next time I have a craving for Italian comfort food!

We will be back the next time we come to sf!!!!
author: Jasmine L.

description: Fantastic experience. Food was consistent, service was friendly and attentive and the dessert was amazing!
author: Robin H.

description:
I really enjoyed Franchino. The atmosphere is cute and quaint--it feels like you're in a little Italian restaurant. Bruschetta is very flavorful--perfectly salted and toasted. The tomatoes shine. My boyfriend ordered the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce. It was very good, though the gnocchi were slightly over cooked (had a bit of a gummy texture). I tried their pesto cheese tortellini and I loved it. The pesto is wonderful and the tortellinis were cooked very well. We shared a bottle of the Lambrusco Rossi Dolce which was delightful (though probably a lot cheaper at Trader Joes). 
The wait staff were not bad--a bit inattentive sometimes, but everything came out quickly and they topped off wine when needed. 
I'd come back next time I visit!
Check out Franchino.
author: Rachel W.

description:
The calimari is NOT fried. The squid is marinated and tossed on a fresh mix salad. The best I've ever had.
My wife and I discovered this on a trip to SF two years ago. We couldn't wait to get back, and it was our first stop upon our return. Papa is in Italy visiting his mom. Momma and daughters seem comfortable with that ;-)
author: Steve K.

description:
Absolutely delicious 
Whenever I return to San Francisco I will definitely be going out of the way to  eat at this spot!
author: Andrea M.

description:
WOW, I mean just flat out WOW! This is an AMAZING restaurant from the cozy ambiance to the wonderfully friendly service, to the owners popping by the table for a hello. Just a wonderful dinner after a stressful work day.  

My friend and I tried both the Caesar salad and the antipasto. both amazing. Really the Antipasto blew me away with the flavor and variety. So good! Then we had the main courses, I had the Gnocci with pesto and he had the Carbonara, both amazing. The gnocci were so tender and tasty with the fresh pesto.. YUM. 

But hold on, seriously the desserts were over the top. I had the Panna Cotta which was very very good...but the ice cream/sorbet lemoncello...my lord I am from Seattle but I may fly down to have that again tonight. I haven't ever had anything like it. If you come here and you do not try this dessert you will be missing out on one of the best creations ever! Not that my Panna Cotta wasn't good but that Lemoncello thing NOM NOM NOM!!!  Amazing meal! I'll be back!
author: Maren H.

description:
This place is amazing and truly authentic.  I was craving a really good homemade Italian meal for our last night in San Francisco.  After searching around we ended up somewhere down the road and immediately walked out after being too loud and just not the atmosphere we wanted.  We searched again and found Franchino's and it was absolutely amazing from beginning to end.

First of all, it is family owned and you can feel that immediately upon walking in the door.  The owner, Franchino (I assume), greeted and talked to every table and his wife came out and served us dessert and espresso.  It is a darling little place with a cozy feel.  We started with the mussels in spicy red sauce...the sauce was divine and we sopped up every last drop with the bread.  We had the Fettuccine Franchino and the Chicken Saltinbocca for entrees and both were outstanding and cooked to absolute perfection. 

We had to end the meal with a homemade cannoli and we opted for an original vanilla shell...amazing!! It made me homesick for my Italian Grandparents and their cooking.

This was probably our favorite meal on our trip just wonderful from beginning to end with the ambiance of a truly Italian family meal.
author: Kendra B.

description: This is by far the best Italian food every time a friend or relative comes into town I bring them here it's a must in San Francisco
author: Chase N.

description:
The brushetta n tortellini soup were delish!
Quaint, clean, friendly, family run show.
Felt like the Godfather might walk in. lol
author: Benjamin P.

description:
My group of friends and I came on Saturday before a marathon to carb-load. No tables were available and the owner told me that he'll get us a table (group of six) as soon as he could. He wouldn't give me an estimate of how long the wait would be. I had to talk to him several times to try to get an idea of the situation. He was charming though, in his heavy Italian accent.

I ordered the pasta pescatore and pesto linguini to go for my boyfriend. My pasta was loaded with clams, mussels, fish and two prawns. The sauce was exactly like the tomato sauce that I had in Italy, it had more oil, but had a rich and complex flavor. I could definitely tell that the sauce was freshly made and with care. The pasta was just a tad overcooked though. I certainly want to come back and try their risottos. 

The place is small and family ran, and it shows. The staff speak Italian to one another and they obviously take pride in the food. Certainly worth a try amidst the tourist traps in the area.
author: Alice W.

description:
Franchinos is another memorable spot in SF and I STRONGLY recommend that you try the gnocchi as they elevate the form to a new level.  And I also STRONGLY recommend that you try said gnocchi with the gorgonzola cream sauce paired with the house chianti. I didn't know what all the fuss was about wine and food pairings until suddenly I tried this dish combo and had the intense sensation of the wine breaking apart each flavor note of the gnocchi.  Similarly, the special of ricotta and spinach stuffed gnocchi pillows is another must try (with the pink sauce). 

Franchino's is an awesome family owned, somewhat clichéd, and quaint restaurant with an extremely nice husband/wife owning and running the place. They serve only classical Italian food but prepare it so well it's like straight out of a daydream. They use top quality ingredients and execute to a higher standard. The beef filling in the cannelloni and the cheese on top are all much better than in any other version that I've tried. At most other Italian restaurants, I either order something different (with a 'spin' on the classic) or leave thinking 'that was good, but I could have made it better'. Instead, Franchino's has set the bar for what it SHOULD taste like. 

Personally, I liked it better when Franchino was more boisterous and talkative, but of late he seems to be 'behaving' himself.
author: Tiffany S.

description: With so many restaurants in north beach it's hard to choose. We liked this place, it's small, mom and sisters waited on us. Portions were on the small side. The Gorgonzola cream sauce was delicious! Kids had the gnocchi and that was good. I had the chicken marsala and that it ok, kinda bland. Salad was good, just would have liked bigger portions.
author: Christie P.

description:
This is a cozy little slice of Italy. A friendly family run restaurant with Old World charm. The owner greeted us warmly outside and walked us in. There, the server (his daughter?) showed us to a window seat. 

The menu is plentiful but not overwhelming. We ordered one of the specials, but customized. No problem. Made to order and delicious! The gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce is to die for! The veal piccata was tender and tasty. The whole family helped; kept our water glasses full and made us feel welcome. We will definitely return!
author: Kent R.

description: Referred by a friend, and it didn't disappoint. Delicious Italian dishes.......even for a finicky teenager, great service. Our chef even came out to our table to greet us. Definitely will go again when we are back in town.
author: Michelle W.

description:
This place is amazing. I feel like I'm back in Italy on vacation. It is obviously family run. Franchino greets you himself (his pictures are all over the restaurant from back in the day). It must be his wife and daughters that serve. I've been here 3 times this past year. It is classic north beach little Italy. They are accommodating to get you a table quickly when the place is busy. The pasta sauces are great and they are flexible with any requests you have for your entree such as a different type of pasta than what is listed on the menu.

Portions are good here. You will leave satisfied and feeling cozy after a nice pasta dinner and a couple glasses of wine

Only negative thing to mention is that it is tight quarters so you might be bumping against the next table at times. But that gives it some charm considering it is a 10 table restaurant.
author: Brad G.

description: I've been going to Franchino's for over 25 years. I've taken girlfriends, family, friends and clients here and all rave about the food and atmosphere. My favorite is their veal piccatta, but everything I have had here has been terrific!. If you have room for dessert try their orally orgasmic Zabaione served fresh and warm the way it should be (not days old and cold like most places serve it) and if Franchino is in the mood he will sing your favorite aria. It will be an evening you won't forget.
author: jack w.

description:
I thank Yelp for putting me in the direction of Franchino, as when you're in Little Italy, it can be overwhelming. Years ago I had a pretty memorable experience at Mona Lisa, but I wasn't in the mood for that kind of Rococo-as-fuck atmosphere. I just wanted something simple and comfortable...oh and delicious. And perhaps decadent. I found that in Franchino.

It's a truly homey atmosphere with what appears to be the owners walking around and talking to people. I opened the menu and was immediately ecstatic to see that there was a vegetarian lasagna. Although I try to avoid dairy regularly, sometimes I'm just in the mood for comfort foods of my youth. Like...lasagna! Only, most authentic Italian joints seem to only offer the standard meat option. 

So I ordered that, plus a glass of Chianti and sat back to enjoy the scene around me. It wasn't terribly crowded, nor was it empty. It was just right, entirely inviting, intimate (well, I was by myself) and I loved the warm, Italian trattoria atmosphere. I could have been in Florence. I could have been in Brooklyn. I could have been on Arthur Avenue in the Bronx. 

The food arrived and I took a moment to appreciate the very sight of it--the curled lasagna noodles, the orangey-red sauce, the slightly browned mozzarella, crispy on the edges (KEY!!!!) And then I dug in. Pure bliss. I don't remember the vegetables, but whatever was in there worked in perfect harmony to give me just the taste I was looking for. Yes, the noodles were the right level of al dente, the sauce tangy, and the cheese not overwhelming. MMMMMMMM I was as happy as Garfield when it was all over.

I'll be back!
author: Joi B.

description: The only times I write reviews is when the place is HORRIBLE or when the place is AMAZING. I am beyond pleased to announce this is 5 star place! I ordered the cheese tortellini with pesto sauce and a house salad. I'm in food comma heaven and to top it off the customer service is excellent, very friendly and family owned! It's a cute location and next time I'm in town I am definitely coming back!
author: Judith R.

description:
AMAZING!
feels and tastes soooo authentic!
the service here is amazing.
I literally have nothing at all bad to say about this place.
go there! you won't be disappointed.
I always get the ciopino - I don't think that's how you spell it, sorry
and it's mouth watering everytime!!
author: Cody F.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in Little Italy. My friends and I love Italian food, and even visited Rome this past month. This place is definitely the next best thing to actually being in Italy! Plus, it is family owned. The mother still works and all of her 4 daughters can be seen working and helping out at the restaurant. Family owned, authentic, amazing taste, homemade, great service... What more can you ask for?!
author: Jeri F.

description: We've been looking for a nice Italian place and we found one! The service was great and they serve a very good quantity of food! I had the risotto con porcini and my husband had spaghetti alla carbonara. It was delicious! We ended with a classic tiramisu, also delicious! I absolutely recommend this restaurant!
author: Ornella G.

description: If you are looking for an authentic old world family experience, this is the place.  They are a family owned/run business in the style most businesses should aspire to be.  We made a reservation and were seated promptly.  We had our soon to be 4yr. old with us and he was warmly welcomed.  Our appetizers were tasty and our entrees were delicious. Our son's dessert was brought out with a birthday candle and the tiramisu was amazing.  Throughout our dining experience we traded anecdotes about small children with the family/waitstaff.  If you are interested in real people that serve great food that actually have pride in what they do, I suggest you give this place a visit.
author: Justin G.

description:
I was here with a group of six women for a dinner meeting. I was excited because I don't get to North Beach as often as I'd like and was anxious for some real Italian food. I had a tough time parking and was a little late to our 6:30 p.m. reservation, but the other 5 girls were there. I called my friend to let her know I was walking and she said that they were already being pressured to hurry. I hastened my walk a bit and got there around 6:45 or so. 

We ordered pretty quickly- I got the gnocci with gorgonzola which is a richer meal than I would usually order, but when in rome, eh? My companions ordered a variety of other items, each of which looked delicious. Our food arrived relatively quickly, which we appreciated. My gnocchi was good, but not the best I have ever had and I wish there had been a little more of it.

I did not appreciate, however, feeling rushed eating my food. We were meeting while we ate, which of course slows the food consumption process, but we all felt really pressured to eat faster. We were offered dessert, which a few ordered, and AS SOON as we were finished we were asked to finish up. They told us they had a reservation for 7:30 (this was at 7:50, by the way) and we needed to vacate. I pointed out the time to the server and she said "I know, that's why we need you to leave". 

SAY WHAAAAAAT?!?

I have never been asked to vacate a table for another party in my entire dining career. I was stunned. All of us were having a David After Dentist moment- "is this real life?".

We vacated after paying the $230 tab (yep, $230 for SIX PEOPLE) and moved our meeting outside. We had business to finish and so we stood out front for about 30 more minutes in order to do so. The overall opinion was that the food was good, but none of us would rush back because of the service. It's unfortunate because I was so hopeful about the delicious, delicious meal I was to have.
author: Holly L.

description:
OMG, that's one tiny place, and even with a reservation, it might take some time for them to get you seated.

But foodwise, I thought the place was good, I really enjoyed my risotto. Service was friendly once you were seated and it felt cosy.
author: Dominique F.

description: WOW. I was so impressed with the quality of the food. I am already craving their pasta again. I had the Capellini Mare e Monti and tiramisu. The Aurora sauce was the perfect blend, the capellini texture was fresh, the prawns and chicken complimented each other really well. The waitress was really nice and the owner even checked on us. I am definitely coming back when I visit this city again. This place is really cute for date night.
author: Tita T.

description:
Either the quality has gone down or my taste buds have higher expectations than the last time I was here (about 2 years ago). 

Now that SF has so many delicious Italian choices where the pasta is made in-house/homemade, it was tough for me to eat the store-bought pasta at Francino.  The pasta lacked texture and flavor, and even the best sauce couldn't change my disappointment.  The gnocchi tasted better, but I just couldn't get over how cheap the pasta tasted.  I discovered another spot in North Beach called BaoNecci and I was really impressed with their pasta, so that's my new go-to spot.
author: Naomi P.

description: Awesome food!  Definitely you can feel the love put into the food. Best Italian food I've had in SF. The owner/cook/everything is a genuine sweetheart that truly wants you to enjoy your dinner. Wide variety on the menu. Specials every night. Prices are outstanding.
author: Kevin P.

description: Franchino was amazing! Such good food, and great service! Coming to San Fran for vacation and went to little Italy looking for some real and authentic Italian food, and we found it! If I'm ever back in this area, I will 100% come back to Franchino!
author: Madison M.

description: The food was amazing. We had veal, gnocchi, and my son had a half order of clams with marinara. Everything was delicious and the pastas are homemade. Really great service too.  We can't wait to try something else the next time we come back!
author: e l.

description: I am an airline pilot who is also an Italian food critic/snob.  This is the best Italian restaurant that I have ever eaten at in the US.   If you dont like the menu (which is almost impossible, they will make whatever you want).  The veal/mushroom/penne knocked my socks off!
author: Tony I.

description:
Another Fantastic meal... Manicotti and special for the night were both A-Mazing! 
The staff is awesome with the great family/home feel!
author: Ben S.

description: Simply the best! Old world charm, family run business, and amazing menu.  No shortcuts and no fancy stuff just great food.
author: David S.

description: Awesome food, great service. We couldn't decide so we asked the waitress for recommendations. One was rigatoni with mushrooms, sausage, red sauce and gorgonzola for added creaminess. The other was gnocchi tricolore, a special suggested by customers with 3 sauces: tomato, gorgonzola and pesto. Perfect for indecisive diners who want as much variety as possible in one visit. Both dishes made us extremely happy! I think I found my go-to Italian restaurant in North Beach. Can't wait to go back!
author: Maria K.

description: Bread was cold. Linguine de volgole (something like that) Was a 5 out of 10 considering the price. Clams didn't taste fresh. Service was ok until the time came to pay. We asked to split 3 cards for a almost 80 bill and was asked to do the math ourselves... What? Then we just decided to split it in 3 and were told only 1 per table and that a favor would be to accept 2. I asked why and was told the chip causes issues. Found it rude to reject legit payment options from customers. Not sure where the 4 stars comes from.
author: Fernando S.

description:
Hanging out in SFO while on vacation with my wife and craving good Italian food far from any chain... we found Franchino on Yelp, and gave it a try. 

While parking can be challenging, the atmosphere and charm of the family establishment is excellent. The owner, and daughters, worked (with a big smile) our tables.

I had the chicken Parmesan, while my wife had gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce. We finished it off with a chocolate cannoli. All superb.

Highly recommended.
author: Michael H.

description: We try and visit this gem at least once a year. A must for anyone visiting the City. Mom and her girls do a wonderful job making everyone feel like family. A small and warm atmosphere also a bit romantic when Dad is there to sing. Food is amazing and we recommend the veal Parmesan ~ always consistent. Recommend reservations but if you need to wait, it's worth it!
author: Denise R.

description: We just had the most enjoyable meal here.  We began we a caprese salad and followed with pasta dishes which were all fresh and beyond yummy.  The atmosphere was cute and the owners make you like your their friend and guest.  We will come back here every time we're in SF.
author: Carrie K.

description:
They have been in this location longer than I'm alive and its because they are constantly good. 
Family owned and operated, great tomato sauce (gravy) and the Lasagna is a favorite
author: Kevin K.

description: It seems something has lost thru the time, only remaining nice thing is warm service of the sisters.
author: Fatih N.

description:
I've really gotta give this place five stars...

As an Italian-American girl in SF from Jersey... I have to say this place has exceeded expectations twice now. A family run joint with a kitschy atmosphere, Franchino really does hit the mark.

I've always had an aversion to ordering pasta out at restaurants, but each dish I've tried was just excellent. Simple flavors done well - exactly what I look for in a great Italian restaurant

The first time I went I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola - I was wary as two heavy flavors can sometimes be too rich, but somehow it was balanced, light and not overly filling. An absolutely excellent dish.

Their daily pasta specials have always been fresh, with a very simple but flavorful ragu sauce that complemented my chicken piccata (seriously, another homestyle classic done just right) incredibly well.

Throw in a great dessert selection, a decent array of wines and an intimate, yet casual, atmosphere - I will keep coming back and recommending this to locals and tourists alike.

Oh, and the family the runs it couldn't be friendlier - the owner even offered to help call cabs for the large out of town group we were with. 

Great little gem.  

PS - Our large group was talked into an appetizer sampler this evening, and while everything was certainly tasty, the roasted eggplant rolls with gorgonzola were simply to die for. Our whole table could not stop talking about it.
author: Alexandra K.

description: Small and full of joy from everyone enjoying their food. The service was fast and the food was so good I salivated from start to finish.
author: Scott H.

description: This was such a pleasant surprise. Find it by accident. Wouldn't miss it for the world. Just amazing amazing food. Atmosphere just as good. Family owned. She cooks better than your mama
author: Charl H.

description:
Pretty crazy to read the polar opposite reviews. 

I sat with a group of 9, we were treated like family and the ladies working were hospitable and truly Italian. The food was pretty damn authentic and tasted great. I had spaghetti carbonara and it was tasty. My wife had salmon risotto which was even better. Would definitely go back
author: Ryan H.

description:
Ugh since when did this place get so popular!? Great for business for this mom and pop place except the tourists are super rude and snotty. Tourists were telling people to go to the end of the line even though they had a reservation. I don't care which country you're from but I would've allowed people to check in with the waiter ESPECIALLY if they had a reservation. Just because you've been waiting in line in the cold doesn't give you the right to be rude to people. GO HOME. 

Anyway, try the prosciutto appetizer and gnocchi! Best I've ever had and I always order this. Most recently, I had a layered cake which is to die for! The services were great as always. The family staff are always so kind, funny, and they are so cute together!
author: Winn D.

description: At first glance, the restaurant is a small, family place. Do not let the size of the restaurant take up your concern, because what they lack in space, which really isn't a problem but some take issue with things like that, they make up entirely with their service, charm and offerings. I went on a Wednesday night with my friend before heading over to City Lights Bookstore. We were sat at a nicely set table, complete with a lit candle. The restaurant is decorated in a very classic Italian/Mediterranean style. In the background you can hear faint opera but the restaurant is quiet for its size. For our appetizer we had the bruschetta. It was AMAZING! I've had it at other restaurants and the bread has either been made soggy by the tomatoes and basil, or the bread was quite hard and topped with very little tomato and basil. Here, the bread was perfect, with a light crunch from toasting but still soft in the middle. The topping was not too juicy and it was well balanced and flavorful. I would definitely go back just for the bruschetta. For our entrees, my friend and I split the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce, she had the Fettuccine Al Salmone with Aurora Sauce, and I had the Grilled Salmon with mixed vegetables. The gnocchi was light and pillowy. It was like heaven in a dish. The sauce was light and flavorful. You didn't get that overtly full feeling that most pasta gives you. It left you satisfied. My salmon was perfectly grilled, but not overcooked. It was seasoned with garlic, olive oil and rosemary. It was one of the best pieces of salmon I've had in a long time, and the best part was that it tasted fresh. The vegetables were grilled in what seemed like the same seasoning as the salmon and they were just as amazing. My friend's entree was actually very good, she enjoyed it and I know from the bite I had of it that I would have enjoyed it. For dessert, we split the tiramisu, which was topped with a candied maraschino cherry. The tiramisu was rich, as expected, but again, the food at this restaurant doesn't make you overtly full and feeling miserable. Everything leaves you satisfied. It was somewhat pricy, but I think it was worth it when you keep in mind the freshness of the food and the satisfaction after. The waitresses were very kind and made sure our dining experience was satisfactory. I will definitely return!
author: Zachary D.

description: I have been coming to Franchinos for years. Every time I come here it feels like being with family. Everyone here is so sweet and they go above and beyond to make you feel welcomed and special. No matter what you order you can't go wrong! I totally recommend a stop in when you are in town.
author: Dena C.

description: Franchino's is amazing. First, how many places are truly family owned and operated?  A place in which the owner stands in the door to greet all costumers. I ordered a special, homemade pasta, something like a thick fetuccine. The sauce had mushrooms and sausage. Chianti was decent and a decent pour! For dessert, homemade (I was told "everything from scratch, nothing comes out of a can here" and you can tell) tiramisu. Creamy but not heavy. The perfect ending to a great meal!!
author: Ingrid R.

description: If you are looking for traditional, family-style Italian food in San Francisco, you can't do much better than Franchino. This little place is family owned, with Mom in the kitchen making the specials just for you. The environment is no-frills, but the fantastic food and amazing service makes it well worth the visit.
author: Peter G.

description:
This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to! When it comes to Italian cooking, it's not about haute cuisine and tiny portions; it's about a family atmosphere and homemade goodness, and this place has it all. This is the first time in a long time that I've gone to a restaurant that is truly family owned and operated, and what a lovely family they are! They were very kind and hospitable. 

I had the linguini pescatore and it was phenomenal! The seafood was fresh, the pasta was homemade, and the sauce was so flavourful that I wanted to lick the plate! My partner had the meat lasagna and it was layer after layer of homemade pasta and thick, meaty tomato sauce. 

Definitely visit this place when you're in San Francisco!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
This place is a really cute, small Italian restaurant. Definitely looks like a great date spot. We got seated right away (table for 2) on a Wednesday night. 

The bruschetta is some of the best I've ever had, just like what you find in Italy. The eggplant parmigiana is also amazing, lots of cheese, thin layers of eggplant, and it comes with either pasta (big tubes, good sauce) or salad. 

The place seems very authentic, food and atmosphere. The service was great, loved hearing the Italian around.
author: Pallavi K.

description:
There is that one restaurant that you talk about and reminisce fondly over once you return home from vacation.  Franchino's was THAT place for my husband and I.  You can't find a more authentic Italian restaurant!  Franchino, the owner, and his wife and daughters made our evening so special.  The food was amazing...we had the delicious gnocchi and  spaghetti with Italian sausage.  We also had the best Tiramisu I have ever tasted in my life. 
It is definitely a special place that I hope to return to again in the future.
author: Carey W.

description:
I have been craving authentic, homey Italian in a hole-in-the-wall place like this since moving to the Bay Area and we just happened in last night with friends - our four-top was seated without a wait, but I think we got lucky with our timing.

This place is the real deal - as authentic as you can get on the West Coast and outside of Italy. Simple, expertly prepared, casual fare dressed up enough to feel like Sunday Supper. 

Family-owned for twenty-five years, Franchino is comprised of a husband and wife team featuring any one of their three daughters ("The SHORT One, The TALL One, ..." Etc.). The trio serves up just the right amount of Old World charm you want in a place like this - great service, pleasant and passionate about their food, and if you're lucky the Mister will favor the joint with a duet, usually alongside one of the more attractive female diners chosen at random. 

Tiny and cozy, be prepared to wait if you haven't secured a table, and not surprisingly wine is the order of the day as this place does not have a full liquor license -- but you won't miss that unless you're somehow not a fan of wine.

I enjoyed the Veal Saltimbocca - succulent and perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of mozzarella and prosciutto. Alongside it, I chose the pasta of the day which happened to be rigatoni -- my favorite!! - with meat sauce. The pasta was perfect al dente, and the entire meal was so good it almost made me cry. You can't pass up dessert in a place like this - I went for a cannoli which they make in-house, and oh my god - amazing!! So get in there already!!
author: Christian W.

description: RUDE RUDE RUDE hostess. Yelled at my brother and I because we wanted to be seated 5 mins before my husband arrived. She said " this is my moms restaurant, a family owned business and you can have a table for two because the other tables are for bigger parties (the tables for 4) and the restaurant was half empty. She kept yelling at us, because I said we were going to go someplace else, while we walked out and saying there is a reason we've been here 28 years and to find another place to go to.... because we asked to be seated- we had just walked a bunch to get there and I am pregnant so wanted to sit and order dinner. She was ridiculously upset for someone who's a restaurant owner and if ANYTHING SHOULD BE THE FIRST TO PROVIDE POSITIVE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I was low in tone being mindful of the other customers seated for dinner and she was yelling. Must say- WORST experience at a restaurant- ever.
author: Rana Z.

description: We love to come here for some delicious homemade Italian food when we come to SF! It is family owned & operated and everyone is very friendly. The whole family actually came to America from Italy. The restaurant is very cozy and authentic. We will come back for more delicious homemade pasta anytime we are in the neighborhood! :)
author: Crystal L.

description: Cozy little place in North Beach. We loved everything we ordered. Service was good and the people were super nice.
author: Gayane K.

description: Solid Italian makes up for lack of finesse with friendly family service and charm.  Sometimes you just want to have a no frills penne with red sauce.  On such occasions, Franchino will satisfy nicely and make you feel at home.
author: Mike L.

description:
Franchino's gets 1 star for faking it. I'm at a loss for words, and almost lost my lunch after eating here, on my birthday, with my mother who was visiting from Brooklyn, NY. Talk about adding insult to injury! 

The meal and overall experience was so bad it's actually funny. To start, when we first walked in my down to earth but food-loving mother said "How come it doesn't smell like food in here...?" It was like the food had been microwaved and left to sit. The eggplant parmesan had the texture of an old shoe, my husband's dish looked like something out of a slasher movie (he ate about 1 bite of the unidentifiable chicken with red stuff and cheese goo), the salad was dressed with something out of a bottle, and the bread just bad. Who f**ks up bread!?! I believe what they say about bread being a litmus test for food and boy do I wish we'd honored this notion. 

Upon both entering and exiting the restaurant, there was Franchino sitting outside drinking a beer (not even peroni) spouting out some things in Italian to patrons and passersby. What a gimmick! My mother gets 2 stars for giving an honest answer when he asked if we enjoyed dinner. "Actually, it was pretty disappointing..." I was not surprised by her candidness but it definitely knocked Franchino's socks off. 

Hope you find this funny but heed my warning - 5 stars for gross!
author: Cara G.

description:
Everyone I bring here loves it as well for seven years running- last night we got there early and since things were slower ( but not for long!!) asked if we could have a drink while waiting for my husband to join us- no problem! Would never have asked when it's busy. 

We look at the menu, but I wonder why because the key to me is just going with what Mama makes for the specials! (Especially the parpadelle- I wait holding my breath to hear there's parpadelle...) gnocchi and chicken piccata also excellent! Save room for dessert- I used to get the tiramisu (awesome) until I tried the panna cotta (amazing- get it, unless it's the last piece- that one's mine!)
author: Keri B.

description:
Adorable place ran by an Italian family. The husband sits outside and chats with everyone walking by. 
Their food was amazing! The pink sauce was delicious and the wife makes the pasta each morning. The noodles were so fresh that it melted in your mouth. I will be back!
author: Charis R.

description:
Mr. Franchino, the owner of this restaurant, is a RUDE IDIOT. I was visiting San Francisco this past weekend with my daughters, our first time there together in many years, so I wanted to have a special dinner. I spotted the tiny Franchino and decided to give it a try. I gave my name to the hostess inside who was friendly & pleasant and said we'd have about a 20 minute wait. At this point I did not see the monster Franchino lurking anywhere nearby. 

After waiting outside about five minutes I stepped back in to ask the hostess if they might have a gluten free pasta. The hostess I had just spoken to was nowhere to be seen but another young woman was standing in her spot. As I leaned forward to ask her my question, the brute Franchino appeared from out of nowhere; he looked drunk and said 'Pleasah step outside' while making that obnoxious waving-shooing 'bye bye' motion with both his hands, adding "Thissah lady does not work here." I was so caught off guard, embarrassed, and insulted by Mr Franchino's rude treatment of me that I didn't even attempt to explain myself to such an IDIOT. 

I did indeed step back outside, grabbed my two daughters, and went immediately next door to Mona Lisa, another Italian restaurant where the room was spacious and the decor beautiful, there was no wait, the service was very friendly and attentive, and, most importantly, the food was delicious. The only bad thing was the lingering sour taste left in my mouth by the rude treatment I had just received next door at Franchino, a restaurant that needs a new owner who has manners and does not insult his own customers. 

Reading through the other reviews here, its clear that Mr Franchino is a Jekyll & Hyde character who does things HIS way without regard for social convention, and patrons who roll the dice by going there never know what their experience will be like. Mine? HORRIBLE!

Forget about stars Mr Franchino, this is a ONE FINGER review for you.... !!!
author: Yogurt M.

description: Best Italian restaurant in SanFran!!! Very very cozy and typical Italian environment; Italian owner is there to open the door and receive you; restaurant is runned by his family! Best boloñesa pasta ever and do not miss the panacotta for dessert! Can't wait to go again!
author: Cristina F.

description: Oh my heck!   The bread with balsamic vinegar and oil made a great free appetizer.  The gnocchi was amazing with chicken.  I did the pesto sauce but next time would go with the cream or meat sauce.  The cheesecake was some of the best I have ever had.  Love this place.
author: Camisha C.

description:
I'll be honest, Franchino wasn't my first choice; it wasn't even my second or third. It had nothing to do with the food or reviews, it had to do to its proximity to Bi-Rite (yes, I admit I have a problem). Despite missing out on a Bi-Rite trifecta, I'm glad we stumbled upon this place.

The restaurant is is small and narrow, but not to the point of feeling cramped. I was fortunate to avoid the wait many have described, but that's not to say the place was empty. On a Thursday evening, there was a steady stream of people dining - I recommend reservations.

My colleague had done a little homework on the place and knew she wanted to try their italian sausage. They were extremely accommodating when she tweaked her order slightly. I, on the other hand, hadn't any research aside from venue and was overwhelmed by the long list of pasta choices, eventually settling on the linguine con vongole with red sauce. 

I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and cleaned my plate. The sauce was extremely flavorful and the dish loaded with clams. Not being able to store leftovers and being notorious for overindulging on pasta, I was pleased that portions were generous without being gluttonous.

Service was friendly and efficient. Throughout our dinner one server and a woman (I suspect the owner's wife) attended to us. The owner's wife was friendly, funny and cute; she reminded me of a grandmother trying to stuff us silly. When my colleague ordered the tiramisu, she brought two spoons despite my protests. When she learned I hadn't tried it (tiramisu just isn't my bag), she playfully scolded me. For what it's worth, my colleague gushed about the tiramisu.

Franchino was a nice little surprise; good food, good people, good prices. I would definitely return next time I'm in town. I wish I knew about this place years ago, when I stopped into the over-hyped Stinking Rose a few doors down!
author: Mary T.

description: This place was AMAZING. Not only was the service spectacular but the food was delicious. I walked in with no reservation and got seated immediately. I ordered the Linguine Con Cozze (spaghetti with mussels) and my boyfriends ordered the Chicken Parmigiana - both were mouth watering. We also ordered the Bruschetta - highly recommend it. We got to speak to the owner, who was very pleasant. The restaurant is family-owned. I WILL definitely come back!
author: Carolina P.

description:
3/31/12 

The food here was okay and WAY overly priced. I ordered a white sauce pasta and butternut squash ravioli which were both a bit oily and soggy. The waiter was constantly hitting on my girlfriend at the time. The service was mediocre and the food took a while. However the restaurant does give a traditional italian feel. Im willing to give this restaurant another shot if im back in the area.
author: Andrew W.

description: Was recommended this place by a friend and decided to come here for date night. Small, family owned restaurant with a lot of character and service that can only come from a place that's still owned and operated by a family. Although the restaurant is small, we found a table on a Tuesday night with no wait. The food was excellent and I wouldn't hesitate coming here again.
author: Ryo C.

description: Amazing gluten free pasta imported from Italy and their homemade pesto was great! Plus the family that runs the restaurant was so sweet.
author: Jackie P.

description: Best meal I had in SF. Authentic Italian food. Family owned. Fairly priced. Wonderful service.
author: Lynda D.

description: Decided to finally try this place out as we were given a gift certificate! Great little family owned Italian joint. Reservations are recommended, especially on Saturday nights, as the place is small and cozy. Service was fantastic and very attentive. Mom and sisters all took good care of us as well as selling the food. The mother makes the pasta herself and you can definitely tell. We started with the bruschetta which had good flavor but was a tad bit on the salty side. This was much better than the basket of bread we were given as we were seated...it was a little on the stale side. We then had the veal saltimbocca and the special pasta of the day. Spinach papperdelle with meat sauce. Good flavor with everything. Paired well with a recommended Italian red wine.
author: Courtney O.

description:
A very cozy, warm, and friendly place that serves rock solid dishes.  Upon entering, we were greeted by several people... all of whom  were very friendly.

We opted for grilled vegetables, chicken parmesan, veal parmesan, and ravioli with mushroom sauce.  The grilled vegetables were among the best I've had.  Not overly oily and overcooked as are commonly found at other places.  The parmesan dishes had a unique and delicious sauce that seemed like a blend between traditional tomato sauce and a more creamy cheese.  The ravioli were cooked just right and smothered in a delicious but rather heavy and rich cream sauce.  This dish would make a better side dish than entree due to its heaviness.

All in all a good experience and a place worth revisiting.  3 1/2 stars.
author: Lee K.

description: Amazing! (Sono Italiano) a proper meal! Fantastic entry course with Cozze and spicy tomato sauce... Following linguine with Vongole in white wine sauce. I'll be here soon again. It was worth any single dollar
author: Guido S.

description:
My absolute new fav gem in my neighborhood. 
Usually there's always a wait but the kind older Italian gentleman..aka the actual owner  aka FRANCHINO HIMSELF will come out, hold a casual conversation and give you the wine list to glance at while you wait.

BONUS- he will allow you to order a glass and drink it outside while you wait for your table

The wife is there, as well as his two daughters which is a recipe for a cozy and open family and homey environment.

The pesto fettuccini is a solid. My boyfriend always gets fettuccini Alfredo with chicken.
The capreese salad is a must with a bottle of Pinot.

Perfect place for an intimate date night.
author: T R.

description:
Our table was in generally happy with our meal - a little lack of flavor there and little boring here - but the service. Was. Crap.

I'm sorry, but the owner of the restaurant should never, ever, come by your table when you are paying the check after an otherwise enjoyable albeit mediocre meal and try to hurry you along while grabbing the cash you're counting because "I have a lot of people waiting outside". We are paying customers enjoying the end of our glass of wine while paying and you try to kick us out? I am livid.

Don't even get me started on the bread issue. We order a bottle of wine and beers and they would not bring us any bread. Oh wait, and without warning they unjustly changed us a 20% gratuity for a table of 5. Normal...perhaps for SF...but only with a warning!! Jerks.

You ruined your food, which already needed a little help, with bullshit attitude aimed at a great paying table. I won't be going back.
author: Anna G.

description: My favorite Italian Restaurant in San Francisco.  Good food.  Good prices.  Staff was very friendly, welcoming!   I've been there twice - both times with groups of friends from work.
author: Dan R.

description: Awesome authentic Italian restaurant owned by a family. Very cute and cozy. Everything was really delicious. We ordered chicken parmigiana with pasta on the side, definitely a must try. Tortellini soup had enough flavour, wasn't too salty, again, great overall. We also ordered their homemade tiramisu, for me personally, the cream on it was a delight. Nice friendly service. The restaurant was packed, so if recommend making a reservation.
author: Luba Y.

description: In accord with previous reviews I ordered the gnocchi ala Gorgonzola. Very tasty. The sauce was splendidly creamy and not overpowering. Our service from Franka was fun and attentive. I'll return here next time I find myself in San Francisco.
author: Alex B.

description: We went here for Italian food with some friends. The place has a charming decor and doesn't feel too big. I ordered the cheese tortellini in alfredo sauce, which was excellent. The alfredo sauce was the waitress's suggestion, and it was the right choice - the alfredo was creamy and matched the cheesy taste quite well. The pasta was perfectly cooked al dente - as is to be expected. My wife got the vegetarian lasagna, which she quite enjoyed. All in all, a nice little place to grab Italian, although I can't say if it's better or worse than anywhere else in little Italy.
author: Ross L.

description: Amazing, homemade Italian food. If you want an excellent bowl of pasta, eat here! It's a small, family owned restaurant and pastas are made fresh daily.
author: Daralyn B.

description: We were here more than one year ago and I've been meaning to write a review. I loved  this restaurant. Food was amazing and great service. The wait was a bit long (it was on  Saturday) but well worth it. Friendly staff and owner is cool, he goes around greeting everyone.
author: Kathy V.

description: By far the BEST Italian I've ever had in my life. Homemade food made by the family grandmother. My pesto tortellini was awesome! I ate every bit of the pesto sauce with my bread! The cannoli was one of the best I've ever had! Would highly recommend.
author: Trey G.

description:
