Very nice mom and pop restaurant. I too think the owner welcomed us in and sat us in one of the 8 or so tables the restaurant has.
I agree with a reviewer it seems the bread is bought elsewhere and was cold.
But the food - wow. The canelloni was amazing the service excellent.
author: Bdiddy D.

description:
Should have known that I'd there's no one in the place eating we should not waste our time. 
The chianti was bad. The gnocchi looked like Kraft Mac & Cheese and the veal piccata looked flat and like it came from a box.  

There is only one thing I can say that is nice, yeah  for family owned small business. Word of advice, it's time for either a makeover or close it up.
author: Kim C.

description:
Had a fabulous meal with fabulous service, and entertainment from Italian guy (owner?) hovering outside the front door and interacting with customers.  Servers were attentive.  We tried a couple of the specials-of-the-day, which were excellent.  The bruschetta appetizer was mouth-watering good, and the tiramisu renewed my interest in tiramisu.  
I will definitely go back!
author: Chris S.

description:
Franchino offers a lovely dining experience. The restaurant itself is small, cozy and cute - just what a great italian restaurant should be. I love the decor and how romantic it is. The wait staff is also friendly and welcoming. I appreciated how they serve bread and it went very well with the olive oil they had on the table.

For appetizers I got the bruschetta. It was honestly the best bruschetta I've ever had. The bread was toasted and warm and the tomatoes were seasoned so perfectly. It was so good! My friend ordered the soup and she said she loved it.

For the entree we shared the gnocchi with the gorgonzola (creamy cheese) sauce. Very good gnocchi. The sauce complimented the pasta well. The gnocchi was small and filled with potatoes - my favorite. The entree was a single serving but with the appetizers, it was enough to fill us both up.

We didn't get dessert, but the dessert menu seemed like it had a lot to offer.

I would definitely come back. Prices were very reasonable for italian cuisine and the restaurant is so romantic and cute that it's a perfect place for an intimate dinner or date.
author: Junel S.

description:
This is by far the most authentic Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  The entire family works there and Mr. Franchino is an absolute goldmine of knowledge, entertainment and pure love of the Italian Culture.  

My wife and I had our first date here and continue to go back on a regular basis for the past 5 years.  The need to be open and let it all happen is a must.   The menu in all capacities speaks for itself.  I have had basically everything and not once have regretted anything. I would highly recommend ordering a full order of Gnocchi Della Casa for the table. 

If you want to let your guard down and relax in the hustle and bustle of North Beach this is the place to be.
author: thekidd b.

description: Go-to spot for italian with that homemade feel. Family owned, Mom cooks all the food! Meatballs, Gnocchi's, Pappardelle and house wine all A+++!
author: Michelle H.

description: My bad. The "random" guy on the sidewalk is the restaurants namesake. Interesting. And the food is great. Treated like family, small, intimate setting that's great for talking and laughing. Nice.
author: Lis C.

description: Had dinner here in Little Italy. Classic Italian dishes made fresh. I had gnocchi, light and pillowy! I couldn't decide between the tomato sauce and the Gorgonzola sauce so I did half and half. Warm and friendly family owned business!
author: Celeste B.

description:
THIS SHOULD BE A ZERO review but i cant do that.
By far the worst Italian experience ever. This place was not cheap and the food was god awful. I got chicken parm and it wasn't edible . beware at all costs!
author: Zzzzz Z.

description: Love this place.  My suggestion- just walk in and ask for a sampler of appetizers/salads and split some entrées.  Best Italian dining experience in the city.
author: Corey T.

description:
Amazing
Great atmosphere, outstanding service, amazing wine selection... and incredible food! Has small town , homey feeling about it

The veal primavera, a recipe the founder brought with him from the old country,  according to his daughters, who sometimes drop by to care for the customers, is insane. I highly recommend it.

Intimate. Great for a date.
author: Jorge D.

description:
Gnocchi good....
Service good...
Wine good.....
All and all , my friends and I had a great experience..
author: Franco L.

description:
Adorable family restaurant. AMAZING fresh food. The Cioppino was fantastic as was everything else. You will get incredible food served by the owner and cooked by his wife. Really great.
One note: Not cheap, but the prices are still reasonable for food this good.
author: Brian W.

description: Wonderful experience. Small family real meal.. Fabulous gnocchi with Gorgonzola & "duck" wine, amazing!!!
author: Lindsey M.

description: I am an out of town visitor and wanted a great plate of pasta while in SFO.   this place definitely delivered.  we ordered two plates of handmade fresh pasta - one was manicotti and the other fettuccine - and they were happy to take special orders and divert from the menu. the husband and wife owners were a total delight and they even refilled our wine at no charge!  pistachio gelato was fantastic too. if I lived here I would be a regular at this place. they have been at this location 25 years - that's saying something.  if you are looking for a small authentic pasta joint, look no further.
author: Desiree G.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, we were lucky enough to find Franchino and their wonderful pasta.  It's such a warm, cozy, family environment.  The whole family was here tonight and our server was the owner's daughter Carmella (who was wonderful).  

We ordered the last bottle of Provincal Syrah, and it was so good that I took a picture of the label, so I could find it again.  We had the clams and salmon carpaccio, which were both great.  I loved the large amount of herbs on salmon, which some people might find overpowering, but not me.  

Our mains were the ravioli, a little too al dente for my liking (but I didn't order these!).  They were brought with a side of grilled Italian sausage:  the star of the show.  Absolutely perfectly cooked and so much flavor.  I had the fettuccine Franchino, which was wonderful.  I would have liked a little more mushroom, peas and prosciutto in it, but all in all, excellent.  It was just a fun experience in a great area.
author: Matt D.

description:
TL;DR: Hope you know the owner, otherwise you're not getting a damn table.

We tried to come here on Sunday evening after returning from Tahoe.  We had called in advance to try and put in a reservation, only to be told they don't take reservations.

We get to the restaurant, and there's a wait list.  We ask to get our names put on the list, but they inform us that "They don't take names" and "We have a system, we'll know when to seat you"

Speaking with a few other individuals in line, they said it seemed like there was no order, system, or anything in place as to how you got seated, but did notice that certain people who greeted the proprietor walking up after them got put on a table right away.

So, I appreciate its your business and you can take your friends in, but when your lackey's are giving people this kind of run around it looks REALLY poorly on your establishment.

We went up the street to a restaurant named after a Disney character and loved it.  You'd be really hard pressed to get me to even try and come back here.
author: Christopher G.

description: We are from out of town and on our way from the airport to our hotel we were referred to this place by our uber driver. All 3 of us loved this place! The food was amazing and the staff were very friendly. I would highly recommended this place to any one visiting San Francisco.
author: Darren F.

description: Great experience!  My only disappointment was they were sold out of the Papardelle I was really looking forward to it. The pasta here is homemade and the lady was kind enough to substitute with a homemade fettuccine. The Italian sausage is also homemade  (delicious) I could have eaten a second plate. The food was so authentic it brought me back to my trip to Italy. The owner felt so  bad that she ran out of the Papardelle that she gave me a complimentary homemade tiramisu "to die for!" I will definitely return next time I visit San Francisco. Hopefully they will have Papardelle.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Still my favorite Italian restaurant anywhere. Was there again two weeks ago and it hasn't changed much, which is a very good thing. Had the Veal Marsala, delicious, and, of course, the Zabaglione for dessert, unearthly goodness. Never had anything that wasn't absolutely delicious. Never had a dessert as good as their zabaglione. I took a very discerning, and somewhat picky, friend with me. She said it was not only the best Italian food she had ever eaten (including in Italy), but may have been the best meal she had ever eaten, period.
author: randall r.

description:
AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST!!!! The prices are steep for Italian food. The bill was $39 for two people. I know it's SF, I know things are expensive but for the portion, quality and presentation of the food it was awful. 

Let me get started on the food. It's gross, not sure how you call it Italian. My boyfriend ordered chicken parm. It came out looking like slop on a plate. He wasn't to sure if there was chicken under there Bc it was covered with sauce and cheese (usually a lot of sauce and cheese is good if the chicken is actually thick and can be seen) this chicken was so thin and not breaded at all. It tasted like it was done in the microwave, just really really gross. 
I got spaghetti with garlic and olive oil sauce the spaghetti was not al dente and it was barley coated in the olive oil. 

I would not be returning to this restaurant in the future. So many other Italian restaurants to try all along Columbus Ave.
author: Amanda C.

description: Great food. This place never disappoints. Wide selection of imported wines and the tiramisu is a must. Pasta was cooked to perfection, al dente. Highly recommended
author: Franchesca S.

description: The Food was Amazing, they do not have much of a beer selection you get the choice of 3 imports and a few domestic but they have a great wine selection. Service is a tad bit slow but it is a small mom and pop place that is always full. I would recomend this place!
author: Mike P.

description:
Poor customer service and bad business.

Franchino blatantly allowed his friends to be seated before a crowd of people on a busy Sunday night. There were a few couples who have been waiting what seemed like a long time before we arrived. He let the familiars in before at least 3-4 parties.

We let him know that we saw and heard everything (the couple asked if Franchino could "help them out" because they didn't have reservations), but he played it off. I do not want to give business to shady people regardless if the food is good or not.

SKIP THIS PLACE.
author: Stine H.

description: This place is adorable! Traditional Italian fare and decor. The owner is an older Italian women who was there on site and her daughter was our server. Love supporting restaurants like this! Authentic!
author: Leslie S.

description:
Franchino is a wonderful family run Italian restaurant that provides outstanding food and service.  When we arrived we were immediately and warmly greeted in Italian by the dapperly dressed Franchino.

The restaurant is smallish and an unusual shape, but that's typical of an old San Francisco building. The decor isn't much, but at least it's not faux Tuscan like the chains. It's really all about the food and service, and Franchino's delivers.

We enjoyed the Pasta Pescatora - mixed seafood, tomato, garlic, basil; Alfredo with chicken; Linguine Salmon in Aurora sauce, which is a mix of red and cream sauces; and Chicken Marsala.  All of our main courses were excellent!  Full, clean flavors, all cooked perfectly.

For dessert we shared a Homemade Canoli with chocolate hazelnut gelato which was good.

There was one misstep, the Prosciutto with melon was not up to expectations. The melon looked sad, and appeared haphazardly put together. I wished they would have suggested something else and said it wasn't available when we ordered it, rather than serving what we got.

But even with the slow start, I love Franchino, and we look forward to returning.  Our dinners were excellent and the great service can only be provided by a true family run establishment.
author: Jason C.

description: I'm no food expert, but this has to be one of the best Italian food I've had on American soil.  Besides the food & excellent service, this place just felt warm and cozy.  The price is extremely fair for the location.  I will definitely visit this restaurant again the next time I'm in Frisco.
author: Evan N.

description:
+ okay bread with olive oil and vinegar (though this should be a given at any good Italian restaurant)
+ the calm appetizers were good

- the owners (i think - daughter and wife) weren't very friendly, but the husband was very quirky and cute
- I disliked their award winning pesto gnocchi. It basically tasted like dough covered with pesto sauce. 
- They don't have fried calamari
- I am really disappointed when a waitress / waiter can't make any recommendations. Saying "everything is good" is a cop out.
author: Margaret R.

description: This was an unexpected treat for us in San Francisco. Being from NYC and of Italian heritage, I have high standards for Italian food. The owner's homemade pappardelle with mushrooms and Italian sausage was melt in your mouth delicious!  It was served in a tomato sauce with a touch of Gorgonzola for some creaminess. So light and with a complex taste. My husband is a fettuccine Alfredo connoisseur and he proclaimed it to be among the best he has had. A light pumpkin tiramisu for dessert and attentive care by the owner and her two daughters made it a great night. I would highly recommend you check out this small, but quality spot!
author: Lisa S.

description:
The reason I started a yelp account, was to write a review for Franchinos. This is my favorite restaurant in the city of San Francisco, and especially, North Beach. 

Where do I start... I take every friend, family member and acquaintance to Franchinos in every opportunity I can. I am a Italy-nut and have been over three times - the mood + atmosphere is almost identical. It is a 100% family-run restaurant and you can taste the expertise and 'home-cooking'. 

Each time, I get a large bottle of wine (One time - they ran out of the wine I had ordered - and instead gave me a larger, more expensive bottle - same price), a wonderful pasta dish (Alfredo, carbonara.. etc.) and a Caesar salad.

Need I say more? Buenisimo. I look forward to the next time.. and the times after that again and again. 

è perfetto!
author: Abigail M.

description:
Two doors down from the stinking rose, it could not be a more different experience. Far far away from tourist traps and the Wharf, here's a little restaurant operated through the ages. Wife and husband prepare a nice dining experience, and it's cute to see how much the son (who's often around) actually resembles both from the 30yo pictures on the walls.

Food-wise, it was very good. Not by any stretch the best Italian food I've had (e.g. the mantticotti had a very blend tomato sauce) but I was happy especially about the way the pasta was cooked. In the end, wine was cheap, dinner was good, and we left smiling.
author: Simon B.

description:
Cute LITTLE restaurant with very good home style southern Italian food. It seems to specializing in simple recipes that showcase classic Italian flavors.

We started with the house salad (doused in dressing - ask for it on the side) and the Scamorza (grilled smoked gouda with peppers, very good)

My date had the linguini with clams and white sauce. So simple, so beautiful - he loved it. (Alas, I can't try clams :( so we'll have to trust him). I had the cannolini. It was very rich and filled with beef. Super yummy. 

For dessert we had the panna cotta and the cheesecake. Both were kinda "eh" to me. I'll give it another shot with one of the nightly specials and/or the tiramisu next time, but barring a big difference between the dishes this just might give me an excuse to hit two places in one night to get dessert somewhere else.

The service was a little brusque, but it wasn't a problem. Just not super warm fuzzies.
author: Monika M.

description: I was going to get some amazing Italian food but ended up quite disappointed.  The bread wasn't fresh and neither of our entrees were up to par with my expectations.  He had chicken marsala and I had fetaccini alfredo with chicken.  The best part of the meal was his side of pasta.  Even the house wine was awful.  I was really looking forward to a delicious dessert but opted to skip it in fear of disappointment.  I would not recommend either of these entrées if you choose to dine here.
author: Jessica D.

description: Still the best Italian joint in North Beach! Mom made a papadelle dish with sausage and mushroom sauce that made me want to hug her! Skip the Stinking Rose and have some real Italian food here!
author: Karen K.

description: Great, family run Italian place in North Beach. Our waitress went above and beyond to be helpful - making a special pasta dish that was her favorite, getting "Mama's" meatballs for our 6 year old daughter. This place has a very authentic, homey feel and loved seeing "Mama" come out, ask about our food, chat with us, etc. The place was full and everyone's food looked great!
author: K. L.

description: Fantastic, authentic Italian food with great family service!
author: Chris H.

description: Phenomenal !!!! Talk to the staff and get what they recommend or the specials !!! It's all amazing .... But their recommendations are to die for !!! Family owned and home made pasta and sauce and .... No words can describe the food !!!!
author: Michelle K.

description: I really enjoyed this restaurant in north beach.we were craving for Italian food I mean real Italian food. Franchino now is my favorite place in north beach.... Bravo Franchino
author: Sarah L.

description:
Last Thursday night, before going to Beach Blanket, one of the gals in our party of 4 had suggested Franchinos.....we couldn't have been more pleased.....we were greeted and seated right away......by the sweetest lady....Mrs Franchinos I am thinking....we ordered the gnocchi as an appetizer for the 4 of us to share....it was delicious.... Our entrees couldn't have been better....and desert, oh my!!!!! The finish to a delicious meal.... I complimented the owner and told her, we would be back.... 
It is nice to have a home cooked meal.... We all enjoyed it......
author: Ronnie H.

description: The best Italian restaurant in San Francisco and I know italian food. I was born and bred on the East Coast just 20 minutes from downtown Manhattan where you will find the best restaurants in the world. This family owned and operated restaurant makes me feel like I am over my parents ( Full blooded Italian) house for Sunday dinner waiting to sample moms lasagna or any pasta dish she decided to serve up. This review is making me hungry and I just ate. Anyway, try this place, tell them Tony sent you. I'm sure they know a Tony and it may get you seated faster.
author: Tony L.

description: I seriously am craving this food right now about two weeks after my cousin and I visited. Absolute a dream of a place with authentic Italian food cooked by Momma herself. The waitresses and busgirl are family members and Momma comes out to check in on you and serve the food (and make adorable jokes!) Some of the all time best Italian food I've ever had. Next time I'm in town visiting my cousin, we are going here!
author: Kait B.

description: Charming, cozy Italian spot in North Beach.  At around 7pm on a Saturday night, the line was out the door - this place is popular!  The service is outstanding: very attentive and friendly. You can tell that this place is family-run!  For an appetizer, we got the antipasto vegetariano ($9), a plate of grilled vegetables with Italian dressing.  The vegetables were nicely cooked, and the vinaigrette really brought out the flavor.  For entrees, I ordered the Capellini Mare e Monti ($20), capellini with prawns, chicken, garlic, mushrooms and choice of tomato, cream, or tomato cream sauce.  This dish was rich and full of chicken and prawns.  My table also got the chicken marsala ($18) and cioppino ($24), which were both good and come with choice of pasta or sauteed vegetables.  While Franchino doesn't have the most exceptional Italian fare, it is definitely well-priced for the area, and the service is outstanding.
author: Erica Y.

description:
I recently started traveling to the city about once a month for work. I now make Franchino's a regular stop while I'm here! I was originally of the impression that one should continue exploring all of the fabulous restaurants this city has to offer, but once I found Franchino's, I didn't feel the need to explore further for amazing Italian food!

The staff (I assume all family members) are friendly and accommodating. One visit, Franchino himself even passed out glasses of complimentary wine to the people who were waiting in line. I had already been seated so didn't get to partake ;)

It's a small place, but I love the intimacy of the joint. If you are going at prime time, expect a wait (maybe only about 15 tables total, so not ideal for large groups either).

Prices are on par with everything else in the North Beach area, but the food is by far supreme. Lots of options on the menu.

I've been to Franchino's a total of 5 times now, so I felt it was about time I finally submit a review.
author: Angie G.

description: This family owned and operated (still) is my favorite little Italian place in the city! It truly reminds me of Italy. It's so quant and charming. The tomatoes for the sauce is mmm. For dessert, the tiramisu is a must!
author: Elisabeth C.

description: The real deal. Family owned and absolutely delicious.My favorite is the Marsala, but picatta and Alfredo delicious as well. Everyone I have brought here over the years has always loved this place. A wee bit crowded, but for food and a nice family at the helm,by far my favorite in North Beach
author: Philip R.

description:
We found this place on our LAST night in frisco and i'm so mad we didn't COME HERE sooner!  The food here was absolutely OUT OF THIS WORLD and if you do decide to come here, which you better, you MUST TRY the Meat Lasagna.

Starters - Bruschetta 3/5 very good, i would've preferred more garlic but thats my preference

Soup - Minestrone 3.5/5 This was very good, a lot of vegetables, but a great take on a classic soup

Main Course - I had the Fettuccine Franchino ( i substituted the Fettuccine for the Capellini) it was absolutely amazing.  The home made pasta was perfectly al dente, the sauce was amazing, everything together was just the perfect blend!! 5/5

My wife had the Meat Lasagna.  This was the ABSOLUTE BEST lasagna i've ever tasted in my life.  It was better than my grandmas, better than any place ive ever been to.  The noodles were nice and plump, perfectly cooked.  The sauce was simply divine, and the meat was far from over powering ( which it can be at times, but not here!) and the cheese was perfect.  If i had come across this beautiful, family ran & owned restaurant sooner i would've eaten here several times throughout my trip.  As fate would have it we discovered this gem the night before we headed back home to jersey.  5/5 stars

When we arrived we were promptly met by the owner street side, who happily welcomed us, and sat us immediately.  We always had our drinks and water topped off without ever needing to track someone down.  You can tell the owner truly cares about his business and that everyone enjoys everything as he is constantly observing the family and making sure everything is running smoothly.  When i come back, i without a doubt will be dining here, and if you let some of these bad reviews sway you in any way, your an absolute FOOL!!!  Take it from a fat guy, this is the place to go if you want an AMAZING, home made Italian meal that fills you up and sticks to your gut for hours!  DO NOT pass this by or you will regret it!
author: Charlie H.

description: Shared an excellent chicken piccata and pasta primavera. Both were excellent! The tiramisu for dessert was not what we were expecting - more ice cream than tiramisu, really - but still very tasty.
author: Rajesh S.

description:
Summary: Very friendly service but touristy Italian food.

Superb tiramisu and the best part of my meal! Their homemade version has just one layer of lady fingers with a thick layer of cream. It almost looked like cheesecake.

The filled gnocchi was rather chewy instead of pillowy soft but I still liked it. The rest of the meal didn't go so well. The calamari salad would have been better if the squid wasn't cold. Our clams were so sandy I worried I chipped a tooth or broke a dental crown. The mustard Marsala is a dish I will never order again, ever.
author: Jeanne C.

description: All of the pasta was cooked to perfection--al dente. The sauces were all very traditional and tasted like they were prepared in an Italian grandma's kitchen. My husband's veal was tender but the sauce was unremarkable and the grilled veggies lacked flavor. The service was superb--our waitress was the owner's daughter. The ambiance is cozy and intimate as the place is quite small.
author: Sonja D.

description:
We just had the best little dinner on the last night of our trip to San Fransisco. This place was perfect. The owner is a little old(ish) Italian guy who greets you at the door. His charming wife came over to the table to talk to us. His daughters served us. We had great apps - wonderful dinners - everyone cleaned their plates. Looked like a great wine list if you want a bottle. We ordered by the glass and enjoyed our wine completely. 

We were giving hugs by the time we left because we felt like family. We'll definitely remember this night and be back next time we're i town.
author: David F.

description:
Such a cute family owned business! The food was amazing. I had the gnocchi in the tomato sauce and loved it. The best part is that it was homemade! I also had the tortellini soup which hit the spot. It was in a chicken broth that tasted like my moms homemade broth (which is the best).

My husband had the Chicken Marsala with a side of the pasta with meat sauce. Needless to say, his plate was licked clean.

Definitely the best Italian food yet!
author: N. C.

description: Decent meal for a late Sunday dinner with the little guys.  Quick service, good food.  Boys loved the basic spaghetti with meat ragu and i enjoyed the chicken parmigiano (steamed veggies were tasty.  Overall a good meal
author: Michael T.

description:
I would give this restaurant 3 stars based on the food but I gave it one more star for the excellent service.  This restaurant is run by a family who offers quick service and is very accommodating.  One of the owners personally greets all the customers and socializes with each table.  He even sings and dances...very entertaining!  The prices are reasonable for an Italian restaurant (entrees range from $12 to $20).

We asked for recommendations since it was our first time here.  Here are the reviews of what we ordered:
-Chicken Marsala
          -This dish either comes with mixed vegetables or pasta of the day.  The chicken was very tender and the sauce was delicious!  The seasoned vegetables I got as my side was also very tasty.  Best part was that the dish tasted light and healthy...one of the better chicken marsalas I've had. 
-Homemade Gnocchi with Pesto Sauce
          -I've had better gnocchi.  The pesto sauce was the best part of this dish.  The portions were generous.

The menu is extensive so I would come back to try some of the other items our server recommended (i.e. Lasagna, Chicken Amalfitano , etc.).
author: Angela F.

description: Another great meal. You gotta try this amazing restaurant. The Palermos of SF, those in threes know in LA know v what I mean. The food is delicious!!!
author: Timm M.

description: Their food looked amazing, but unfortunately, I am stuck on a medical diet and so I couldn't eat anything - I actually had a microwaveable entree, and they seemed hesitant, but microwaved it for me and even plated it!  They treated the rest of my party like gold.  They were so nice.  My sister had one of their seafood pasta dishes and raved about it like cray.  It's a family run business, and it is clearly evident they care about their food and service.
author: Alfie V.

description:
me and my friend were looking at the menu from outside, when a suited up gentleman you would see out of an italian movie claimed he had the best chioppino in town.  he welcomingly invited us in, and introduced us to his wife.

We ordered and were well-serviced with water.  however the food took long and the appetizer bread was extremely stale.

Chicken was salty.

Ciopinno was lacking and needed more broth and less shell.  I appreciated the fact that there was no sand, however.  I put it below the ones at Cioppino's at the wharf, and the one in Nordstrom Cafe

this place is great if you want a home cooked feel and intimate setting with the friendly staff.  this is a legitimate italian experience, however i can't say the food was the best.
author: Tina A.

description:
The Dish: Got the bell peppers/cheese for appetizer, veel with mushroom sauce, baked beef in lasagna, and absolutely delicious spaghetti dish. Overall, this place offers delicious food. Amazing food, amazing food.

Ambience: When they make you wait in line, you're not allowed to enter the door. You have to wait outside...which I thought was weird, but it adds to the environment when you're actually eating. So-so service. 

Some guy was allowed to randomly walk in and offer roses to people for a price. Absolutely racist and started using "ching chong" language to my family...even though we're from America...
author: Gina T.

description:
Follow up review of Franchino's.  Tonight Franchino was on his best behavior.  Did not see him tip the wine glass even once!

We had the veal parmigiana.  It was absolutely heavenly, so tender you could forget the knife.  The sauce was a beautiful creamy red color which tasted ....well, there was none left after I finished.

F's wife was the most outgoing and friendly I have ever seen her.  Keeping her Hubby in line seems to be working.
author: Bradley C.

description:
Nom NoM NOM: Olive oil and Tiramisu!
Blah Blah Blah: Price to Portion Size

We had the chicken piccata and saltimbocca entrees with house pasta.  The food taste wise was solid and good, but the portion size was small for the price. Maybe because this place is in a tourist area or maybe because they are sticking to true European portion sizes for entrees. (Yes I'm American and I could have eaten double my entree size)  You can always try and fill up on the free bread and delicious olive oil though lol. 

The interior is cute and the service was great but it wasn't that busy when we went.
I believe it was a family run place and their homemade tiramisu was the bomb, but again it was such a small portion for the price. 

::::::::Breakdown::::::::
Food: 3.5 Stars
Place: 4 Stars 
Service: 4 Stars
Price/Value: 3 Stars
Overall: 3.5 Stars
author: Manohak S.

description:
We decided to play tourists and visit Fisherman's Wharf and walk through North Beach.  My wife wanted Italian, so I pulled up Yelp and carefully weeded out the tourist traps, settling on this place.

Boy, we wanted to like this place.  Older Italian gent near the door complete with hat, Italian "nonna"/matriarch, her daughter the waitress. Clearly these people know Italian food.  I was excited when I saw on the framed wall of photos a note scribbled on the back of a bill saying "THIS IS NO TOURIST TRAP.  So and So (Italian name), somewhere in Florida".  Olive oil and vinegar on the table with the bread, here we go.  Could it be, that at last, I found a place that makes good homestyle Italian food?  Sadly, no.

The highlights: the red sauce (I think she called it Ragu?) on the side of pasta was pretty good.  My daughter's fettucine alfredo was heavy as expected but good.   Manicotti, also pretty good (probably the best dish of the day and an off-menu special at that).


The lowlights:  chicken parmesan was an unbreaded cutlet or two, smothered in some orangey colored cheese.  I think it was a sauce, but the quality of the cheese was poor, so when it reached the table, it was just this orange glob.  Homemade ravioli, good, but way too much cream in the sauce. 

We really, really wanted to like this place.  I grew up with a 1st generation Italian-American great-grandmother who made fresh pasta daily, so I know what I'm talking about.

Service was very good and the owner was super sweet, so I wish the food had been better.

As I exited, I noticed the owner trying to usher in customers off the street, as noted in other reviews.  Nothing wrong with that, but when your food is good, finding customers is rarely a problem.

In a pinch, it will do, but I hope there's better out in North Beach.
author: dan s.

description:
I was in a mood for some authentic Italian food. 

This was the place! 

It is a family run restaurant in the heart of North Beach. As you walk by the restaurant, the owner welcomes you in. Opens the door for you and greets you in Italian. 

The wife smiles at you and seats you at the table. The whole experience reminds you of returning home. The smell of homecooked food that fills the room, the subtle Italian music in the background and the many old photos that decorate the walls just say welcome and enjoy!

I had the linguine with the fresh clams and white wine sauce. It was amazing! Linguine was cooked al dente. I only wished there were more clams. My friend had the Pasta Pescatora with mixed seafood and tomato sauce. I loved it. It was really flavorful and shrimp, mussels, and clams were outstanding. We ended with the panna cotta. My girlfriend and I are always on a look out for the best panna cotta since our travels to Italy. So far, we haven't had much luck until we came here! Thank you, Franchino for helping us find an excellent panna cotta. 

There are many Italian restaurants in North Beach but this is one that is exceptional and not too touristy.
author: Molly T.

description: Absolutely delicious and reasonably priced Italian food. This is a family run business and you can taste it in the food. I highly recommend the fettuccine alfredo and tiramisu.
author: Christina A.

description: The best Italian place in San Fran. Atmosphere was very calm and cute. The Bruschetta changed my life. To DIE for. Pesto pasta was also amazing! HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Kaylee W.

description:
Charming restaurant and lovely staff.

I came for an early dinner at the Franchino's after finding the restaurant on Yelp. I'm in San Francisco on business and after a busy day wanted a relaxing venue with good food and drink. I wasn't to be disappointed. 

Eating alone not a problem and I was made to feel very welcome by the owners. Penne Ragu main course was excellent, cooked well and very tasty. The Tiramisu I had for dessert was fantastic, one of the best I have had in a long time. Attentive service, a friendly chat with the owner - I will definitely be visiting again,
author: Ben W.

description:
Greeted by the man himself on a busy Friday night in North Beach.  In spite of the fact that I was dining alone, he ensured I was seated and served as soon as possible.  I was treated with great respect and to diligent service by his wife and daughter(s).

The food (Spaghetti alla Carbonaro) was delectable.  Fresh Italian bread accompanied the meal with a nice mellow glass of Chianti.  This was the type of food and experience that I've always wanted out of North Beach.  

Not only did my belly feel happy and my taste buds left tingling, my soul felt good.  The food was prepared with love, it shines through.

I will return here every time I'm in SF.
author: Jon C.

description:
Yelp has failed me for the first time ever. An italian cafe with bad pasta. Franchino works the door and lures the unsuspecting into his mouse trap. His wife and daughters await with smiles as bait and once you are seated your in the trap.

Franchino returns inside every 20 minutes and fills up his Peroni (brand of Italian beer) glass with a can of Miller light. He enjoyed at least 4 beers while I pushed around my food figuring out how I could pay the bill and get out.

The guy get's smashed every night and after eating his food I can't blame him. Mexicans, prepare so-called Italian food while the Italian window dressing and performance act is conducted in the front of the house.

The recommended home made pasta - was not only, not home made, but had top be frozen. Reminded me of an episode of kitchen nightmares.
author: JW U.

description:
Ok, this place had some really great reviews and some really bad ones but I was stuck in between North Beach and Chinatown for dinner and wanted to find a place that wasn't too expensive. I tried Franchino and I wish I had gone somewhere else.

I was greeted by an older gentleman that was most definitely a couple sheets to the wind already. He was friendly but you could smell the liquor on him. He sat me down immediately and asked his wait staff to come over immediately. The service was good, friendly, prompt, polite. I really liked the people there so I am sad that the food overshadowed the service.

I ordered chicken picatta. When it came I considered sending it back and walking out, but I knew that I didn't have time to find another place, sit down, order, and all that before I had to head home so I dug in.

Chicken Picatta should be made with chicken cutlets sautéed in butter and finished with a light butter-lemon-caper sauce.  Strictly speaking, this was Chicken Picatta, but the execution on each component was lacking. The chicken cutlets had no color at all! The lemon-butter sauce tasted like it came out of a can and the capers seemed like they'd been added at the last minute. The lemon was so overpowering. There wasn't even a hint of other seasonings. The accompanying penne pasta with tomato sauce was flavorless.

Sorry, Franchino, but I will not be back.
author: Donley P.

description:
Had a great time here the other night.
We got there when it was crowded and there was a bit of a line. We got to talking with another group and with the owner, and eventually a 4-top opened up and the owner offered to seat our two groups together, if we didn't mind, so we wouldn't have to wait.
We made quick friends with the other couple and enjoyed a fun meal.
As a thank you for being so accommodating, the waitress brought us two free desserts to share.
I would definitely come here again - with the understanding that there might be a wait and that we might end up sharing a table again.
author: Rachel M.

description:
To start I wanna say this was THE BEST experience I have ever had!

Franchinos has a warm and inviting hospitality that I haven't' found any place else.

It was mothers day and my mom decided she had a craving for Italian. And so we always chose Mona Lisa by default.  This time we decided to try something different! So I hopped on Yelp, in search of a new place we haven't tried and that had good reviews for the food! We like the idea that its a family owned restaurant. So we gave it a try!!!

Upon arrival, of course driving on Columbus looking for the address had NO idea it was literally right next door to Mona Lisa. After all the times we wined and dined and Mona Lisa, we couldn't believe we never noticed Franchinos!!

Walking to the front door there's a cute 11 year old kid playing the accordion with a Fedora and glasses!! The cutest kid!! We stand by the door, and I guess Franchino the owner takes us in and asks how many, we say four. But the fourth was looking for parking.  We get seated and the Lady of the house comes and greets us with water, and asks how many are dining..we say four. and he should be in shortly, just looking for parking!! She replies, "oh no, I was asking if he doesn't find parking he could come park in front of our restaurant, Its our parking space!!!" We all couldn't believe how hospitable she was for offering us the parking space!! But by then it was too late, he had found a spot.

so so far so good...we ordered appetizer's and main dishes... of course PASTA!!! I got the best thing my mouth has ever tasted, Fettuccine with pesto cream sauce!! My mouth was in heaven. I was stuffed, Super stuffed...but I felt like I was getting the most authentic tasting Italian food....so I kept eating till my plate disappeared!! It was so good that I dream of that place, often.  And soon enough I'll go back and indulge in the mouth watering food.

Upon exiting the man of the house was chitchatting with us as if we were standing at the door of his home!!! How cute! He then opened the door and walked us out, like family!!! :) So warm and inviting and hospitality at its best!!!

With family owned, you can never go wrong! :)

Now, go in there and get a taste of real authentic Italian homemade food!!

INDULGE if you must!
author: SammyWammy S.

description:
I stopped by this cozy family Italian restaurant on a week night with a few companions. Given its high volume of reviews and generally high rating, I had high expectations. The place certainly felt like a family restaurant with that sort of charm and the menu prices/items seemed in line with other places in North Beach. We didn't feel particularly welcomed but it seems that the owner or dad wasn't around to greet us like the other yelpers so that could have been the reason.

When we asked what the waitress would recommend, she directed our attention to the left side of the menu and didn't mention a single non-pasta item, which wasn't a great start for a group of hungry carnivores. We all ended up going with various pastas.

The pesto gnocchi came highly recommended but was probably the only disappointment. It felt a little one noted and plain. The dough itself was well cooked so I suppose the complaint is really directed at the overall dish.

The seafood pasta was probably the best dish we tried and I would consider getting it if I came back.

All in all, I thought it was an okay place but was a little disappointed given the other reviews.
author: Victor W.

description: I love the family owed feel of this place! The food is so delicious too. I ate every bite of my bruschetta, meat lasagna and tiramisu! This place is inviting and so adorable. I will be back again and again!
author: Amanda E.

description:
We came here over the weekend for a dinner with close friends, and I only have one word to describe this little gem: perfect! From the location, the staff, the decor and ambiance, to the food; everything was PERFECT.  For a little while I even felt like I was no longer in San Francisco, but sitting back in Italy, enjoying some fantastic Italian wood and wine with great friends. 

I would highly recommend this restaurant to any friends or family who want a REAL Italian dinner and experience.  

I'd have to say, beside the food, the best part was when the owner of the restaurant turned on the song "Volare", and had a nice dance with each of the ladies at our table. 

Amazing restaurant, owners, and food!!!!!
author: Suzanna F.

description: I can't say enough about this restaurant.  I come from an Italian family and this is the first Italian restaurant that I have eaten at that was like eating in my Sicilian grandparents kitchen.  It was a very moving experience for me since both my grandparents are gone.  The atmosphere, the ambiance, the smells coming from the kitchen, and the food was delicious.  I had gnocchi with the half and half sauce.  My grandmother always made her gnocchi fresh and this was like eating her dish.  Both owners came to my husband and my table and  and introduced themselves and asked how our food was.  I tell everyone that is going into San Francisco to stop and eat there as they will not be sorry, or if they want authentic Italian cooking they won't find better!  Can't wait to go back!  A great "Thank" you to Mr. & Mrs. Franchino for making our experience in your restaurant one to last a life -time!
author: Darlene G.

description: Spaghetti cabornara in little Italy doesn't get any better. This place is amazing. The gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce, homemade pappardelle, all amazing! The owners and their beautifully wonderful daughters seal the deal. The food is fantastic, wine is amazing and then they do the most amazing job making you feel your part of the family and at their home for dinner. Such a great choice, glad we got to try this wonderful place. Such a gem.
author: Nici M.

description: Outstanding. The food was over the top! The service here is in the Top 5 of all the places I have reviewed.  We were also treated to the owner sing Italian songs. They go out of their way to make sure you feel like family.
author: randy t.

description: After living in the Bay Area and visiting on and off for the last 25 years, I finally got to eat Italian food in North Beach. When looking for a place to eat, my one criteria was that it looked authentic with legit Italians as their staff. Franchino was that and more. Franchino himself greets you at the door and makes you feel welcome. We tried to make reservations, but with some miscommunication were unable too. We were still seated right away even before a larger party with reservations. Throughout the meal we we served by the entire family. The wine was great and the food was even better. My friend and I each had delicious gnocchi. I had the Gorgonzola sauce which was rich but delicious, and my friend had the pesto which was also to die for. They have something for everyone and really treat you like one of the family. After I left, I felt like I had died and gone to heaven.
author: Renee E.

description: Love this place! Authentic tasty food, great owners/staff. It's like being in Italy! I always make time to come here when I am in Frisco.
author: Natalia S.

description:
He grabbed me by the hand and led me inside...

This was after my heart was a little broken that the quaint French bistro a few blocks away was fully booked for the night. Spontaneity doesn't always work out so well on a Friday night in San Francisco.

While I was walking down Columbus Ave. searching for alternatives in North Beach on my Yelp App, I looked up and Franchino was there drawing me into his restaurant. He looked into my eyes, took my hand and escorted me to an open table and that was that. 

It was girls night out in the city and I decided to put myself completely in their hands by ordering the pasta of the day which came with Italian sausage in a red sauce. My friend more fully perused the menu and was delighted with her meal. Most pasta entrees on the menu are $15 - 18.

For a place that wasn't what I wanted when I started the evening, my experience made it seem like this was the place I was meant to be. The restaurant itself is quite odd with lots of photos and nicknacks on the walls. The space is a bit cluttered with odds and ends and the tables are very close together so you have to slide between them if you are sitting on the banquette. It doesn't scream romantic to me. A better choice for a relaxed meal with friends when you are looking for a home away from home atmosphere. 

Franchino was an enjoyable host, at times joking with tables, or suddenly breaking into song at loud volume. Totally in his glory and I dug the show. He had me at hello.
author: Jen K.

description:
I don't write reviews often unless I feel the compelling need to let my annoyances or pleasure out about a place.

Crap service. First time trying Italian food in San Fran. Basically what happened was that not only did they not pay attention that we waited 30 minutes for a seat but also let other people sit before us when we were there first and waited longer. I understand accidents happen but if it wasn't for the snarky or arrogant comment earlier + the mission to find parking on a Sat night in the area, it might've been ok. Food wasn't amazing either it was just not bad to good. 

Heres what happened. I show up with my lady friend to tell them we need seats for 2 people. And the lady who works said ok great it'll be about 20 to 30 minutes. She didn't ask for a name or write anything about us and there were people there waiting before us already. Wondering how they will accurately keep track of their queue, I asked her immediately after that if she needed to write my name down or how will she know who is next and what not. She replied by saying "we've been in business here for over 25 years,  we know who's next." 

30 min later.. All the people who were there before us gets seated and now its about our turn... except that didn't happen... We were totally ignored and had another lady acknowledge that the other parties (came after us) will be seated shortly... at the same time she was seating another that came after us. At this point we already expected this. So we go to the entrance to ask her politely when are we going to be seated or what place in line are we? She said, "you guys are last, we'll be ready in 20 to 30 min." At that point i said sorry, but we've been here for 30 min now and you just seated people that came after us, shouldn't we be next? She replied sorry about that but we let them seat already. She didn't even verify that we'll be next. I started muttering "fuck i knew this shit would happen to my friend and saying we both knew". She said sorry again. You can imagine how annoyed I was especially after trying to verify how will they keep track of the patrons order of wait-list. 

The other party was kind enough to talk to her and let her know that we were indeed there first and waiting. So until then she came up to us and said "you guys want to be seated?" Rude. But whatever i'm giving them a try because of Yelp. 

In the end, because of the experience, arrogance, service and lack of quality food. I will not be coming here ever again.

PS: the complementary bread is shitty too.
author: Esau R.

description:
The first time I visited Franchino's was for my high school intersession and did it leave a great first impression! It's been two years and I finally re-visited this cute little family-owned restaurant. Our waiter was so kind and welcoming (we came in around 3pm, but someone told us they didn't open til 5) and we were seated immediately. 
 
A couple minutes later a very large group maybe of  8 peeped in and a woman asked if she could use the restroom. The waiter kindly said, "No, sorry." And the lady then responded with a "Are you kidding me? This is a restaurant and you don't have a bathroom?" I, as a customer was pretty annoyed of this woman's attitude- so I knew the waiter was probably even more annoyed. She kindly said "It's for customer's only sorry". They soon got i n this little quarrel about how the lady was going to eat here blahblahblah. So the party of 8 sat down and the waiter let her use the bathroom but too bad, it was taken. She left to find another bathroom, came back, and told her  party of 8 she didn't want to eat here because of the way she was treated. (Okay).

After they left, all that was being talked about was that whole situation and I could tell the waiter was upset. I wish I came in at a different time-- maybe my meal would've felt more homely if there wasn't such a incident. )= My cheese ravioli with meat sauce soon came and I joyfully ate my meal. Perfect. The sauce wasn't watery and the cheese in the ravioli wasn't too mushy. Wish I had more room in my tummy to try dessert. 

Overall, my meal was delicious and I will definitely be coming back soon
author: Melissa C.

description: Franchino's is definitely a must. It's a small family run place with amazing food and service. The special included fresh made pasta that I thoroughly enjoyed. Dinner was finished with handmade chocolate cannoli. I will definitely be dining at Franchino's the next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Lori R.

description:
More chances than not, you'll be greeted by Franchino himself who's usually hanging outside smoking on a cigar or roaming his own restaurants ensuring all his customers are taken care of. This is truly a family run restaurant with the entire family involved and you can definitely feel the love.

I started off my Italian dining experience with a fresh crisp salad complete with great and tasty Italian dressing. I then moved on to the Lasagna with meat sauce. Talk about home made lasagna! One of the best lasagna's I've had and that says a lot considering I've had plenty. This hot, cheesy and meaty plate of lasagna was packed with great flavor and I savored it to it's last bite.

During the tail end of the dinner I got to experience Franchino's true Italian personality overhearing a rather entertaining discussion he had with guests at the table next to me. I don't know if they were drunk off the wine or if they were naturally just talkative Italians but the voice level of the discussion went from 5 to 10 in a few minutes.

If you're looking for a great Italian dinner with great service and food come here. If you're looking for nice "quiet" place to cozy up with your date you're not going to find it here. But it's North Beach for crying our loud and when you mix Italians with food you get lots of company, laughs and loudness.
author: Andrew S.

description: This is and has been for a year our go to restaurant in North Beach. Home made oasta and specials every night. Honestly ut does not get better than this. Ask what pasta Mama has made for that day. Let them choose the right wine to go with and sit back and enjoy. You will never be disappointed.
author: Dan A.

description: Traveling from out of town, we visited this restaurant based on the good Yelp reviews. They did not disappoint! Super quaint, delicious food and wonderful staff. The entrees were average priced, but the desserts were very expensive. Each dessert item was $9.95. The tiramisu was a small piece and the cannoli was average sized. We will definitely return but will grab gelato down the street, for dessert next time. :)
author: Eva C.

description: We stopped by here as it was recommended by yelpers. The food was okay, nothing really special about it. The location is very small, but that's usual for the area. It was also on the pricey side, but that seems to be usual for the area as well. Staff was friendly and the food was served quickly. The bathroom is in a really inconvenient location. I would explore other options in the area before I went here again.
author: Kathy R.

description:
My husband and I were looking for an AMAZING experience in San Francisco. We seldom treat ourselves to great dining experiences, because in general we are very cheap and hate spending money on food. My husband is a very picky eater and I kinda usually go along with him on his food choices.

Tonight I told him I wanted Italian and I wanted to go to Little Italy for something authentic. We got online and looked at the reviews on Yelp and kind of fell in love with the idea of Franchino's. 

When we walked up to the restaurant Franchino was sitting outside of the restaurant and greeted us as we walked up. He instantly made us feel special and sat us down at a window seat, which turned out to be one of the best seats in the house. The place is small and quaint and exactly the feel that I was looking for.

We were planning on splurging a little but not going crazy, but then Franchino asked us what kind of wine we wanted as if we were for sure getting wine and recommended something to us not on the menu. He said to trust him. We couldn't deny him so agreed. He then told us that we were going to love the Antipasto appetizer and to trust him again. We weren't planning on getting wine or an appetizer, but realized that we had to go with his recommendations and make this an experience. We gave in and went with everything he recommended. We couldn't have been happier. The Wine was the BEST wine we have EVER tasted and we drank the entire bottle. The Antipasto sampler was better than anything we've ever had as well and my husband tasted and liked everything on the plate, including the vegetables, which he NEVER eats. I was so impressed.

We both really enjoyed our entrees, he had steak and I had something that wasn't on the menu, but was recommended by our waitress. It was phenomenal.  

We both decided to splurge and end with desert and Cappuccinos, but it was the end of a perfect and memorable night. Although in the end we ended up spending $150, to us it was the best thing that we did in San Fran. We could have easily spend less, but really splurged and went with everything they recommended. I couldn't be happier.

We ended the night with a picture with Francino to remember the night by. 

I highly recommend this just for the memories. Thank you to the great people there, you went over and beyond our expectations.
author: Kimberly J.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant.  This place has great food, great vibe and will quickly win your heart.  If you love fresh pasta, fresh sausage, garlic butter...this is your place.
author: B G.

description: Phenomenal food! Great familia! It was amazing. Service was excellent and very attentive. Clam linguine was superb!!?
author: Trevor S.

description:
I went here tonight with my husband and definitely wasn't wowed. For one thing, don't believe that reservations mean anything here. We made a reservation for 7 and waited in line for 51 min. As a pregnant woman in my third trimester, I garnered a lot of sympathy from the other people in line, but we weren't even apologized to once by the staff here. I really didn't feel any 'family-owned' vibe. I just felt ignored and used for our money. The food was good, but the bar is so high for Italian food in North Beach that this place didn't stand out. Honestly, we picked this place because they supposedly took reservations and I didn't want to pass out while lined up on a smog-filled street, but since they don't honor reservations, we could have lined up and gone anywhere else. 
The unexpectedly long wait also resulted in an extra hour of a parking charge and missing out on another place we planned to visit after dinner. That might not be as big a deal if you live within walking distance, but keep that in mind if you're not local.
author: Karen G.

description:
This is our favorite Italian place in San Francisco!  My girlfriend and I went here early in our relationship and it quickly became our go to venue for special occasions.  It's got everything we need for a special date: delicious food, intimate atmosphere, and friendly service.  

It's rare to find a truly family owned and operated small restaurant in North Beach, but Franchino is the real deal.  I can never go wrong with the gnocchi with pesto and my girlfriend loves the pappardelle.  Honestly, everything we've tried here has been wonderful.  

We'll keep coming back, and hope they stay around decades!
author: Matt B.

description: Food was absolutely spectacular! We were a large group from San Diego and Chicago that thoroughly enjoy the homemade cooking! This was by far the best food and additionally service we experience. With so many choices for Italian and restaurants in general in San Francisco it can be challenging but this was a hidden gem!!!
author: Elle H.

description: In this economy, and in an area with an abundance of Italian restaurants, you would think an establishment would do what they could to attract customers.  Not at Franchino's.  Visiting from out of town, we chose this restaurant based on Yelp reviews to celebrate my daughter's sixth birthday.  After dropping 5/6ths of my party off at the restaurant so I could find parking, I received a call in the parking lot that the owners would not seat 5/6ths of the party...I needed to be there.  As it turns out, the nice folks at Mona Lisa next door were more than happy to accommodate us, and even brought us free bruschetta to honor my daughter's special day.  We haven't quite gotten the food to our table at Mona Lisa as I write this review, still flabbergasted at Franchino's elitist policies, but the Italian hospitality shown us by Mona Lisa will earn them high marks.
author: Dan M.

description:
I love family run joints like this.... They are SOOO friendly and hospitable.  It's like eating in their home... Reallly!  

Thanks to Jason G, once again, for the rec and for ordering SO MUCH FOOD!  Dang bro, I'm going to gain hella weight hanging out with you...

Starters: Bruschetta, mussels, and some sort of meat on a cantalope... All of which were tasty and refreshing.  Great choices!

Penne pasta with chicken (ok)
Lobster and seafood pasta dish (don't remember the exact name - It sounded amazing but was just ok)
Pasta with mussels (Good)
Some sort of meat tortellini in a creamy sauce (nice, rich, and creamy)
Lasagna (savory)

All in all, a nice filling meal with great company in the busy streets of North Beach.  Drinks are limited to wine and water only....
author: Danny L.

description: Absolutely a wonderful experience. The caprese salad and house salads were a great start. My wife and I had 2 different veal dishes (mustard and saltimbucco). Both excellent! Followed our meal with delicious limoncello custard. Very friendly and efficient service with a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back.
author: Dave A.

description:
This is a very authentic old-fashioned place about a billion times better than the Stinkin' Rose, which is tourist trap Hell.
The owner is a nice guy and a total character. Place was hekka packed at 9:10 pm on a Sunday night and he like MacGyver reappropriated two tables and stole chairs to accommodate us. We ordered - I had the spagetti and meatballs, friend has chicken saltimboca, other friend had eggplant parm. So, worst part - bread - it's just not warm or worth the carbs. The pastas were all good, esp the aurora sauce penne. Saltimboca - there was a clumpy white sauce involved, which sort of killed it.
I have heartburn. But, overall, it was good. It's the kind of place, you just gotta know what to order.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Columbus Ave. in North Beach is hit or miss for sure. More miss however. Franchino feels authentic enough. A nice warm family vibe. Intimate. Not too touristy. 

The food was made with love. Nice recommendations. You can do better in the area, but if you're exploring different eateries in the area as a local, I would recommend for sure for a spur of the moment choice where it's likely you'll be seated and treated well without bothering with a reservation.
author: Brad C.

description:
Watch this - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jT9uJDKOwPs
I wish I had seen it before eating here.  The video shares the history of the restaurant and neighborhood and introduces the Italian family that owns the place.  You get to see a younger version of Franchino and his wife. It's adorable and gives you a hint of the warmth and hospitality you'll encounter. 

The place is tiny and tables are squeezed next to each other.  Not good for big groups though I guess if you are willing to wait they could probably fit a party of 8 along the window by pushing tables together. But seriously I think even a party of four was pushing it and twice that sounds insane.  Point being, keep it small?

Ambiance: incredibly mom and pop. You hear the waiters and owners speaking Italian amongst themselves. I think the two female waiters are sisters or cousins - definitely related in some way.  And then there's Franchino and his wife.  Franchino contributes heavily to the ambiance that I loved so much.  When we arrived he was standing outside wearing a fedora and smoking a cigar. He greeted us warmly and beckoned us inside. Later in the evening I watched him walk over and make himself an espresso. What a good gig for him right? Drinking his espresso, smoking his cigar, and making friends with his guests.  As we got up to leave at the end of our meal, he shook each of our hands and wished us buona sera (good evening). So warm and attentive. 

In terms of the food, I'd say it's average. The cioppino was good, the salmon was buttery, the canneloni was filling but the quality of the ground beef inside was eh? None of the dishes blew me away - and really, I think I could have made everything at home just as well.

All of this said, Franchino still gets four stars.  It's worth it if you come for the experience and less so for the food. It's perfect for a down to earth, homey night out with the family. The place is filled with history and worth a visit.
author: Kimya P.

description:
This is old country awesomeness at its finest.  Frank and Josephine, along with the daughters, run this tiny little establishment the way a family restaurant should be run...with pride.  You will be treated like house guests to wonderfully authentic Italian food.  Frank routinely bursts into song and will gladly come to your table for some lively banter so don't be too surprised.  It only adds to the charm of this wonderful little spot.

If you are looking for upscale Food Network fusion cuisine, you may want to look elsewhere.
author: Jim K.

description:
Dinnertime, hungry, walking around North Beach. There are so many choices, so I feel lucky that I found this place and that they had a table available. It is a very small place and was very busy.

This turned into one of the best Italian meals I have ever had. I had the Chicken Porcini, and the chicken was melt-in-your-mouth perfectly cooked. This is a real  family run place, with real home-cooked food.
author: David A.

description: We stopped to look at the menu outside and "mama" came out and asked us in. We are so glad she did. Very friendly, family owned and operated restaurant. We had "mamas" special which was delicious. The service was great, the ambience was great, and we felt like we were in Italy. Definitely going back and would highly recommend a visit if you're in town.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Service was a type of service I've never experienced...it was amazing. Make you feel welcome and that only adds flavor to the already delicious food
author: Anthony F.

description: I've never written a review but the hostess here was straight racist. While waiting an hour wait I asked if I  could use her bathroom and she said "not your people". We were waiting for a table. Do not go to this place unless you happen to be Anglo Saxon white or they will not serve you. I haven't experienced this typed of bigotry since I lived in the south.
author: Dominique L.

description: I think this might be one of the most amazing restaurant experiences that I've ever had. My boyfriend and I were up the street perusing City of Lights and wanted to find a place to eat, so I used my Yelp app and found this place. Not only was it the best Caesar Salad I've every had in my life (which says a lot)!!!! The waitresses were so sweet, when I asked if the fun-loving, wine-drinking man was her father, she replied "sometimes". It is obvious that they have fun working together as a family and the food was phenomenal. They were friendly with families, couples and everyone there. Great place and amazing food!!!
author: Nicole L.

description:
Delicious food! 
It's a long wait at night for dinner, because it's so good everyone wants to go! It's a small restaurant so it doesn't hold many ppl, but well worth the wait! I go here often when I come to SF. 
100% family run!!! My fav is the Gnocchi!
author: Michelle K.

description: Very tiny family owned restaurant. Loved the old man who walked around seating everyone. It's a very dim and romantic place but you are very close to the other customers as it is TINY. But OMG the food is so amazing. The Salmon Rissotto with the pink sauce (red with white) was absolutely delicious. I dream about how great it is. The spaghetti with sausage was very good too and the lasagna was rather decent.
author: Anthea L.

description: This was the best little Italian restaurant! It was exactly what my wife and I were looking for in the city. The proprietor is a sweet lady whose daughters help her out. I had the chicken saltimbocca, and it was beyond awesome! The pasta with meat sauce was a great compliment to it. My wife ordered the chicken pesto fettuccine and we both were blown away but how good it was! I recommend everyone try this place!
author: Jarrett M.

description: Sub par at best. Less than hospitable,  the women that work there are the rudest people that I have ever encountered. I will go anywhere else next time I crave Italian
author: Jamie P.

description: The restaurant was a disappointment for my girlfriend and I. The penne dish and the chicken Marsala didn't have any flavor.   It seemed like store bought noodles and sauce. Just a bunch of pepper and not much else. Service was great and it was a cute little place but the quality of the food did not come close to the price tag.
author: Nate S.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday in a really small group. The restaurant itself is pretty small (seats no more than 20 people). 

The food was great at the restaurant and they kept giving us more bread without us having to ask! Does that even happen anymore? Good service, good appetizers, good entrees.  

I thought the price of the food was a little more on the expensive side. While this is understandable as it is a family-owned place, my wallet thinks otherwise. You'll pay an average of $15 for an entree of pasta. Then you add on to your bill from there. 

They have one wall pretty much filled with bottles of wine, which looked really nice. The entire restaurant had a nice ambiance. I definitely recommend coming here.
author: Shreya G.

description:
I officially LOVE Franchino's. This past Valentine's Day, my boyfriend and I wanted to keep it simple - no big plans, just end up doing what we wanted to on the fly. So when I got home from work, all I wanted to do was walk around North Beach and go to Franchino's. So we did.

On Valentine's Day evening, we did have to wait a little - about 20 minutes, but it's worth it. Once again, the family atmosphere and genuine, friendly service makes it so pleasing to come here. On top of that, the absolutely delicious and solid pasta dishes hit home.

This time around I ordered the Cappellini Mare e Monti - Shrimp & Chicken with Aurora Sauce. This dish was perfect and so delicious. I would definitely recommend Franchino's to anyone. While we dined there, I realized our second time here was on my birthday and first time was boyfriend's birthday/Valentine's Day. (First time was when we were still dating!) Another great experience - can't wait to go back!
author: Tiffany K.

description: A shame on the name of Italian food!  I have lived in Italy and a food connoisseur and was saddened to see that the sole reason why this "26 year old family-run Italian business,* is in existence simply because of  its location in a heavily trafficked tourist area. The pasta with seafood was drowned in tomato sauce to camouflage the stale fish which was so chewy that chewing on plastic seems much more inviting.  I tried my best to chew, but a futile endeavor and had to spit it out. The only positive comment I can make is that the female server was pleasant and attentive. My recommendation- if your advertising tag line is " family-run," then give a family meal to customers not pasta soaked in canned tomato sauce and chewy fish, making it it a very expensive inedible chewy chow!
author: Ambu S.

description: What a wonderful place!!  My wife and family visit SF every 2 or 3 years, and we visit Franchino often.  I love the fact that it's still family owned, and the family makes many of the dishes from scratch.  The servers are friendly and most have been there for years.  The food is awesome.  My son had the gnocchi and I had chicken piccata.  We also shared bruschetta.  All were excellent and very tasty.  We weren't rushed, and despite the small size of the restaurant, it wasn't too noisy.  We were perfectly capable of hearing each other without raising our voices.  We will definitely be back!!
author: Carey S.

description: We loved this place. Visiting the North Beach area for the first time this is exactly what I envisioned a local, family run, North Beach Italian restaurant would be like. All of the dishes we ordered were very good, the risotto was excellent. Everything was home made and fresh. I would definitely return and highly recommend it.
author: Bill C.

description:
We came here based on Yelp reviews, but I'm shocked at the lack of sophistication among San Francisco palates, if this is what they call five-star Italian food.  In NYC, this place would have closed within a month.  Word would have gotten around town that these real Italians (yes, Italians) are using HERSHEY'S SYRUP as the, uh, "chocolate" in their "homemade tiramisu."  Oh yes.  They did.  I still can't get over this:  even a freezer-section tiramisu at Trader Joe's uses actual shaved chocolate.

Our clam appetizer was good; the clams were sandy but tender and fresh, and taken off the fire at precisely the right moment.  The meat lasagna was the best thing Chef Boyardee ever made, I swear--with its cheesy, soupy tomato sauce, no ricotta, and no discernible flavors apart from meat, cheese, and noodles.  The Fettucini al Salmone appeared to use either farmed or canned salmon; much better flavor and quality would result from wild-caught smoked salmon.  Salmon's in season right now, so there's no excuse for using that nasty, farmed McFish.  The homemade chocolate-dredged cannoli has my approval, despite being plated with a flourish of that gadawful Hershey's syrup bottle.  But the tiramisu is a capital offense, with its quarter-inch-thick cake layer soaked in three drops of coffee, and the aforementioned Hershey's drizzled around the plate's edge.  It's like a piece of cheesecake you might get as part of an airline meal.  LOLWUT about sums up my reaction to it.

I kept reading that this is the real deal, complete with on-site Italian grandmother.  Nope.  This is how Italians cook for non-Italians whom they think don't know any better.

Service was kindly.  My advice:  Take the clams.  Take the cannoli.  Get outta there before the cops arrive to bust them for that tiramisu.
author: Girl D.

description:
- food: mediocre, store-bought pasta
- atmosphere: tiny, cozy, and loud
- staff: inattentive, forgetful
- price: overpriced 

additional info:
- their stale bread seems to be indicative of the overall quality and laziness of this restaurant
author: J. B.

description: Just had some good pasta here. My mushroom sauce ravioli could've used slightly more flavor, but it was still good. Tasted authentic. What was actually outstanding was the balsamic vinegar they had for the bread - sweeter than what I'm used to, but it was fantastic! I'll be back to try their other pastas.
author: J. D.

description: All the food is amazing!! Order whatever the special is for the night!! Thank you for making our family Easter dinner so delightful!
author: Anna G.

description: This was the last place me and my girlfriend came to eat dinner on our four day trip to San Francisco, and it was the best Italian food we've had by far. Not only is the food great and fresh, but the experience is the best very cozy and it makes you feel like you are in their home. I recommend the fettuccine pesto with chicken. It would be a 5 star but it's a bit too cozy. If you are in a group of 5 or more you may have some issues being seated.
author: Jesse V.

description: Can't find a reason to take away a star, so 5 it is.  Prompt, friendly, great authentic Italian food (my husband is Italian). Gnocchi w/pesto very good, seafood pasta great!  Tiramisu we had to take home because we were full!  Haven't enjoyed it yet but I am sure it's going to be great!
author: DeeAnn S.

description:
Nice Little family owned restaurant. Nicer than your average hole in the wall. 

Love eating down in this area when I take the family to san fran. Wish I could remember what the wife had, but it was excellent. I had the veal saltimbocca, tender and perfect. My daughter "the vegetarian" couldn't find anything that she liked so the server talked to the chef and they made her something special, it was also huge and delicious. Deserts were perfect we had the marvelous Tiramisu and a second desert which was also great. Chef came to our table and chatted with us and checked on our daughters dinner. Have to say that I agree with every one else, the bread is lacking. 

A lot of people are complaining about the service. Don't go expecting a 5 star restaurant, its not. It is a well run little family place with great attention to their food quality.
author: Bruce G.

description: Amaazing food, amazing service, and an amazing atmosphere. This cute little family owned restaurant is one of the best Italian restaurants here. The food is so delicious, and they have a great wine selection too. The food is delicious and it's very pricey, but i think it's well worth the service and taste.
author: Colleen G.

description: This was exactly what we were looking for: authenticity. Run by a REAL Italian family, serving homemade pasta in delicious sauces. My friend and I accidentally almost ate in that factory restaurant next door, but ran out when we saw what a zoo that place is, with not an Italian in site. Thankfully we found Franchino--cozy, yummy, and the owner even entertained us with some singing! Fresh seafood, light-as-air pastas, would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Sarah H.

description:
We were originally a group of 4, but added 1 at the last minute. They were able to accommodate us, which isn't easy in the small space.

The food was amazing. The sampler appetizer was delicious to share, but WOW was it expensive ($30 each and we ordered 2 for the table based on the recommendation of the server). 

The owner outside that greets you at the door is fabulous. At first I thought he was out of the Godfather and it was a little intimidating, but after talking to him after a few minutes I wanted to hug him and take him home with me. The restaurant is cozy and the atmosphere if very old world Italian. 

Service was great, thorough, timely, friendly. The food was delicious and dessert (chocolate cannoli was to die for!)

They have Prosecco on the menu, but it turned out to be Korbel - a little disappointing.

Overall, it was a delicious meal in a great atmosphere.
author: Suzie K.

description:
If you are going to be in the city, eat at Franchino's! 

It felt like I walked in to someone's home for a dinner party. We were greeted by the owner and his family members. We started with an order of bruschetta and some vino. I ordered the chicken marsala and my boyfriend ordered  the special of the night.  Weve been to a million Italian restaurants but this is by far the best. Every bite was as good as the first!
author: Ashley M.

description:
