I came here on a Thursday night with some friends. We had a reservation for 7:00pm and it's a good thing we did-- the restaurant was medium-sized by SF standards but filled up quickly. All four of us were vegetarian which was not a problem! They have such a long pasta menu and most everything is made-to-order that we were able to pick our sauce and pasta of choice and get whatever we wanted. I ordered the Linguini with their pesto sauce, and my wife ordered the parpadelle with their wild mushroom sauce. Make sure to pick noodles that they make in house! (for example, the penne was not housemade but the trenne was and it's an easy swap). We enjoyed both of our dishes, but we weren't blown away by either one. The wild mushroom sauce was creamy and satisfying but not really mushroom heavy, which is what the wife would've liked. The pesto was delicious, but Iwe favor pesto of the "Cal-Italian" world, like those featured at Al's Place or Flour + Water.
Loved the pictures on the walls and family-owned feel of the place-- especially the older lady who explained what trenne pasta was when she brought out our dishes and who complimented me on my perfectly clean plate as she later cleared them. 

Of the many choices on the Colombus stretch, this is a solid option!
author: T K.

description: Had a amazing dinner here for the holiday work party. I had a few different small bites and appetizers that all were very delightful! Then had a steak as the main course. My steak was cooked to perfection and cut like butter! If you want a nice quite authentic Italian meal please come enjoy this restaurant! The family who own the restaurant were very pleasant friendly people as well :)
author: Nichole E.

description:
A local we met working a taffy & fudge shop down Columbus Ave, a transplant from Waco as it happens, recommended this excellent Mama & Papa & Daughters Two North Beach Ristorante. 
Its a Great American Story: In 1976, newlyweds Franchino and Giuseppina Nozzolino arrived in SF from their tiny Italian hometown of Sarno near the Amalfi Coast. They paid their dues for 13 years in working-class food industry jobs before rewarding  themselves by realizing The Dream; opening Ristorante Franchino in '89.
And, great show both before and along with dinner.
On Sunday night we waited about 15 mins while getting Act One out front. Pro-Tip: Don't - I said DO NOT - complain about the wait time. Literally quoting Mr. F: "Mama Mia, MAMA MIA, I'm a busy-a Man, I do de best-a I can-a!" 
He could've legitimately added: "BTW in case-a you didn't-a notice I'm A Stereotype-a." And by this I mean no disrespect. He's proudly, magnificently, charismatically Italian.  
Act 2, inside: "Every-a-body LOVES a-me, Except-a My Wife-a!" 
Teeny, tiny, cozy in character; maybe 15 or 16 four-toppers. 
After mange we weren't surprised to learn sweet Miss Giuseppina creates her AMAzing pasta and desserts fresh before working front-of-house along with Franchino & 2 of their 4 grown-up, family-strong daughters. 
Leigh's Gnocchi Della Casa, homemade potato dumplings with tomato, pesto or gorgonzola sauce ($16) and my Veal Saltimbocca, sautéed and covered with prosciutto & mozzarella ($20) were WELL worth the brief, easy wait and dinero. Sharing Miss Giuseppina's Homemade Tiramisu ($9) and Homemade Chocolate Cannoli ($9) - Oh lord. Fantastic. 
Go. Book a cheap flight, wait patiently with whining waylaid, enjoy the food & floor show; thank me later. In person. With gifts. GO.
NOW.
author: Dayne C.

description: Great quality food every time I'm there. I order something different every time. The food always comes out hot and flavorful. You may think you want to go to The Stinking Rose, but you're wrong. Go to Franchino's.
author: Julie L.

description: The menu has fettuccine Alfredo, but i ordered a spaghetti Alfredo with mushrooms, onions and garlic and honest to God the end result was the best Alfredo pasta that i ever had.. Also ordered some chianti  and that did it's job of enhancing the already awesome flavor of the Alfredo sauce perfectly. I got the tiramisu, which was alright, but i am definitely coming  here for Alfredo pasta next time I get the craving for it.
author: Arvind G.

description:
My Ma and I were long overdue for a night out and I decided to take her to Franchino after one of my friends sang their praises years ago. I've lived virtually my whole life in North Beach, and I only now found this gem of a restaurant?

What a shame...cause the food was great!

I can see some of the grouchiness with the other reviews...this place is small, family-run, and as a result can be less than efficient some times. But the matriarch of the family (I think her name was Josephine?) was your typical warm, caring Italian mom-like figure. 

We split tomatoes and mozzarella (caprese style - which was light and filling), the fettucine franchino (a rich blend of cream sauce, proscuitto and mushrooms - it was rich and satisfying), and a linguine vongole (with white sauce). Overall a very good meal and the kid playing the accordion and our tiramisu only served to cap off a good night.
author: Aaron F.

description: Adorable place, feels like true Italy. Gnocchi where the best since the ones I tried in Tuscany, Italy. They also serve very good pasta with seafood. The place is owned by an Italian family, who work there and make everything themselves. The right place to feel Italy and try their traditional cuisine.
author: Anna G.

description:
Simply put, Franchino is like home.

I'm an Italian from Jersey.  When I was growing up I lived on the same block as my grandmother, so I'm accustomed to great home-cooked Italian meals and gigantic extended family gatherings.  Walking into Franchino was like walking into one of those gatherings.  The delicious smell of fresh cooked Italian food and the smiling face of Franchino himself warmly greeting customers as if he were welcoming them into his own home.

The food was excellent - all very fresh and flavorful, reminiscent of the recipes I grew up with.  Reasonably priced. Friendly, prompt service - we must have been served by every member of the crew at some point! Great bread, great wine, great atmosphere.  A hole-in-the-wall gem in the crowded North Beach neighborhood.

One tip - it's a small place, so it might not be the best place for a LARGE group, depending on the night.  They don't really have a wait list, Franchino just kinda keeps the list in his head and seats you the moment he has space for you.  I'm not sure if they take reservations but it would be advisable to make one if they do.

Dining at Franchino is like being home.  Forget Olive Garden, when you're at Franchino's, you're family!
author: George C.

description:
Amazing food. The mom, Carmela, and the dad were wonderful hosts. Felt like being an Italian home, such warmth and comfort. Small dining area, but wonderful atmosphere.

We got the eggplant parm, prawns, steak, and fettuccini Alfredo... All were incredible. To add to it, "Mom" (the owner) suggested a chianti that wasn't on the wine list--it was incredible!!! Would suggest to all and can't wait to go back!!!
author: Toni B.

description: Giving this place 1 star for the service. This place is completely unorganized and I wasted 20 minutes waiting to eat dinner while I was starving. The owner doesn't take down names for the wait and because of this, another party was seated before us. He even asked us to wait outside and it was freezing. I was hungry and then angry because of their service. After that we left and gave our money to another restaurant that deserved it. Learn how to manage your restaurant!
author: Elle C.

description:
Italian food is always amazing...but this place is awesome. The owners, first of all are the cutest thing on the planet. The father, mother, and daughters were all working when we went for dinner. Its always a good sign when the whole family takes pride in the family restaurant. 

I had the gnocci with gargonzola sauce and my friend had the salmon with some sort of amazing cheese sauce on top of it. We decided to go all out and forget out diets and it was soo worth it. DELICIOUS! The portions are huge and the food is rich, so our ambitions of finishing our own dishes were sqaushed, but the leftovers the next day were amazing too!

The restaurant was very clean. It was sort of small, but hey, its North Beach. We also got a bottle of Mark West Pinot Noir that was average price and delicious. 

They don't take reservations the same day, so you sort of have to line up outside and wait for a table, which in our case wasn't a big deal because there was only one other couple in line when we got there. I can see this being a bit awkward if you take your date their with no reservation and have to stand outside in the cold for a bit. But your date will definitely forgive you when she tastes her dinner! 

Yum! So far my favorite place in North Beach.
author: Juliet S.

description:
Everytime I come here I am reminded what a phenomenal place this is.

The reviews speak for themselves.  It is probably my favorite restaurant in all of North Beach.  Family owned, friendly, and fabulous every time. Whether you are a big group of 8 or here on a dinner date - it's a bit romantic with a completely chill atmosphere.

More importantly the food will not disappoint you. When they say everything is good is not just a cop out, it's the truth. Can't decide? Just close our eyes, spin in a circle 5 times and point to something. It'll be the best choice you ever made.
author: Christina C.

description: Our family of six had dinner at  Franchino's Sat night.  We are from San Diego and live near a mall w a Buca De Bepo (sp?) a franchise that imitates old Italian family food w tacky/sheek decor.  Franchino's must be where they got the idea from!  Everything about this place was a joy.  From the older Italian grandpa with booming voice and playfull welcome, to grandma who helped us  tease/scold our naughty 12yo son, to the daughter waitress.  Space and decor was a visual delight.  Food was delicious and complex, much better than mall restaurant mentioned above.  Tiramisu for dessert was the best I've had.  Thanks so much for making our stay in SF a delightful vacation for all our senses.
author: What W.

description: You won't be disappointed with the food. It's Italian that won't blow you away as I have visited the north end of Boston and coral gables, those two stops were amazing this place was ok.
author: Scott S.

description: Such a wonderful family restaurant! Chicken piccata and chicken Marsala were perfect! Our vegans also had great meals. The server was obviously concerned about making sure our vegans were well cared for by warning about one of their choices. Loved it!!! And the awesome Italian man in front giving out kisses was a special treat :)
author: Kelly B.

description:
This rating is only for how small this restaurant is.  I am sure that if we had actually been able to eat here it would have been delicious but the place is so small that they can only accommodate a few people.  

We called to make reservations but when we arrived we were told that we could't be seated because there was a line of people who had reservations that were also waiting to be seated.  That was disappointing and defeated the purpose of us making reservations.  

The owner (I think it was the owner) was VERY nice and gracious and told us that he was doing the best he could but people before us hadn't been seated so we would have to wait.  We decided to go to Stinking Rose who accommodated us right away.

I would love to try this place and change my rating once they expand or when they can actually accommodate  reservations.
author: Victoria C.

description: Sunday night when we were in San Francisco, I knew I wanted Italian food, so we got a cab & headed over to North Beach,  found this place though Yelp, what else!  It was between this place and the restaurant next door, "Mona Lisa",  which looked fancier.  Something told me this place would be the better choice.  The owner greats you outside at the door, his wife and daughter also work there.  The place was warm & welcoming, perfect on a rather cold fall evening.  I ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir, a house salad, and the Gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce, all was excellent.  The place has a really comfortable italian feel to it.  Even all the pictures on the wall of the owner and his guests and family though the years, felt homey.  First class all the way.  Will return again soon, my dinner was that good.  I love that the gentleman greeting you outside at the door, is also the man in the pictures on the wall.
author: Winny S.

description: Had an early dinner (around 4pm) with my sister and mom and we were each extremely happy with the meal, the service, and the atmosphere. Our waitress was knowledgeable, helpful, and refreshingly honest. She knew which seafood items were in season during our cost. She made perfect recommendations for me and my mom - we tend to be indecisive yet not entirely easy to please. We asked who was cooking and what is made on site, and we were happy to hear that ma and pop do most of the cooking and every item we asked about was made right there in the kitchen. I had the seafood linguine and there was at least as much seafood on my plate as pasta, if not more. Mom had the spinach gnocchi and it was cooked perfectly with a delicious Alfredo sauce. Sis had the meat sauce tortellini and all three of us agreed that the flavor was phenomenal. Before ordering dessert we made sure the tiramisu was traditional and made on site. The tiramisu is PERFECT. We each had an espresso with dessert and that was the cherry on top off s most excellent cake. We plan to have dinner here any time they visit me in sf in the future.
author: Phylicia G.

description: Terrible service, rude to customers. They promised us a table that they then gave away to other customers after seating us. We were told our table would be ready in minutes by one server then another rudely confronted us telling us we were in the way and needed to wait outside. Overall terrible experience and I don't think any amount of good food would've fixed it.
author: Brittany V.

description: Reservation management here is quite painful. We had one in the party running behind but they wouldn't seat us despite having two birthdays amongst us. Food was mediocre.
author: Amit P.

description: Franco - that is the best damned gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce I have ever had! Thank you for a delightful experience.
author: David B.

description: We love love love this place!!! Family owned family run. This place is a must when dining in SF. The lasagna and gnocchi are absolutely out of this world.
author: Whit G.

description: Without a doubt the best Fettuccine Alfredo in San Francisco! It's rich, flavorful, and filling! Exactly how it should be. The place is a lovely, intimate family owned restaurant...but that comes with some difficulties. As wonderful as the intimate atmosphere may be, it's also very small; only about 20 people can fit in there at a time. With that being said, the wait time can get pretty long. If you want good Italian pasta, come here! If you want good Italian pasta while in a big group...you might want to go elsewhere.
author: Delilah S.

description:
We have had dinner here twice. The most recent was last weekend. Both times our dinner has been excellent. The family is very friendly and made us feel welcome. We were seated right away. We received water and bread along with olive oil and vinegar. 

We placed our order which arrived within a very short time. Our group of five had several pastas and all were very good, hot down to the bottom of the plate. There was nothing left on any of the plates.

We have not been disappointed on either occasion.

We will definitely be back.
author: G A.

description:
My boss brought our team to Franchino's while on business in San Francisco. Oh my!  The atmosphere was great, and the food was clearly authentic Old World.  The pasta...the sauces...the desserts...the wine...

The place is small -- only seats 30-40 people, but it is unique and quaint.  It is family-owned and run, and they are a fabulous group of people (the owner's mother had just arrived from Italy when we were there).  We received first-class service.  I will ask to go back here every time I am in San Francisco!
author: Donna B.

description:
We were walking around North Beach and were greeted by the owner, and took us to our table within 20 minutes. Not bad, considering it's a tiny little place and the place was packed! 

I ordered the gnocchi in pesto sauce, bf ordered the salmon with pasta on the side, and his brother ordered the seafood linguini, I believe. My gnocchi was fantastic! It was flavored well and chewy, which I loved. Give me delicious gnocchi any day, and I'm happy! The salmon was okay, nothing to rave about. 

Overall, it's a great family-owned restaurant that has great food, we left satisfied and happy.
author: Sharon K.

description:
If you like  hole in the wall dives go here! But don't say I didn't warn you. Not sure what people see in this place . I had the seafood risotto, It tasted like wet soggy instant rice with expired  seafood from a china town dumpster. My wife order egg plant  parmesan, It tasted like the smell of a middle school boys gym locker room.
Save your money.  Don't be fooled by the positive reviews on here. Apparently they have a big family and a lot of friends because someone had to write reviews to bump them up the list on yelp. I promise it wasn't a real paying customer. Take your money and go to the store buy some spaghetti sauce, boil noodles and bam I just saved you 50 plus dollars.
author: Matt A.

description:
As always, when I visited SF recently a dinner at Franchino was mandatory.  Alas, Frank and Josephine were in Italy on a well-deserved vacation, leaving the restaurant in the very capable hands of their daughters.  True, I missed watching Papa out on Columbus playing scopa when not inviting passers-by in for dinner.  And Mama taking great pride as she watched everyone thoroughly enjoying their food.  But the meal and service remained spectacular: prosciutto and melon, spaghetti carbonara, and of course Mama J's wonderful panna cotta.

I have utmost respect for family-owned businesses (it's a tough gig).  Franchino remains one of the best.
author: William D.

description:
Only resturant that we could quickly find that wasn't gourmet Italian that had pasta dishes.  We had a late reservation so we were seated immediately. We were greated warmly by both owners. Loved the ma and pop Italian atmosphere.  

We ordered salads that were very fresh and the dressing was robust. I ordered  pasta with red/ cream sauce and the hubby ordered Carbonara. Both of our dishes were very fresh but lacked flavor that one would expect at an Italian eatery. Tasted absolutely no sign of salt, pepper, garlic or basil... Very, very bland.  The bread was cold and only offered up red wine vinegar and oil for it.  

We didn't order desert but it looked fab! 

Ma and Pa bickered a bit in the back ground  during our dinner that made it really awkward... It was a late dinner so I understand they were tired and ready to start the closing process. But I would have rather they turned us away than take us on with the awkwardness.  Ma complained to us as well about late diners which was very awkward since we were late...but they took us on...

I would rate the atmosphere (less the bickering) a 4.0 and the food just a 3. Total 3.5. With tip, dinner was $80 for 2 of us with one glass of wine each, salad, meal and no dessert. 

Ps... Our waitress was their daughter and she was a sweetheart and very attentive..

My advice to the owners would be to allow their chefs to be creative and spice up the dishes with fresh garlic and basil...allow them to change up the menu with new dishes... What worked 20 years ago may not work today. Also to not complain to their customers about other customers,  restaurants...ect...

Hated being constructive... Would love to see this resturant survive... Seems like a good family.
author: Sherrie T.

description:
This place is amazing.   A true family run adventure!

Try the mixed appetizer, the best we have ever had!!!

Thank you for the wonderful time, laughs and great food!
author: John G.

description: Delicious, fresh homemade pasta and Italian family-owned and run.  Affable and knowledgeable service.  The owner and chef came out to serve our main dishes and ask how we were enjoying our meal.  Quite a wonderful Italian spot in an area with some mediocre and over-priced Italian food.
author: John M.

description: Good food and quantity.  Veal Saltimbocca was good.  May have been a bit overpriced.  Not too busy so you can get a table when you want it more likely.
author: John M.

description:
My preference would have been to give this place 3.5 stars but yelp doesn't give you that option. Anyway..
Likes, not loved the the food. We were three and ordered the smoked mozzarella, veggie lasagna and the perto gnocchi. The mozzarella was very good and topped with red peppers and asparagus grilled to perfection. The main course though was not as inspired. The gnocchi was quite dense and the lasagna was topped with just too much cheese and there wasn't much else to it. The tomato sauce though was quite nice.
The highlight was the panna cotta. The size was perfect, texture and sweetness good, and the combination of raspberry and chocolate sauce a nice finishing touch.
Wouldn't mind going here again.
author: Anupama C.

description:
I've had a number of experiences where I've ended up in North Beach and walked up and down Columbus looking for a place to eat.  it's always the same - we look at a lot of menus that are about the same, finally realize that they all look relatively similar, get too hungry and just choose the next one we come upon.  Unfortunately, we are usually disappointed.  After trying 3 or 4 restaurants in this manner, we planned ahead this time, did some solid Yelp searching, and finally settled on Franchino because it had good reviews, great variety on the menu, and reasonably priced (for North Beach).

And....yay!  So happy!  Everyone in our group was very satisfied.  We ordered a good assortment of pasta dishes and everyone was very pleased - good portion sizes, the right amount of sauce (not drowning the pasta into nothingness), wonderful flavors.  We also all finished off with dessert - canolis and tiramisu - and, again, very pleased by how delicate and tasty the desserts were.  Our server was abrupt and cold (she seemed annoyed when I asked if she had any recommendations from their enormous menu) and that detracted a little bit from the overall experience, but the dinner itself was great so I don't see why that should stop anyone from going, plus serving is tough work.
author: Luthien N.

description:
Cute family run restaurant.  Husband and Wife team watched over the restaurant on a Saturday night making sure everyone was enjoying their food.

Had the Linguine Con Vongole (fresh clams with garlic in white wine sauce).  Really tasty, sauce wasn't overbearing.  And they kept bringing out bread and butter which I like. =)

Good wine.  'Nough said.
author: Anh D.

description: We met friends in SF and were looking for a place eat, it was a perfect pick.  This little place was welcoming,  family run , warm environment.  Food was very good, but portions were on the small side. Fairly priced menu with pleanty of choices. Will definitely make my list next time we are in SF.
author: Maurice B.

description: My visit to Francinno took an unexpected turn, but it wasn't lower than average or even so and so. Overall, the restaurant itself is decent, with alright service, and it's very homey. Honestly, it reminded me of my grandparents house, with dully painted walls, a smaller type of restaurant. There is great food, but small portions. I would recommend this for just a small dinner, but not when you are very hungry. (The portions are actually average, put in big bowls but only a small part of that is filled.)
author: Georgiana P.

description: Best mom & pop italian in sf! Walk right by the stinking rose & go here. Ask what ravioli the lady of the house made that day & order it!
author: Loren P.

description:
Super cute, little family own Italian restaurant. Had a nice glass of Chianti, clams in white wine sauce and carbonara. Decent carbonara. Not killer, but hits the spot and very very satisfying. 

I do wish the bread was warm instead of cold and stale, but it was fine to dip into the clam in white wine sauce.
author: Alex L.

description: Every time we are in San Francisco, we make sure we eat here.  The food is fantastic, the service couldn't be better, and the prices are reasonable.  Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city!
author: Eric N.

description:
As an Italian, I feel like my opinion of this restaurant may weigh a little heavier than others...

This place is fantastic! My dad stumbled upon it while driving through San Fran on business and we have been here every time we are in town. Family owned by the cutest little family ever for almost 30 years. The food is very delicious and authentic. 

They have excellent chicken Parmesan that they serve with either the veggie of the day or the pasta of the day. Their sauce is amazing (and I am super picky with my sauces, trust me). Everyone else loved their dishes too-- we plan on coming for dinner again during our week stay here.

I highly recommend! I know the Stinking Rose is super close and this place may seem small, but it's amazing and you are crazy not to try it.
author: M B.

description:
It's no wonder that by 7pm there is a line down the block to eat at Franchino. Be warned that this is not a place to dine three hours...it's an incredibly popular, small family-owned restaurant, i.e. they need to turn some tables!

Regardless, they were incredibly accommodating to our group of six even though by the time the entire party arrived we were an hour late for our reservation. Water glasses were constantly filled. They didn't try to give us the check until we asked for it. Service was friendly and efficient.

Onto the food - simply scrumptious! Linguine con vongole was perfectly executed and there was not an overcooked clam in sight. You must order the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce as it was DIVINE. I also tried a friend's tomato cream sauce and another's red meat sauce and both were delicious as well.

Get here early, order some house wine with your meal, and you'll be swept away to foodie heaven.
author: Claire C.

description: I called them twice but they said they don't take reservations. So I went there early with my partner and the first thing they ask is if we have reservations or not. Then I saw bunch of ppl coming in with reservations. What a discrimination
author: Harris Y.

description:
What a terrible experience this was. After checking all the yelp reviews of Italian places in North Beach, I chose this one, great reviews family owned, something really different! I wish I could review the food of this place, but unfortunately Franchino and his wonderful family didn't give us that pleasure, instead they KICKED us out of their restaurant. 

Upon arrival to the restaurant, Franchino opened the door and walked us in immediately. The restaurant was packed but there was one table for two. This table isn't supposed to be there, as it was literally barely squeezed in between another table and the kitchen area. Right next to the kitchen is this area where they keep menus, dishes, the cash register, papers, glasses, etc..all on this rubbery mat area. In between this area and a table for four we were seated, Franchino joked as he sat us down "best seats in the house" My mom sat facing the restaurant, and although she was squished her view wasn't bad. I sat facing my mom and well, this lovely kitchen/staff area, actually I wasn't facing it, i was in it, one reach of the arm and i could be grabbing you menus, serving you water, grabbing your check, etc. 

As soon as we sat down I felt really uncomfortable, my mom spotted a couple by the window getting up, and I called over a waitress. I VERY kindly asked her if we could be moved to the table that was leaving... she said, "oh I don't know I have to ask HIM." Then she disappeared, no response. When we saw Franchino walking by my mom called over to him, and he kind of ignored us. A few minutes later a couple walked into the restaurant, which he immediately seating at the open table... A few minutes later a couple next to us was signing their bill. Then our waitress came up to ask asking what we wanted to drink... I believe this was his daughter, since no one responded to us we decided to ask again.

My mom asks her, do you think we can be moved to this table that's leaving, my daughter doesn't feel comfortable sitting here. Her response "there are people who have been waiting for 20 minutes outside, we can't take away their seats" - frankly, through the windows you can tell no one is waiting outside, and we only got here 10 minutes ago, so no one could have been waiting for more than 5. Then I said, oh "do you think we can take that table, and they could take ours? or well wait for the next one?" her response: "we aren't going to make people get up from their dinner to re seat you" my mom responds "oh ahaha no that's not what we meant, we mean if something opens if its not a problem"......at that moment she grabs our menus and goes, " I think its best you leave, have a good night" - my mom didn't understand her so she says. "oh okay we can wait outside" and the waitress repeats, "no no you need to leave, have a good night" and starts escorting us out of the restaurant. 

I was in such a shock, I was speechless. This place is tiny so surely everyone heard and understood and I was embarrassed. As we are walking out Franchino is sitting outside, and as my mom starts telling him how his waitress kicked us out, he told her if we weren't happy with sitting there we should have never sat down and left right away and he just said we are too busy for "this" and turned around and walked back into the restaurant... he was just as rude as his waitress. 

In all my years, I have NEVER been kicked out of a restaurant. NEVER! My mom was so upset she started crying after we left!

I would never recommend this place, this family is so rude and entitled, how dare you kick someone out of your restaurant for KINDLY asking to be re seated after you shove us into such a terrible seat. Just because you have a lot of customers and great hype doesn't mean you can act this way, stay humble and appreciative of your clients because what goes around comes around!
author: Milana K.

description: My second time here and definitely not my last! By far the best Italian food in SF! The owners treat all customers like family and I can say with confidence that everything on the menu is amazing! I love the lasagna and their ravioli. For dessert, the cannoli is the way to go!
author: Alejandra N.

description:
Just because this place is on Columbus street does not mean that it is good.  If you are a tourist this is a trap!!!,  Mediocre Northern Italian food, the owner walks around like a big shot!!He was yelling at us because there are no seats,  He does not take names of customers  as they come in, It is total chaos!!! Okay maybe being Itaian will allow you to have that kind of character,,, Maybe the food is good.

We had to wait for 30 minutes and the old man got crazier!!! The bread was hard and was sitting on the counter for hours.... we had the mussels for appetizers .  It was so small and overcooked that it was not worth the price. The chicken parmesan( not even breaded) was pounded up chicken to half an inch with melted cheese on it, the rotini pasta was dry, the sauce is horrendous . It tasted like canned dried up gravy. The gnocchi with pesto had no taste to it, the fettucine alfredo....ayayayay!!! nothing to write home about. .
I had the pasta with calamari.  I had to doctor it up with parmesan cheese and crushed red pepper.  For dessert we had the chocolate cannoli, the cream was runny and the whole pistacchio nuts tasted old.  The tiramisu,  had thin ladyfingers, but if you like total sweetness , this dessert is for you. 
We were so disappointed....   our bill came up to $123. Maybe this is how Northern Italian food is but taste is universal,  My husband is Sicilian, and has been in the restaurant business since he was wee small . Mr. Franchino was very abrupt to him.  Too bad Cesare's closed down. We could have just went to Bucca di peppo and got better food and service.
author: Cara L.

description: My daughter requested an evening in North Beach. She's a bit younger and not as familiar as I am, so when we arrived I was thinking, "oh no, we're going to have to pay exorbitant prices for pasta that's just average". We found ourselves in front of a restaurant she suggested that is clearly very popular with tourists. I pulled out my trusty Yelp app to save me from a potentially bad experience. Thankfully, Yelp saw my location and recommended I go next-door to Franchino! OK, so Yelp didn't really recommend it to me, but four out of five stars  for a whopping 810 reviews is pretty darn good. We had Maria as our server, one of the four sisters who works a few nights a week to help run their mother's restaurant. She made our evening so fun! The way she described the specials for the night meant that we didn't even have to look at the rest of the menu. We have the paparadelle pasta with sausage, mushrooms and tomato sauce, and the spinach gnocchi with a four cheese sauce. It's felt very special to know that it was Maria's mother who made the pasta. But mostly, it was very, very good. Thank you Franchino for wonderful evening.
author: Lisa H.

description: I wish I had a chance to actually taste their delicious food and give a 5 star review but I have to go with a 1 star due to super rude waitress who told us to wait for an hour even though we had a reservation and the owner who told us "What can I do". What you could have done is taking reservations seriously and reserve the seats for your customers who show up on time. Very disappointed.
author: Volkan E.

description:
My husband and I both studied abroad in Italy, and this was some of the best Italian we've had in the states! The owners were so sweet and made sure we loved our experience. 

The house wine was great. My husband had the manicotti special and left nothing on the plate. I ordered the vegetable risotto with tomato sauce which was superb. Coffee and espresso after our meal made it perfect. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a delicious Italian meal in San Francisco!
author: Megan N.

description:
I think I've just discovered my new go-to Italian spot! It's amore! 

This place brings me back to Italy. Nice, family ran restaurant where the papa greets every guest who enters. 

My boyfriend and I arrived around 7, no reservation, no wait. We ordered the bruschetta, cappellini al pomodoro, and chicken with the house pasta. As we waited for our food we had bread and olive oil. Add a little salt, yum! 

The bruschetta... Omg. Probably even better than the ones I've had in Italy! I would def recommend! Then my pasta arrived! I've never had cappellini noodles (extra thin), but I'll say I was pleasantly surprised. It was fresh, simple, yet full of flavor. My bf also loved his chicken. 

For dessert we shared panna cotta with strawberry sauce. It was very creamy and oddly tasted like cheesecake! Haha. 

Overall, great experience. Very home feel to the restaurrant. Great authentic Italian food.
author: Jackie M.

description: Excellent food and service. Gnocchi special stuffed with truffle was amazing, gnocchi w Gorgonzola was outstanding, chicken was great and smoked mozzarella w peppers delicious.
author: Amy W.

description: Best Alfredo sauce I've ever had. Family owned and operated and really intimate vibe.
author: Nathalie R.

description:
This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. The food is home cooked and you can taste the difference. Wonderfully fresh and authentic Italian cooking. It's always a good sign when the waiter says "for the specials, my mom cooked today..."
Great ambiance, friendly service. All around great.
author: Mrs. G.

description:
Everyone's working at the restaurant is really friendly despite being very busy. We came one weekend night and the place was just packed. It's almost impossible for people to walk between the tables. I'd rather go to some place less crowded, so when I go again I will definitely choose a less busy time.

The food is good, although my pasta tastes a little too generic.
author: Novalina N.

description:
Food is good. Not great. Family running and experience is awesome. People complain about the wait or reservation issues. Then yelp how they find a great place close by that was no wait at all. No wait among places that have a line should tell you something. This place is a great experience with good food. I say 4 star food 5 star for owners / staff.

Update. The owner guy is too macho and rude to his wife and kid. Stopped going due to him. He can really rub you wrong. The wife and daughter are awesome.
author: S G.

description:
Franchino is a great family run place and a great choice if you're looking for Italian food in North Beach.  The service is great and the food is great.  My bf loves their gnocchi and I've liked everything I've gotten.  The prices are very reasonable.  Try the chocolate cannoli, it's awesome.  Great wine selection as well.

Cons: seating is tight, but it's a pretty small place.
author: Laura J.

description: Precisely what I have been looking for. My family and I all ordered the parmigiana dishes. Chicken, eggplant and veal. All three were the best we had ever had. While we may not be "foodies" I do love italian food, and prefer the New York style I grew up with from my youth and this fit the bill 100 percent. The family running the place was fantastic, the location couldn't be better and the prices were significantly lower than I thought they would have been. A great find and we will certainly come back whenever we are in SF.
author: Bruce H.

description: Incredible service and food. We got the lasagna and chicken parmesan. They were both AMAZING! We left feeling full but not heavy. We got a table right away, but I got the feeling that it's usually not the case. I'd recommend calling ahead or arriving early. Also, they only seat you when everyone in your pretty has arrived.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: We just ate here-party of 6. Everyone's meal was excellent. I had the Chicken Piccata-best sauce ever!!! The waitress was excellent as she provided great service and was very accommodating. Very rustic feel inside. Only wish they had slightly better bread according to my husband.
author: Joan W.

description:
I just went to Franchinos last night for the first time and loved it. We went in because I have passed by it several times and it looked, and smelled very good with a huge menu posted outside.
When we got to the entrance we were greeted by Franchino himself!  He has an awesome attitude and is very friendly, and said to my group  at the front door with a thick italian accent, " Come in to my restaurant, I promise you will love it. Listen I will tell you what, if it is not to your satisfaction then dinner is on me" -Franchino.

 I ordered the new york steak with a side of pasta with meat sauce, believe me- it was perfect, couldnt have asked for more. Pretty neat that waitresses are Franchinos wife and two daughters. Overall, a  great Italian family owned it restaurant, and all at a decent price. I will have to make Franchinos one of my regular places to eat.
author: Colin H.

description: It doesn't get any more authentic and outstanding that Franchino's! The family is out of this world and so is the food. Get there early because it is guaranteed to be a packed house. Service was second to none and if you're looking for a slice out of a little Italy this is your place! Awesome! We will be back again and again. One of the premier spots in North Beach! Check it out!
author: Kirk K.

description:
I usually use Yelp to find a restaurant but tonight I decided to just walk up Columbus and see what I stumbled upon figuring I didn't have a reservation.  Let me tell you that was the best decision I have made in a long time after finding Franchino!

We started with a sampler appetizer which was DELICIOUS.  It had a little bit of everything and each bite seemed better than the last.  My two favorites on the sampler were eggplant and I believe goat cheese as well as the prosciutto and melone.  Bruschetta was really good too.  It was all good - I may as well name everything on the sampler!

For dinner I had the homemade ravioli with ragu and my friend had the carbonara.  Each were fabulous.  The ravioli literally felt like silk and melted in my mouth.  I was so full that my friend finished my plate after clearing his own because mine was just that good.

We were too full for dessert.  In addition to the great food the servers were absolute dolls.  They were the daughters of the owners who were out of town for the first time celebrating their 35th anniversary.  Well the owner should trust their kids because it was incredible despite their absence!

Cheers to Franchino and I'll definitely be back!
author: Amy D.

description:
Very good flavorful authentic Italian food! I love that its still a family ran restaurant. I would definitely recommend ordering the seafood marinara dish (they have it with or without pasta) and if you enjoy pesto, they have a really good chicken pesto linguini dish. They have a large selection of pasta dishes and the few that my boyfriend and I have tried have all been delicious!

One thing that I was a little disappointed by was their tiramisu. I had high expectations given its suppose to be an authentic italian restaurant but their tiramisu was just average, and it wasn't made in the traditional way that tiramisu is made with the alternating layers of lady fingers/mascarpone-cream mix/ cocoa power. I thought that Mona Lisa #3 (which is near Franchino) had a much better tiramisu than Franchino's.
author: Christine Y.

description:
If you want a warm, friendly old world atmosphere, in a completely unpretentious setting, with down-home Italian food, at great prices.... this is an excellent choice.

Old school Italian, with attentive, charming owners and decor that is a quite hokey. The service was great and the food very good. Excellent value.

Dishes we really liked: Vegetable antipasti, chicken saltimbocca, and cioppino. Each was very traditional and very well executed. All were under $20.

Zabaglione dessert was interesting and delicious. Very highly recommended. Worth the $9.95 price.

Can't recommend the chocolate cannoli. Overly chilled, with waxy chocolate coating. 

Ask the female owner a question about the menu, and she will answer with clarity, detail, and charm.
author: Adam R.

description: Nice family owned restaurant with a nice.variety of dishes on the menu. The Ceasars salad was delicious. I had the chicken porcini. The flavor of the porcini really shined in the dish. I would definitely  recommend  the dish and the restaurant.  Be prepared to wait about 20 minutes for a table. The service, and the food were excellent and worth the wait.
author: Clay S.

description: Food here was very good.  But the table seating/reservation system was awkward at best and very cramped once we sat down.  Menu was good but nothing to knock your socks off.  We all had traditional dishes.  Waitresses were very good - helpful and attentive.  It was worth coming to once.  But probably won't be rushing back here.
author: Lewis C.

description:
I'm a big fan of family-run businesses and this place was fantastic. I struggled a little bit with the menu choices as I am on a vegan diet for a month, but the risotto primavera was delicious and so was the garlicky spaghetti d'olivo (I'm not sure that's spelled right, but it'll still help you find it on the menu!).

The service was superb and friendly. The owners and their daughter were serving so it felt like we had joined their family for dinner in their home. I had an engaging conversation with each one of them at some point during our dinner.

As I said, the menu all looked delicious, but, since I am on my vegan diet, I was limited. However, my dinner partners were not and they raved about their dinners.

The only reason I could not give five stars here was because the by-the-glass wine selection was not very good wine (six choices, each $6.95 a glass) and the olive oil on the table was pretty low grade. If I wasn't so cheap, I would have sprung for one of the bottles of wine on their short but comprehensive-looking list.

Okay, a short comment about olive oil. I'm really picky about my olive oil at home and expect it to be at least as good, if not better, when I eat out. Many restaruants serve cheap olive oil for dipping bread these days, and I think most serve Italian olive oil that comes in a bucket! The best olive oil is always fresh olive oil - and in California, that means local, Californian olive oil. The stuff imported from Italy can be 6 months or older and loses all of its peppery taste...but I'm ranting.

If you love enjoiying good Italian food in the company of a sweet, friendly Italian family, go say "hi" to Franchino for me.
author: Jaycen R.

description:
I had a bunch of stuff at Franchino, but one thing that stuck with me was their carbonara. Excellent carbonara! I love the creaminess!!!

The owner of the place is so friendly! He comes to your table and sings sometimes. 

Love the food, love the pople, love the ambiance of Franchino!
author: Erica L.

description:
I wish my first kiss was as fun as going to this restaurant. 

From the moment you walk in you just feel like you walked into your grandparent's house. The place has great decorations everywhere and seriously is just so comfy. You just want to stay. I'm not the type to stay in a restaurant after I've finished eating but I could live here. 

The food was amazing. I asked the waitress, one of the daughters of the owner what seafood pasta she recommended. Without pause she said "the Pescatore." WOW was she right. One of the best pasta dishes I have ever had. Delicious homemade pasta. Amazing mix of seafood. All kinds: calamari, shellfish, actual fish. It was a medley of love dancing around my tongue. I could not have been happier.
My friend got another seafood pasta dish, which she said was amazing. I forget the name, but moral of the story is: Go with the seafood pasta.
My other two friends both got the mushroom risotto. At first they said it was kind of bland. Needed some salt and pepper, but they felt bad asking for salt. One friend tried to add pepper to her risotto, and the cap was loose and red pepper crashed down upon her plate like an angry lava flow. The waitress saw and took it back. They gave her a new plate which tasted better. it was cheesier. My other friend was jealous.  

The wine list was apparently great. I'm not much of a wine man, so I left it out. But my three friends raved about the two bottles they ordered. And wanted to order many more.

For dessert we ordered the panna cotta. Easily the best panna cotta I'd ever had. The sauce was delicious, and the creamy part itself was so rich and moist. I wish I had ordered my own instead of having to share with three others. 

The atmosphere was what made this place above and beyond the ordinary. Mid meal, the owner, Franchino himself, sang a song in Italian for everyone. He has a great voice and sang a really heartfelt song. It was great. The whole place is family run. His two daughters are waitresses, and the wife I believe does the cooking. We talked to her for a while too and she was so nice. They all were amazing. 

The food isn't too cheap, but its worth it. And there can be a wait, so I'd make a reservation. But if you want some amazing Italian, you have to try this place out!
author: Eli Y.

description: First time to San Francisco and tried this place on a whim. Best chicken parm I've ever had!!! Great service also! Place is a little cramped but it works
author: Brianna C.

description:
TRUE ITALIAN PLACE! GREAT!!!!!!!

The atmosphere is super cozy.  This is a family restaurant.  The owner is soooo funny )))))) .He's super nice.

I will definitely return again.
author: Julia G.

description:
I really wish that I could review the food. However, unfortunately I can't because we didn't get to eat any of it...

When my family and I arrived for our reservation, the small restaurant was packed and there was another group waiting for their "reservation" ahead of us. 

My dad decided to inquire how long our wait was going to be:

Dad: How long can we expect to wait?
Owner (with blue hair on top!), a little frazzled: I am trying the hardest I can!
Dad: I'm just wondering about how long it will be...
Owner, more annoyed: I am trying the best I can!
Dad: We had a reservation...
Owner: I know, I am trying the hardest I can.
Dad: So basically you're saying my reservation is irrelevant?
Owner: Yes, I guess you could say that...

We were clearly going to need to wait at least 30 minutes and were getting hungry. So we headed across the street to the yummy Greek restaurant Estia across the street where there was no wait and no irrelevant-reservation needed. 

I might try Franchino again but I'm just not sure. I was pretty disappointed that my reservation seemed to mean nothing :(
author: Meghan P.

description: This place is so cute. It's pretty small but we made it right before the rush and waited less than 10 minutes. The people who work here know what to do. Food is good, came out at a good time. Would come here again.
author: Viv B.

description: Fantastic!!!  Such a friendly place!  They really do make you feel like family.  The food was out of this world. Now my favorite Italian food in the bay area!
author: Daniel A.

description:
We had a good meal but it was overshadowed by the attitude of the hostess/owner/waitress.  Very rude. All about her needs.  No regard for allowing the customer to enjoy the experience.   If she wants to turn tables so quickly,  maybe she should say that upon booking reservation.  Rushed from the get go.  

1 hour 20 minutes on a $200+ tab is ridiculous.  Then you TELL us to leave?  How about you try booking your reservations 90 minutes apart and not 60 minutes apart. 

Don't go here if you are hoping to relax and enjoy an evening out.  There are lots of other choices.
author: Mary H.

description:
I thought it was great down-home type of Italian dining.  It's tiny inside so if you can, call ahead and make reservations.  But be warned, I did that but when I arrived, there no tables. So yes, they do take reservations, but it's unclear whether they will honor it. That was my main frustration with this place. Now onto the good part...the food.

It's a cute restaurant with may be 1-2 tables outside, but I didn't see anyone eating on the sidewalk. The food was absolutely fantastic. Had some of pasta dishes. One wasn't even on the menu but it was something I saw someone else eating and inquired about it--apparently if you go there enough and if they have the food, they'll make dishes that aren't on the menu. It was a delicious parpadelle dish with sausage, chicken, and a whole lot more.  The carbonara was ok too; not the best I've had, but the other dish made up for it. 

They're extremely friendly and at one point someone just started serenading the restaurant.  Seems very much a family type of place that is just very quaint.

And I cannot forget, the tiramisu was DELICIOUS. When it came out I thought they messed up our order and got us cheesecake or something but wow. It was good.

Great, quaint place to have a real Italian meal.
author: Traci H.

description: Awesome restaurant. Easily the most authentic in Little Italy. not the biggest or showiest - but this is where you come if you want amazing authentic Italian cooked by Nonna ! Book way ahead or walk in but be prepared to wait 20-30mins on busy nights - but worth the wait. The Gamberi was awesome
author: Richard D.

description: Yummy Italian food at an authentic family owned joint. We need a place like this in Palo Alto!
author: Alex R.

description: This place was exactly what I'm looking for in a city full of mediocre tourist traps. The food was authentic and the family owned vibe was what sold it. We had the bruschetta which was better than most, the penne with Arrabbiata which really hit the spot but the star of the meal was the gnocchi with half Gorgonzola cream sauce and half pesto. I'm glad the waitress suggested doing half and half because each was even better than the other. It was an amazing meal and supporting a family that was so sweet was the best part.
author: Katie H.

description:
Simply outstanding homestyle food like you would find in the Italian countryside. I have been a North Beach groupie for years and never went inside this tiny restaurant for two reasons: (1) the old fellow who stands outside like a drunken hawker turned me off and (2) I'm always looking for a bargain. Well, I was WRONG not to have gone in there sooner. Where has this restaurant been all my life? What I didn't realize was that this place IS a bargain, for the value you get. The food is far and away the best I've had in North Beach, better even than some of the fancier, more modern restaurants across the street.  

The doting proprietress loves to talk food and help you order the best thing on (or off) the menu, and might offer a few opinions about how Italian food is properly eaten while she's at it. The wines are good, the patrons all talk to each other and you really feel like you're home when you're in there. The old drunk guy might lean a little too close to your chair if you're an attractive female or burst inappropriately into an off-key aria while you're trying to talk to your date, but the place is all the more authentic for it. I insist to everyone I know that they must go here and eat to their heart's content! I recommend the cioppino but everything there is truly outstanding.
author: Coooooookies M.

description: Great little Italian place.  Very yummy food.  I loved the red sauce.  Exactly what I was looking for.
author: Caitlyn K.

description: Food was excellent,  wait staff was friendly and on top of it.  The owner came to our table and really made us feel welcomed and appreciated.  Wonderful experience!
author: Kyle S.

description: Let me begin by saying that I loved this place the first few time I went here. Their lasagna is honestly the best thing here. Now on to my most recent experience here. I have been lucky enough to recently receive a service dog and now can't imagine life without her. I was so excited to have some dinner here until I reached the front door. First, a couple walked up to the door after I had and the gentleman (if I can even call him that) took them inside first and shut the door so I couldn't enter. This left me standing outside the door waiting for him to come back. When he came back outside he then informed me that I was not welcome in his restaurant with my dog. I then tried to explain to him that it was a service animal and that I am disabled. He still refused to let me enter his restaurant. I won't be going back to this restaurant not only because I can't, but because I refuse to support someone so ignorant and rude.
author: Jasmin P.

description:
F riendly Italian man greets you as you enter
R estaurant is run by his family
A mbiance feels very intimately and home-like
N ice menu with very traditional selections
C an't wait to have Gnocchi again, with tomato sauce
H uuuuge fan of their Chicken Marsala
I ts sauce was amazing; the chicken, very moist 
N ever expected the Pasta Arrabbiata to be that spicy
O therwise, the penne was well made
author: Anthony N.

description:
First experience here tonight with a group of 6 friends, many from out of town, and don't plan on returning, with a plethora of options in the vicinity.

I had called a few weeks ago to make reservations for group of 6 @ 5:30pm.  Lady answered with a friendly tone and was happy to take my name down.  

However, tonight, I arrived to get a table a few minutes before 5:30pm, restaurant was still empty with 2-3 tables occupied only.   My party of 5 was present with 1 friend just finishing up parking.  The server came to our table and gave us an attitude that she normally doesnt seat a party until every single one is present.  I was quick to respond that I did make reservations for 5:30 for our group.  No form of apology or embarrasment expressed.   This set the tone for the evening, we were peeved.

Luckily enough, our pasta was presentable and we all seemed to enjoy our plate of carbs.  

Given the first impression of service and the rude welcoming, I will certainly not return to give them business.  

Sad to say.
author: Jackie D.

description: The service was good and the people are so nice, but this is over-priced and nothing special. It's typical "Little Italy" fare.
author: B B.

description: Wonderful little Italian joint! We had the lasagna and house special (flat noodles with sausage). So amazing! The service was excellent. You can tell it's a family run shop. Everyone was very attentive and friendly. Definitely recommend the lasagna...
author: Justin R.

description:
We have been living in the Bay Area for about 6 months now and eat out at least twice a week. This was out worst experience in this city... The elderly waitress was sweet and made an effort to use a few Italian words. The person who seemed to be the owner was singing loudly outside (cute), however the food... It was so bad that we tried a bite of each and had it to go so that we could give it to the homeless person we knew was on the corner. Where have you helpers been eating????
Bread: hard and old
Carbonara: smelled and tasted foul... Was the pancetta expired?
Eggplant: not eatable at all! Soft soggy thing...
Pasta with red sauce: plain, plain, plain
Wine: drinkable
Place: smelly
Happy hashing gotten back home and having a grilled cheese... Much better:)
Sorry folks, complacency in not the solution
author: Amanda T.

description:
Franchino's was a great mom and pop Italian restaurant in North Beach.  It was a warm, friendly atmosphere and to top it off they served delicious food. 

I ordered one of the specials.  The fact that the waitress said, "My mom made this great pasta..." made me soon realize that this was food going to be made with love.  :)  The pasta was very tasty that even my friend dug into it himself.

The service was great and either the daughter or the mom checked in on us.  The bus boy continually made sure our waters were full and I was bummed that I didn't have enough room for dessert.

The only reason I'm giving it four stars is simply because the space is pretty small.  Be sure to get there a little early though because it'll get crowded quick and they don't take reservations.

Another great thing about them was while I was waiting outside for my friend, the owner was outside opening the door for the guests and while doing that he and I would chat as if we were hanging out at his house.  Really great people and welcoming environment.

Go eat at Franchino's!
author: Leilani R.

description:
Absolutely loved the food, the family-run atmosphere and the service. Its a small place, but we got seated right away since it was a Sunday evening. One of the few places where everything we ordered was just perfect. The mussels were fantastic and the salmon with capers was absolutely heavenly! The waitress who is the daughter of the owners even brought us complimentary port at the end of our dinner.

Franchino himself was around and looked so much like the Godfather that we were a little scared of him (in a good way).
author: Nitin N.

description:
Do yourself a favor and don't miss this place. I haven't been this pleased with a restaurant in a LONG time. I was searching for an Italian spot in North Beach when I had guests in town - I wanted a super yummy Italian restaurant (obvs) that wasn't too touristy (The Stinking Rose) but was still in the hustle and bustle of the fun part of North Beach. This place met all my needs! 
The most charming thing about Franchino is that it's family owned, and the owner (a friendly older Italian man with a think accent and awesome felt hat with flowers) greets you at the door, seats you, and asks how your meal was. It had an old-world feel that I loved. 
And the food - oh the food! I ordered the tortillini (homemade) and swooned. As did my dining partners over their gnocchi (homemade) and their ravioli (homemade). 
Overall, the meal was awesome, the service superb, and the experience just top notch.
author: Jeanna B.

description:
Take my review with a grain of salt because I am from Atlanta, and it is an Italian food desert, but this was a overall great experience.  

My coworkers and I were looking for a tasty Italian place, and we headed toward North Beach as recommended by a hotel.  We had a list of a couple of places, but for some reason Franchino caught our eye.  After a quick check on Yelp, we were sold. 

The restaurant is pretty small and packed.  The walls are decorated with family photos and poster of Italy.  Very charming.  The owner greeted us promptly and seated us at a cozy booth.  Service was friendly and everyone knew what they were doing.  Was it all family members working there?

I had the seafood pasta- clams, mussels, squid, fish in a red sauce. My coworkers had the chicken parmigiana, veal, and chicken/veggie pasta in a red sauce.  Everything was fresh, delicious, and well seasoned.  I really liked the way each component of my dish picked up flavors of the others. 

Afterwards, in true tourist style, we got a picture with the owner and were on out merry way to check out Chinatown.
author: Jumi Y.

description:
I had read a positive review about Franchino's on sfgate.com and decided that on my next visit to the Bay area I wanted to try them out. We passed a lot of other restaurants on the walk to Franchino's, but I was determined to give them a shot. I'm glad we did. 
 The restaurant was small and we arrived just a smidge before the dinner rush. Mr. Franchino was standing outside and hurriedly escorted us to a table. This is a family owned establishment so his daughters were waiting tables and his wife was chatting to customers and bringing out the dishes. I got mussels in red sauce and she cracked up because I was wearing white. She told me the people who order their linguini with mussels always wear white and always walk away wearing the sauce. I promised her I'd prove her wrong (I did!). She tossed in a free dessert to us when she found out it was our 9 year anniversary AND for not spilling the sauce on myself. 
 As I said before, the place is very small. That is easy to see when one enters the establishment. In saying that I must note I was put off by a woman who entered (during dinner rush), with no reservation and demanding a table for 8, including two high-chair-aged children. Mr. Franchino looked around and told her if she came back in 30 minutes he would make sure she had a table ready. The woman was ghastly; becoming irate and sighing loudly and letting him know how he should "appreciate" her business and seat her right then. (Where?!) I was very impressed with how calm Mr. Franchino stayed and the way he explained that he could not simply remove other customers to seat her un-reserved party. She had left and I assumed for good, but upon our exit she returned (almost 30 minutes after) and as promised Mr. Franchino had a table waiting and had waters already poured for their group. I can only hope they tipped well that night.
 Anyhow, I would highly recommend Franchino's. The only mark I made was due to the extreme closeness of the tables and how this made it very hard to get up and move without bumping into other people's plates/drinks. I would have more appreciated the loss of one-two tables to spread out just that much more, but I understand the business is needed, so in the end it isn't too bad.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I was really looking forward to going to Franchino. Maybe my expectations were higher than usual but I was imagining a cute cozy italian dimly lit restuarant but instead it was more of a mom and pop's sorta eatery. You can't help but think, this is a cover up for a mafia den and any minute the cops will bust right through the door. 

Let's talk about the food. It was good. not great. A little pricey for what it is but I enjoyed it. But it's all about worth. I felt like I would have a better experience and food quality for another Italian restaurant down the street. 

Why were the tables so close together? I'm sure the family of four next to us didnt enjoy our conversations about our bike accidents and travels.

It was just okay.
author: Kelly C.

description:
We stumbled upon Franchino while meandering around North Beach looking for a place for a late lunch.  We were thisclose to going to Steps of Rome, but saw that it got 3 1/2 stars and decided we should try something new.  We pulled up Franchino's Yelp page on our iPhones and were deligted to see that, like in the photo, Mr. Franchino was standing in front of the restaurant with a welcoming smile and a 1950s hat.  Franchino was our clear choice.

We were seated by the window and Mr. Franchino's wife gave us our menus and told us about the specials.  On her recommendation, we got the manicotti with spinach and ricotta and the spaghetti with calamari.  We started with the house salad and got the complimentary bread basket.

The house salad was ok, as was the bread.  A bit disappointing because I love bread baskets.  The bread came out cold and was nothing special.  

Then came out our entrees... one bite of the manicotti and we were speechless.  It was AMAZING!  The rich tomato-based marinara tasted fresh and was absolutely perfect with the bites of cheesy pasta.  This dish was some of the best pasta I've ever had.  It was so simple and delicious and I still think about it from time to time.  True story.

The spaghetti with calamari was also quite good (though the manicotti was the standout dish of the afternoon).  I've learned through many disappointing dining experiences that mixing seafood with a marinara-based pasta can be a recipe for disaster.  In many of my past experiences, it has been fishy and disturbing.  The spaghetti with calamari was my first pleasant experience with marinara-based seafood pasta!  The calamari was perfectly tender and the flavor perfectly complemented the spaghetti rather than overpowering it.

The owners of Franchino are a wonderful couple and we loved patronizing this delicious family-run restaurant.  I will definitely be back!
author: Julie S.

description:
After walking all the way from
Market  street to North Beach we were really looking forward to some good Italian food and were planning to head to one of the many restaurants we have enjoyed in the neighborhood in the past.  After being convinced to give the place a try (and discretely checking the Yelp reviews) we were so glad we stopped.  The small restaurant felt homey and intimate and the food was AMAZING! The bruschetta was the best we ever had (including all over Italy), the gnocchi was "to die for" and the seafood risotto was awesome.  The warm family made us feel like we were guests in their own home.  We now have a new favorite SF restaurant and will definitely be back next time we are in town.
Thanks for a perfect evening!
author: Patti B.

description:
Friends came to town from Chicago and, being Italian and lovers of good Italian fare, wanted to eat at Joe Dimaggio's. As Maxwell Smart would say, "Missed it by that much," since Dimaggio's, sadly, closed several months ago.

"Where to now?" came the question, and with a little Yelp help, Franchino was the answer. Reservations at 6 on Sunday evening were made, parking was found in a nearby garage, and my wife and I walked in at 6:01. Our friends were already there and seated, with a very nice bottle of red that had been suggested by the owner, who greeted us when we walked in by saying, "You're late!" -- with a big smile and a gesture toward our friends. (He'd never met any of us before.)

This is a family business (23 years, we were told), and we were served by the father (a sweet man, and chief entertainer), the mother (a superb cook and charming lady), and two of the daughters (efficiency in human form, but still with time to make you feel at home). 

Our four dishes were all different, and all were excellent. From the Italian comfort food (Gnocchi, with a side of sausage) to the standard Fettuccine Alfredo on the other side of the table and from the Capellini Mare & Monti (prawns, chicken breast, mushrooms, garlic with "aurora" sauce -- a combination of tomato and cream, less cream) to the Pasta Pescatora (mixed seafood, tomato, garlic and basil) on our side of the table, everything came out hot, fresh, and perfectly cooked. The dishwasher had little work to do on any of our plates.

The place is small, but the atmosphere was so comfortable that it didn't feel cramped. Every seat was taken by 6:30, but we were able to visit with no problem, so the noise level was quite acceptable.

As someone else noted, the bread is OK and free but nothing special, but that was the only "average" thing about this dining experience. We had a great time with great food and great service. On the one hand I'm sorry that Dimaggio's in North Beach closed. On the other hand, I'd like to send them a "thank you" note for helping us find Franchino.
author: Lewis G.

description: Great service but should definitely call and reserve. Great food, especially the seafood dishes.
author: Yentze F.

description:
If you are in North Beach and are overwhelmed by all the Italian restaurants barking for your attention to dine with them, please try Franchino first. You wont be disappointed.

Alright, I've pretty much lived in North Beach my whole life and rarely ventured out to Italian restaurants in this area. But I have to admit that this one stands out just a bit more than the others along Columbus. If you can mute the constant sounds of the most lovable yet voicetress host, then you could enjoy your meal in peace, but you can do that in any restaurant. So enjoy the ambiance. I pretty much asked the server to just feed me. She ended up serving me a Homemade Pasta with Italian Sausage. This is very good. I do recommend it. And I'm sure there are much more yummy dishes to try if you go again. My friend had the Fettuccine Franchino with prosciutto. This was also yummy. Creamy sauce and not too heavy like most Fettuccine Alfredos are. And then the saltiness of the prosciutto tops it off. All this was accompanied with the house wine. How can you have an Italian dinner without wine. Now the dessert. Chocolate covered Canolli and I forgot what I had but it looked like a custard cream sitting on a chocolate graham cracker. Whatever it was it was delicious. So all in all, I was very pleased here and would eat here again.
author: William M.

description: For the price and location (Italian central), I was very underwhelmed. The seafood pasta and meat lasagna were not bad but also nothing special. The tiramisu was good but I personally prefer tiramisu with a little more lady finger and not quite so much cream.
author: June W.

description: Cannot say enough about how charming and wonderful this place is. This is a family joint through and through. Our server started with a description of the specials that her mother had decided to make that evening. We ended up ordering the gnocchi (one of their specials). It may have been the best thing ever created for human consumption. Holy mother of god. It's a smaller place, but it is filled with the wonderful food and family charm that you crave in an Italian place. Don't skip this restaurant.
author: Jessica S.

description: Lovely. An actual family-run Italian restaurant. No pretense, just fast, friendly service and great food. Prices were reasonable and it felt nice to be there. I think one of the features is that it's a small place - you simply can't get abandoned in some corner, and everyone has a view of the decor and the street. We'll be back, as we were looking for just this sort of place!
author: K W.

description:
Realistically, this was more of 3.5 for me.

We came here during 4th of July weekend. Found the place solely based on yelp star-rating and number of $ (it has a pretty high yelp rating, so I was expecting some delish food). We walked from Bay street and Mason to avoid the parking disaster that is North Beach. Good call. 

We walked past a lot of good looking Italian joints on the way, this literally was the last one. After passing a ton of fancy ones that were packed and smelled delicious, I joked to my friend that we probably chose the crappiest one that would be empty and cheaply decorated. I wasn't half-off... The decor wasn't amazing or as updated and new as others we'd passed, but it had a homey feel and the people were nice.

An older Italian man greeted us outside and ushered us in. He was cheerful and welcoming and lighthearted. He gave us a very small table in a tight corner. It was extremely hot inside. This is a family place and you can tell that everyone who works there is immediate family. I like that in a place. All of the servers were uber-friendly and our food came REALLY quick and piping hot. 

We had 2 Peronis, the Chicken Parmagiana with a penne of sorts, and Risotto Primavera with the tomato sauce. Total bill after tip: ~$56. The food was good, but not amazing. Something about the vegetables in the primavera seemed frozen to me, but it might have just been the cut. They didn't taste frozen and I definitely cleaned my plate. I didn't taste the chicken parmagiana, but it was different looking than I am used to. It seemed really gooey on top and completely drenched in sauce. My friend had nothing bad to say though.

I would have liked to try the meat raviolis in the mushroom sauce, or the risotto with mushrooms in a cream sauce (those two menu items are just off the top of my head, but I remember seeing things like that and being interested). 

Overall, very decent. Probably wouldn't return again for a while, just because of the sheer multitude of Italian restaurants in the area that I would want to try before going back there a second time.
author: Michelle L.

description: They need a better way to welcome new customers. There was no hostess or anybody to organize everyone waiting for a table. The owner was picking and choosing who gets to dine inside. He came off as elitist. I stood in the doorway for twenty minutes, trying to make eye contact and no one ever acknowledged me. At least have the common courtesy to do that!
author: G. S.

description:
A reliably good, cozy meal -- this was our third visit to Franchino with friends/family visiting from out of town, and it has been a great experience every time. As Yelp might lead you to believe, this is one of the best options on the fun but otherwise touristy and mediocre main stretch of North Beach, and we would agree.

The long menu was slightly overwhelming, but we asked our waitress to narrow it down to their 3 best pasta dishes, of which we ordered 2, and they were in fact very very good.
author: Jen Y.

description: Very very good!!!! Hopefully you get lucky enough to meet the owner!!! Great owner and family man that has a great business sense!!!! My wife and I will be back!!! The real deal!!!! =) Enjoy!
author: Michael J.

description: OMG!!!! It was so good! Get whatever Mom has been cooking all day... I had the pappardelle and sausage, the sauce was so smooth and silky and fresh pasta.
author: Joe B.

description: This place is such a gem in North Beach. It feels like one of the last authentic restaurants in the neighborhood, and it's still family- run. It's super-tiny, but that's part of its charm. The pasta is pasta (not much different from restaurant to restaurant on Columbus), but the meatballs are outstanding! And the service is great -- very friendly and accommodating. We'll keep coming back!
author: Lindsey L.

description: Best home-cooked Italian! - just like my Grandma used to make.  The food is so good that a buddy and I once drove all the way to Franchino for dinner after snowboarding at Kirkwood.  The last 3 times I've dined at Franchino, I've handed the menu back and said "you pick"  It's all delicious.
author: Brian P.

description: This place is wonderful. Don't get to San Fran as much as I'd like but this place is where we eat.   The food is wonderful! Great owners and staff.  We raced in on our way to airport for dinner.  They seated a 6 top and fed us in under an hour.  We made the flight home to ATL full and happy.  Patrons for life.
author: Roman G.

description: Great food and friendly service. Small family-owned restaurant with fantastic authentic Italian food. I loved the cozy laid-back atmosphere & felt very welcomed.
author: Bonnie B.

description: This place was pretty good except one thing for sure, even though you have reservation at a certain time, don't expect to get seated right on time. My friends and I had reservation at 8:30pm but we didn't even get seated till almost 9 and the restaurant is pretty small since it's family-owned. The owner of the restaurant didn't even greet us when we came in but when a family came in, he would greet them. I was like wow, so rude! The food is kinda pricey. The food I ordered was my sister's choice of carbonera. It was about $20 per person for a really small plate of spaghetti. That was pretty disappointing. The food was good though but a little too expensive in my budget!
author: Monica W.

description: Simply the best homemade Italian food you will find in North Beach. Everything is made in their kitchen, including the cannoli shells. Family run, warm family atmosphere that you won't find at some other stuffy restaurants in North Beach. Great service, superb food and worth the short wait on a Saturday night. Best experience in North Beach! Thank you Franchino, Guisseppina and family!
author: Doro P.

description:
My boyfriend and I were visiting from out of town and picked Franchino more or less at random after visiting City Lights and wandering up the street.  I'm glad we did!

He had the chicken porcini and I had the pasta primavera.  Both were excellent.  The wine was good (we both ordered the house chianti, so we weren't expecting anything phenomenal but it was better than a lot of house wine I've had), and the tiramisu we split for dessert was pretty delicious.

It is small, but that's actually kind of a plus in my book.  I found the atmosphere and the owners and staff were charming -- one of the owners ushered us to a table personally, and the other came by after both dinner and dessert to personally ask us if we'd enjoyed it.

It's definiely a place I'll want to visit next time I'm in the area.
author: Jocey N.

description: Get the pasta special of the day!!!! Mouth O's!!!! I'm not a big fan of Italian primarily because I like my body and I like fitting into my clothes. What I saw was a busy family restaurant with mostly locals (the tourists go to the Stinking Rose) parading alluring pastas like summer in Amsterdam.
