My usual fish with capers was cast aside for a giant plate of homemade fettuccine, cream, three kinds of cheese, butter and more cream. It was worth every last calorie. I literally left the BF speechless by licking the plate clean. Very warm service and Old World chivalry by the family patriarch who greets every guest at the door.
author: Vanessa Y.

description: I was in town for the Outside Lands music festival (I go every year) and looked up some Italian places to eat. All of the reviews on this place were good so my friend and I gave them a try. We were not disappointed. I got the chicken parmesan and my friend got the fettucine alfredo. We ate the entire plate! They give you big portions as it is but it was that good. The place is cute, small and cozy. The staff is friendly, attentive and professional. I will definitely visit next year, Highly recommend!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Best Italian restaurant I have ever been to!

Incredible food every time.  Small - might want to make reservations, esp. on the weekends.

And you have to look at their hours; they aren't open for lunch, unfortunately.

Just a great, small little restaurant, with nothing to look at from the outside, especially compared to all the "fancy" looking restaurants on all sides of the street.  But do yourself a big favor, and go here instead of any of the other restaurants.

It's small and warm, and they really make you feel like family - great authentic Italian food made by Italians!
author: Lynn E.

description: Wow wow wow. First thing that sold me on this place was the sweet man sitting outside telling us we needed to come eat food made by his mom and daughter. Second thing? homemade Tiramisu! I had the gnocchi pesto. Yummmmmm. My friend had chicken marsala. Yummmm... other friend had the risotto primavera with cream sauce. Amazing! Can't go wrong with anything here.
author: Melissa L.

description: My boyfriend and I were craving authentic Italian food and decided to visit Franchino based on Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed.  The owners were so friendly and accommodating. The owner took time to talk to us quite a bit. She was awesome!  We had veal saltimbocca and chicken piccata - both were outstanding. The house chianti was also very good. Finished our meal by sharing a cannoli stuffed with zabaione...heavenly. Loved the ambiance. Small and homey - felt like we were having dinner with family. Will definitely be back!
author: Melissa L.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF, based almost primarily on the food. The location itself is small/crowded and clearly converted from a home/residential property, the service usually isn't very fast, and getting reservations can be tough...but the food makes up for all of this and more! The ravioli is out of this world - absolutely perfect. Salads and desserts are perfect. I can't ever recall a meal I've had here that wasn't amazing. Highly recommended for anyone who loves authentic, home-made Italian food.
author: James H.

description:
I had the Cheese Tortellini with meat sauce. James ate the Ravioli with meat sauce, and Josh ate the Chicken Fettucini. My  cheese tortellini was exactly what I wanted, it was the right cheesy-ness and the meat sauce was perfect! We also had an appetizer of mussels which were wonderful! I found this restaurant on Yelp when my brother asked if we could eat italian. Someone said the ravioli was great so we went here! And it was! The place is much smaller than I thought it would be, but the waitress & host were friendly. 
I drank their house wine.
author: Katrina M.

description: This place is one of the family owned restaurants in North Beach. The owner was very friendly and nice. But to be honest, food was okay... I ordered Seafood Pasta and the seafood wasn't so fresh. I totally love the idea of supporting local restaurants, but I won't come back here:p
author: Maitai N.

description: This place was amazing. My boyfriend and I were two lost tourists searching for a place to eat using yelp on our cell phone when Mr. Franchino found us and dragged us into the restaurant. I'm soooo glad he did! Amazing amazing amazing! Best gnocchi I've EVER had! My boyfriend got the special with sausage and omg it was even better! To top it off, the best tiramisu EVER!  I'm a serious foodie and I was shocked by this place. Yummm. If I ever go back to San Fran, I will definitely eat here again!!
author: Katy S.

description:
Cioppino and penne w/ meat sauce were excellent

Very friendly service

Bread is forgettable but free
author: Captain B.

description: Yes, this is the stuff!  I was very pleased with the food here.  The ambiance was just right -- the tables are close together for sure but it's Little Italy, for crying out loud -- the lighting was just perfect for a quaint restaurant.  My husband had some chicken thing that came with pasta.  He was amazed how much food came with it.  I ordered the gnocchi gorgonzola.  This is the reason for my three stars instead of four.  As for as the gorgonzola sauce goes, I've had better and it definitely could have used more garlic.  Otherwise, it wasn't enough of a deterrent to keep me from coming back, in fact, I'd like to make it a point to return the next time I am in town!
author: Taryn C.

description: Wonderful atmosphere. Excellent service. The food is near perfection. And the cannelloni is speechless.
author: Mike H.

description:
This cute, cozy, friendly North Beach restaurant delivers authentic, if uninspired, Italian food.  Featuring all the standards you have come to expect from a family-owned and operated establishment, the menu includes appetizers like Caesar salad, bruschetta, and cozze in red sauce; entrees like fettuccine vongole, fettuccine Alfredo, and spaghetti with meat sauce; and desserts like tiramisu and cheesecake.

The Caprese salad was pretty standard -- nothing special.  The sauces were tasty -- penne arrabiata was spicy just like it should be and the pesto was good too.

With only 10-12 tables, the space is quite "cozy" (read that "crowded"), but the service is friendly and timely.  Our water glasses were always full and we never lacked for bread or anything else. While it has a limited offerings of beer and wine by the glass, the wine list is well-priced and features selections that complement the cuisine.

Franchino's food is solid and value-priced.  This is not Gary Danko, so don't expect innovation, just good, Italian food the way your nona used to make it.
author: CJ G.

description:
FIVE WORDS: They have the BEST gnocchi.  I've never tried one before, and when I ordered it...it was absolutely AMAZING.  If this is your first time eating here, I would recommend getting this dish as it's homemade by the mom! It's definitely a mom and pop store.

The reason I took 1 star off is because we made a reservation at 8:45, rushed our butts to get there on time, and realized, they didn't even save a spot for us.  We had to wait 20-30 minutes for our seats.  No point in reservation when you can't even reserve a table.  

So even if you reserve a table, 50/50 you'll actually get it saved.
author: Trang B.

description:
Great food. The bruschetta was very tasty and exceptionally fresh. I ordered the gnocchi with tomato sauce and was not disappointed. In all honesty, Firenze has better gnocchi, but this was also very good. The ambiance reminded me of being in someones home. You can tell it is a family run operation. Definitely worth a try!

Enjoy
author: Ami D.

description:
First off, the food was very good Italian. Worthy of four strong yelp stars. Wine selection was fairly good.  Pasta was cooked like it should be. Sauces not overbearing.

Now for the rest which I love but which may not concern others looking simply for good food:
Run by a tight family working together.  Wife/Mother makes the desserts of which we tried the cheesecake.  Wasn't made from mascarpone cheese but it was good, not too sweet which I appreciate.  Food is served by the daughters.  Husband/Dad walks around making sure everyone is tended to properly. There are photos on the wall of the young Dad/Husband proudly in his restaurant from the 70's it looked like.  This all makes for a warm experience.  You feel like you're sharing a little time with this family.

Note, this is a small restaurant, so there is not a lot of seating and you'll be able to hear your neighboring patrons' conversations a little too well.  It can get too noisy so it's not the best place for a nice intimate conversational dinner.

We walked in, didn't have any reservations so I can't comment as to the negative reviews regarding this.  We waited outside for a seat for no more than 10 minutes on a Thursday evening, around 7pm.  Owner Dad seated us and made sure we were happy.  Daughters tended to us attentively and we will return for another dinner experience with this family soon.
author: Liz K.

description: I went to Franchino on recommendation from a family friend and it did not disappoint. Not even a little bit. The waitress was the daughter of the owners and when she said "My mom made the rigatoni this morning and it's perfect.", I was sold. I'm a self-admitted Italian food snob from growing up Italian and moreover, in a family Italian catering and pizza business, but like I said, I was sold quickly. The pastas were fresh, the wine selection was fantastic and their sauce was just right. Keep in mind that this place is small and does not take reservations, but the wait is worth it. There are many bars nearby to grab a pre-dinner drink while you wait. I will recommend Franchino to anyone visiting SF.
author: Whitney J.

description: Like dining Italy. Maybe better. Food is unbelievably great. This place will be on my must return to list every time I travel to San Francisco. Friendly, family owned. Family work together to run the place. Can't go wrong here.
author: Tommy Y.

description:
4 stars for their food, 5 stars for their service. 

The owner of Franchino, who was a very friendly Italian guy, greeted us with open arms, almost as though we were family. We ordered a couple glasses of Cabernet, and a smoked mozzarella cheese appetizer. 

My sister wanted to know if they served buccatini pasta, but it wasn't on the menu and the daughter of the owner who happened to be our waitress, confirmed that they didn't have it. The owner, overhearing our conversation, rushes two doors down to buy a box of buccatini pasta just for my sister. Talk about going above and beyond! 

Our appetizer and entrees were amazing. My sister, who used to go to Italy all the time for business, told me that the buccatini pasta was cooked perfect. I thought it was overly al dente, almost crunchy. The flavors were nice though.. very simple. I ordered the salmon fettucini with pesto sauce. Delish!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I just discovered Franchino and it was wonderful. This family owned & operated restaurant serves everything fresh & tasty. The calamari was tender & tasty. The shrimp were plentiful & fresh. The desserts were awesome. We had a cannoli (secret, they dip the shell into bittersweet chocolate) & bomba.
I recommend this gem to everyone. Mange!
author: Stuart G.

description:
Seriously the best pasta my boyfriend and i have ever had, and we've had alot of pasta in our lifetimes! Boyfriend specially ordered Penne pasta with red-meat sauce. I got Gnocchi with pesto sauce. 

Boyfriend loves his and said it was the best he's ever had.The pesto sauce is like nothing i have ever had before. The daughter who mainly waited on us told us her mother makes it and it's really good. I love Gnocchi. I love pesto. The Gnocchi Pesto?? OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!!

This is a family run restraunt and everything is homemade with the best ingrediants. Even the fricken balsamic vinegar was the best i have ever tasted! Two daughters, a mother, a grandmother, and a father run this place and all with smiles and the sweetest love. Our dinners tasted like pure orgasmic love- that is the best way i can describe it. I don't eat much, and my boyfriend has a small stomach; we couldn't rlly finish our dinners- but we still did. We had too lol. Even the sauces, everything was absolutly perfect. This was the sweetest most loving Italian family i have ever met. Menu is extensive for a traditional italian place. This is suppose to be one of the best Italian places in North Beach. I'm not entirely sure consideing this is the first italian place i have eaten at here, but it is INSANELY amazing nd there is nothing to beat, its unbeatable. The portions are not massive but the are large. Enough for you to finish if you have quite the appetite- thankgod my bf and i were starving after a major hike. Everyone around us was loving what they had. Each family member asked us how things were and the italian man even asked is what we ate and thought about it, he was so pleased and held our hands. He sang cheerfully italian music. This place is small but lovely. We want to take our families back here. 

Main dishes are about $15 a piece. Its expensive, but worth it for a special occasion. I don't see how any place could top this. If anyone wants to go out for italian in Frisco, this is where we will be found.
author: Brittainie B.

description:
I actually have been to this place a couple of times.  Its always a great place to show off whenever I have visitors in town.  But I held off reviewing because I first wanted to compare it to actual Italian food from Italy.  Now having had that experience this week, I still think Franchino's restaurant might be the best Italian food ever.  Here's why:

1.) Franchino greets you as if you were family every time you enter his restaurant.  He remembers me by name even though I've only been there three times!
2.) All their food is fresh and homemade.  They go to the market every day to get fresh vegetables and spices.   The pasta is homemade as his family gets to the restaurant every morning at 7am to start prepping.
3.) Franchino sings.  
4.) Most importantly, the food is fantastic.  The food isn't heavy or greasy.  And the portion sizes are just right.

As great as Franchino's is, just realize that you'll probably spend at least $90 for a date (plus wine) if you get an appetizer and two meals.  But trust me its worth it.
author: Jeff G.

description:
There are two very important reasons why I would give a restaurant five stars. 

Reason one is the food, it has to be delicious and it has to be hot.  I got the eggplant parm and my roommate got the seafood pasta thing from which I theif-ed a bite from her plate.  Both were outstanding.  Check.  

Reason two is the ambiance, and this place has "it".  "it" means something special, something unique and authentic.  The family vibe here is really special, and everyone was very gracious.  The place is not huge but is packed with tlc and you can tell they decorated themselves. Also friendly and impeccable service.  Plan to go here with a date or with your parents, it is just so cozy you can bring just about anyone here.
author: Sabrina R.

description: The gnocchi with tomato sauce was very good. Lasagna looked good as well. Tiny place so watch out for lines.
author: A A.

description: As old school good as it gets!  If you are looking for hipster foofy, keep walking.  This is a place for a get together over some great food, wine and relax.  The owner is super friendly and the rest of the familia made our evening awesome.  If you are going to pay San Fran prices dining out in the rooted areas, make it count with a bit of living history:)  Thank you Franchino for making our eve out an memorable one!
author: Tee S.

description:
What a huge jerk! Five hungry kids with a reservation and this moron was turning us out. I will never come back...EVER.  Went off to North Beach Restaurant and had a superb meal absent Franchino the Fool

Kevin from Pebble Beach
author: Kevin S.

description: You might find cheaper, or nicer decor in North Beach, but you will not find better food.  If you aren't charmed by the Mother and Daughters working hard while exuding Italian warmth, you ain't got a heart. Yes, you might have to drive around go a half hour (be prepared) to get a parking spot and then wait, but it is  worth it.  Fresh, hand made pasta and Tiramisu by mom were wonderful.  We will be back.
author: Dennis W.

description: Love this place... Found it by chance many years ago and always make a point to eat there when in San Francisco. Highly recommend trying it!!
author: Jeff L.

description:
It's restaurants like this one that make localsl so lucky to live here yay!

Authentic to the max! Service, atmosphere, food, staff!.. Mama, Papa, so on and so on, awesome. But the food! is so the real deal, so charming. 
Whatever you like, you taste the love.
author: eVa J.

description: Great family owned restaurant! It feels like you're in someone's home and eating a true home cooked Italian meal. Highly recommend the lemon and capers salmon
author: Erica F.

description:
This review is long overdue. A few months back, the Then-Boyfriend-Now-Fiance and I were in North Beach when hunger struck. We happened to walk past Franchino's and were examining the menu when the owner himself came out and trapped us. I mean it. He shook our hands, introduced himself and basically kidnapped us and deposited us into seats. I'm glad he did.

We were introduced to Josephina, his wife, who runs the kitchen and is a pleasant, loquacious hostess. I ended up getting the Fettucine Franchino (with prosciutto, peas and mushrooms) and the Then-Boyfriend-Now-Fiance got one of the specials. I think it was papardelle with Italian sausage. The specials are great because all of the pasta is handmade. That means they don't dry the pasta out which results in a fuller, richer flavor. 

The food is delicious. It tastes homemade, what I imagine my Italian grandmother would make me if I were Italian. The place is very small and only seats about 20 people at once. Franchino may ask you if you wouldn't mind sharing a table with someone else. Don't feel pressured into accepting. Turnover is pretty good, so you might wait around 15-20 minutes. 

Pricewise, Franchino's is a little expensive - about 15-18 bucks for a pasta dish, a bit more for other dishes. Don't expect anything fancy though! The bread they serve is often cold and when it's really busy, you might not get your order taken as quickly as you'd like, but just enjoy Franchino's effusiveness and go with the flow.

As a little piece of trivia, the Then-Boyfriend-Now-Fiance and I asked Franchino on our first visit if the restaurant was named after him. It is but Franchino is his middle name. Francesco is his first name and after a little bit of thought, he said he preferred it, but he doesn't care either way.
author: Christine P.

description: We enjoyed our dinner at this warm, family run restaurant.  Not the most auspicious beginning as the bread was stale, with a poor texture.  We started with the Caesar salad and the grilled vegetables.  Both dishes were okay but not great.  Too much dressing on the Caesar and too much vinegar on the grilled vegetables.  Things looked up, though, when our main courses arrived.  We ordered the penne Amatriciana  and the chicken piccata.  Both dishes were very tasty.  Finished off with the chocolate cannoli, which I liked.
author: Cyndy L.

description: Incredible Gnocchi. Better than anything we tried in Italy. And we are Gnocchi connoisseurs. Lovely ambience. The owner is super nice. A wonderful experience in San Francisco. You won't be  disappointed.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
A local family run Italian eatery catering to the local crowd. May take a little while for them to acknowledge you when you walk in if they don't recognize you. This didn't bother us as we understood the dynamics.

The rating is about the food which was all ok, bur rather ordinary. We tried the homemade minestrone and the ravioli porcini which was filling and tasted fine. Price was reasonable $24.85 before tip.
author: Rachel W.

description:
A family business. 

Nonna's cooking in the kitchen. Nonno's walking around the dining area singing.  And the rest of the family is making sure your wine glass is filled, bread basket is full and a smile is on everyone's face!

Homemade pasta, great sauces, and amazing appetizers and desserts. 

One of my favorite finds in the city for a homey feeling Italian restaurant. My go to - just remember, Nonno may try to sing to you and Nonna's gonna make you eat until you pop!

But you'll roll out of here satisfied and 5 pounds happier.
author: Lisa L.

description: Franchino is the man...and  I wouldn't mess with him! haha really though, he is really friendly and the restaurant was super busy on a Saturday night. We had a short wait, you could make a reservation but it's not that kind of place... because its so small and busy you basically get in as quick as he can get you in. The service is homey and nice and the food was yummy. Fiance and I just happened to stop in here for my bday dinner and it was a great choice!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Very cute, quiet place to have a nice meal. The owner is incredibly charming and service is quick.

I really enjoyed the bruschetta, but the chicken parm was not outstanding. I wanted to thoroughly enjoy the meal because the setup was perfect for a classic Italian dining experience, but it was just okay.
author: Jackie T.

description: This is the best Italian food in San Francisco.  I have to at least mention that due to the size of this restaurant, they have a very strict reservation policy. They only have about 10 tables in the restaurant, so if you are lucky enough to get a reservation, make sure you show up on time. With or without a reservation, the hostess will do everything she can to seat you so reservations are not necessary. When you are fortunate enough to get a table, your taste buds will be delighted if you try the bruschetta.  The tomatoes are fresh and the garlic is perfectly portioned.  All of the pasta and sauces are homemade, and you will be able to tell in your first bite. My partner had the gnocchi with both the pesto and bolognese (they happily accommodated his special order), and both bites were equally delicious.  I had the special of the night (pasta in bolognese with sausage) and it was exactly what I was wanting!!! The next time you are in North Beach, make sure to stop in at Franchino!
author: Justin D.

description: I had the grilled shrimp scampi and it was THE BEST! Loved the whole setting, especially the family of Franchino who prepare the meals and serve the tables. Well done.
author: Rob J.

description:
Went here last night with the bf and it was an all-around great experience. It is a small little family owned restaurant, and Mr. Franchino (or whom I assume was) was sitting outside decked out in his little old school gangster outfit including a nice hat and a nice suit. The atmosphere was pretty casual but I was dressed up and didn't feel out of place. 
We started with Cesar salad and bruscetta and they were both really good. The bruscetta was very moist and yummy and the Cesar salad was crunchy and had a great flavor. 
My bf ordered the Gorgonzola gnocchi and it was so cheesalicious and yummy. The sauce was super rich and thick. I ordered the Penne Arrabiata which is a spicy red sauce with capers and it was pretty spicy and really flavorful and great. Would def recommend both dishes. The service was great and totally down to earth and not pretentious whatsoever. They also have reasonably priced bottles of wine 20 bucks and up. Thumbs up for sure.
author: Shayna S.

description:
What? A delicious, reasonably priced Italian resturant on Columbus??? Is that even possible?

Yes! The service is great and the food was delcious. It's family owned so you really get a warm feeling from the enviorment. The food was amazing and there was a nice varaity for different diets, etc.
author: Crystal M.

description: I can't say enough. What a family, what an antmosphere. This is the most amazing place. Fantastic food, wonderful people. We will be back about once per month. We love you guys.
author: Brent J.

description: my girlfriend took me here for a celebratory dinner and it was delicious and amazing! I had the clam linguine in wine sauce and she had the eggplant parm. The staff were so friendly and the decor was perfect. Great dinner spot! thank yoU!!!!
author: Holly H.

description: Valentine's Day dinner. We had a reservation and were seated promptly. Very small place, but we felt like we were in Italy! It was warm inside, and we had just hoofed over from Union Square, so we were really hoping to sit outside, but they weren't seating anyone outside. It was fine, because once we cooled off, we were fine inside. We chose to get a salad, pasta dish, dessert, with a bottle of wine, because we weren't that hungry. We had plenty to eat. And it was all delicious. We will definitely be back! And I agree with someone previously who said something about the bread being bland, and it was, but when we were in Italy recently, we also had bland bread there. Some places put more effort in their bread basket than this owner does. But where it counts, the chef knows his/her stuff! Loved it!
author: Robin A.

description: Love the family that owns Franchino! Home made pasta all the time. Try the stuffed gnocchi...melt in your mouth! My favorite Italian Restaurant in the city.
author: Ally V.

description: A real Italian family run Restaurant in North Beach. What's not to like about it. It's small and Papa sits outside the door greeting the guests. Mama is the hostess and the two daughters wait and bus the tables. Wonderful Italian food. I had the veal picatta, delicious. Everyone else also enjoyed their meals. Excellent food, it comes out fast. We were done faster than we expected. Loved it; worthy of another visit.
author: George C.

description:
Great little restaurant in North Beach. As many have already stated this is a family owned restaurant - dad working the crowd and being very charming and endearing, daughter taking the orders, and mom bringing out the food. The hubby and I split a tomato, mozzarella, & basil salad, I had the cheese tortellini with pesto and a cabernet & the hubby had some lasagna. Everything was excellent!!
Such a cute little family and great food! Will be back!
author: C C.

description: With so many choices in the area, very few, if any are as good as this one.   Love eating at local family owned and operated and this one did not disappoint.  Price is reasonable and service was friendly and fast.   Excellent quality as well.   Not a big bar selection but enough to satisfy.   Will return next time in in San Francisco for sure.
author: Joe B.

description: Pretty awesome folks!!! The homemade pasta and cannoli is delicious!
author: Sheila F.

description: This place disgusts me. Completely disappointed with their service!  I made a reservation at 6pm and called them at 5:58pm as a courtesy to tell them I was on my way and was going to be 5 minutes late. They proceeded to tell me that I'll then have to be put on the wait list and my reservation won't be valid. For 5 minutes of tardiness, that is completely excessive!  I can't believe that.  And the women that answered the phone was completely rude and gave me total attitude.  Just a heads up that supposedly the food might be good but to have that kind of service is unacceptable and other places in the city are better.
author: Renee S.

description: This place is truly a neighborhood gem. We have been going to North Beach restaurants for years and years but only recently walked by Franchino's and thought - wow - we have never tried this place. So, we did this past Sunday right after the festival. Really good food in an extremely welcoming atmosphere. I notice policepersons stopped in like regulars - always a good sign. Excellent. Recommend!
author: Amy M.

description:
AAAAHHHHH!!!  Mangia  Mangia!!!  Mr. Franchino is ALWAYS a character and his family is VERY nice!!!   (Yes, Mr. Franchino pulled me off the streets with hubby in tow MANY years back too!!!  LOL!!!)  Food is pretty decent, though I took away a star b/c there are signs that they have succumbed to the pressures of the bad economy (i.e. portions are smaller than I've remembered years back.)

I also would NOT recommend the minestrone soup if you like your minestrone soup more tomato-y.  It's more a broth soup with LOADS of veggie.  I had to think on those times and how healthy it is for me to drink this stuff and that's why I didn't take away another star.  :)
author: Joanna R.

description:
Delicious Italian food and great service await you here.  Some of the appetizers and dessert (I tried the chocolate connoli)were a little more bland than I'm used to, but my entree was fantastic.  It was a tomato-based sauce with chicken and veal and then Gorgonzola cheese thrown in at the end, served over penne pasta.  I shared a little half bottle of Chianti, which paired decently with the food.  

The atmosphere is made special by the staff.  This is a family run business and the daughter (I believe) was our waitress.  But the guy who runs the place is one of the most boisterous people I have been around in a while.  Constantly talking in a loud voice, singing, and interacting with not only one table, but the whole restaurant.  After dinner we were going to take a picture outside and he came out and worked his way into the photo!  It was a memorable place and I'd probably go there again on my next visit to San Fran.
author: Catie L.

description:
Ma come vi adoro!!!

Finally a place that feels like home! This is my absolute favorite italian restaurant experienced outside of Italy. Franchino is awesome and got me to dance with him briefly once because he caught me singing along the song that they were playing. His wife is the sweetest and so is the rest of the family. They are italians, which makes them extremely warm-hearted.. so expect big smiles, some jokes, pats on the back and perhaps even a hug. The place itself is a bit tight, but really cozy and they are very accomodating toward larger groups too. 

Moving onto the other part.. the food. Simply AWESOME.
Although there are tons of choices on the menu, they will tell you the freshly made pasta of the day which are oh-so-good. I love their gnocchi, the risotti, and all their sauces complement the dishes really really well. i have to say, this place is so good, it makes me melancholic....
author: Jade T.

description:
It's like eating with a big Italian family. Great, authentic Italian food, good advice when asked, and terrific service. 

With a party of 9, last minute on a Saturday night, we were sat within 15 minutes. The owner chatted with our kids, and made us feel at home. They have meat-filled raviolis, which I can never find. The Fettuccine Alfredo was delicious. 

We had just about every dessert on the menu. The tiramisu had only a hint of coffee, the cannoli was not overly sweet, and they had this custard with wine that was so strangely good. It was an overall great experience!
author: Chris C.

description:
The exterior doesn't do it credit, but this place is great.  Franchino's is my new favorite restaurant in North Beach, and I've been to pretty much all of them.   I was there on a Wednesday night, and there were way more Italian people sitting at tables swilling wine then Americans or even tourists.  

The family who runs the joint is hilarious, with Franchino himself holding court and greeting, his wife helping cook and making espressos,  and the daughters serving.  The decor looks cheese - you would call it "dated" or "Old school/vintage/classic North Beach" depending on your point of view.  The food, however, was fresh, filling, and spectacular.  We ordered the bruschetta (which was probably the best I've ever had, ever, and I pretty much live off that stuff), fettuccine alfredo, a manicotti special, and a pasta with ragu special, and all of those were great.  I was shocked.  

From here on out I'm taking all my visiting friends to Franchino's, and I'll be going back myself, often.
author: William C.

description:
Hands down, my favorite place in North Beach to end the day when I'm visiting this city. I will reiterate what everyone says about how anything and everything you order will be delicious. My favorites include any of the fresh pastas that day; gnocchi, linguine, all YUM! The lasagna here is sooo great. And if you're debating between ordering the special of the night... don't debate any longer because it's bound to be spot on!
The restaurant itself isn't fancy, but it's perfectly charming and rustic. Especially the family that runs it. The owner himself is such a hoot! He'll most likely be the first person you see as you walk near the restaurant as he welcomes you into his "home" and throughout your meal, you'll most likely hear him belting out a few Italian tunes. His wife is the sweetest cook you'll ever meet! She definitely knows her way around the kitchen. 
It's great, consistent, homey Italian food! :)
author: Tu-Anh T.

description: Stopped in solely based on Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Tony Soprano would eat here. Not the best Italian I've ever had but quite good - all the pastas were fresh made and the sauces were decidedly southern Italian. We turned the ordering over to the Staff only specifying what we wanted red sauce, spicy, pasta with a paired chianti and appetizer. Topped off with excellent desserts (hint  the Snowball is killer) and a double espresso made for a perfect dinner. We arrived by 6 and were out at 7:30. A beautiful evening, OLD style Italian. Great service from a family who genuinely loves what they do. The owner even shook my hand as we left, asking how the dinner was. When was the last time that happened to you in a major tourist area like North Beach of SF? Right!
author: Tracy P.

description: If I could give Franchino zero stars, believe me I would. Not for the food, which we never had the opportunity to sample. But for the completely disrespectful way we were treated by the owner/maitre'd. We had long-planned a family dinner at Franchino, my sister-in-law had talked to the owner twice regarding our reservation (once to make it and once to confirm it). But when we arrived (on time) for our reservation they made no effort to honor it. Instead we waited for an hour, with the little man coming to the door periodically to seat other, smaller parties, ahead of us, and to attempt some over-the-top, smarmy casanova "charm"  to placate us. In short, pathetic. He never apologized for the delay or expressed any meaningful effort to seat us, even though we inquired repeatedly. After an hour (I know, no idea why we waited as long as we did), he came out to tell us that he was "squeezing" us in a corner of the restaurant. That did it, we went next door to Mona Lisa. There we waited 20 additional minutes for a table, but were well cared for by the owner and hostess (including the lovely bottle of their house Chianti that they brought us while we waited street side). So not only did we end up having a lovely dinner NEXT DOOR, we were able to avoid giving our money to the awful little man at Franchinos...we win.
author: Linda L.

description:
This is one of those places that lives up to my expectations in every way. 

I expect that italian food, above being delicious is going to be fresh. None of this sweet Ragu crap, I want my sauce to be chunky and tangy. I also want my dessert to be as boozy as possible. This place was a win on both counts.

I have been showing my mom around SF for the past few days. She is 1/2 Italian and clearly remembers what it is like to live in an Italian household and including the food and personalities that come with it. She immediately told me that this place reminded her of being at her grandparents home for the holidays complete with a boisterous guy walking running the show and wearing a fedora. 

I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce. This is a fair amount of food but I recommend balancing this out with a salad. All of that starch and oil needs a counter weight. My mom had the cioppino which was filled with some of the freshest seafood possible. This is her favorite dish and she was not disappointed. My step-dad ordered the chicken marsala and he said that he has never had better. All shining reviews. 

Like I said, Italian desserts will give you a buzz. I have had so many Tiramisu attempts which failed because they thought they could leave out the alcohol. Sorry, just can't work. I had the Zabayonehot, which is a custard made with white wine. I enjoyed every bite and lets just say that after my Peroni and this dessert, I am glad I was not driving home.

The staff is so welcoming and they obviously put on a bit of a show for the north beach effect. It is all well received and fun. The owner even gave my step-dad a little crap for not finishing his salad. Awesome!
author: Eric G.

description:
Finding great Italian food in North Beach is not as easy as it sounds. Intrigued by the ratings and claims that this place was both good AND authentic, had to check it out while in the neighborhood.

Quaint is the perfect word for this little oddly shaped place. Greeted warmly by the owner (assuming that's who he was by how he was running the show the whole night) and luckily managed to get the last table in the joint. It was cozy to say the least but as long as you don't have to get up during the meal, it's fine.

Memory is a bit hazy of specifically what was ordered but I do remember that everything was delicious and perfectly portioned, no overstuffed, supersized American portions, hooray! 

Even though the place was packed and people were waiting, I never felt rushed, which is always nice. Upon leaving the owner came over to make sure we enjoyed the meal and thanked us for our profuse compliments, he shook my hand and assisted me with my coat --and they say chivalry is dead!
author: Christine K.

description:
Such a cute lil Italian family joint. Was greeted by the older gentleman owner who kindly seated us right away. The bread they served at the beginning was a bit stale and cold, but the two pasta dishes my friend and I ordered was tasty and al dente -just the way i like it. 
We even got a special treat where Mr. Franchino even dimmed down the lights and sang a short song for the whole restaurant. ;)
he is such an ADORABLE LIL MAN!!!!

I love this joint becuase you can really tell the family takes care of their customers and makes sure everyone is happy with their meal. Wish we had a joint like this in my hometown. I shall miss you Mr. Franchino!
author: minna p.

description:
This is my second review of Franchino. The first one was flawless, this time I'm aggravated. Called ahead and made "reservations" for 7:30 for a Saturday night for 4. Warning: reservations mean NOTHING here. Don't even bother calling ahead, and truthfully I think they should just say they don't take them! We weren't seated until 8:30ish. There were 4 huge parties in front of us, including a party of 13, which is just stupid and annoying to other patrons to bring to this size of a restaurant. 

They were offering wine to drink out on the sidewalk while people waited, which was nice, but that wine should have been on the house. We were served an order of delicious bruschetta for our troubles, which was slightly redeeming (and why this review got 3 stars instead of 2). 

Of course the food and service once we sat was fantastic as always. I will continue to come, but only during the week! Good luck to anyone that frequents on a weekend night!
author: J E.

description: This place was just what we were looking for. Small, welcoming family atmosphere. We've been to Italy, and this was very authentic. If we lived closer, we would be regulars.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Great service, small restaurant (No AC so avoid going when its hot).
Special today was this wide flat noodles, ask for it!
author: Roll N.

description: Great gnocchi! Nice old school family atmosphere. Definitely recommend
author: Coleman G.

description:
After the great reviews here, I was so looking forward to trying out this place last night . Big disappointment!! 

My girl friend and I arrived around 6pm last evening on a warm beautiful Thursday night. There were only 2 other parties in the whole restaurant. We went early expecting the crowds mentioned here. 
(the restaurant did start filling out around 7pm). Anyway, the owner dad, mom daughter all nice. So service great (for now) 

We looked at the menu and the only wines by the glass had no label. Basically house wine, I guess. For a Cabernet, it only says "Cabernet" and so on. I ordered the mystery cab. Wine by the glass? Not so great. 

As we are trying to relax, we start smelling cigarette smoke. We thought it was one of the other patrons...turns out it was the owner smoking right at the open door. The wife came by our table to bring water right as my friend and I were talking about how clueless this guy was. Good for mom owner, she went out said something in Italian to dad owner..... we assumed she told him what we said as he moved away from the door and farther to side of the restaurant to finish smoking. 1/2 hr later dad owner is smoking a second cigarette right at the open front door again! 

On to the food: 
My friend ordered the gnocchi with pesto which was a on the firm side and with not much taste to it. I think gnocchi should be soft outside and slightly chewy in the middle with a yummy taste of potatoes. These were no where near like we expected. The pesto sauce was also bland. 

I ordered the special home made pappardelle with a sausage creamy red sauce. Yelp reviewers are 100% accurate on the home made pasta because the pasta was DELIZIOSO. Best texture, taste, everything ever!! The sausage red sauce however could have used a bit more kick. It was fine but nothing fantastic about it. Still I ate the whole thing because of the pappardelle. 

Dessert menu - nothing exciting so we decided to head to Cafe Greco for it. 

Service 1 star - half star taken away because of the clueless dad smoker 
food - 1 star which goes completely to the pappardelle only. 

Still I may give this place another try some day.
author: Mags P.

description: Very nice family owned restaurant ..i had their cesar salad ,and risotto primavera.my girlfriend had the arabiata pasta they were both very flavorful...thanks for the chef I ll come back!!i really recommend this place
author: John S.

description:
Me and a friend came and ate some appetizers.  Which was amazing!  My buddy got a free glass of wine after chatting with our friendly host.  We sat outside because we wanted to people watch and catch some fresh air.
After hearing about the owners story about how he came to America and set up shop in San Francisco, we enjoyed some delicious espresso and dessert.
Great place.
Yes the owner is very talkative but that is one of the reasons why this place is unique, I felt like I was eating food at a families house (but paying for it).
Plus I don't like places that are unfriendly and clinical.
author: Krisztina V.

description: Great Italian food and an even better family atmosphere. Everyone is very nice and courteous. I loved my gnocchi and my wife loved her risotto. Go here if you want Italian!
author: Justin C.

description: Excellent meal. Owners on premise. Friendly staff and great service. Small, quaint atmosphere. Highly recommend.
author: Richard G.

description: Very excellent food! hole in the wall place, and packed in to the gills, out table wasn't ready although i had made reservations days ahead, but it was worth the wait.  Mr Franchino himself was there outside to greet me and my party.  Pesto fettuccine with chicken was excellent.  Very fairly priced.
author: Jack W.

description: Got the fettuccine alfredo w/ chicken and a caprese salad.  Caprese salad was okay, but fettuccine alfredo was REALLY good so I have to give it a 5. Really authentic place owned by an Italian-speaking family
author: Aneesh S.

description:
The location of this place adds a lot to it's ambiance.  I was a visitor in San Francisco for the weekend and fell in love with North Beach and Washington Square.

Part of the aforementioned ambiance is the owner and wait staff.  This place is the perfect example of a small, family run operation, and when it comes to Italian restaurants, this is really important.  The owner schmoozes and croons old Italian songs in a wine stupor, while his wife serves wonderful gnocchi she just made.  The food was fantastic, and I was lucky enough to be sitting at a table next to Cody Ross and his family before Game 1 of the World Series.

A fantastic place to go on a cool night in San Francisco.
author: Alex M.

description:
It's a wonderful family run place with an enthusiastic Italian owner who greeted us like long lost relatives.  I was smiling, because he was a flirt with the lady customers, which reminded me of Italy. I loved this place already! 

The food was pretty damn awesome! My idea of heaven is sitting at this restaurant eating bruchetta all day.  Did I mention I love bruchetta? I chose the fettucini with homemade pesto and chicken. I was filled with regret when the daughter gave me a hefty size of parmesan all over my dish.  It rendered my stomach useless because I couldn't finish my food.  It was too much parmesan for my liking, and I'm a little lactose. (still in slight denial). It did not take away from my meal, because it was awesome and I have leftovers. HOLLAR!
author: Amy L.

description: This is my wife's and my first time in San Francisco, and our first dining experience at Long Beach (do not call it Little Italy - sensitive New Yorkers). We hopped out of our cab and gravitated towards Franchino - and we weren't disappointed. Top notch recommendations for food and vino, with a sorely missed family atmosphere. Highly, highly recommended...buena serra, Franchino - we will definitely be back!
author: Scott K.

description: Magnifico! As other reviewers said, this restaurant has a nice homey, yet elegant, feel. Staff is very friendly and attentive to customers' needs. The proprietor loves to sing opera, and the regulars periodically goad him into it by clapping while shouting, "Sing! Sing!" over and over. He coyly declines, but eventually gives in, and you can tell he's in his element, as he belts out numbers like "O Sole Mio."
author: cv b.

description: The YELP reviews below me pretty much summed this place up PERFECTLY. I was visiting SF this weekend with my boyfriend and this was THE best meal we had. I found it simply by searching "best Italian food in San Francisco." The service was great, and the food was so fresh. We didn't get any appetizers, but the meal itself sufficed. We both ordered pasta dishes: Capellini Mare E Monti for me (prawns, chicken, mushrooms, garlic with tomato sauce) and Fettuccine Al Salmone with aurora sauce for him. We were STUFFED.. We couldn't stop raving about it. I honestly rarely do YELP reviews, but this place was so great, I couldn't help myself. Def worth the visit!!
author: Gabriella S.

description: The small restaurant is in a great location right in Little Italy. Next time I go to San Francisco, I am for sure coming back here. The Veal Saltimboca  was to die for and I can honestly say I have never had a more delicious fettucinni than the one they make here.!
author: Nicolette V.

description: Best Italian we have had in years. Mama must work her butt off each day to create gnocchi, cannoli and ravioli of such quality. Vongole, smoked mozzarella, ravioli and the special pappardelle all excellent.  The family inadvertently entertained us while we ate, go early as I think it gets a bit chaotic as the evening wears on. Thanks for great service Monica!
author: Jf L.

description: Excellent everytime.  This is my favorite restaurant hands down. The family that owns this restaurant is friendly and make you feel welcome the moment you walk in.  Homemade pasta, deserts and the Chianti is always good.  I would eat here everyday if I lived in the city!  Try the manicotti, light as air!
author: L C D.

description:
Frachino's is very special to me.  It's where I popped the question, and it's been my favorite Italian restaurant for years.  Yes the gnocchi is great, but my fiance and I both agree they make the best eggplant parm this side of the Atlantic.  Pasta is always fresh, and the tiramisu is spot on.

It's one of the few places I can tell Papa to surprise me with my meal, and they bring out a phenomenal dish.  Can you tell I'm not a picky eater?

I'm sure there are other mom & pop Italian restaurants that might be as good, better, or at least close to Franchino's.  North Beach is a very echlectic area with great food.  My advice is to just pick a restaurant and stick with it until they give you a reason not to.  I've only received great food, great service, and reasonable prices with that mom & pop feel, so I'll keep going until I can't anymore.
author: Darren F.

description:
I ate at Franchino's on 4/8/12 for my husband's birthday. We made reservations and skipped to the front of the line but not because of the reservations.  They never asked for our name.  As others have said, the place is tiny and it definitely feels like a Mom and Pop.  He had the manicotti special, and I had the ravioli porcini. . Our dinners came out very quickly.  The ravioli was very undercooked (bordering crunchy)  as were the mushrooms.  We debated if they were previously frozen or if they had been left in a colander for a couple of hours. The sauce was just heavy cream. The manicotti were simply tubes stuffed with cheese (basically no spinach) topped with more cheese to which the waitress asked if I'd like more cheese.

 I understand that manicotit has to be cooked ahead of time, but it too needed more time in the oven (under the broiler).  All together, this place was a disappointment given the reviews here, the price, and the food itself.  Perhaps the problem was that both owners? were out front instead of in the kitchen.  At the very best, this restaurant is horribly inconsistent in the quality of food out of the kitchen.  Our total bill including the tip was 40$.  I think 15$ would be more reasonable given the low quality of the food.
author: Andrea R.

description: Not sure what the hype is about Franchino.  The service was good and everyone working there was very friendly, the decor was nice as well but the food really did nothing to stand out.  I felt like I could have made everything at home and the ingredients which should be the star of Italian food did nothing to distinguish themselves.  The food was decent but with such a wide variety of restaurants in the area I can't say this one is special.
author: Ryan J.

description:
My wife and I found this restaurant while walking down Columbus street to see what looked good and then yelping it to see if it had good reviews.  I had previously checked out the neighborhood and found a lot of 4+ stars, so I wanted to find a place the Yelpsters liked.  

We were not disappointed by this place.  It was a Tuesday night, so it wasn't very crowded, and we got a table within a few minutes.  Water and bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar came very quickly.  

We ordered some of the house wine by the glass, which was very average, but drinkable.  For entrees we ordered the Chicken Marsala with vegetables, and the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce.  The Gnocchi was great.  I wished we lived in San Francisco so I could eat this very often.  The chicken marsala was also very good.  The chicken was very thin, with the right amount of sauce and mushrooms.  The vegetables were baked or broiled, so they had a nice taste and texture, especially with some parmesan sprinkled on the.

For dessert we shared an Ice cream bombe made with spumoni ice cream (chocolate, cherry and pistachio ice cream layers), covered with dark chocolate, and a cherry on top. Yum.

The service was very good.  We were waited on by both our waitress, and the older lady (wife of the owner?).

It's very nice to go to a family owned restaurant with good food.  We'll be back.
author: Stephen S.

description: Family run and homey feeling. Complete with singing from the owner and all. Great food. The tiramisu was amazing.
author: Melissa J.

description: Let me start by saying the one star rating is based on the owner's service not the food (which is excellant).  The clams were great and the homemade sausage and pasta were to die for.  Everything was great until the owner "papa" was giving us a history lesson on where marilyn monroe and joe d. got married (in the church down the street).  I corrected him with an interesting fact that they were married at city hall and just took pictures in front of the church for joe's family back home.  This fact greatly distrubed "papa" and he began to be completly rude and abnoxious towards me and my group.  He ruined our great dinner and our evening with his unprofessionalism.  Enjoy the food but watch out for drunk "papa."
author: Paco V.

description:
EDIT: I received a message from who I believe to be the owner of the restaurant (franca p.) blaming me for my negative experience with the food. Apparently (despite the other reviews), it's MY fault I didn't enjoy my meal.

I don't want to be too negative about this place, but overall it was not what I was hoping for in an Italian restaurant.

PROS
+ Cozy atmosphere
+ Friendly staff; greeted by the owner; seated promptly; service was very attentive
+ Plenty of choices

ORDERED
- Chicken Parmagiana: This dish was essentially three thin slices of chicken (and I mean thin) coatedd in melted cheese and covered in a salty sauce. The chicken was decently cooked, but the flavor was simply lacking. There was an abundance of salt and no real kick.

To the side (you have a choice of pasta or vegetables) was a mix of pasta covered by a standard red meat sauce. This had no flavor whatsoever. I hesitate to say it, but I could have opened a can of Chef Boyardee that had more flavor than what was presented to me on that dish.

For a dish that was $17, I was expecting so much more. In order to get a better review, this dish should have been $6.95.

- Salmon carpaccio: Overall impression is that the salmon was prepared okay but the entire dish came across as very one-sided and salty.
- Meat Lasagna: The best of the three dishes. This had a decent amount of flavor and wasn't too bad.

OVERALL
I'm surprised so many people are giving such generous and raving reviews. The reason I came here was because of the Yelp! reviewers, and this is one of the first times I've been let down. 

At the time of eating I told my friends that I would have been more pleased eating at an Olive Garden (that's saying a lot considering I don't like Olive Garden). If the prices were more reasonable for what you're actually getting, I would have rated it better. Bring me something more than cold bread and a main dish for such a high price (throw in a salad for that price).

I would like everyone to remember that just because an Italian restaurant is lined up on Columbus Ave., doesn't automatically give it a pass for having good Italian food.
author: Shamim I.

description: Loved this place.  Small mom and pop restaurant with some of the best Italian food I've ever eaten.  Get the bruschetta.  Get the fettucini with tomato cream - amazing.  Tiramisu was great as well.  Pass on the house wine though.  End result - I'll be back for more.
author: Pankaj B.

description:
This place is fantastic!! It has 100% iitalian character and best of all you'll most likely run into the owner with the most adorable "mama Mia" expression. The wait at this restaurant on a busy night is worth it and it is a great place a group of 4 to eat for under $20 per person and even more amazing with friends and a bottle of wine. (Slightly overpriced, but Italians are imported). 

4stars for food, wine, character and price.
Subtracted 1star for very limited seating, location difficult if not public transit for parking reasons.
author: Karisa C.

description:
Best Italian I have had in quite some time! 

Keep in mind this is a family owned business...
author: Robb D.

description:
I tend to stay far, far away from the land of North Beach because I have to go through super crowded Chinatown to get there and NB is crawling with out of towners. Not that out of towners are bad. I love tourists! I just have places to go and don't have time to deal with the mosey-ing. 

We came to Franchino's one night upon recommendation with an out of town guest. And O-M-G! The fresh homemade pasta with Italian sausage and mushrooms was sooo good! 

The portions are spot on or a little heavy. Pasta is tasty and filling! 

The tiramisu looked different from what I'm used to seeing but this one was soft, lightly sweet, and delicious. 

The service is down home friendly. Momma pinched her belly when we asked her if she recommended the tiramisu. Of course!
author: Jacquee P.

description:
My friend wanted to come here for her belated birthday dinner because it was close to Ft Mason and we were headed there for a roller derby game later (don't judge). Though she's a CA native and has lived in the Bay Area for quite a few years, she didn't seem to know that North Beach exists. She was expecting a lovely meal, and well, based on the location, I wasn't. 

Still, for the price it could have at least been an edible meal. As others have said, the bread was laaaame. And the olive oil and balsamic on the table were super cheap quality. Definitely couldn't save the cold, stale, boring loaf. 

My friend ordered Linguine with Mussels, and the person I assume was the owner's wife (hopefully co-owner) went on a really long... not rant, not tirade.... explanation? as to why my friend should get the wine sauce instead of a cream sauce, despite the fact that my friend had not even ordered the sauce at that point. Then I piped up about how Italians don't combine cheese with seafood either, and that conversation went on way too long, but was entirely my fault. Full responsibility taken for that one. 

Okay, so as we're waiting for our food to arrive (I ordered the carbonara), the owner started bellowing really random things, and it was very uncomfortable. It was still early in the evening, the place was fairly quiet, and we just didn't know how to take this. So we ignored him. Awkward. 

Then came the food. My friend asked me what it means when mussels taste "fishy", and I told her it's not such a good thing. My carbonara was just awful. The sauce hadn't stuck to the pasta -- there was a big pool of greasy egg and soggy panchetta beneath the spaghetti. The spaghetti itself tasted very obviously refrigerated/reheated. 

The wine was okay....

I get that Italian restaurants in North Beach don't have to try very hard since most of their clientele are tourists. They don't have to worry about establishing a regular, local client base. But that doesn't mean they shouldn't.
author: Dana W.

description: Boston-type, guido food. Place is incredible!! Staff is all family. The way a guido joint should be. Not many of spots like this on the west coast.
author: Robert A.

description: Franchino's has become a San Francisco staple with the Wife and I.  This place is truly a family affair with an adorable atmosphere.  Franchino, a former professional singer, the father, the mother who spends her days making fresh pasta for the dinner crowd and their two daughters taking care of your dining experience.  The food is has been great every time, it is simple classic clean Italian food.  Franchino's is home to the best Bruschetta I have ever had.  I know what you're saying, "Dan, is it bread and tomatoes, how do you screw that up".  Seriously it is freakin fantastic.  The fresh made pastas are incredible and the sauces are light.  Very nice wine list and fun desserts.  Franchino may even honor you with a song, especially when he has had a few glasses of wine.  Try it, you'll love it
author: Dan B.

description:
I wish I had a better experience at Franchino. We had a reservation for Friday night, but when we showed up, there wasn't a table available to us. Instead, we split a four-seat table with another set of diners. It was somewhat uncomfortable eating at the same table with strangers, especially since they were talking shop about medical issues. Sorry, Max, if you're reading this -- it's not that you weren't perfectly nice, but I don't want to hear about some woman's cancer during date night.

Aside from our dinner companions, it's a pretty straight up Italian dining affair. I had the Cioppino, which was very flavorful but the seafood was a bit overcooked.  My boyfriend had the stuffed cheese pasta, which was also pretty good (and cheesy). I would say the food was good, but not exceptional -- certainly nothing extraordinary in the North Beach neighborhood.
author: Teresa K.

description: Great family run restaurant. We had the meat ravioli with cream sauce and gnocci, both were great. Recommend this for dinner, but come prepared to wait as it very small and hard to get parties of four or more. Also, keep the ladies away from papa manning the door. Ciao
author: Bob N.

description:
We passed this and checked it out on Yelp, seeing it got 4 stars.  We knew we were in for a treat when the proprietor overheard us and argued it was 4.5 ;)  

Three of us got gnocchi, which was excellent, and the fourth got risotto, which was good.  The service was exceptionally personal and efficient.  The prices are quite reasonable.   A keeper!
author: Fred D.

description: I chose this restaurant based on the great Yelp reviews.  I always take the really negative reviews with a grain of salt. Probably a competitor who's jealous!  Anyway...my hubby and I had a delicious, authentic meal here on our last night in SF.  I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola cream sauce -- so delicious! Perfectly cooked, melt in your mouth pasta, and rich creamy sauce. SO GOOD.  Hubby had his usual veal parmesan (I can never get him to stray away), but it was fantastic as well.  Veal was so tender and flavorful.  Definitely a charming, small "mom & pop shop" and they treat you like family.
author: Sally G.

description:
I can't say anything more than if you're visiting San Francisco or living in San Francisco you should eat here.  The food is delicious. The owners are charming, nice and amazingly down to earth.  The husband is loud, extremely charming and alternates between singing and shouting the well known phrase, "mamma mia." The wife, goes between the tables, explaining the options on the menu, filling glasses and being well just as charming as her husband, just on a quieter scale.  

I had the manicotti, which was delicious, and the calamari salad which was a meal unto itself, but so delicious.  I skipped out on dessert because I was so full, but I will remember my meal there and plan on visiting the restaurant again the next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Sara S.

description: Amazing tiramisu... great food.... great service.... @ this family owned restaurant. The hosts are really friendly.
author: Ankur P.

description: The restaurant is small and crowded and you might have to wait outside to eat BUT it is worth every bite. The family is awesome and I just about felt I was in their home. Best meal I have had in the city in a long time.........
author: Brenda G.

description:
When I say I've tried most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach - I mean I've tried most of the Italian restaurants in North Beach. And anyone that knows me well can tell you that once I decide I like a place, I have a hard time straying. Franchino is one of those places. 

It's family run and the family that runs it is more than adorable. It's often hard to get a table (the restaurant only seats about 25 people), but the wait is worth it. Do yourself a favor though and get there on the earlier side if you want a seat for dinner. 

I've had plenty of dishes here and their all good. I love love love their chicken dishes though. The chicken is pounded out super thin and the spices are just right! Pesto is pretty great too!
author: Anna E.

description:
If you are searching all the reviews for a good Italian place like I was then read this review. I spent over an hour reading tons of mixed reviews on places here on Yelp and really could not make up my mind. Finally I decided on this one and so glad I did. 

First off I am a white boy of strong German background from the east coast and I can tell you that I find it hard to spend money on Italian food. Most of it all tastes the same to me and usually I feel like I can cook it better at home. When my gf and I were in SF for a getaway I really wanted to try to find a good Italian place.

Here are the key points to take away from this place:
-Family owned that actually is there and takes notice of everything going on. They are very nice, not pushy and also very helpful.

-I had the Seafood Risotto and it was very good!! Clams and Mussels cooked perfectly. My gf had the Fettuccine Franchino ...it was unreal. The pasta is very fresh and you can tell it is homemade. All the sauces are fresh and not canned stuff that is tossed together like most places.

-Inexpensive. I though it was very fair priced and the portions were very decent

-They do not rush you out of the place. Actually took awhile to get the check

-Finally,  the Tiramisu was excellent... I always have it wherever I go and this one was on my top 3.
author: Carl S.

description:
I looked around for a place to take my parents while they were visiting from out of town and stumbled upon Franchino. We arrived around 7pm and the place was packed! I walked in and gave my name to Franco, the very friendly owner, and he just said... okay! When I realized there was no sense of organization to his accommodations I just kinda laughed. I asked him how long the wait was and he just shrugged his shoulders and said my name, so at least he remembered! 

My party of 4 came back about 45 minutes later and stood in line behind people that had "reservations." PEOPLE they DO NOT take reservations. He may tell you that but seriously, this is the kinda place you just have to show your face and stick around until he has a table for you... kinda sucky I know, but totally worth the wait.

Luckily, my mom likes to talk to strangers and struck up a great conversation with Franco about my Italian grandma and instantly we were family. He yelled my name and we were in. 

The food was AMAZING. I ordered vegetable lasagna (which was home made) and it was to die for. I am a big pasta fan, and this place may easily be the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to.

I definitely plan on going back on a less crowded night. I have to warn yelpers to not take anything Franco says seriously. The family is so sweet and they really welcome you into their homelike restaurant. Franco likes to drink, so there's some entertainment mixed in!
author: Shel Z.

description: Yes, this is the real deal.  Tasty food and great atmosphere.  Haven't had a bad meal yet.  You should get reservations.  Go here!
author: Mike G.

description:
Really cool family-owned and operated.  The host is an avuncular Italian man who tries to get everyone seated as quickly as he can given that the place is crowded and people take their time.

It's also incredible to find an Italian restaurant on Columbus that isn't the embodiment of kitsch.  One of my favorite moments is when that avuncular host dragged an 8-year Italian boy away from his seat and introduced him to the restaurant and tried to get him to sing.  He didn't want to sing, but the host delivered rousing renditions of Italian folk-songs despite a sore throat.  Really cool to get free entertainment with dinner!

Food was amazing: house salad was surprisingly good (or we were just hungry), while the house-made gnocchi in gorgonzola cream sauce hit the spot.  I'm sometimes worried that gnocchi will be too filling or too potato-ey, but this was one actually tasted home-made as in each piece there was a little bit of a textural difference between the wrapping and the filling.  The cream sauce had a nice tang, but not too sharp.  Portions were actually the right size too!

Got a nice bottle of lambrusco (red sparkling wine) that was reasonably priced too.

Also, my bf and I were definitely talking for a while at the end of our meal, and they were very cool letting us sit there even though we were the only ones

The only drawback in my mind was the bread which was both very ho-hum and stale.  I don't think I can complain too much, given how much of it I was eating.  It just kind of took away from the experience slightly.
author: Jeff A.

description: I've been here four times now - it's our regular place in North Beach for homey, Italian food. The homemade pasta is amazing, and their zaglione for dessert was sublime - beautifully spiked with marsala and just the right melt in your mouth custardy deliciousness. The whole restaurant is like family - come here!
author: J. L.

description: Had a wonderful experience on 3/23/12. Decided last minute on Italian, and since we were staying at the Hilton, Financial District, it was an easy walk up Columbus to lots of Italian. Decided on Franchino based on Yelp reviews & fact they took reservations. Called at 6:00 to ask for 7:15 table (yes, I know - early diners who love a blue light/plate/hair special). No problem getting the reservation. Experience was uphill from there. Greeted w/a smile and open door. Gentleman seemed to be part of the family who ran the shop w/pride. 'Mother' dropped by the table within moments to say hello & describe the special. 'Daughter' took care of us the rest of the way, and care for us she did. I was a typical pain in rear who wanted something not on the menu. No worries, she listed the veggies they had in the kitchen to help me create exactly what I wanted. Timing of food & beverage was great. Flavor wonderful, and portions perfect to keep me from being uncomfortable & make the decision about whether to have dessert pretty darn hard. Felt welcomed when we arrived, and felt completely satisfied & full when we left. That, added to everything in between, made for one heckofa good dinner experience.
author: Bill L.

description: Amazing food and atmosphere! By far the best meal we had on our vacation. We will definitely be back on our next trip to San Fran!
author: Christina F.

description:
Franchino's offers homemade Italian food in a "mom and pop" restaurant with an ambiance that doesn't make it feel like a "mom and pop" spot. 

I had the fortune of dining here twice on my visits to SF and was very sad when my sister moved back east because that meant no more Franchino's veal papardelle special for me :( I kid you not when I say that this is one of the best pasta dishes I've ever tasted and I crave it on the regular. Moreover, the owners are so welcoming that you feel like you're at dinner at a friend's house in Italy. Franchino himself is just the most adorable Italian man who takes such pride in his cooking and hosting people that it's truly endearing and makes you want to return over and over again.
author: Pia S.

description: Ok..place was cool..service very good and super friendly and relaxed...food was mixed:  ceasar salad waaay overdressed, pesto gnocchi very good, pasta with meat sauce very good, chicken saltimboca/chicken parmigiana was...eh...desserts were good... between the parking hassles and somewhat uninspired food I doubt I'll be back...
author: Tom H.

description: prices have gone up a little since my last visit, but still good quality food.  the service is hit or miss..sometimes the family is so nice and welcoming but sometimes they're swamped and it shows.  I always get the special..can't go wrong.   Super authentic food, and I've lived in Italy.
author: Courtney C.

description: This was my 3rd time at this restaurant. Usually fantastic (which is why I gave 5 stars)...this time the couple who normally is there, was on vacation...so it wasn't quite as good as usual, but it's normally unbelievable.
author: Mojos G.

description:
About a year ago, I stumbled into an Italian restaurant in North Beach and had a fantastic meal.  I never could remember or find said restaurant and forgot about it.

Last night, for a business dinner, I looked up Italian restaurants on Yelp and booked dinner here.  As soon as I turned the corner, I remembered that it was the same place.

Service was generally snappy (4 out of 5).  Ambiance was pretty good (4/5), but the food was spectacular.  My gnocci was just amazing.  I brought some home to share with a friend and I ended up eating it 30 minutes later.

I'd go back.
author: Ankur P.

description:
Eh...it was okay. The service was good but  seemed a little forced. Very small place but that didnt matter.

 The lasanga was decent but the sauce was a little too tomato pasty for me.  The carbonara had good flavor but not  big fan of onion in my pasta. 

Don't know if I'll go back, I was simply not too impressed.
author: E. Y. G.

description:
If you want reasonable priced good old fashioned italian food-look no further! Loved the family run atmosphere. The daughters and mom are inside to attend to your every need.
Dad sits outside greeting people, sips his beer and is a card
The food is great-I had meat stuffed ravoli in porcini sauce and my husband had fetticini with procuitto, mushrooms, cream sauce-delightful and fresh-we had them select the wine and they did not go and get some expensive yah hoo bottle but a GOOD wine that went with our meal at a nice price.
We had appetizer, bottle of wine and entree + dessert for under $100 in San Francisco-
BEWARE- do not try and go at 7pm without a reservation-try eating early and talk to the family-they are the best!!!!
author: SJ O.

description:
Quite a surprise, actually!!!

On a Saturday night, we came in and scored a table immediately. This is a huge plus considering we drove around the area for half an hour to find parking. Only to realize, there are 2 parking structures on Vallejo (Note: La Lola will validate for one of them.) Doh!!! 

Fantastic Bruschettas! Fresh, crunchy, and refreshing.

Homemade Lasagna, how should I put this...The best I have tasted in a long while. Perfecto!!! Taste, texture, and cheese were perfect.

I also love their southern style pasta dishes.

=)
author: DAVID N.

description: Delicious! Gets the stamp of approval from my Italian mother! Gnocchi is amazing, and also the lasagna. Family owned- excellent service. Don't miss!!
author: Amy H.

description:
I brought the boys here for our last dinner in the city, and everyone left very happy.

The mother, father and daughter were all there that night.  We started with some bread and glasses of wine (house Chianti).  One of my dining partners ordered the mussels as an appetizer and the other ordered the bruschetta.  

I noticed the dish I had last time was not on the menu.  I wasn't surprised since the night we were there it was listed as a special of the day.  When I mentioned this to our server (the awesome daughter), she said it would be no problem to whip up the dish I wanted.  SWEET.  Papardalle noodles, salmon and asparagus with a light pink sauce.  DF ordered a simple spaghetti dish for his main entree and JM ordered the gnocchi as his main entree.  

My dish wasn't as good as it was the first time.  There wasn't as much salmon in it and the portion was a hair smaller.  Was it enough to feel disappointed?  Heavens no, but it was an observation.  The food was still tasty.  Both DF and JM loved their food and didn't leave anything on their plates, even with having had the appetizers!

I'm glad that, when in town, I can support local businesses like this.  I love family run joints and with Italian being spoken all around me, I love this place even more.  

If you're staying near the airport, you can expect to drive approximately 25 minutes to get to North Beach (under ideal circumstances).  I have had great luck in finding parking in the garage on Vallejo St., near the police precinct.
author: Michele D.

description:
Once you've had Italian food in Florence, all other Italian food outside of Italy seems to disappoint. I've tried several other Italian restaurants in the city, and the one that comes closest to tasting like the dishes you'll find in Italy is Franchino.

Starting with the atmosphere, there is something about this restaurant that feels authentically Italian. Compared to its larger, flashier, more imitative tourist trap counterparts that surround it, Franchino is tucked away a bit more discretely on Columbus Ave. It's quaint, but very cozy and jovial. And once you step inside, you are immediately greeted by hosts and servers (most of whom appear to be related) that seem genuinely happy to have you as a guest. 

However, the top-notch service is just the beginning. The dishes at Franchino are excellent. The sauces are tasty and full of bold, exciting flavors. My first trip to Franchino, I ordered the Veal Pargiana which was juicy, tender, and cooked to perfection. On my second outing, I ordered the Mussel and Clam Risotto which was very creamy and very tasty. I even snuck a bite of my friend's Gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce which was to-die-for...it was even reminiscent of the Gnocchi I had in Florence (which, to this day, remains the best Gnocchi I've ever had in my life. This gnocchi does, however, come in a close second). All of these dishes were well-portioned and perfectly cooked. 

Although I have yet to be truly inspired enough by any Italian restaurant in SF to hand out a 5-star rating, Franchino definitely comes close. With winning service, solid Italian cuisine, and the 2nd best gnocchi I've ever tasted, I would say the rating is a bit closer to 4.5 stars. Definitely check this place out the next time you decide to grab dinner in North Beach.

P.S. After Franchino, head to Stella's Pastry Cafe down the block. Their chocolate hazelnut truffle cake is heavenly!
author: Joseph F.

description: Linguine alla vongole is always a good test of how good an Italian restaurant and it is AWESOME here and tasted like what I had in Rome. Overall, everyone loved everything that we had!
author: Shin Yi L.

description:
We stopped by Franchino for dinner on our last night in the city. We randomly picked it off the street (of course only after looking at how many stars it received in Yelp). 

I loved the family feeling that this place had. It really reminded me of some of the great Italian places located in the North End in Boston. Anyway, we all had amazing dinners (the tortellini was amazing) and a few bottles of wine. My only qualm with this place was that the time between when we ordered and when we actually ate seemed like hours. If you're looking for authentic Italian, then this is certainly the place to go (probably only with 1 or 2 of your friends though).
author: Cathy S.

description:
I am completely disappointed. I really hate writing bad reviews and try to always find a silver lining.. but when a restaurant with 4 stars disappoints you to this caliber, it's kind of hard to keep your mouth shut. 

I made reservations here after reading all the rave reviews on Yelp (I was really sold when it turned out that one of my friends had even given a 4 star review). I had originally made my Saturday night reservations for 6:30 a week in advance, but ended up having to change them to 7:30 reservations two days later.
