When I had called to change the reservations, I was told that it would be difficult for them to fit my large party of 7 in at that time, but they would try their best and that we may have to wait for a little bit.  I explained to the woman on the phone that waiting for a little while was not a problem and that I appreciated her understanding in the time change. 

Flash forward to Saturday night and we arrived exactly at 7:30 on the dot. Everyone in my party of 7 was present with the exception of one person who was looking for parking.  I notified the staff that we were all present with the exception of one person who would arrive shortly.  Now, I was already informed on the phone that tables are not seated until everyone is present.  I get it.  I didn't just start eating out yesterday and I've worked at my fair share of restaurants.  It's a fair request and one which I am very understanding of.  So when one of ladies asked me to notify her when my party was complete, I pretty much figured that we may have to wait for a bit.  What really took me by surprise though, was when I had first walked in, there were about 3-4 tables that were still open.  And when I had walked in the second time to notify them that my last person had arrived (about 5-10 minutes. later), ALL of the tables had been given away. 

This took me by surprise since I had made reservations and had made it clear to the lady that I had spoken to that I had made reservations. Don't get me wrong, I understood that i couldn't be seated until my whole party was there, but I would have expected at least a 10 minute grace period since I had made reservations and I had such a large party. Since it was obvious that we weren't getting a table right away, we asked the ladies that worked there (and even Franchino himself!) how long the wait would be. And all we got was a, "please be patient, it'll be just a few more minutes".  Alas, after AN HOUR AND A HALF LATER, we were tired, cold, and hungry. At that point, we finally saw a table leave and were sure that they would offer it up to us since we had been waiting the longest. But NO, they gave the table away to a table of 4 that had arrived after us even though they probably could have squeezed us in. 

That broke the camel's back. My bf, who at this point was furious, ended up going back and giving them a piece of his mind. As much as I was against him doing it, I can't really say that I felt like they didn't deserve it. Not only had I made reservations, but we did technically arrive on time. And if only they had been honest about it, and had told us that the wait would be more than an hour, we wouldn't have been upset. We would have just simply moved on to somewhere else but we would have came back at another time to try it. But they weren't honest about it. They kept stringing us along with their, "please be patient, it'll be just a few more minutes".  

Again, I'm really disappointed that I have to give out a 1 star review. It's my first, and what I hope to be my last.  I'd like to say that I would give them another shot so that they could redeem themselves, but when you can't even get seated, you just don't want to take the chance of not getting seated again.
author: Joanne K.

description: By far one of the best Italian foods I have ever had! The place is very cozy and nice! Franchinno the owner of the place opens the door for you and welcomes you! The risotto is extraordinary! Go to this place if you want to get some good food
author: Armin G.

description: Went back here a couple weeks ago, super excited to go since I'm a huge fan of the ravioli. Something was different about it, though - it was much spicier than before. We were wondering if sausage had been added to the meat in the ravioli? Sadly, I'm not as big a fan of the newer version.
author: Kathryn B.

description:
We were in San Francisco last weekend and passing thru North Beach I consulted Yelp for a nearby place to stop for dinner early Friday night. The ratings were high and it was a family owned Mom and Pop place, so...

Franchino introduced himself, promptly seated us and introduced us to his wonderful wife, daughter and granddaughter. FRIENDLY, FRIENDLY, FRIENDLY!

But most importantly - the food: Momma customized our order - I had the chicken and veal with penne but as I am not into a heavy cream sauce she toned it down with some red sauce as well. Her home made penne made this dish wonderful! 

My wife had the cioppino over pasta - again Momma's homemade noodles. Wonderfully delicious and not skimpy on the seafood.

We chatted with our nearby tablemate (hey, Chad!) who had the penne with meat sauce. It smelled so good I had to ask him how it was - he said it was delicious and this was indeed his first visit.

We referred others in our group here as well and will visit again on our next SF visit. Great food, great service, great people!
author: Tony R.

description: We found this place our first night in SF.  Loved it so much, we ate here again a week later, our last night in town.  The food is very good, the atmosphere is really cool and the owners and their daughters are very friendly.  Prices are comparable to other restaurants in the area, the menu selection is good and the wine list has great options.  Will visit again next time in SF!!!
author: Brian H.

description: Love this place. The minute you walk into the restaurant,  you are greeted by the owner (who is super friendly). The seating area is small but packed with personality. The food prices were very reasonable and most importantly the food tasted great.   I would highly recommend this place to anyone that wants great Italian food from a family owned/operated restaurant.
author: Becca And Timmy W.

description:
Enjoyed a wonderful southern Italian dinner at Franchino's over the weekend.  Franchino and the staff are fantastic, very warm and friendly.  Our timing was likely right on, as the food was delivered exceptionally quickly and the overall level of attention was perfect.  

While the chicken parm was unique, it was not my favorite.  The Capellini Mare & Monti on the other hand was fantastic.  

I'll be back!
author: Cory J.

description:
We had a seriously delicious dinner her last night. Dinner was late, so the restaurant  was mostly empty. We were greeted by a very (overly in the opinion of everyone in the party) owner. Service was prompt, friendly and helpful. They accommodated our specific requests (vegetarians and health-conscious).

The canoli was the best I've ever had. 

The overly zealous owner was the main drawback. I can see how he might be endearing when the restaurant is hopping.
author: Chase P.

description: Everything we ate was excellent. Best alfredo sauce I've ever had. Gnocchi were great, tiramisu was wonderful. Nice, simple, family-type place. I'd make the trip to the City just to eat here again.
author: Brian C.

description: I have visited Franchino's twice now.  The first time we just "gave it a shot" as we were walking by and Franchino was seated outside and started to converse with us.  We went in and had a great dinner.  We swore to return.  Well, we finally did this past week.  This time with a larger party of eight (5 adults, 3 children)  We made reservations since the restaurant is not very large.  I believe there may be about a dozen or so tables. It is a very quaint and cozy family run restaurant.  The food is always fresh tasting.  We had bruschetta apps. We tried the daily special entrees and we tried three different desserts...everything was delicious.  The staff has been very friendly to us both times.  We will definitely return.
author: Tom J.

description: The food here is *really* good.  Seriously, very good.  But I have to say that I think it's overpriced.  And we made a reservation here for a friend's birthday, came a few minutes before (so on time), and then waited over an hour.  Not okay.  It's a *very* small space, and you are smashed in, so I'm sure they're trying to get as many people in as possible, but the wait was really not acceptable with a reservation...
author: Tarah D.

description: I had my wedding reception dinner here last month. The food and service was great. It's a small and cozy restaurant perfect for 20 people. I had the seafood pasta and it was delicious, just like how it was in Italy.
author: Katherine S.

description: Best italian food i have ever had. The bruscetta was so flavorful and perfectly crisp it started themeal out on a high note. The gnocchi,as people have said before, melts in your mouth and makes you close your eyes so you can fully enjoy it. I got the lasagna which tasted homemade and was amazingly hearty, cheesy and satisfying. The tiramisu was of course great, but the cannoli was the star of the desserts and even their coffee was fantastic! Great servicethat is really quick and attentive as well! Dont miss this place :) it would make an amazing date night spot!
author: Aundrea B.

description:
I had a long, thorough review written when I accidently cleared the screen and couldn't get it back.  Anyway, the food and overall experience was so above-and-beyond disappointing.  The food was so blah- mediocre would be a compliment. It tasted like cafeteria food, except that I got about twice as much when I was 10 years old.  Which brings me to thumbs down #2:  the portions were a joke, how little we got.   Three tiny, thin slices of chicken on a plate each.  Entree served. The waitress was rude.   I can say the owner was very friendly.  There were plenty of open tables so we got seated immediately.  The food came very quickly (but then again, it tasted like it was put together in a minute).  My husband and I felt violated for how much we paid for such a lousy and tiny meal.  JUST.SO.BAD.

On a positive ntoe, this has been one of those one-day-you'll-laugh-about-it experiences that we will always remember about our time living in San Francisco.
author: Nadia P.

description: Absolutely the best time ever.  Franchinos made our trip to SF for our sons 16 th birthday nothing but remarkable, special and so much fun.  Although there was a wait for our party of 9, the experience that we had was nothing short of wonderful. Mr. Franchino was very interactive with the standing room only line waiting out front to get a table.  Once inside the family atmosphere was felt throughout out, with Mr. Franchino serenade the packed dinner crowd.   The food was the best I had every tasted.  A must is the bruschetta and gnocchi with pesto sauce. Best homemade pesto sauce ever.  The desert, cheesecake and tiramisu topped the night off. Would defiantly return anytime, hopefully sooner then later
author: Shelly B.

description: We loved our dinner last night.  It is a small family restaurant.  They were so nice and attentive.  Our meals were delicious!  The ravioli with mushrooms sauce was amazing.  I will go back just for that.  We also had fettuccini con gamberi and veal parmagiane which were both serviced with hearty rich tomato meat sauces.  Both delicious!
author: Lisa F.

description:
It's become a tradition to come her on New Years Day with my mother and watch her drink chianti. She says it's good, and she's a "connoisseur" or something. But this place... Ahhh. It's lovely. In a sea of Italian joints, it's definitely superior to them all.

The food's insane, I definitely recommend the chicken piccata or the pesto tortellini, but really everything's great so whatever you order is bound to be enjoyable.

The family who owns it are some of the nicest people I have ever encountered. (Tip them well, dammit.) It's definitely homey, but if you're an anti-social butthead this isn't the place for you.

Oh, and if you sit next to the wall by the bathroom, the wall with the random door, you can knock on it and freak out your friends you'll end up taking here because this place is addicting.
author: Sierra V.

description:
Dining in North Beach (especially on Columbus Ave.) usually results in most locals running in the opposite direction. The area, easily summed up as the center of all things cheesy about "Little Italy", offer swarms of tourists chowing down with "Nel blu dipinto di blu (Volare)" blasting in the background. But on this given night, with a craving for Italian and a lack of motivation to leave the 'hood, I opted to stroll down the hill and take my chances.

In all honesty, this has been my second time to Franchino and I wanted to stop by again to verify my first-time impression of the place. In the end, I really enjoyed the place and the food is simply very good. Locally owned, locally served, simple and not excessively pricey. Although the decor is... well, what decor?... I thought the place was "charming". The prosciutto and melon is a great start to the meal. Their pastas are great and flavorful. The capellini with the prawns/chicken in the aurora sauce was money. The lasagna was hearty and very good. Make sure to ask about their specials too!

While I still maintain a strong apprehension to eating around NB, it was good to know that I have a reliable spot to hit up when the time calls for it.
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description:
i guess you shouldn't expect much from an touristy italian restaurant smack dab in the middle of columbus street.

first of all the seating system is strange, they don't necessarily honor reservations ahead of people who just show up.  the owner, the old guy, just lets people duke it out amongst themselves and has a bit of  'you should be lucky to dine here' attitude.  it's amusing but can be easily off putting.

the food is average to below average.  the flavors were very dull and did not taste fresh or home made.  my bruschetta was oily on stale-ish bread and my gnocchi in red sauce was bland.

the old guy sings in the middle of dinner and tries to get the restaurant to start clapping in rhythm for the heck of it.  at first it's funny, but then it reaches an awkward point where you just want to stop and finish and what the hell are we clapping for anyway?  especially when he starts it again 5 minutes later....
author: Josie M.

description:
Whenever we're in North Beach, we always come here for dinner. The service is very good, and the owner and his family very friendly. They have a huge menu, and don't be afraid to ask for suggestions if you're not sure what to order. 

The only drawback is that the desserts aren't all that great. They're ok, but you can get better tiramisu and cake down the street at Caffe Greco.  But you might be so stuffed from dinner you don't want dessert anyway!
author: Stacy B.

description:
We wanted to get home after a long day in SF so we ordered the spaghetti con calamari to take home. So in love! The sauce was just perfect and I'm sure had we eaten at the restaurant, the pasta would've been al dente. Even when I was done, I wanted more.

For a take out, service was excellent. The owners were charming and I loved taking in the ambience. It feels like I stepped into their home, if their home had three 3-foot paintings with ornate decorations on the wall. So mesmerizing!

I definitely will be stopping by again!
author: Bonnie L.

description: My husband surprised me by taking me to dinner here last night for our 32 nd wedding anniversary. He mentioned this when he made the reservation and When we walked in the door. It was slow at the time. My husband had chicken parm and I had the ciopianio sorry about the spelling. Food was delightful although my husband felt he could have used more pasta and ate mine. The daughter and wife team were sweet. We left and at NO time did anyone wish us a happy anniversary which would have been nice,
author: Janette M.

description: Exactly the mom and pop Italian place we were looking for.  Seated right away, met the family.  Had a hard time figuring out what to order.  Best bruchetta EVER.  So delicious.  Ordered the gnocchi just to try it cause it was the house specialty.  Didn't disappoint at all.  Amazing.  Ordered the pasta with shrimp mushrooms and chicken in their aurora sauce, and was a tiny bit bummed.  Only had two shrimp and the chicken was a little dry.  Sauce was great, just wish i had ordered something else.  Boyfriend enjoyed his veal marsala.  Loved it.  Great little gem in the heart of little italy.  Would definitely go back.
author: Chelsea A.

description: This place has the best penne bolognese. I have tried almost all restaurants in North Beach in search for the best penne bolognese, and I absolutely loved Franchino's. The owners are very sweet and friendly, they remind me of my own grandparents. Very traditional and all about the family along with great food. :D
author: Jamie C.

description: I went here with my roommate for his birthday and loved it. The food is good, but the service is awesome. It has a classic Italian North Beach feel. Well worth going to.
author: Derek n.

description: How have I lived in the city for over three years and never been here till now.  I think Franchino may have just become my favorite Italian place in the city.  As an Italian girl, I appreciate good, authentic Italian food, and Franchino hits all the right notes. It is a small, family run place.  The owner and his wife, who serves the food, were born in Italy.  Both are friendly, welcoming, and likable.  The food was amazing as well.  I had the cheese ravioli, and my friend had the linguini with clam sauce.  Both were excellent.  We split a delicious cannoli for dessert.  Overall, a great experience!
author: Karen L.

description:
I'm sorry but i have found a better italian restaurant so i have to knock you down a notch!..

SORRY! 

see my other review!
author: Kristina G.

description: great pasta and very welcome atmosphere. I love their staffs, they are so friendly. I had creamy seafood pasta and it's amazingly good, best pasta I ever had.
author: Suabot J.

description: From the moment we walked by this place, we felt welcome. The owner greeted us at the door and enticed us to come in and eat. He visited our table a few times during the meal to assure that we were enjoying ourselves. The staff was very attentive and even treated us to a plate of bruschetta with fresh mozzarella because our lasagna was taking a while (as lasagna does). I wish we could give this place MORE stars so its rating could go up from a 4 to a 5!
author: Mike A.

description:
The specials are amazing, the pasta is hand made the same day.  Franchino is extremely nice and very accomodating.  He sat my 6 person party on a Saturday night.  Very hard thing to do with the small space they have available.

Everyone enjoyed dinner; a hard feat considering my alien relatives don't eat anything with spices (WTF?) in it.  I have gone back multiple times since that dinner, and it's still good.
author: drew j.

description:
We were a party of seven.. amazing gnocchi.   Then  I had veal with fresh vegetables. But the zabbione dessert which is warm and made to order is outstanding!
It is a gem of a family owned business!
author: Mary L.

description: I made a reservation for a birthday for my daughter on a beautiful Saturday but the only thing that was beautiful was my daughter and the sunshine. I only heard about this place through Yelp and it gave this restaurant four stars so I thought it would be good but boy it wasn't. The service was so bad the food all came at different times so needless to say everything got cold real quick. Then the food I ordered Claim Linguine and it really tasted like you would imagine wet socks would taste like. Everyone in my party had the same feelings so this one is a real stinker stay away,it bad.
author: Mark L.

description: Love this place, have been here 7 or 8 times. They are very consistant, food is great, the family that works there are very personable, and I never leave there dissatisfied. If you are looking for a nice italian restaurant in the city, I would highly recommend franchinos!
author: Amin S.

description:
Absolutely delightful.  This is a bustling, but intimate venue ( under 50 people total seating capacity).
Affordable wine selection, though don't marry yourself to the vintages on the menu
Our waitress offered, "My mom made manicotti this evening," as her opening special, and it was prepared in a soft red sauce - not overpowered by a mozzarella topper.  My entree was custom - I was interested in the gorgonzola cream sauce, but not the gnocci, so I had that over their ricotta ravioli -- superb.
"Leave the gun, take the cannoli," and the cannoli was one of the best I've ever enjoyed - freshest ricotta, not overly sugared - nothing pre-fab about this place.
A romantic, engaging and enchanting experience...and the restaurant contributed to its perfection.
author: Theresa B.

description:
I feel bad giving this review because it is a family owned business and the owners very kind people. But just because it's family-owned doesn't mean the food will be good.

Not sure what the others were thinking in giving this place great reviews, but our food was awful. I have eaten much better Italian food at crappy chain restaurants like Macaroni Grill or even Olive Garden (which I consider bottom of the barrel!!).

I had the chicken parma - when it came out it, it was swimming in cheese and wasn't baked in bread crumbs. The chicken tasted frozen and was very unappetizing. The sauce was non existent, and the pasta was something I could make at home. My boyfriend had the lasagna which was also swimming in cheese and had no flavor. We barely ate of half of our food before we left to try something else in North Beach.

Please, PLEASE choose somewhere else! Cafe DeLucchi down the street was much better than this place.
author: Jen R.

description:
Hands down, one of my favorite restaurants of my life. 

Cute little italian restaurant, mixed in amongst North Beach. Small, quaint but very personal service. It has a European feel to it- where you can sit and talk for hours and not be bothered. 

The bread does need some work- it isn't fancy or spectacular- but the pasta is to die for. My favorite: ravioli with meatsauce or the gnocci. Best gnocci I've ever had.

Great place to bring an out of towner, or if you want a good homecooked meal.
author: Holly O.

description: Had high expectations for this place, but the pasta fell short of satisfaction. The linguine with clams was supposed to come with a white wine sauce, but I felt like my noodles were served with no sauce whatsoever, with only the feta cheese for taste.  Not sure if they forgot to add the sauce, or if the white wine sauce is actually supposed to taste like nothing. The capellino (spell check) with aurora sauce was much more  flavorful, so if you would like to come here, the aurora sauce (basically tomato and cream sauce), or red sauce would probably be a better bet than the white wine sauce.   Each meal also came with bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegrette, though there was nothing special about the bread.  It was served at room temperature  and was a little on the hard side.  The restaurant itself is super tiny and cute, with the well mentioned family setting.  There is also an assortment of wines to choose from to drink with your pasta.
author: Patty O.

description:
An easily overlooked diamond amongst its fellow brighter and glitzier Italian eateries.  Which is exactly what ended up happening on the evening I ate here - walked right by it twice before a friend and I noticed the correct address.  Stepping inside, we were instantly greeted enthusiastically by the owner.  A cozy unpretentious space with baby blue walls adorned with scenic paintings, it felt like we were guests visiting an elderly Italian aunt's house.  If I had one.

The food was fabulous - as close to what I'd imagine to be authentic Italian home-cooking.  We ordered the special of the day - Italian sausage, tomato sauce, with parpadella pasta.  Incredible fresh al dente pasta with a meaty and flavorful sauce.  So delicious that I found myself cleaning every inch of the plate with the bread long after we finished the meal.  Bruschetta - zesty fresh tomato and basil.  So simple and yet so good.  My glass of Chianti was a perfect complement to the meal.  

And of course, what Italian meal would be complete without homemade tiramisu?  Sinfully sweet and soft... more mascarpone topping than I would have liked, but it still was a guilty pleasure.  An all around fantastic meal.  This is one of those restaurants that feels like a true discovery.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Amazing!  Found this place through Yelp.  Happened to be next to one of our other favorites places.  We were  lucky and got a table for two as we walked in.  There is always a line here and now I know why.  Service was fantastic.  Ended up speaking with the owners (husband and wife) and really enjoyed hearing about their restaurant and how they haven't changed recipes in 30+ years.  If it tastes good don't change it!  

Had salmone and penne along with a veil dish.  Bruschetta was fantastics and the tiramisu was prepared to perfection!

I'll be bringing the family back this weekend.  Hope we can get a seat!

I'd be stunned if you were let down.  Give it a try.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description:
Absolutely splendid!

What really made the meal was the unbelievable marinated calamari. Seriously the most delectable, tender, and flavorful calamari I have ever had!

Franchino's is known for their gnocchi and they did not disappoint. I recommend ordering with all three sauces. Gnocchi striped in tomato, pesto, and gorgonzola cream sauce - it's like an edible Italian flag! The standard basket of bread and garlic bread we ordered was eh - just save room for the fantastic appetizers. I think our group tried them all and they didn't disappoint.

The owners were delightful; the space small, but charming - great place for a cheerful date.

Take some time to gaze at the fading pictures of their past 24 years, chat with the owners and you'll forget you're in the bustling much trafficked north beach.
author: Ennis O.

description: Was in San Francisco for the weekend and found this restaurant on Yelp so decided to check it out.  The family running the restaurant was friendly and had a great sense of humor, and the food was great!  I ordered the gnocchi and my friend ordered the lasagna, both were delicious.  I didn't think I would be able to finish my plate but I couldn't let something that tasty go to waste so I paced myself and ate every last bite, and even left room for the chocolate cannoli.  Definitely check this place out if you're in the area!
author: Dede R.

description:
excellent home made food. gnocchi was excellent.
***come early for Parking***
don't let that ruin your dinner experience
author: August S.

description: Loved that this restaurant is family owned and run. We had the bruschetta and tortellini soup for appetizers, ravioli and chicken parmesan for entrees, and the cannoli and a custard filled pastry for dessert. All dishes were good but not great, which is why I would not come back nor recommend the restaurant above the others in North Beach.
author: Kristin P.

description: Excellent pasta - perfectly cooked!  We also enjoyed the clams, they were in a salty, buttery broth that was to die for!  Porcini Ravioli was amazing!
author: Dawn S.

description:
Franchino was possibly the best Italian food I've had in this town in five years. Had a nice Sunday dinner out with the roommates (one of whom comes here pretty frequently). It's a family-run & operated establishment, & one of the sisters waited on us. She was attentive & friendly, & was sure to give us the details on who made what back in the kitchen -- very charming.

I ordered the penne with chicken & lamb, which was delicious. I cleaned all the sauce from my plate with a piece of bread when I was done with it. That good. And we got out of there without spending tourist prices. I highly recommend Franchino, & I'll definitely be back.
author: Pete J.

description: No joke that this place is not good for kids! We tried to go there with our 2-year old son this evening, but failed miserably. The owner tried to seat us squarely in the doorway. He tried to accomodate us, but I just knew our rambunctious kid would be a problem at that table, so we decided to go elsewhere. The owner seemed to find this insulting and rudely chastised us on the sidewalk as we were leaving, with some paranoiac complaint that we just wanted to use the bathroom without buying anything. Yes, it's true they were in the bathroom for a few minutes, but seriously, why start an argument in front of your customers. A very distasteful experience,
author: Andrew S.

description: My grandmother and I went out for Italian last night and stumbled upon this gem. Upon looking at the menu outside, a man said for us to come in, the food is wonderful, so we went on in. Smaller than some of the Italian restaurants in the North Beach but everything about this place is exceptional.  The food is not too large a portion like some Italian restaurants, but definitely not small either. I had room for a delightful dessert, and I am happy that I did.  For dinner, I had the Fettuccine Franchino... great! My grandmother had the special, a thicker noodle with sausage and red sauce... amazing!  Best of all was the limoncillo dessert that came in a cute champaign flute.  The restaurant is family owned and ran. The family is nothing less than friendly.  They make you feel at home and are wonderful to talk with.  I will definitely be back!
author: R S.

description: Best Italian I have had on the West Coast! Atmosphere was top-notch. Very authentic. Great service, lovely people? My only complaint? It's hard to get in ... you absolutely need a reservation, the place fills up quick. Parking is also not fun. But it's worth every penny!!! To die for (get the Ravoli Porcini and the Veal Parmigiana)
author: Alph G.

description: I judge an Italian place by the fettuccini alfredo - if it tastes like canned sauce from Safeway it sucks. This place is amazing. The fettuccini alfredo is decadent. Plus the owner is a riot.
author: Matt T.

description: Super fun!  Took some out of town guests here and we had 6 different meals and 2 appetizers that were all delicious.  Service was quick and friendly.  And we really got a kick out of the family atmosphere - exactly what we were looking for!  I will definitely be bringing our next out of town guests here as well!  :)  I don't know why the intro here shows not good for kids - it was great!  Mine plus some others I saw in there - no problems at all!
author: K M.

description:
I must have walked by this place a million times and had no idea it was there until I was looking for a place to take my brothers for dinner last night and came across  the mostly positive reviews on Yelp.

We had reservations for six and were seated immediately upon arriving by the owner who was very nice and speaking to me in Italian until I explained to him in my very broken Italian that we were second generation Italian American which basically meant "Non capisco most of what you're saying."

We ordered a appetizer (Smoked Mozzarella) and it was very yummy smeared on the fresh French bread we passed around from a basket that was continuously refilled throughout our meal.

The bottle of Pino Grigio recommended by the owner's wife was very good and not too expensive and when it ran out was followed by a  drinkable house Cab by the glass.

The entrees were impressive. I had the very tasty Pollo Amalfitano (chicken sauteed with garlic, mushrooms, prosciutto, and leaks in a tomato sauce) which was served with al dente rotini pasta. My friend had the Pollo Saltinbocca (sauteed chicken covered with ham and smothered in cheese) and loved it, although it could have been a little warmer temperature-wise when served (having worked with chefs in the past I'm never shy about sending a dish back that's not hot enough). My brothers had the Pollo Masala (chicken sauteed in Marsala wine and mushrooms) and the Risotto Primavera (Arborio rice with fresh vegetables, garlic and tomato). Cioppino and the Pasta del Giorno (changes daily as the name implies) rounded out our party and everyone was very happy with their selections.

Only a few of us were interested in desert so we spit a Tiramisu and a Chocolate Cannoli, both homemade and both excellent even though the Tiramisu was a variation on the theme (sweet creamy mascarpone atop a delicious crust).

The atmosphere was great and as many other reviewers have said it was like being inside a family kitchen as patron after patron came in to eat who knew the entire family or people just dropped in to hug the owner or his wife. The music, although occasionally on the loud side, was all Italian and the feel of the place was warm, casual, and inviting.

The best part for me, besides the food, was that quality I so much enjoyed when living in Europe and one rarely seen in this country: no one tried to rush us out of there even after we had finished eating. Service was attentive without being annoying, the prices were very reasonable, and a great time was had by all.

I look forward to going back again.
author: Nivek M.

description: This place was great! It's pretty small so be prepared to possibly wait. Everyone I was with enjoyed their meals and the ambiance is super warm and inviting. They also have a decent wine selection.
author: Brittney G.

description: We came into the City for a baseball weekend. My wife loves North Beach as her family is from Sicily and what a great venue for Italian cuisine. I chose Franchino based on reviews and the photos looked fantastic. I made a 7:30pm reservation and we we seated within 5 minutes of our reservation time, there were 4 of us. The place is small but quaint, larger groups will be challenged for space. Papa was not there but his daughters were in charge and did not disappoint. They suggested a great bottle of Chianti, which they attributed to their Mom, kudos to Mama. Everyone had a different dish and the sauce was off the hook with homemade pasta. We have pasta weekly in our home and I would love this. Not sure what some folks had who were rather harsh in their reviews. We were given ample space to enjoy our meal and everyone was super friendly. We will definitely return on our next sojourn to the Bay. Go Giants!
author: Chuck V.

description:
3.5 Stars* I'm willing to try this place again :)

Through the magic powers of yelp, I found this charming family owned restaurant, equipped with a sweet, entertaining couple who served us for the night.

The man, though loud and partly drunk (yea, I saw you finish that beer!!), was funny and almost too much to handle. He only spoke a few words to us, which is fine by me, since he was really getting into it with other tables. That was fun to watch :)

His wife, was more quiet and sweet, but she was also funny. "No matter how many times you take him to the doctor, you can't find anything wrong with him" she said, about her husband.

So. Cute.

The food was freshly made and tasted good. I really REALLY liked what my boyfriend ordered - Risotto with clams, calamari and fish. SO SO SOOOO good. I'd come back just for that.

My dish, Fettucine Franchino with a creamy mushroom sauce and pancetta, was not as good as his. It was alright... tasted like it was microwaved and then served to me.

He had a glass of red wine (not the greatest) and I had a strawberry Italian soda (I was in the mood, OKAY!).

Wine menu seems extensive, though, I'm not sure if the quality is any good.

Prices were reasonable, enough to make me go back and get that risotto!!

The crowd was half obnoxious and the other half were couples who were trying to enjoy themselves. First date place? No way.

The place is really small and cramped and the energy is definitely high. I'd love to go back here, order a cheap bottle of wine, and get me some of that risotto. :)
author: T L.

description:
The food here is absolutely amazing.  

Most of the pastas are handmade everyday by the owner's wife.  The rest of the pastas are bought just down the street from a local pasta maker.

The pesto sauce: DELICIOUS!

The gnocchi: FANTASTIC!

The owner is a crazy guy.  He ended up serenading the whole restaurant last time I was there.

FYI, they say that they take reservations, but having a reservation means nothing.  You'll have to wait no matter what.  

But it's oh so worth the wait!
author: Maddie M.

description: Service and food was amazing! I had the Fetttucine Alfredo and licked my plate clean! Will go back every time we visit San Francisco!
author: Jamie S.

description:
I Love Love Love Franchino's. 

The food is so delicious and tastes like it is made with love.  The owners are super friendly.  I also like that the dishes are pretty large so you can defenitly share with others, or take home some leftovers.  

The only downfall is that it is a bit small, and the decor is not super great, but surely boasts family ambiance, which is good.
author: Denise M.

description:
There's certain things I expect when I go out for a nice Italian meal, and Franchino's definitely delivered on all of them.

Restaurant owner in the front greeting everyone with a big smile and handshake? Check.

Italian grandmother (in this case the owner's wife) in the back churning out handmade pasta dishes? Check.

The owner's two daughters waiting on tables and checking in every five minutes or so to make sure things are good? Check. (The bus boy was even the owner's ten-year old grandson. This place is about as family run as you see in this day and age.)

Owner shaking my hand on the way out the door and asking me if I'll come back again? Check.

Owner ripping apart my bill, saying I'm part of the family now and immediately dancing the tarantella with me? Eh, a guy can dream, can't he?

In all seriousness, you really can't beat this place as far as Italian places in North Beach go. The pasta is really, really good. The sauces are really, really good. And the service is really, really exceptional.
author: Joey J.

description: Amazing little family owned establishment opened in the 1970s. My friends and I came in very early before they were officially opened. However, the owner was very welcoming and took great care of us. The food here is amazing and I ordered the Cannelloni and my friend had a lasagna and tiramisu for dessert .
author: Josh W.

description: Good pasta sauce but had to send our salads back for bad lettuce.
author: Marcus B.

description: Wonderful homemade Italian food. Family owned for over 21 years and very friendly. From app to desert all delicious. Start with homemade Bruschetta and finish with homemade Tiramisu
author: Ron D.

description: The owners (husband & wife) are very warm and welcoming - it was a pleasure being served by them and their daughter. They kept the wine flowing. This place has all of the favorites - including the chicken parm - a primary reason we went there. It was a fun, causal and warm atmosphere - made for a perfect time with our friends in from LA.
author: Vicki L.

description:
Truly a hidden gem and definitely the best Italian restaurant I've been to in the city.  The place is very small but gives an awesome homey-cozy feel; it literally feels like you walked into the family's kitchen/dining room.  The staff was extremely nice and friendly, and the meals were delicious.  I went with a group of seven, and all but one of our meals were amazing.  The one meal that fell short was very salty, and I'm sure the server would have made a new one if we complained.  

I look forward to going back to this place, and another amazing experience will push this place to 5-stars.
author: Daniel L.

description:
GNOCCHI!  Those who love this little dumpling must come and try it - you know how difficult it is to find someone who knows how to cook it right...this may be the place for you!  Those perfectly chewy dumplings were truly the highlight for me - I just couldn't stop eating them...and the Gongozola sauce, *drooling*!

Look sure can be deceiving...we drove by and walked by this place too many times, always thought it was another one of those large tourist joints...NOT!  Thanks to other Yelpers, I know better and went there for dinner...delicious!

Small but cozy, a very good friendly family vibe.  While waiting (yes, they don't sit you unless your entire party is there - doesn't matter you made reservation, doesn't matter they are parking the car and on their way...you will stand and wait and risk having your table taken by another party who comes later) and looking around, everything other patrons were having looked so good and the aroma!

It took a while before we were served with water and bread and even longer before our order was taken.  However, the waitress (daughter) was extremely friendly and helpful so all is forgotten and forgiven. 

Appetizers:
Grilled mozaarella with pepper and asparagus with plenty olive oil - very tasty, goes great with a little bit of bread

vongole - clams with white wine and garlic - this was SO good.  every clam was plump and juicy.  the sauce was so good, i had it by the spoonful!

Pappardella of the day - this is not on the menu but I asked about it because of the reviews I read.  Get it if they have it - it's homemade and you can have it any way you want.  We had it the way they suggested with sausage, basil and whatever else goodness - very tasty...again, the pasta was fantastic.

Homemade Gnocchi in gongonzola sauce - MUST HAVE!

Veal marsala - it was ok.  My least favorite dish of the night...actually a bit disappointed.  We will likely stick with pasta dishes next time.

We had a bottle of wine but I forgot what - it was good.  However, I noticed almost all other tables had the Masi.  

Homemade cannoli with chocolate shell - good.

Some custard like flan with raspberry sauce - good.

I was told the coffee was very good - strong and tasty.

All in all, a great evening with some yummy food.  Shall return.
author: Gloria H.

description:
Franchino is an unexpected hit! One Friday, girlfriends want to hit up North Beach so I randomly found Franchino's because the place had reservations available on the same day. 

The restaurant was right next to the Stinking Rose and was kind of shabby looking, nothing fancy' shmancy', but this is where I start raving. Their wine was cheap- chianti for 19 bucks, and the pasta was I say so good. 

When I think of Italian, I think of stuff that can be whipped up at home and even in my mighty power in the kitchen, I'd never be able to make pasta like. 

I ordered the seafood pasta, the sauce was just so good, not thicke, not super runny, shrimp, mussels, calamari were fresh, and my friends kept on eating out of my plate. I swore I was about to slap them and threw my cleaned plate at their faces. THAT PASTA DISH IS ALL MINE BIATCHES. I wonder if I was just ravenously starving that day, or was the food that good?

The girls ordered some gnochi's that was really good too! It was just super filling though and didn't have meat. 

I think the next time I really want Italian, I've have to go back there again. 

Not pricey, not amazing atmosphere, delectable food, causing random cravings... so go for the food! 

4.25 stars
author: Miss Pigg y.

description: Loved this place. Definitely make a reservation, it is small.  Very accommodating to our picky child's food wants. Delicious food, not too heavy. We had risotto pescatore, chicken parm, caesar salad, spaghetti and meatballs. Would go again.
author: Alex E.

description: My wife and I are both of Italian dissent  so we are extremely critical when it comes to Italian food. We both grew up in households where our parents and grandparents made their own meatballs and gravy (yes true Italians really call it gravy and not sauce or meat sauce).  If you want neuvo cuisine type food maybe Franchino isn't your cup of tea. But if you want great pasta with meatballs, and great gravy that is all homemade by Mama who is originally from the Amalifi Coast of Italy, this is your place. The restaurant is small and fills up quickly so get there early. We arrived by 6pm and had no problem getting a table. Arrive at 7pm and the place is packed.  The owner makes all of her own pasta and gravy and you can tell. Her daughters work as waitresses and they are all a delight.  We're from the Phila area originally and these folks made us feel right at home.  The chianti is great accompaniment and if you save room for dessert, the homemade tiramisu is to die for. To be frank, I can't figure out how anyone could give this restaurant a 1 rating.  The food is just too good. Maybe if you want quiet romantic, you could deduct points for the ambiance but still, the food more than compensates. I cannot say enough good things about Franchino. We would absolutely make this one of our eateries on our next trip.
author: Dennis S.

description:
This is a great great lil joint.  Right when we we walked in, we were greeted by the owner with a little heckling (all in good fun) for being a minute late.  The atmosphere was very cozy, warm and friendly.

After looking up and down the menu full of amazing choices, I decided to go with the Pollo Amalfitano and it did not disappoint.  I woulda licked the plate clean if there was anything left on it.  My four other friends looked like they really enjoyed their meals too.

I would definitely come back here and I might give it an extra star, but for right now I feel like there coulda been just a little bit more food on the plate.
author: Tom Y.

description:
In short, this is Italian Disneyland (hardly authentic). And to top things off, last time I went there, the owner/host (who seems completely off of his rocker, btw -- you get the sense that he's working hard to maintain an "Italian tough guy" schtick) actually HIT ME on the head. In the middle of our dinner, he busts out singing "Ole Sole Mio" (hardly an authentic Italian dining experience), and because I wasn't clapping loud enough, he actually smacked me on the head. Not sure what else I can say, but take my advice -- this place sucks.

As far as the food -- it's decent, but overpriced and on the skimpy side. Also,  the prices on their menu displayed outside are lower than the actual menu.
author: Nicole S.

description:
They make pasta like butter. 
Its a small family owned restaurant where Franchino sings and his wife tends to the guests and his children help in the restaurant. 
The pastas sauces are so good you want every drop , the chicken tender to the taste. The veal which i rarely eat is so tender its like butter.

Its my secret place I take people to impress them on a night out.
Low-key and casual a great north beach destination.
author: Joe R.

description:
Let's say your father is in town and he's bringing his girlfriend (assuming he and your mother aren't together because if they WERE and he brought his girlfriend this would be a review of an entirely different sort --- but I digress).  Suppose his girlfriend is Italian.  Then suppose that since she isn't in this area much she invites her cousin and his family to meet all of you in the city for dinner.  This cousin is a chef.  

One might think that dragging this bunch to an Italian restaurant in North Beach would be the last thing in the world one would want to do.  One would be WRONG!

Franchino not only impresses your guests with true Italian family atmosphere, but the food is fantastic enough to impress someone who used to manning his own kitchen.

I love this place so much it's hard to know where to start.  

The service:  It's awesome.  But when you've got a husband/wife/daughter team running the place what do you expect?  There's always someone there to answer a question, fill a glass or sprinkle a little extra cheese on your plate.  And they take their jobs seriously because --- well, they own the joint.  It's in their best interest to make sure you want to come back again, and it shows.

The atmosphere:  Great.  The dining area looks like a giant version of someone's grandma's kitchen.  There's the obligatory assortment of family photos on the walls and other various other knick-knacks that make it feel like home.  There's usually music and it your lucky, it'll be an Italian Opera because that's when you'll get a REAL treat, Franchino will sing!  

The Food (etc):  While the other stuff make a restaurant good --- this is what makes it GREAT.  If you're feeling brave give the menu back to Franchino and ask him for a recommendation.  You may find he's been working on something new for the menu and would love for you to give it a try.  We've eaten there many times and have never left disappointed.  And as I said from the beginning --- I've brought in Italian connoisseurs and they left with a smile on their face and full belly.  Ask 'mama' about desert and you'll find a woman who's tremendously proud of her cannoli and for a good reason!  And as someone else said --- the tiramisu --- Yummy!    My personal favorite entre --- The Gnocchi with Gorgonzola.  

Overall --- yes the place is pricey but come in hungry because you'll certainly come away full.


One last thing --- Franchino and his family are from Naples and their food reflects the region.
author: Shawn M.

description: I was anticipating an excellent if not very good meal given all the great reviews. But given the price, the quality of the food should be better. We ordered a linguine dish with clams that was tasteless except for the clams. The capellini with red cream, aurora, sauce is good but not great. The meat was limited. The bread came with olive oil and balsamic vinegrette but was just normal. The atmosphere was great and had the family feeling to it cannot make up for the food. Also, parking was horrible, but that's because it was North Beach.
author: Triet N.

description: If there is one place to get an authentic tiramisu it has to be here!! Seriously hands down the best desert I have ever had!! The food was great too, we got the cioppino and smoked salmon!
author: Pollo T.

description: We had 7pm reservations and our friends arrived on time. We had trouble getting a cab and arrived 15 min behind them. They wouldn't seat our friends saying that the entire party had to be there, then when we arrived they informed us (with quite the attitude) that we would have to get in line behind everyone else now and wait. This regardless of the fact that our EMPTY table with five chairs was sitting right there! Regardless of how good the food is, I would not give these people my business or reccomendation.
author: Drea L.

description:
After spending 4 months in Italy, i've become somewhat of an italian food snob. Very little in north beach meets my standards. 

...with the exception of franchino. truly a family owned italian restaurant serving outstanding food in the heart of the tourist trap of columbus st. Ignore all the others waving you to go in - go straight to franchino for a delicious night out.

the bruschetta was phenomenal! a must try. The only pasta I ever eat is the homemade egg pasta (usually the spoken special). It is second only to a family-run, hole-in-the-wall trattoria I found in the alleys of Bologna. It's got just the right chewy/springy texture and a well balanced sauce. I don't even need the salmon that comes with it - the pasta alone is fantastic....No matter how full I am, I eat this up! The tiramisu and panna cotta are both very good and great to top off the meal.

If you've never been to Italy, Franco can be a bit overwhelming. He reminds me of the charming, loud, and melodramatic restaurant owners in Sicily. They laugh, they cry, they sing - it's all part of the show. Play along and everyone will have a good time ;)

Buon appetito!
author: dana n.

description:
Food is great, price is fair and the owners are great.  There isn't an online menu, but they will make you pretty much anything you want.  Chicken piccata was awesome.

I can only knock it down to a four because I ordered to go and the result was terrible.  My bag was filled with a mixture of lemon sauce and melting butter.  All the containers had to be washed and dried before I could open them and get at the goodies.  No fork or knife, and no one to put the dish together without getting a separate plate.
author: jeremy S.

description:
I had an incredible dinner here a few months ago with a girlfriend.  It is family owned and operated.  We were served by the couple who owns the restaurant and had a blast with them.  They are so sweet...boisterous and conversational as well in keeping with the Italian theme.

The food and wine were fabulous.  Best Italian food I have had in the city.  Definitely a great place to take out-of-towners or anyone who wants authentic and awesome Italian food.  Franchino is definitely my new spot in North Beach!
author: Rochelle G.

description:
If you want feel how it is to be in a family-italian restaurant in North beach, you must go to Franchino. Franchino & his crew are amazing !  They always receive us with a happy face and if you are luck Franchino might sing for you.  
They make their own pasta and it can't go wrong. You have to make reservation because the place is always busy on weekends.
author: Debora D.

description:
"Buonasera!!!  Welcome back, my friend!"

This place is so welcoming its crazy!  The owner sings, dances and feeds his way into your heart as his family welcomes and serves you their delicacies.  Its not the best Italian food I've ever had, but its close, and its hand down the best overall experience.

The antipasti plate is not on the menu, but if you ask the owner nice, he'll hook you up!
author: Michael H.

description:
After reading all the reviews on this restaurant in North Beach, I knew I had found the right place (as I forgot the name) when the owner starting tapping on the window from the inside to get our attention as we were looking over the menu outside the restaurant.  There were 4 of us and I'm glad I chose Franchino's to celebrate my 50th Birthday.  Being Italian myself, I'm very picky with my Italian food.  

The service was outstanding and very accommodating.  Family run and owned which brought such ambiance that "Papa Sita" was really not that obnoxious at all.  He certainly put a smile on all our faces.  

We split Ceasar salads which were very good.  Lettuce was bit brown on the edges but the dressing was homemade, light and very tasty.  The bread served with the meal seemed dry, but we were so hungry the four of us went through 2 baskets.

Boyfriend loved his RISOTTO WITH MUSHROOMS.
My older son ordered a CHICKEN WITH LIGHT MUSHROOM TOMATO SAUCE.  Said he could have eaten two of them.
My younger son ordered a traditional SPAGHETTI WITH MEAT SAUCE which he said was very good.  
I ordered a CAPELLINI WITH MUSHROOMS, CHICKEN AND PRAWNS in a light tomato sauce - outstanding!

Portions were fairly good.  We all ordered dessert and a lovely bottle of Italian MASI wine ($30) - VERY, VERY GOOD.

All in all - a wonderful dinner and humble surroundings.  Highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Debbie C.

description:
I've been wanting to eat here for so long because the couple who runs it reminds me of my grandparents.

Fantastic food, great service, and it's family run. what more could you ask for?

the gnocci in gorgonzola sauce was great. :)
author: laura f.

description:
Normally I'm not a fan of Italian food (people seem to always take me to restaurants like Maggiano's, and I'm rather turned off by the large family style portions of fat), but this place was a breath of fresh air and delicious to boot!

I made reservations for 6, and was greeted quite boisterously by the owner and his wife when we arrived. We were seated near the large window, and as we waited for our food to arrive, we were given bruschetta, compliments of the house! The bruschetta was warm, had lots of chunks of fresh tomato, and had a great fresh and herb filled flavor. The bread was soaked in warm olive oil, delicious!

I had the chicken amalfitano, which are thin chicken breast slices covered in proscuitto and mushroom/tomato sauce. It was so savory, and made me swoon at what 'real' italian food tasted like. It was rich, but not grossly so, and very balanced on the palate. I did hear from my dining companions that the risotto was a little bland and the veggie lasagna a little too 'tangy'. I tried a bite of my friend's gnocchi, it was soft, chewy in a good way, and smooth. I also ordered some spicy spaghetti with Italian sausage to go for my boyfriend, and he also stated that it was bland and not spicy at all.

The food took a while to come out, so expect a bit of a wait and enjoy the conversation!
author: Katherine P.

description: I always love coming to eat here. One of the best restaurants in north beach and very homey family run restaurant. Franchino is a very sweet gentleman with a bubbling persona. Every time I have come here he checks and makes sure we are having a great time. My last visit I had the opportunity to hear him sing a lovely birthday song in Italian.
author: Ally A.

description:
Hahah... ahh the memories.

I met up my boys here one night and they happened to be with their Italian friend Luigi who frequents Franchinos. As I walk in, Franchino grabs me by the hand dancing to his Italian tune. Of course he starts discussing something with me in Italian to which I respond with some meager Italian vocabulary. He throws me to my table (which in the tiny venue, wasn't too far from the door). 
After wine galore, Franchino brought out a plethora of deserts (all delicious) and insisted that we try all of them! Even though we were full, he spoon-fed me the last mousse! After his wife was giving him some looks, he spoon-fed the boys too. Hahaha...soo good. 

The service was THE best. I don't remember the last time my desert was spoon-fed to me by the owner of a dining establishment... Oh that's right, it's never happened before.
author: Rada I.

description: Not being from San Francisco I won't get to eat here a often as I would like. This place is very charming and really has superb food and service.  I really can't think of a single negative critique and suggest this as a "must visit" venue.
author: Jonathon S.

description: Amazing food ! Great Service ... warm treatment by the owner himself Mr Franchino ..... definitely a must go !
author: Priyanka P.

description:
Franchino has an excellent Italian style atmosphere. It is a family owned restaurant, and its obvious from the moment you are seated. The mom is nice and the dad is hilarious. I've been here twice and last time the 12 year old niece was our waiter. 

I've liked all the dishes I've had here. My friends, my girlfriend, and I like to eat family style at Italian and Chinese restaurants, so I've had the spaghetti al ragu, fettucine alfredo, ravioli al ragu, tortellini, and spaghetti carbonara. The spaghetti carbonara is one of my favorites because I've never had it anywhere else before. However, I am not well learned in the Italian cuisine. 

For me, this is treating myself considering my budget, but the prices are reasonable. I'll definitely come here again next time I want Italian food.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Stuffed myself here after the Goorin Bros party, figured pigging out wouldn't make my head fatter and I didn't buy any asshats.

Food good, Italian owners very sweet.  Ate too much, you could say I was penne wise and lb foolish.  Afterward I pasta out.
author: GIR ..

description:
So, this was the first time I have gone out for Italian in North Beach and I was not disappointed.  You can tell the family is really involved in the running of this restaurant.  The owner greeted us at the door and his wife was our waitress.  They were very enthusiastic and you could tell they really wanted us to have a good experience, offering to give us suggestions or to answer any questions we had about the menu.   

We got two baskets of Italian bread right away...yums.  I loved it.  I know this is going to sound weird, but I hate sourdough bread, so a big basket of Italian bread made my day.  While we were waiting for our food, our waitress brought out bruschetta on the house for us b/c she wanted us to have something while our food was being prepared.  It was sooo good.  Nice toasted pieces of Italian bread brushed with olive oil, topped with fresh tomatoes, herbs and parmesan cheese...delicious.   I ordered the gnocci with tomato sauce.  It was good, soft and chewy, but not too heavy like a lot of gnocci can be.  The tomato sauce was a good compliment.  My friend had the chicken amalfitano, which was also very good...the mushrooms and proscuitto really added to the chicken.  The meal was overall, very good.  The food took a long time to prepare, but you can't rush good, fresh food.
author: Kristina D.

description: The family atmosphere was so comfortable. The meal was excellent as well as the desert. I will be back again each time I visit the city. The best tiramisu was the best I have ever had.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Very disappointing.  The owner puts on a great show and works the dining room quite well.  Unfortunately, the food is well below average.  My chicken parmigiana was paper thin and overcooked.  The sauce was quite uninteresting.  My date had some ravioli that was quite undercooked.

The only good part was the bruschetta, which was very tasty.
author: Vince I.

description: Cute, friendly family restaurant to try in the north beach area. Came here with a girlfriend, had the calmari spagetti and the gnocci in pesto to share. Both delicious and bold in flavor. Would definitely try other pasta on the menu.
author: Linh D.

description:
Don't ever go here if you want rude service and want to wait forever even if you made a reservation. I can't rate the food because I didn't even get to it. When I got there on time with my reservation, we had to wait for a long time. We came in and there were not any tables reserved for us at all, and everyone seems to have just begun eating! The waitress just said it will be a few minutes. 15 minutes later she said that again.

 So we told her that it was unprofessional that we have to wait this long even though we made a reservation.  The waitress had the nerve to talk back to us and even yell at us! She had the nerve to tell us, "This isn't the Fairmont, this is a family owned restaurant. If you want a reservation, you should go somewhere else."

 If Franchino can't keep a reservation, they should stop giving them out! Just because Franchino has a good rating doesn't give them the right to be rude and yell at their customers! These people don't treat their customers right and are very rude, and I am definitely NOT going back there again.
author: Corabel S.

description: I am totally in love with this place - it's perfect for a date night or a casual, home cooked authentic italian dinner. Any of these 2 star reviews are from people who are far too picky... if you're looking for a great meal at a place family owned and friendly, come here! Delicious food, quaint adorable atmosphere, and the family who owns it is absolutely adorable and welcoming. I've been here a few times now and they are a big reason why (not to mention i love italian food!). One of North Beach's best.
author: Victoria J.

description: We booked a table for 7pm; we got there 5min early and the last table for 2 was just given away to another couple. When we told the owner we actually booked a table he just looked around, shrugged and said we would need to wait then - I wouldn't even mind that if they actually had a bar to wait, but the place is so small that waiting means either hanging out at the door, literally between 3 other tables or outside - absolutely not, so we left and went to Cafe Macaroni instead, which was delicious!
author: Maxi B.

description:
Went here on account of one of my Bay Area resources Andrew L. http://drunken.yelp.com Thank you!!!!!

Got there was greeted warmly and I felt like I was at someone's house! 

Appetizer was Fried Calamari. Fried crisp and calamari wasn't chewy. Yay! I got the Capellini with Prawns and it was just to die for.  I am picky when it comes to seafood but they were cooked to perfection.  Crisp around the edges and moist (but not overdone) on the inside.   My prawns were YUMMAY!!!

I had a bite of my friend's Chicken Parmigiana and it was just so freakin' good.  The cut of the chicken breast was not tough but actually juicy which sometimes is a rare find when ti comes to Parmigiana. The cheese on top tasted fresh. Herbs and spices were perfect and didn't over power my palette.   I really couldn't complain.  Even down to the vegetable sides dishes, they were cooked perfectly and not overdone.  Gotta love that too. 

The prices for Italian food is about equivalent as anywhere else but for the taste and quality of the ingredients. I thought I got a great deal.

I wish my review was more detailed regarding price and all but after 4 glasses of wine, things started to get fuzzy.   I'm going here AGAIN and I'm not drinking this time! hehe  

I ate too much to get dessert though! Damn it!
author: K D.

description:
* * * * * *  6 Stars!!!
This place made me and my girl smile, repeatedly, for well over an hour.  

From the moment we walked in, we knew there was something different and special about this place.  We left glowing after talking with Josephina and Franco - owners, cooks and wait staff, all in one - about food, wine and Italia.   

If you have ever had southern Italian cooking you will immediately embrace their menu and daily specials.  If you haven't, you will fall in love with it immediately.

This was like being back home at my mom's place or one of my aunt's and uncle's houses for dinner.  Tons of character, lots of stories and delicious food on the plate.  Just like grandma, we also took note of the spotless windows, clean tile floors and the well-kept murals on the walls too.   The sauces are out of this world and the ingredients are fresh and cooked to order.  Note:  There were chunks of fresh tomato and diced kalamata olives in my sauce.   Yum!

We're going back Friday night to try the gnocchi gorgonzola and the house-made tiramisu.  

And we never go to the same restaurant (except Swan) twice in the same week.  

This one is now on our permanent list of amazing NB finds.

Go, eat, drink, laugh and enjoy!

edit: 10/30/07 - dare I say that this place is perfect?  almost one year later and we have easily dropped enough money here to pay for a new car.  the food and service never get old.
edit: 8/17/07- home made parpardelle with chicken AND veal in a light tomato sauce - magnificent~!  
edit:  11/18/06 - we went back again to try to gnocchi in gorgonzola sauce.  heavenly!
author: Rob K.

description: Food was just ok, wine glass was overpriced and crappy, old man tried too hard but I guess he has to compete with the yellers in all the other italian tourist spots on this block.
author: miguel v.

description:
It was my first time to Franchino's last night and I'll definitely be back. The smoked salmon carpacchio appetizer was delicious. With dinner we had a bottle of Italian Merlot - not on the wine list - that the owner's daughter suggested. I split a bowl of minnestrone soup for my first course and had the Veal Picata. I also got to taste one of the Chicken dishes my friend order - both were great. The sauce on the chicken though was my favorite.

We weren't hurried even though there was a wait for tables. Definitely get reservations - the place is very popular and fills up quickly.
author: Eden S.

description: Memorable location with a history. Appreciated the authenticity of the restaurant with the music. Food was just okay-- I had the spaghetti carbonara and it was very bland-- expected more fresh of a dish.
author: Lissette L.

description:
When the moon hits your eye 
like a big pizza pie,  That's AMORE! 
When the world seems to shine 
like you've had too much wine, That's AMORE!
Bells will ring ting a-ling ting a-ling
Ting a-ling-a-ling, and you'll sing VITA BELLA.
author: Daniella B.

description:
4.5 stars for Franchino.

Since I have not find any good Italian restaurant in LA, I have been in desperate need of good pasta for the last year.  At Franchino, I got the Linguine con vongoles and it was delicious; my tummy was finally happy. 

And extra bonus, the friends I went with dont' mind I eat off their plate so I got to try Chicken Parmigiana and Seafood Pasta. Both dishes are very good. 

For dessert, we got Panna Cotta and Tiramisu.  I love the tiramisu and my friends love the panna cotta. Happy diners all around!

Another big thank you to yelp for pointing me to Franchino cuz it totally satisfy my craving.
author: Jen G.

description: Came here on a Friday night (7:30pm) with my mother and sister after searching on yelp for a family run Italian restaurant with good ratings.  When we got to the restaurant there was on old man sitting outside the front door who caught me off guard, who I later realized was the owner.  We had a reservation so we sat down right away and the server who I assume was a family member greeted us.  The server was very friendly, and had a good spirit about her.  We ordered the gnocchi, pasta pescatora and some chicken dish and some kind of cheese for an appetizer.  The food tasted fresh and homemade and it came out within 10 minutes.  The service was impeccable and the ambiance was exactly what we were looking for - like being in a small restaurant in Italy.
author: Mookie L.

description:
I've made the epic journey up to North Beach 4 times since I moved to the city 5 years ago. (Face it, Oakland is easier to get to for some of us.)  3 of those times, Franchino was my specific destination.

From the moment you walk in the door and are greeted, it's clear that this is a special treasure.  The family that runs it are just as delightful as the food is.  I always leave full with a warm fuzzy feeling inside from a meal that's been prepared and executed with love and pride.  Be sure to have a house salad with your main course, for they're as delicious as they are lovely to look at.
author: Marie S.

description: Awesome! Their penne primavera is perfect. It's a great vegan option. The family is warm and friendly. As authentic as it gets. The non-vegans swooned over the homemade gnocchi. Highly recommended small gem in the heart of north beach.
author: b s.

description: Great family restaurant with reasonable prices and amazing food!  Love the eggplant, gnocchi, and aurora sauce!
author: Sagar P.

description:
I absolutely loved this place. I took my lovely girlfriend here based on the previous reviews. 

They did not disappoint. The food was amazing. We waited about 20 mins for our food, but that was on a crazy busy day. During this time we ordered a bottle a wine and chatted with the owner.

The food was amazing and hit the spot. I had been craving good italian food. This place was a gem and I can't wait to go back.

Also, the owners will do anything they can to make you comfortable. That's always a plus in my book.

The only downside is the small space. It can get very squishy with the waiters going about the place.
author: Sharelle W.

description:
RACIST!!!!  

These ppl have the worst service ever. 
First, we had a reservation and the server didn't even acknowledge the fact even after showing the reservation on the phone. 
After waiting about 30 minutes, she sits down ppl who had a reservation after us and tell us that "maybe this isn't the place for you guys to eat"? I don't even think I need to go on.
 
I would definitely not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Katrina B.

description: I would give this place 4 stars because the food was great! But what ticked me off was I made an 8pm reservation and I didn't get a table until 8:45pm.   I think that is unacceptable.  The gnocchi was yummy - had it with pesto - but maybe it was also because I was FAMISHED!
author: Shereen K.

description:
One of my favorite spots in my neighborhood. Even though it is dead smack in the middle of tourist central this place still keeps to its roots of family owned business. Pops in the front hitting on the ladies ... daughters serving up the meals and trying to keep the peace... youngest generation sweeping and cleaning and mom in the back spitting in the unsuspecting wenches meals that are being over welcoming to her squeeze (not really... but you get what I am saying) 

A for sure local favorite!
author: Drew B.

description: Great charm, great specials, great Chianti.  An easy five stars.  Less than 20 tables, we sat right down in this of many fine districts in San Francisco.
author: james v.

description: Fun, cozy (tight space), colorful North Beach restaurant complete with gregarious and eccentric Italian host seating women, individually and with great flourish.  Food was excellent and piping hot,  A bit expensive, but dining here is an event so you get food + fun for the price.
author: Billy B.

description:
completely overrated! Space is tight and really, really noisy.  I had the grilled veal- definately not much flavor, lacking on the rosemary.. only a few vegetables accompanied the dish.... I was still hungry after I finished the plate.  

THe house wine was not anything spectacular.  Mediocre meal.
author: Melissa G.

description:
The food here is pretty good--worth 4 stars. More home style than most of the places on Columbus. We had a lovely antipasta plate that was drenched in tasty olive oil. Delicous. My spaghetti amatriaciana was good, as was my pal Claudia's meat ragu. 

Franchino is obviously a family restaurant. Unfortunately, the patriarch of the family is a little abrasive, if not off his rocker. He's loud, and constantly shouting at guests. The restaurant is small  so you are bound to be a little distracted by this. So if you're looking for a relaxing or romantic dinner you won't find it here.

We asked to see the dessert menu and he said "No dessert tonight. So we left. Go back? I don't know.
author: Bruce K.

description: This is such a wonderful restaurant!!! When we asked our waitress for the daily specials she said "This morning my mom made...." We have only experienced something similar in Italy itself. It was so cute! And the food was so fresh, light and tasty! The tirimisu and cannoli's are delicious! We will be coming back!
author: Shannon A.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 2/5
Price: $$$
Presentation of food: 3.5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 2.5/5
Overall: 3/5

Came here when I was still pregnant, they sat me and my in-laws family (they wanted to come) and I (of 6 total) against the corner; and I sat by the windows. The table were so close to each other where I could've barely fit through the gap, I had to slide through side ways to make sure I don't hit the table next to me (there were a couple sitting there!). Seem like they cram as many tables as they can to the little joint. The food wasn't bad, I had the Baked Lasagna which I admit is pretty darn good! But that's all I had to rave about... I ordered a diet coke with my food and I noticed it was canned (which is totally fine), until I notice they poured it into a cup FOR YOU and they kept the rest of whats left in the can to themselves! So that was a JIP, since I was craving my diet coke (you can only imagine since I was pregnant); and to get jipped for a can of coke. that was like $2 or $2.50 (not sure)! I think this place is waaay over priced for their food, it's decent & I get the fact its 100% authentic italian but then again I didn't see Italian cooks in the kitchen, I saw Latin cooks as usual. So I DEFINITELY  agree that it is over priced. Will NOT be back VOLUNTARILY. Plus the owner was there and he was tipsy to the MAX and kept yapping to our table when we were trying to eat. No Bueno.
author: Eva H.

description:
This family owned and operated restaurant is small and cozy but with a homey feel. So I came here with my parents during their trip to the city. 

Bread reminded me of my trip to Italy, except that the bread wasn't hard as a rock like in the hotels in which we stayed. The spaghetti carbonara (my dad's favorite) was pretty tasty and "almost like the real one in Italy" according to my dad (but who knows, it's been a while and is his memory really that good?). My mom had the pasta with shrimp and chicken in aurora sauce (tomato and cream) and that was quite tasty as well. My boyfriend had the fettucine franchino but unfortunately changed the sauce also to aurora; maybe this was not a good idea because I'm sure it's "fettucine franchino" without the changes. I had the gnocchi, but unfortunately  picked the gorgonzola sauce and everything was white. Maybe I should have picked tomato..

Anyway overall quite a pleasant dining experience except for some loud out of towners behind me. Other than that, enjoyable. Service was good, and the family is pretty friendly to their customers.
author: Yosie G.

description:
This is a great, family-run place!  I was visiting San Francisco with my boyfriend and we were craving Italian for dinner.  We heard this place was good, so we went. 

I think we ended up being lucky to get in, because they don't have the most organized seating system.  For how busy it was, the host (also the owner, Mr. Franchino himself)  didn't have a list for names or anything (then again, he's a pro).  Anyway, we got seated on a Friday night in about 20 minutes (not bad for North Beach on a weekend night).

I got the linguine with pesto and my boyfriend had the chicken parmesan.  The food was fresh and wonderful--truly homemade.  This has to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the entire U.S.!
author: Claire S.

description:
Since moving from Philly 18 months ago, I have been SO disappointed in the quality of Italian food in this city.  Franchino is FINALLY a place that is really, really delicious.  The owner is definitely a character, but that adds to the charm.  The homemade raviolis are a must; I also loved the risotto with vegetables.  

Now I know where to go when I'm craving the good stuff.
author: E M.

description:
Okay, remember the review I wrote for Sodini's way back when? I take it all back. This place is the BEST italian food I have ever had out. So don't tell my mom, but I swear to god the cook stole her sauce recipe (not like she really one, she always wings perfection of red yumminess)...not to mention the waitress (i.e. owner) was like my nonna reincarnated (okay, so more like my granfathers sister than my dead grandmother, but you don't know the difference?!) ANYWAY, the gnocchi in tomato sauce at this off-the-beaten-path-ridiculously-tasty-love-it-cause-its-not-a-tourist-spot is worth recommending to friends and strangers alike.
PS My bf had one of the nights specials and it was equal in yummy goodness...
author: Jess W.

description: Franchino's is my favorite Italian restaurant!  I have never been disappointed with the food or the service while eating here.  This is a small family run business and they have always been very nice and accommodating.  The food here is AMAZING!  I have never ordered anything I didn't like.  Every time I come to SF, I have to eat here.  They have good wine, the owners are always very friendly and I enjoy talking to them while we are eating!
author: Samantha H.

description: Great food and atmosphere. Best Alfredo sauce I've ever tasted. Can't wait to visit again
author: Ashley H.

description:
The only reason this get 4 stars is because of the of the owner, but this is later. The food was fantastic - I had meet lasagna ($14.85) and wife pasta egg plant parmesan ($14.85). We loved it!
