Reservations recommended, and because the restaurant seats about 40 tops, even then you might wait a bit if the prior party lingers. Well worth it. Sorry we did not meet Franco and Mamma - they were in Washington DC for a college graduation.

Recommend for adults only - an unruly child could not only inconvenience the parents but spoil the night for the rest of the restaurant.
author: Kathleen W.

description: I planned a special dinner for my son who just graduated from San Francisco State, at Franchino's, after many hours of research on what Italian restaurant would be good for my family including the old in-laws.  I read everyone else's reviews on many italian restaurants but the idea of a mom and pop place in North Beach looked and sounded good.  We all loved it.  The atmosphere.  Mama,Papa,fettucine alfredo,gnocchi with tomato sauce,manicotti stuffed with spinach,salmon saltambocca fettucine with prawns and a veal with peppers dish.  We had some italian beer which according to the graduate tasted like Heinkein.  Papa was outside in his adorable brown hat with the duck feathers and momma was taking care of the kitchen.  All I can say is that I really loved the place.  Go if you get a chance and are in the mood for North Beach and Italian Food.  The desserts were great also.  Yea Dino is playing in the background but very quietly.
author: Nicki B.

description: You know, this is actually a charming little restaurant, and pretty authentic food.  The host takes very good care of you and will occasionally break out into opera signing!  It's really an oasis of Italian restaurants in North Beach, which ironically doesn't have a lot of 'great' Italian restaurants.  Good for locals or tourists.  Small space, but cozy and inviting.
author: Big Toe ..

description: This place was phenomenal. After looking on Yelp for an "Italian restaurant in North Beach" (real hard, I know) and finding this as a top rated $$ place, we decided to take a few friends from out of town here. It's not too big so we made reservations and were seated pretty promptly upon arrival (we moved our reservation earlier with just an hour til our actual time so it was okay to wait). Upon arrival we felt like we had stepped into someone's italian home.  The place is run by a family so that makes it even better. For our appetizers, five of us split two: Calamari salad which everyone who ate calamari enjoyed and grilled red pepper with smoke mozarella...this was so good.. smoked mozarella made the dish so incredibly tasty. For our main courses two got the penne arrabiata (did i spell that right?), two others chose the veal/chicken papardelle special in a red sauce, and I got linguine with clams in a white wine sauce. I tried all three of these dishes and they were exquisite. We LOVED every single one. Each one seemed so freshly made ... because it was. As we enjoyed probably what I want to say was the best tiramasu any of us had hands down ever had and a very yummy cannoli, the lady who ran the place came over and we showered her with compliments. She then proceeded to explain to us why the food was so good. The kitchen is very small at the restaurant so she makes the pastas at home before coming in. Then the only things that are pre-made are the sauces. Everything is made right when it's ordered so it tastes just that fresh! The tiramasu, unlike many places who freeze and then defrost to serve was made that day with a perfect creamy texture and incredibly crispy base of some type of cookie. It was so nice of her (we were the last table left) to just chat with us and tell us about how and why the food was this delicious. We are planning to go back here this Thursday because we can't wait to try other things on the menu. If you want different, homemade italian food in a great, cozy setting, this is the place for you. Can't wait to head back in just a few days!
author: Dalia M.

description:
A fantastic family-owned restaurant!

I found this place via Yelp and wanted to try it during my trip to SF.  Unfortunately, when we walked to the restaurant from our hotel we saw that it was closed and just ate next door at Mona Lisa.  The food at Mona Lisa was average, and it made me more determined to eat at Franchino's before we left.  So the day we were planning to leave, I wanted to stop by Molinari's for a sandwich but noticed that Franchino's was open.   We went inside and noticed that we were the only ones there but that wasn't  too surprising since it was only 4pm.  We found the owners to be beyond hospitable and extremely friendly.  I ordered the seafood linguine while my boyfriend ordered one of the "specials of the day" which was a homemade parppadelle with a sausage and mushroom sauce.  OMG, the food was amazingly good!!  What made it so good was the fact that it tasted homemade, and not like the food you would normally get at an Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill.  It was probably one of the best Italian meals I've had outside of Italy.  Also, the portions weren't too bad either.  It was just enough to leave you satisfied but not overly full.  Overall, our bill came out to be $45 which included the two pasta dishes and a coffee.

I will definitely be back here whenever I'm up in SF because the food was just too delicious and definitely top-notch.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
the bruschetta (toasted bread with tomatoes, basil, olive oil and garlic) for $6 was good, but a bit too salty. 

the fettuccine al pesto with chicken was tasty, and none too pesto-y either! alright! i had the meat lasagna (strange because ive never ordered lasagna in a restaurant before... it just seems so frozen-mealy) and it was good. not amazing but not bad. 

to drink i had a small over-iced glass of mango italian soda while the bf got a coke. now... its understandable that my soda would warrant costing to refill it but the coke?! a) tiny glass b) lots of ice c) its coke!

overall, the food and service was good. the bathroom was surprisingly large and clean while the restaurant itself was cozy with mirrors and paintings (a little odd to watch yourself or your date eat, though). its a quaint little italian place and i would have enjoyed it if not for the lame refill charge. 

stroll down to city lights book store for a browse after :)
author: terra d.

description:
4.5 (you'll love my fotos!)

italian food is probably one of my all time favorites, but given that i've spent some time in boston and italy, i've been extremely spoiled by AUTHENTIC ITALIANO CUISINE ... i've been to quite a few in north beach already and it was just simply disappointing to the fact of not wanting to give north beach another chance .. i guess it's right when you decide to never give a certain type of food another chance, but it was ITALIAN food -- one of my weakness ...

how could i resist?  

after living in SF for 9.5 months, i've realized that i was missing out, and that i was extremely grateful that he KNEW what GOOD ITALIAN FOOD was supposed to taste like, I N D E E D... 

the food tasted SOOO homemade, SOOO authentic -- it seriously brought back such FOND memories from the north end (boston) & italy overall ... :) oooweee!!

the service is truly outstanding ... for those who haven't been to italy, you have to understand and accept its culture .. they're extremely welcoming, obnoxious, and flirtatious ... the owner, however, is different. you can actually tolerate and deal with his obnoxious humor and behavior. i've always wondered how these italian folks could keep up with their engaging personality ... but NOW, i've found out the secret ... peek at my fotos .. (oh, there's one with me & the owner because he kept flirting with me that i said, ok, let's take a picture and i swear, i've never seen him so happy!) hahaha. GOOD TIMES. the place is quite small, and even yet, it's got this homey vibe ... 

a family owned restaurant where the hubby, wifey and the daughter works as a server. the hubby, OBVIOUSLY is SOOO ENERGETIC BECAUSE ... he DRINKS ALKI in btwn . is that funnay or what?  i  *no joke* caught him in action, drinking AT LEAST 4 MGD, but took only one foto .. it was to the point that he was slurring a few times, but it kept the mood alive ... it's actually also great that the server is his daughter because she's extremely pleasant and helpful. she asks you simple questions ... "do you like seafood?" "do you like creamy or marinara?" etc etc ... and then, she gives you few choices and i'm telling you that she's pretty dead on because we were extremely pleased with all of our food...

We started off with their $5.95 bruschetta, and man, their tomatos were super fresh, you get like 7 pieces and it's pretty edible !

He had the homemade pasta w/marinara sauce w/mushroom, and italian sausage for $22.95. OMG ... this was sooo freaking YUMMMMMMMMMY.. everything was perfect. the noodles are made in house and they're quite fat like pat see ew style .. TRUST ME ON THIS, GET IT, or I'LL REIMBURSE YOU!

i got their fettuccine franchino with prosciutto, mushrooms and cream for $12.95... another excellent solid choice but their homemade special blew me away that i ended up eating 3/4 of his dish overall ...

we also shared their homemade cannoli for $5.95, which wasn't exactly my favorite ... you're on your own for dessert but their dishes are DELICIOUS!!! 

YUMMMMM!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I am biased toward this place, because I used to come here as a kid with my family, when spending the summer in Berkeley. We found it by chance, and were surprised by its authenticity. Being Italian, we have always been skeptical of everything Italian-American, and especially of the restaurants. 
I have been living a couple of years in the States by now, and I am still suspicious of "Italian" cuisine here, and yet Franchino's dishes do taste right! And I like the family business atmosphere. Tonight, when I went back there with my boyfriend after ten years of absence, Franchino's wife (supposing the owner's name is actually Franchino) sweetly gave to my boyfriend advice about learning Italian. Also, I did not remember the desserts being so delicious! In particular, the tiramisu' was one of the best I ever had!

Since people are already so enthusiastic, I prefer to talk about the minuses. True, the owner is very bad with organizing the tables, and true, reservations are not that useful (unless maybe in reducing the waiting a little bit: with a reservation, we waited a bit more than half an hour, but a group of people without it waited for an hour-- but it could have been due to the number, who knows). I personally don't care, but if you mind waiting, go on a weekday and early or late.
Furthermore, to me it's really overpriced. A pasta dish for 18 dollars (the pappardelle with funghi and salsiccia I had tonight) is really expensive for what it is. But I guess it may be fair here, given that other cheaper places are much worse in terms of quality.
Finally, the pasta dishes have too much sauce: my pappardelle with salsiccia was more like salsiccia with pasta! But I am sure a lot of people appreciate that...
So overall the flaws are not really such. I will come back next time I visit the city!
author: Sara P.

description: Awesome little Italian place! The owner made us feel welcome and it really didn't take long to get a table. This was the best Italian we've had in SF, a must go!
author: Heidi S.

description:
I lived in NB for three years and before then Italian foods wasn't top on my list.  We stumbled upon Franchino's and it has become our favorite Italian place to eat after trying out a dozen other restaurants in NB.

I distinctively remembered my husband having the chicken with prochetta (or what ever Italian ham is called) and after trying it the marinara sauce, I was blown away.

Another time, we went on a double date and my friend wanted Alfredo pasta on the side.  He had to take back his plate before I ate half the plate. It was delicious!

We don't live in NB anymore but we always go back to Franchino if we go to NB.
author: Mona B.

description:
This was a place that I would definitely go back to over and over.

This is the place where your mama would be running.. Josephine runs the room like mama... the decor is like you would find mama decorating her kitchen. The gnocchi... to die for... they make it from scratch and the gorgonzola cheese sauce is like food for the soul.... just the right amount of creaminess and just thick enough to coat but not overpower the gnocchi.

Highly recommend... make sure to call ahead. We got there on time but papa "was doing the best he could" to get us seated. Line out the door during dinner... 

Make sure to order the decaf espresso... made excellently!
author: Dennis W.

description:
another instance where A HALF A STAR WOULD BE AWESOME. thanks yelp. grr.

anyhoo - a few weeks back my dining club had our monthly meeting here...it was my choice and i felt that it might be a fun little jaunt to head down to north beach for some authentic italian....well, i was right...AND i was wrong.

first of all - i take great offense at restaurants that take reservations and then don't honor them...especially when it's a part of seven - i mean come on! moral of the story...we were sat at 750 for our 730 reservation...snobby? maybe, but that's just the way i roll.

Franchino's is cute, i'll give it that...it has that "i've been here for a million years, i'm run by a family and the dad is the host and also the singing entertainment" vibe.  It's got old pictures, maps, etc and a menu of literally every italian item you could want.

The food, i must say, was very very good. The bruschetta was the standout appetizer and I got the very special, not even on the menu but everyone knows about it Gnocchi tri colore (pesto, cream and tomato sauces....they pour it so it looks like the italian flag).  IT IS SO SO GOOD and i had enough left over to enjoy it again for lunch.

The dining room is super cramped, they kept the front door open and i felt like a popsicle and the host dad guy, while adorable, was a little annoying for me.

I guess i wouldnt really hesitate to take an out of town guest or friend here, as long as it was a party of 2 or 3...the food is good and you really do get that SF north beach feel - but for us sf-ers.....go to vicoletto if you a)have a large party and b) want something a little more sophisticated.

I wonder if they do tricolore take out?
author: Brooke M.

description: Curiuos to see how this goes. Not great with ambience but 4 star rated so I raised  my expectations on the food. I have the fettuchini con gamberi and my friend had the ghocchi. The sauce was good but the ghnocchi wasnt as soft and didn't get exactly melt as I expected. Overall, I wouldn't mind coming to eat here if I'm in the hood but not worth making a trip over.
author: Cathy Y.

description: WORST experience in all of restaurant dining!  The owner was very rude and took one of our ladies chair away.  JERK!  Food was okay, way over rated here on YELP!!
author: Jester Swink J.

description: We made reservations for 7:30 for five people.  Inevitably we were late and had to call and extend the reservations until 7:45-8:00.  They had no problems.  When we got to the restaurant I was greeted with a hearty handshake and a friendly smile.  Needless to say, we felt really comfortable there.  We were sat with no problems, even being a little late.  The place is not large so I was expecting more resistance and 'tude because we were late.  But nope, no problem.  We were given the menus and specials and a few minutes later we were trying a great bottle of wine.  I ordered a nice chicken dish that had prosciutto and mushrooms.  It was really great.  The place is totally mom and pops and I think the two daughters wait on the floor while the parents run the shop.  For fun, I noticed a porcelain elephant that seemed out of place.  See if you can find it.
author: Julian A.

description: When I walked in, the owner approached with his authentic Italian accent and asked how many and if we had a reservation. At first I was a little nervous because he asks me this about 4 times, not once retaining the correct information. He then sits us at a tiny table for two and adds an extra chair to make it suitable for three. This would have all really annoyed me except for the fact that the food was awesome. I think I would have sat in the little crevice between the bathroom and the kitchen if I could eat more of the Tiramisu. The wine was cheap and tasted good, and my Clam Linguini was the perfect amount of noodles and fresh clams. I will go back again. I must sample this Pesto Gnocchi that everyone keeps talking about.
author: Katrina F.

description: After the waitress/hostess lectured us about how they don't seat incomplete parties (while a table sat empty in the corner), I didn't feel like giving them our business anymore and went someplace else with friendlier service. Suddenly all of the good reviews my fellow Yelpers had written about this place no longer mattered.
author: April B.

description: We found the atmosphere cozy and warm.  The owner, his wife and daughter took very good care of us and were extremely personable.   We enjoyed the chicken Saltimbocca, Alfredo with chicken, Lasagna, Penne Arribiata.  The chocolate cannoli, lemon desert and the coffee ice cream were all very good.
author: Barrett B.

description:
My friend and I were wandering around North Beach (San Francisco) to find an Italian restaurant. We looked at the menu's outside of several restaurants - you know, you just get this feeling of "ah ha!" when you feel like you found the right one. (I love the experience of Italian restaurant shopping, just like old times at the Gaslamp Quarter in Downtown San Diego!)
"Mona Lisa" intrigued me so we crossed the street, and a guy started talking to us with a heavy Italian accent. We were somewhat overwhelmed by the number of choices on the menu. So we walked over to the next restaurant where the owner also came out to talk to us saying, "This is the best restaurant... etc."
I like to say I'm half bay area native, but obviously am not a SF native, since it was very weird how aggressive all the restaurant owners were!

Well, we decided to go in without knowing even the restaurant name. The menu looked good with all typical Italian pastas - fettuccine alfredo, pesto, clam sauce, etc. I didn't pay much attention to a lot since I was starving... I decided to order the Fettuccine Franchino, which had prosciutto, mushrooms, and peas in a cream sauce. It kinda reminded me of carbonara. I don't think it wouldn't have mattered if I weren't starving - I could tell it tasted GREAT. My friend also liked his Fettuccine al Pesto with chicken. 
Prices for pastas were reasonable - about $12 to $20 per dish, I don't know about wines since I don't drink wine. Everything of what I remember seemed reasonable though.

We really liked the restaurant and felt proud that we chose Cafe Franchino. There was a restaurant we passed by earlier, which was obviously very showy and touristy since there were a bunch of people eating outside on the street with a singer serenading a diner. Not that there is wrong with being a tourist, but it didn't seem like too much fun to go with the "obviously" popular one. We always look for the restaurants with a decent number of customers too. 
Franchino had a good balance of popularity, good menu items, and reasonable prices; and the "good feeling" became more apparent to us during the meal, because we realized that it was a family owned restaurant with father, mother, daughter, son in law, etc. You can't help but feel good about dining at a mom/pop restaurant that only natives may only know about.

When I visit San Francisco again, I will definitely try to go there again. =)
author: Annette A.

description: It's been years since I first ate at Franchino, but based on its high ranking on Yelp I'm guessing it's still as good as it was when I ate here years ago during a visit to the city. My memory could be a little fuzzy but I remember it being some of the best Italian food I've ever had! It's a small family run place - wife in the kitchen, daughter as waitress, the owner (Franchino?) making sure the guests are happy... And happy we were. The service was great! They were more than happy to let me order something off-menu (apologizing for my food snobbery) but the pièce de résistance was when the bottle of wine we ordered with dinner ran dry, Franchino came to our table with another bottle and refilled our glasses (gratis) saying "I hate seeing an empty wine glass." 5 stars all the way!
author: Jonathan B.

description: Oh Franchino I want to love ya but I was not impressed at all.  Yes this is a cute tiny little mamma and pappa italian resturant but I was NOT impressed.  First of all if your bread sucks at any italian restaurant it is an indicator of what is to follow.  Ordered Caprese salad and it was just lame lame lame.  But i do have to say the pasta was quite good.   Overall it just did not blow me away which sucks cause we totally used the Yelp system for this one and it let us down. oh well you can't win them all.
author: C Y.

description: So very yummy! Loved the Mamma and Papa atmosphere.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
best itlaian i've been to in SF
family ran with pride and no pretence
wines are great
mushrom risotto is amazing
can get busy so be prepared to wait and haggle for a table
lovely staff
will be going again soon
author: david s.

description: Me and my friends decided to go to franchino again for a celebration. We came on a Sunday night and it was so crowded, we ended up waiting 1 hour which wasn't so bad. We were all craving franchino and we needed it out of our system haha The food was good, but I guess the reason for my four star is because the food wasn't as delicious as the first time. Their customer service is still outstanding. Our bills came out to 130 for 5 people which is not bad for good food!
author: stephanie n.

description: Took the Italian husband here for his birthday. He's rather picky about the Italian food and loves his pasta and vino. We were warmly greeted and taken care of by the delightful couple that runs the place. The husband would randomly break into song in Italian. Food was spectacular as was the service. Felt like a nice traditional Italian meal. Not cheap, but not outrageous. We'll be back some time.
author: Anne Y.

description: Fantastic! We arrived early for our reservation and while we waited outside, we were able to order a bottle of cab. There were six of us and each were given a generous glass of wine, and when we sat down at our table the man (owner?) at the door brought over a half-full bottle and said this was what we had left of that bottle we bought. We were all pretty sure he gave us more like a bottle and half for the price of our one simply because we had to wait. We definitely left enough to cover it in the tip, though. Service was great, all of our meals were delicious. Try the specials and the gnocchi. But, be sure to make a reservation because this place must only hold 10 - 12 small tables - definitely a hold in the wall.
author: Niki N.

description: I am so afraid to write this review because I wonder where the tipping point of good reviews causes hour-long waits and lines out the door.  This place is a "locals" gem.  Tourists just seem to walk past it (thankfully).  This is the one restaurant I bring all my out-of-town guests to impress them with the best Italian food in NB.  The Sicilian soup is phenomenal.  Sadly, the owners need to take a day off once a week, so it's "no soup for you" on Monday nights.
author: Karen R.

description:
We were looking for someplace to get a nice Italian meal that was close to the office and that could accommodate 7 people with no reservation. So I hopped on Yelp (where else?) to see what folks had to say. There certainly are folks in both camps for Franchino, but we decided to give it a whirl, and boy were we pleasantly surprised!

Everyone in our group was a bit put off by the barkers on the street trying to lure in business, but that's a fact of life when your stock in trade is serving tourists who have absolutely no idea where to eat when they're stomachs start to rumble. And the inside didn't help a lot - think Liberace with a *tad* less glitter and you get a vague notion of the insides of the place. But it IS charming in its own funny way...

But the highlight (as it should be) was the food. Folks in our group ordered everything from pasta to chicken to eggplant and each person cleaned his/her plate and was relatively silent while doing so - quite a compliment! I thoroughly enjoyed the risotto San Francisco - served with lumps of crab and partial crab legs stirred into it. Yum!

And I thought the service was efficient. Not super friendly but fine.

We'll definitely make the walk over for lunch or another dinner one of these days!
author: Elizabeth E.

description: With the food, it comes to 4 stars. But with the warm and fun Italian owners, it comes to 5 stars. It's not a easy job for me to give a 5 star (and actually, the food is really "just" 4 star) but the whole experiences is just wonderful. I had seafood risotto, with white wine sauce and the naturally flavored seafood broth.It was very good simply because the ingredient was very fresh, and the amount of seafood on top was very generous (10 clams,10 mussels, 8-10 calamari,8-10 little squid,8-10 pieces of salmon, 2 prawns). And it was just 16.95 before tax. What a wonderful treat in SF~
author: zoe w.

description: We went here based on all the Yelp reviews before us and we really enjoyed it.  The owner/dad is a real character.  The food was delish and the service was very friendly.
author: Baby J.

description: Now this place was GOOD.  We walked in early on a week night and the place was empty and I was starting to think that the reviews I read on yelp were for some other place.  We ordered a grilled veggie appetizer and it was pretty good.  The seafood pasta dishes though were amazing...great flavors and even though we ordered 3 seafood pasta type of dishes each one tasted different and was very good in its own way.  The thing that sealed the deal was definitely the tiramisu...I know, tiramisu is tiramisu right?  Wrong!!  It was different from all the other tiramisus I've had before and very very yummy and very creamy.  And of course, by the time we left the restaurant at close to 9 it was packed and now I know why.  At this time this is my favorite place in North Beach.  Still have a few more to try but will definitely return to this one.
author: Jean T.

description: I really enjoy coming to Franchino when dining in North Beach. It is the closest thing to what I remember growing up Italian, in NJ. The recipes are old world family style. The Mrs., who runs the kitchen, has what it takes to make you appreciate her style vs that of the more pristine competition in North Beach. Mr. "Franchino" is a welcoming host. I'm becoming a welcome regular.
author: Red C.

description: Eu concordo (I agree).  The average four star review for this place is not off the mark.  Great service.  Feels like you're eating at their house with the way Franchino and his wife talk to you.  They're really sweet and do a wonderful job making you feel welcome.  The food is yummy too.  I had the eggplant parmesan and loved it.  It comes with a side of perfectly steamed zucchini and carrots with excellent flavor.  Only thing keeping me from giving this place five stars would be the bread, could be better, was not incredibly fresh, but other than that I was happy with everything else.
author: Swetha G.

description: A group of us (6) went recently and had a terrific time. Food was excellent and we had the owners (family) select a few appetizers and they were amazing. Really good selection of Italian wines also (we bought 2 bottles). We ended with deserts and we were not disappointed. We are already planning a return visit since we live close to SF. As you can tell - we really liked this place and recommend it as one of the best in the North Beach section of San Francisco which is known for its Italian restaurants/.
author: Doug B.

description:
big group...
birthday party...
italiano...
cold peroni birra
amazing food...
vino...
Franchino...
pasta...
more vino...
great service...
yummy tiramisu...
author: B. W.

description:
Very good food for what it is.  Namely, a small family run Italian restaurant.  The family that runs the place was very friendly and provided good service.  We called that night, about an hour before and made a reservation.  Once we got there, we had to wait about 10 or 15 minutes, which is no big deal at all, especially for a Saturday night in North Beach.
I had the gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce, which they said they were "known for".  I loved it.  I never order Gnocchi when I go out to eat, ever.  Everyone seemed to really enjoy what they got, from Veal to Salmon to Seafood Risotto.  The food wasn't 5 star, but it was more then good enough.  Add that to the real Italian family kitchen feel and the neighborhood ambiance and I feel its worth the 4 stars.  And Yes, the bread is cold and lifeless, but know that and don't expect more.
Also, we brought in our own bottle of wine and with out a word, the waitress offered to open it for us right off and charged us the customary 20$ corkage.  They never tried to push or upsale us at all, which was nice.
One note about wait time:  The place is SMALL, maybe holds like 30 or so.  While we were there finishing up, a customer that made a reservation got very upset and created a scene about having to wait for 30 minutes past his reservation time.  He got angry and was raising his voice saying "why do you take reservations if you can't honor them, I'm NEVER coming back." Etc.  I'm sorry, but if waiting 30 min's on a NICE Saturday evening gets your panties in that much of a wad, what are you doing at a place like this? This is NOT fine dining.  Again, this is a great little neighborhood family owned and operated cozy place to eat.
author: Michael S.

description: I'll be honest, I was pretty disappointed. While the service was warm and friendly, the bread was stale, and the dishes were just so-so. It wasn't terrible, but I wasn't impressed either.
author: Brianne K.

description: Hands down, best Italian food I ever had. Get the gnocci!
author: Blake J.

description: This was superb!  We went late on a Sunday evening and had a wait, but it was well worth it!  Franchino served us wine while we waited outside and even brought out an appetizer (on the house).  Franchino's daughters served us, while his wife was walking around serving, too.  We asked them to just serve us what they'd like, and she brought out an AWESOME appetizer sampler (grilled smoked mozzerrella, cantaloupe wrapped in prosciutto, bruschetta, fresh mozzerrella with tomato and basil drizzled with olive oil) and pesto gnocchi and another awesome pasta (pasta was homemade by Franchino's wife). YUM YUM for food and the atmosphere and service was excellent as well.  We will certainly go again.
author: Aleah B.

description: kind of meh.  my friend had the waitress pick and whatever she brought him was really good.  but my other friend got the clams and linguine with a garlic sauce.  totally bland.  she even specified that she really likes garlic so it was really disappointing to have the dish smell slightly of garlic but taste nothing like it.  i had the fettucine al salmone, which was good, but not remarkable.  i guess if you're going, trust the staff, not your own taste.
author: Matti K.

description: Hands down, in my top 3 restaurants to eat ever/Italian - the place is family-owned, so you'll be greeted by the hostess who is the daughter and checked up on by the manager who is the dad. Vegetable or chicken primavera, lasagna, a glass of Chianti, and a small-ass place makes me feel like I'm in my parents' house. I've been there on dates, for my birthday with my family, and for small dinner parties, and every experience has been positive. The wait can be a little tedious for big groups (20-30 minutes), but I think it's worth it. They sort of have weird hours though, but your best bet will probably be dinner anywho.
author: Jenz y.

description:
the food here is phenomenal, but the atmosphere is lacking.  

franco, the owner, is EXTREMELY loud and very forward with the ladies, which is a little too much for me.  i definitely empathize with the reviewers who felt like he was interrupting their meal at times.

the speakers are horrible and whenever franco turns up the volume ( which happened a few times ) the music sounds very distorted and unpleasant.  

on the bright side, our food was absolutely delicious.  we ordered the vegetable lasagna and couldn't have been happier with it.  we also had a nice plate of bruschetta and the tiramisu ( which was yummy but not as spectacular as that other review made it sound ).  our peronis were served frosty, refreshing glasses.  

i really want to give franchino a 3.5, because 3 seems too low for the quality of food, but 4 seems high when i felt uncomfortable multiple times during my meal.
author: Charly G.

description: IF U R ITALIAN EAT HERE!! Its great customer service, def. Try all suggestions of the owners having a blast!!
author: Danielle E.

description: I love it five stars.. The owner and waiters are so friendly
author: Alaa A.

description: Homemade fettucini with Italian sausage special - delicious.
author: John R.

description: I can't believe that I'm saying this, but I actually found a restaurant I like in North Beach. Until now, NB was a black hole for me, foodwise. I had been to the Rose Pistola, and any restaurant anyone ever passionately recommended, and still no luck. But Franchino challenged my thought that NB was filled with tourist kitschy dives--a fun family-run place with the granfather walking out of the back immaculately dressed for his poker night, while the husband and wife are cooking their hearts out. I'm sending in my Italian spy, Aida, to verify if this place is as good asI think, and I'll check back after I get her full report.
author: Mudaba A.

description:
With all the positive responses that I saw on yelp, I decided to give Franchino a shot!  I did notice the family-like atmosphere from the moment I walked in.   The owner was talking with all the patrons, hugging the women, and being friendly with the guys.  
I ordered the 'spaghetti with calamari' which I thought was quite tasty.  I liked how they didn't drown my pasta with sauce and the spices I thought were perfect.   So with all these postives, why would I only give them 3 stars?  Well, when I first ordered, I asked for a couple of glasses of Merlot which never came until I had to remind her when our salad came.  The daughter definetly had a lot on her mind, because she forgot my order.  Also, when my spaghetti dish came, it didn't have a spoon.  I know Im being a little picky, but I think service is definetly as and even more important than the food...sometimes.  
I know everyone loves everything about this place...but if not for these little but important things, it would have been at least 4 stars.
author: Jeremy V.

description:
my mushroom risotto had ZERO salt in it.  and i didn't want to offend anyone at this family joint so i didn't ask for any.  but i still managed to eat it all anyways.

so they apparently "don't believe in deep-fryers"...so their calamari salad is just boiled calamari slathered with some dressing.  i think they should start believing in deep-fryers.

the 'dad' is very friendly...but also borderline "is he on something...?"  my friend hadn't read the reviews and thought he'd lost his mind when he started singing what wasn't quite a song and gyrating his hips right in front of her face.  it was more awkward than friendly.

i was looking forward to the food and left disappointed.
author: Adela K.

description: My husband and I went here for a well deserved date night and it was well worth it!  This place is small, but completely charming.  For an appetizer we had the smoked mozzarella with veggies app that was to die for.  The gongonzola gnocchi entree was killer, and very filling.  They had a decent wine list, very friendly, quick service, and it is always fun to have the 2 owners (a delightful couple) wandering around the tables.  We had a great, delicious night there and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.  Thanks for a great date night!
author: Sara J.

description: We love Franchino's! We come here every time we're in San Francisco, and it never disappoints. The food is excellent, the service great, and Franchino himself is a treasure! It's a small restaurant, but they always find a way to make room for everyone. Love it!
author: Barbara B.

description: I liked it.  It's cool to find a place that's family-owned and run.  We started off with the bruschetta for an appetizer, which was probably the best I've had.  I had the pasta pescatora, while my girlfriend ordered the spaghetti carbonera.  Both were quite tasty.  Overall a very good meal and very reasonably priced.
author: Karl B.

description:
Great food and solid prices in a small, family owned place.  The owners were very friendly and accommodating, and even told us we could come in after they were supposed to have closed on a Sunday night.  

I would describe the food as simple and top notch.  Bruscetta was very tasty, and the pasta dishes were delicious - really some of the best we've had.  We had a special tomato sauce and a pesto sauce.  Nothing over the top, just a perfect blend of texture and tastes.  It reminds me of Italy, and how even though you eat a lot you don't feel weighed down afterwards.  The owner said that it is because the ingredients they use are fresh every day, and I think it shows.  

I wasn't sure about 5 stars because I agree with some people that the place is a little worn, but the food isn't very expensive either.  Ultimately it is great at what it tries to be - a family place with fantastic food at good prices.  Very, very satisfying meal.  Will definitely be back.
author: Marc G.

description: Traditional Italian dishes, most of which are home-made. Dessert can use some work on presentation. Home-made Tiramisu is great. Not to mention the owner sings like he can win American Idle.
author: Joanne X.

description:
After reading the reviews on yelp, I decided to bring my friends from Italy to this restaurant before we saw Beach Blanket. THe owner was extreamly friendly until about half way through dinner. The pasta dish was great, but we made the mistake of letting the owner order for us. We  got a a mediocre salmon dish (very over priced that wasn't fresh. 
We had plenty of time before the show for dinner, and the restaurant wasn't busy. But when we didnt want desert, the owner ignored us and our plea to bring the check. We literally had to stand up and demand the check in order to get out of there. I will nt be going back there again.
author: Tony A.

description: Francino is a small but quality "by the book" italian restaurant.  They have a large menu for a small restaurant, good wine selection with knowledgable wait staff.  The cozy, friendly, family service is very relaxing and pleasant.  Not the type of place you want to make a reservation for, but drop in and feel like family.
author: Joe G.

description: I love this restaurant! The food here is as good as East Coast italian food. There aren't many places like this on the West Coast. The customer service is great too. The owner himself even hailed a cab for us after dinner!
author: Kelly D.

description: This absolutely my favorite pasta place in San Franciso. As an Asian girl who has an Italian alter ego I LIVE for pasta. My two favorites are their spaghetti with red clam sauce and the Lasagna. The food is tasty and the owners are so nice. It is one of the friendlier places in North Beach.
author: Christina Y.

description: We planned a family birthday event at Franchinos based on all the high ratings this restaurant received on Yelp.  Well, we couldn't have been more disappointed!!  Of all the great Italian restaurants in North Beach, we had to choose this OVERRATED, OVERPRICED and UNDERPAR disaster of a restaurant.  It's been a week since our visit and I'm still upset about our poor choice.  First, the food was awful - nothing was seasoned correctly.  The linguine & clams were dry and tasteless; the risotto was the worst I've ever had.  In fact, it tasted like burnt butter.  The veal parmigian was overcooked and way too salty.  Out of a party of 8, only 1 person was satisfied with their meal and I really think they were just being nice about the horrible situation.  Also, I made a point to let the hostess know we were celebrating a birthday the day I made the reservations.  I then reminded the hostess when we arrived that we were celebrating a birthday.  After our crappy meal, I again told the waitress twice of our birthday celebration --- nothing!  No acknowledgment, no dessert -- actually, no offer to even purchase dessert either.  Oh and the owner, I hear (actually read from all the reviews) that he sings at your table.  Really people?!  All the owner did the whole time we were there was smoke right outside the font door which, in turn, smelled up the whole place!  Never, never, NEVER again would I step foot near this hell hole!!!!!
author: Judy L.

description: I came across this restaurant haphazardly while walking along Columbus Avenue with friends.  This is a find.  The food was wonderful as was the hospitality of the proprietors.  My friends and I shared a combo plate of appetizers and the pasta special of pappardelle pasta with veal and chicken in a creamy tomato sauce.  The antipasto vegetariano was also very good.  All the food was well seasoned and flavorful.   The atmosphere was fun and boisterous.  I will definitely go back to this restaurant.
author: Ralph E.

description:
i had a gf who loved italian food 
so over the years we tried every damn restaurant
in north beach, 
hell probably in the city, 
and when all was said and done, 
Franchino came out a winner. 
A real friendly place, 
real people, 
and the tiramisu is better than god, sex and drugs combined. 
Perhaps the best I have ever tried. 
Take a date or a friend and go have a bottle of wine,
what the hell are you waiting for!
scat!
author: saru s.

description: This place was great. Very traditional Italian atmosphere - small tables (small place in general), mother and her daughters make and serve the food. Service is good, atmosphere is lacking, but food makes up for it. I had a veggie cappellini pasta that was so tasty, and my boyfriend had a wonderful fettuccine with salmon and mushrooms in a cream/tomato sauce. It was delicious. Wonderful bruchetta, flavorful, buttery fresh bread, and perfectly seasoned tomatoes. We ended with a very  nice peach panna cotta. I highly recommend this place.
author: Alisa M.

description:
I am always weary of eating in North Beach because of the whole tourist trap thing. Most places are overpriced, no where near authentic and some are just plan bad. 

Upon entry, we received a brilliant greeting by pop "Ciao, buona sera, come belle raggazzi! Bellissime! " Franchino is a little (unhidden) treasure owned by an adorable mom and pop. The decor is very homey and cozy. You feel like you may have walked into their own dining room. Small tables fill the restaurant and photos line the walls. The menu is short and sweet: different varieties of pastas, meats, desserts and wines. We were waited on by pop himself and he is a riot. I almost felt like I was at the House of Nanking and I'll tell you why. I couldn't make up my mind, so I asked pop what he recommended. Pop: "You like rice?"
Me: "As in risotto, certo"
Pop: "You like seafood?"
Me (a little hesitant): "Definitely" (Hoping that his definition of seafood wasn't old, smelly fish)
He scribbled something on his notepad and 30 minutes later I was staring at the most incredible salmon and asparagus risotto! It was a gamble, but it was worth it. My friends had the Gorgonzola gnocchi and the sausage pappardelle. Everything was totally delish. The service is a little slow, but I chalk it up to part of the charm. Franchino is charming, tasty and reasonably priced. We didn't try dessert, so we'll have to go back soon. On our way out, we all got kisses from pop and exited with full bellies and big grins.
author: Jenny S.

description: Really it's 4.5 stars!  .5 off for the wine which wasn't good, but not their fault.  This place is so cute, very San Francisco!  It's family run, which is adorable, and all their food is homemade.  If you can remember, save room for their tiramisu - unlike any other!
author: Ashley M.

description: This might be on my all time good list.  When someone says a place is "mom and pop" this is the definition.  Pop works the door or sidewalk. Mom and two daughters take care of the 26 seats in the restaurant.  Did I mention the food was great as well. Really cool place
author: Joe P.

description: This is such a good place.  I went there with my gf when she came into town and my bf about a month ago.  My gf wanted Italian food, and in north beach somewhere.  I wasn't sure where to go, so I YELPED it, and i found this place.  I love this place.  We ordered their shrimp fettuccine alfredo pasta cause my gf wanted a white sauce.  It was awesome.  The pasta was fresh, the alfredo was just right, not too cheezy, not too salty, and not watery.  Gotta come try this place.  Then this older senior couple sits next to us and they are old timers, they are probably in their 70s, but they look like they are in their late 50s-early 60s, they've been coming here over 20+ yrs.  They didn't order anything on the menu.  They asked the owner "what's homemade tonight?"  That's how they taught me to order for next time.  And when their food came, they even let me try a bite.  It was awesome!!! :)
author: Amy A.

description: Good food. The owners are friendly and funny. The place is really small though. You can probably stand in the middle of the main room and touch half the tables in the restaurant.
author: Steve C.

description:
anytime u get to hug the owner of the restaurant at the end of ur meal.. then its all good...haha..

the service, the food, the wine, and a big hug from the owner just cemented this place as a 5star establisment..
author: Carlo M.

description: If you get grabbed from the sidewalk to go into Franchino it will be worth it!  Good menu, reasonably priced, with very fun family feel.  Ok maybe most family dinners aren't fun, but this is a very cozy restaurant that treats the locals and tourists well.  Make sure to start with the bruschetta!
author: Johnson H.

description: The food was pretty solid but a little overpriced. I like the atmosphere a lot. The owner seemed very cool about moving us around mid meal but then didn't comp anything on the bill. Boo!!
author: M L.

description: For a very affordable Italian restaurant, I thought this place did an excellent job on the dishes that our table got.  Two got gnocchi and my pesto was great and had a little red pepper in the middle for nice presentation.  The other gnocchi with red sauce got some green parsley for the opposite contrast.  I sampled some squid from another's Pasta Pescatora which had a huge amount and variety of seafood in it and it was really good.  I might get than next time, though I'm not big into digging into clam shells to get that meat.   Bread was average, but there's enough carbs already in pasta that I didn't require outstanding bread.  Waitress was nice and personable and the patriarch of the place was amusing in his antics.  Bill was $31 a person with a bottle of wine and 3 of 5 people getting salad/soup.  They did forget to bring an appetizer of clams, but it probably was for the best since all were full.  Nothing fancy about this place, but the atmosphere makes you feel very comfortable and though a tight fit in the small space, I didn't mind that.
author: Marc S.

description: Okay, this is a typical family owned Italian restaurant. So expect so so food but great atmosphere (as another Yelper mentioned, the owner loves to sing.) I do think they can use some new paint or re-decorations.
author: T L.

description: Yum yum yum. My boyfriend and I found this wonderful place on yelp while we were looking for the best Italian place in north beach. Oh how right yelp was. I got the chicken piccata with a side of pasta. I cleaned the plate which I almost never do. The pasta sauce was my favorite, I could eat it everyday if I lived in San Francisco. Please check this place out, it's delicious!
author: Morgan J.

description: How can you NOT love this place?  Well, I'm sure that there are some that are looking for the modern ambiance with perfunctory service that may find Franchino's cozy, intimate, family-like atmosphere  too claustrophobic for their taste.  Yet, I am NOT one of those people.  I love the owner and this family run restaurant (with wife and daughter along for the ride) is just beautiful.  It is one of my favorite places to go to unwind.  The food is like home, but it is the atmosphere that I crave.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Great atmosphere, friendly staff, decent food. Not the best ever, but good. Pasta primavera had lots of veggies.
author: Amanda D.

description: I ordered the Fresh Pasta with sausage and it was the best pasta I've had, ever!  Granted I'm no Italian food expert, it was very tasty.  I want to come back here and try the rest of the menu.  I came here around 5pm and the place wasn't too busy yet.  The owners were really friendly and welcomed everyone who came in.
author: Tim L.

description: As you walk up Columbus you are enticed by the wafting smells of roasted garlic -- there are so many Italian cafes to choose from! We went with the #1 yelp recommendation and are glad we did. Although there is no street side seating, we had window seats with a great view of the busy street. We were immediately seated and we our orders taken quickly. The charm of a family restaurant - mom and grown daughters serving, father at the door greeting everyone "Buona Serra !"... I had a nice glass of Pinot Grigio and the bruschetta is the best I've ever had. Grilled in olive oil and crunchy on the outside- and wonderful tomato basil on top! The linguine and clams in white garlic sauce was perfect and my husband enjoyed spaghetti and meatballs. We shared Tiramisu - lovely dinner, very authentic cuisine from the heart of Italy.  We were finished in under an hour -- and didn't feel rushed.  When we left there was a line out the door!
author: Shirley D.

description: Loved the atmosphere, felt like you were in a homemade kitchen in Italy.  Our entrees were perfect!  Service was great.  4 stars because the bread was all right.
author: Diana C.

description:
This has been one of my favorite restaurants for a long time. I stumbled upon it on a busy night in North Beach. I decided to opt for a smaller establishment and hopefully avoid some of the tourists and general craziness.

I was delighted to find a truly family owned and operated restaurant that serves excellent food! Speaking with the husband and wife owners can only brighten up you day. 

The seafood linguine is loaded with seafood and I HIGHLY recommended it. Don't be lured by the "big box"  alternatives, this is definitly the place to visit in North Beach!
author: Valerie W.

description:
We were having a tough time trying to figure out which yummy looking Italian place to dine in. We passed by Franchino and I noticed the Yelp 4.5 star rating sticker they had posted. The prices looked reasonable and the food looked authentic. However, it also looked crowded and busy. Hungry as we were, we started walking away when the owner poked his head outside and said "how many are you? 4? Come on in here! We'll make some room for you!"
The waitresses (the owners' wife and kids) were attentive and super friendly. They gave us a really good bottle of olive oil with our bread, instead of the butter that everyone else seemed to have. The food was great. I had the mushroom risotto, which was delicious (though if you can't make mushrooms, cream and garlic delicious then there is something wrong with you). I also tried the seafood pasta (sooo much seafood! YUM!) and the pesto gnocchi (light and fluffy and fresh and tasty).
Will be back next time I'm wandering around North Beach
author: Lauren T.

description:
My wife and I went here yesterday around 9.20pm for dinner for her B'Day.  It was a bit busy but we found a seat without a reservation. We were seated by the owner. His wife and daughter were the servers. Simple but elegant decor. There was soft Italian music in the background. The owner seemed a bit drunk & would mutter in Italian but it was all good. The table seemed a bit cramped up but it was not that bad. . 

My wife had Fettuccine prawns with a tomato, basil sauce ($17.95) and i had the spaghetti with calamari ($14.95) in a tomato sauce. We got complimentary bread. It was not stale at all. I must stress on this. It tasted great with sweet creamy butter or with olive oil/ balsamic vinegar. Yummy. Are total was $36 not bad at all.  

I tasted both dishes. Our server added more grated Parmesan. The sauces were very rich and creamy. Ample taste and rich in flavor. I liked my wife's dish more. The food is very yummy!! 

I mentioned it was my wife's Bay but no complimentary desert, but we were too full. But it would have been a nice gesture as we were new to the place. Oh well...so knocked one star for that. 

We went to Steps of Rome Cafe for cappuccino afterwards.

Overall great value for the price and food tasted way better than Pasta Pomodoro. We might go back if we are in the North Beach. Maybe not to celebrate a special occasion. 

PS: for seafood I still recommend Soto Mare....
author: EthnicFood L.

description: When we travel we typically go to a variety of restaurants.  Franchino was so good that we ate there twice while we were visiting.  The business is family run and the atmosphere was exceptional.  The only thing that was better was the food.  If you make it here you have to get the gnocchi in the gorgonzola sauce.  I am not traditionally a fan of gorganzola but I will be craving this dish for a long time!  I would also recommend the veal or chicken parmesan and the grilled veggies.
author: Chris H.

description: Considering most places in North Beach are touristy This place is a favorite. I love that it is right next to the place that I despise ( stinking rose blehhh) Some nights the owner will sing in Italian to you. Intimate and delicious Italian food!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
We went to Franchino's last night based on the 33 yelps before me and we were not disappointed with our meal. The common dish price was about 15 bucks which lead us to think the food was served family style but when we asked the answer was "no but we can place the plates in the middle of the table and give extra plates" which we though was nice. We ordered the gnocchi with tomato sauce and the chicken saltinboca; the gnocchi had the right texture and tasted delicious; the chicken was very cheesy and delicious but my only disapointment was that I was expecting more, there were only  2 very thin pieces of chicken on the plate and for 15 bucks I expected 3 maybe 4; this was not too much of a problem since we are visiting from out of town and do not have a fridge in the hotel room but still I wanted a little more. For desert we had the tiramisu which was very good but on the small side; it was definitely portioned for 1 person.

Overall this was a great choice for dinner;  a dinner for 2 with desert will run you about 50 bucks with tip.
author: Richard L.

description: Excellent Gnocchi. Nice cozy place with good food.
author: Philip T.

description: This place rocks!  We found it on Yelp, and as we approached the restaurant, the owner was outside telling us, "this is the place."  He seated us and introduced us to his wife, who was our server.  A little later, their daughter came in with her family for Saturday dinner at Mom and Dad's.  Then she got up when it got busy to wait tables.  If you hate chains and love Mom and Pop restaurants, this is the place for you.  Great food and a family atmosphere.
author: Mike M.

description:
This is the best home cooked Italian food outside of my mother in-law's Buffalo NY kitchen.

The gnocchi was so light and puffy making it the best we have ever tasted.  The speciality of the day included home made flat noodles with sauce with all types of seafood that was fantastick.  While there were no meatballs that we would have enjoyed, the Italian sausage was acceptable.  The five of us enjoyed appetizers, dessert and Chianti and everything was soild home cooked Itailian food.  If you are looking for fancy and innovative Itailian food, go somewhere else.

We will definitely be back...  The pappa outside guarding the door, the momma with her apron on walking around and their ever so polite daughter were all delightful.
author: Mark S.

description: Really good food, although the cold calamari salad wasn't as fresh as I had hoped. The owners seem very warm and friendly. Charming atmosphere!
author: Katy D.

description: italian in little italy. it's no delfina or anything like that but it gets the job done.
author: gino a.

description: The owner Franchino is just the best he is a huge part of the evening at this cramped but very cozy authentic Italian restaurant's and I have been coming here for quite some time and the food never disappoints I might say the prices are quite reasonable for the quality of the food that is served here the food is just excellent.It is family owned and operated times in this place it has felt as I were in Franchino's own kitchen's and entertainment value 5 stars food is a solid 4 keep on cooking!
author: Joe M.

description:
At first I was against the N. Beach tourist trap in which most of the "Italian" restaurants are just OK.  Thsi place is cozy, authentic (some home made pastas, savory, and like being at italian grammas kitchen)!

This is a must if you like hot, fresh, savory Italian food.  AND the prices are so affordable.  I have taken a few foodie friends there and they all loved it.
author: S A.

description:
atmosphere: 4
food: 3
service: 4.5

closer to a 3 than a 4...
A nice departure from some of the larger restaurants, you can actually hear your company w/o shouting too loudly. It's got a comfortable feel, and I almost want to use the phrase "when you're here, you're family".

The owners are very nice and love to sing! get Bel Canto to sing by getting the entire restaurant to cheer and chant for him to sing!

we opened with a great antipasta which is NOT on the menu. make sure you ask for it. They charge $7/person. Appetizer consised of :
-smoked gouda (smoked in house)
-smoked mozarella with basil and tomatoes (smoked in house)
-carpaccio with cantaloupe
-eggplant stuffed with rocotta.

the table bread was dry and cold. eating it just passed time.

for entree i had the seafood risotto in the cream sauce. I love cream sauces, and it helped fill me with the already large portion. I wasn't crazy about the salmon in there -- smelled and tasted too fishy (a little cat foody) for me. The calamari was cooked TO PERFECTION (mario batali says calamari ought to be cooked 30 seconds or 30 minutes. anything in between is rubber bands). other dinner guests had butterflied shrimp and a side of linguini (cooked to al dente) and the other had calamari in re sauce with vegetables. Unless you really love calamari, the portion was a little too big to enjoy each bite.

Overall, a nice intimate, fun, family dining experience.
author: Miss C.

description: Excellent- love the Mom and Pop atmosphere, the fact that it never seems to be too busy to get a table, and of course, the food. Chicken porcini and pesto pastas were delicious!
author: Jay B.

description:
3.5 stars.
food good - not amazing, but more than decent - very good flavors.  portions not huge - pretty smallish, but sufficient.  very much what i'd imagine (hopefully semi-accurately) to be home-style southern italian cooking.
atmosphere good - franchino is hilarious but a little predictable in that slightly annoyingly obnoxious italian way.  
i had the gnocchi with gorgonzola.  very good.  others had chicken marsala (really nice sauce), chicken parm (good but also not as expected), caprese.  most entrees were under $20.  the montepulciano wine was good, bottle at $44.

i'd come back, but not before trying other places in north beach.  it's not my favorite place by far in north beach, there are other places i'd return to first.  even though it's not a tourist attractor, it still doesn't feel very natural.
author: C L.

description: Best Italian food I've ever had. The dad seemed a little tipsy, but maybe that's just his personality... He was funny though, interactive but not overly so. Fun place and romantic dinner.
author: Ryan P.

description: Cute and cozy family owned restaurant in the middle of tourist central...that's a find!  I have been here twice, once with a friend and another time with my boyfriend and I'll definitely be coming back.  The food is great, the service is very personal and the space is small yet cozy.  The owner, while most people seem to find it adorable, was a little too loud in such a small place. When he started singing, I couldn't hear a word my boyfriend was saying.  However, it's always nice to find a place with character and the Caprese salad and pasta dishes have all been amazing.
author: Shawna S.

description: one of the best experiences i had while visiting san francisco and i can't wait to go back!
author: tessa c.

description: I arrived here for dinner and was greeted outside the door by a sweet and friendly woman who looked as if she was inviting me into her home to sit at her personal dinner table.  The food was great.  I don't recall the exact name of the entree I got, but the pesto was so out of this world flavorful.  They use very good quality olive oil in their dishes.  Though there was a noisy group of people seated next to us, I was so occupied with enjoying the burst of flavors in my food, that the roudy bunch hardly phased me.
author: Damon Z.

description: Had lunch today at Franchino's on Columbus Ave. in North Beach.  Inside, it looks like home.  Bead-board wooden walls, photographs on the wall and murals of Capri and Ischi that look like they were done by someone's sort of talented cousin.  Much better "feel" than most of the other tourist-trap North Beach restaurants.  Place is family owned and run.  Mama makes wonderful home made pasta, and very good ragu.  I really liked the bruschetta and veal picatta.  Service was  just fine....unrushed, friendly and helpful.
author: Norman R.

description: I took my roommate and her parents here for dinner on a Saturday night.  As soon as I walked in I felt the family vibe with the owners asking my name and how I was doing an telling me that my party was late.  It was a great atmosphere!   The servers were also especially nice and helpful.  While it was empty at 6:30, there was a line outside at around 7:30.  I got the pasta primavera with pesto which was amazing, the pesto was very fresh and not too heavy on top of the light penne noodles.  Apparently, the wine was to die for, a Chianti although I can't recall the name, the owner said that they order it special from Italy.  We got the tiramisu and the chocolate dipped cannoli.  I would recommend both! The tiramisu was very light and airy with a strong espresso taste (my personal favorite). The cannoli lived up to my roommate's father's expectations who had never had good cannoli before.  It was a wonderful experience and I am planning on going back soon.
author: brittany r.

description: I was looking forward to eating at this family restaurant... I ate here during the 4th of July weekend and was so disappointed (we chose this place because of yelp).  The atmosphere was poor (could use some upgrading - it looks like they did not put a dime back into this place).   I was looking forward to some great Italian food (what we got was food that was luke warm  and nothing to get excited about).  The owner was friendly and the service was good but this place was a big let down!!!  I found a pizza place around the block that I thought did a much better job.. Next time I am in San Fran I will be passing on this location.  I still can't believe the disconnect from the prior reviews (big let down)
author: josh R.

description:
Based on the great reviews here, my husband and I decided to try this place.  It's a cute little restaurant.  The owner exuberantly greeted us at the door.  I knew instantly that this restaurant would have a lot of personality!   

There was a bit of a wait for a table so we waited while others finished their meals.  From the time previous guests left, it took them 15 minutes to turn around a table for us and several other guests waiting.  The wait was frustrating since we were both very hungry.  They just move at a very leisurely European pace.  

The fettuccine al Franchino and gnocchi were both good, but not outstanding.  

Positives:  
-Loads of personality
-Good food
-Very friendly

Negatives:
-wait
-slow service (though this seems to be standard at most authentic Italian restaurants)
-limited wine/beer list
author: Jennifer B.

description: Very cute little restaurant. Attracted by slightly more reasonable prices than next door and the Italian owner who reminded me of my grandpa. He is a character, singing at the tables, welcoming everyone. I was not impressed with my meat canneloni--didn't have much flavor. Other two people I was with enjoyed their dishes but definitely not the best Italian food ever.
author: Sarah C.

description: Truly 5 star! Doesn't look that interesting from the outside but when u go in u feel ur in a village in Italy and grandma an grandpa ar taking care of u and I don't even like pasta!
author: Z M.

description: Ok, so sometimes Franco can be a bit much but his wife's homemade raviolis!  Consistantly good food with a family run atmosphere.  We like the fact that we're supporting a real family business - Franco is the greeter/host/entertainment, his wife helps with tables and occasionally in the kitchen if she's in the mood, and their daughter helps with service.  Occasionally you'll even catch the young grandson lending a hand ...
author: Jessica G.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for our 2 year anniversary dinner because of all the yelp reviews....but OMG they just dont do this place justice...it is SO AMAZING!  The owner personally talked to everyone waiting to get seated and made us all laugh periodically, its a small place, and hurried to get us seated.  And the daughter was our server and the mother did some of that too...after talking to the mother i found out that she makes the pastas and sauces herself.  It was just so cute and felt like family, which is rare in a city restaurant or anywhere really.  And the food was so good we both ate all of it.  The owner sang a song and and was so friendly to everyone.  It was amazing.....The PERFECT dinner and it was such a special occasion, I couldn't imagine having gone anywhere else. 
OH and its really not that pricey at all...like 15-20 per entre
author: Natalie H.

description: The restaurant is small but has a great atmosphere and excellent service.  When you enter, the owner greets you loudly in Italian and seats you at one of the small tables.  The walls are covered in family pictures and wine bottles, making it feel rustic, cozy and authentic.   The food was very good.  I had a house salad and grilled chicken breast with the pasta of the day (rigatoni with meat sauce).  He had spaghetti with meat sauce.  The pasta sauce was light and tasty.  Overall, dinner was great.
author: Jay E.

description: Went here for a family dinner and it satisfied all.  The upscale decor fit right in with the food and wine selection.  Our table split a bottle of Pinot Noir which was the first selection on the extensive wine list, it was smooth and seemed to fit with everyones meal.  I recommend the local sidecar if there is a wait and you go to the bar.  A Piano player started later in the night and seemed a tad to loud to keep a easy listening conversation going, which was really my only compliant.
author: Justin K.

description: The food was great.  The portions were just right.  The atmosphere is exactly what I like.  The prices were a little high.  But it is a wonderful place with wonderful people....and I will be going back.
author: Stephen S.

description: This place was so much fun.  We got there at six and it was empty, which was perfect because we got the full effect of the owner and his family.  I had the Spaghetti Calamari and it was ridiculously good.  Aside from the food being really good, the constant entertainment was totally worth it.  The owner at one point asked my date to go outside and tell someone smoking a cigar to leave and smoke it somewhere else, even though he had smoked about 5 since we'd been there.  He also insisted that I finish off a bottle of his wine, which I was happy to help with since it was yummy.  Definitely worth it, get there early so you can enjoy the owners singing and conversation.  He claimed that at 7 the place would be packed.
author: Lindsay G.

description:
Decent price, great atmosphere, amazing food. I could not have taken my family to a better restaurant during their visit. 
    We were greeted warmly by the owner, and immediately seated at the tiny table. The swinging kitchen doors occasionally revealed bursts of flame from the skillets. In the corner, two neighboring tables were talking and joking loudly over wine and spaghetti. It really felt like you were among friends. Friends who really know how to cook.
   I had the penne with prosciutto which was heavenly, and my brother's gnocchi was amazing as well. The bread could have been better, but this was still the best meal I've had in the city so far.
author: Eric F.

description:
I have to add to the good reviews for Franchino's 
It is quite small inside but it has a great atmosphere. 
To make a long story short the wait staff was wonderful, it seemed as though a lot of them were family members and I loved how they all spoke Italian.....took me back to Italy. The food was also very good, everyone at our table really enjoyed their dinner and we all loved the homemade pasta. I had the Gnocchi with pesto and it was delicious and I am very picky with Gnocchi. As others have mentioned the owner was there and was he was very jolly....which added to the whole experience. We woud deff. return to this little gem.
author: L L.

description: 4 stars!?!? Are you kidding me Yelpers? The owners are lovely, hence the two stars but the food is very average American Italian and we paid $95 all in for two entrees, two desserts and a glass of wine.   A tourist rip off (I'm new in SF and am probably just going to stay clear of Little Italy in future: it's just as bad as Little Italy in NYC).
author: andrew l.

description: I've had the gnocchi here and it is fantastic. The place is pretty small, so expect to wait before you get seated, but it's worth it. I went with my boyfriend and the owner didn't want to seat us yet because he only had a table for 4 available. (Which I understand...this place was FULL). However, there was another couple waiting as well, so I asked them if they just wanted to join us at the larger table so we could eat. The owner was cool with it and it ended up being an enjoyable dinner! Great food, great conversation, the owners are very nice. We will definitely return!!! But next time, we'll take Muni, because parking is a pain!!
author: Nicole M.

description: We found this on yelp and it was just as others have written.  The owner greets you at the door and even though they were packed, they made room for us.  The service was great and the food was too.  Very nice place and quite genuine.
author: Barbara R.

description: I stumbled on Franchino after walking all over Columbus looking for an Italian restaurant. As a solo woman traveler I was looking for something less touristy, reasonably priced and where I would feel comfortable dining alone. The cute italian couple who run the place really make the atmosphere, I felt like I was visiting my (nonexistent) Italian grandparents. Franchino seemed surprised and amused that I was a woman dining alone which was funny. I ended up meeting a fellow solo traveler sitting next to me and we decided to eat together which was awesome! I had the caprese salad which wasn't great. it's served on a bed of soggy lettuce and the mozzarella wasn't fresh but it was edible. I also had the gnocchi in tomato sauce which was delicious. I would recommend it. My dining companion had the eggplant appetizer and the veal entree and said she enjoyed both. The best part of the place was the service and talking to Franchino and his wife. I would recommend it! It stands out from the other fancy, tourist trap Italian restaurants in North Beach.
author: Nes L.

description:
The food was very good.   Had a smoked mozzarella with peppers which was very good and something you don't see everyday.  Had calamari as an entree which was also good.

Given that this is a small restaurant, it probably isn't the best for large groups unless you wanted to eat later at night.

Decor of the inside is a bit dated, but you could also call it character if you wanted.   Not a modern interior.
author: Matthew J.

description: A great littleItalian restaurant in the heart of little Italy. The owner, Francino, is one of a kind and makes you feel like your his favorite customer every time. I've been to Italy twice and this is true Italian food. Absolutely amazing. Italian culture is family. And this place is Italian culture.  The one stop I know I will make every time I'm in San Francisco.
author: John W.

description:
Yum yum, simply fabulous.  I ate there twice and both times simply amazed with the food.  The pasta specials are to die for.  The home made sausage and sauce is delicious over any of their pastas.  The steak was juicy and yummmy.  The restaurant is tiny and you feel like you're in your Italian neighbor's home eating with them.  The owner has a loud booming voice and is very welcoming and attentive.  Their chianti is good and you will go back again and again.  I wish I lived near there to go there more often.

PS  Go there for an early dinner (5 pm) if you don't want to wait.  It's worth the wait I assure you!
author: Fudi C.

description: To give you the whole/short story of my search for the best Italian restaurant in North Beach I will tell you this. I searched YELP, and all the other possible resources out there for HOURS AND HOURS, looking to find the BEST reviews, so I could take my family to the most amazing Italian dinner of their lives. I am happy to say this Saturday night, we had that meal...so please let me share with you a lil bit about our experience, so if you are in search of this same meal, you will be just as pleased....or at least you will be able to make a decision, based on your needs/wants! This little restaurant is truly a family operated, very small, but cozy, and surprisingly not TOO HOT INSIDE restaurant's we first arrived, my only complaint was that we had made reservations a week in advance and we were seated at a two top with three people....the two I was with do not like to feel hot and sweaty well they eat, so I was a lil worried, luckily it all worked out though, it was not uncomfortable at all.....We ordered a bottle of wine, the prices were excellent, but the choice in wines could be a little better. Lots of Italian reds though...if that's your thing...My boyfriend ordered the lasagna, his mom, the chicken Parmesan, and myself the Gnocchi, because I had to see what all the hype was about...anyway...the red sauce and the lasagna, definitely was the best meal we ordered. Then I would have to say the Gnocchi, now since, I have never tried it before, i cannot judge, other then to say it tasted very fresh and homemade...all the pasta tasted FRESH homemade, like they had just cooked up the dough...the Pesto Sauce...amazing...the Red Sauce, even more amazing...the Chicken Parmesan I would not recommend, if you have to have the chicken breaded, although the owners wife told us why they don't bread it, and it made perfect sense....the egg yolk, if not used can not be saved until the next day, or people would get sick, and they want to avoid that, I like that cause it shows me they care about their customers...Anyway...I was very very happy with my meal...The lasagna was the best any of us had ever had....the dessert we had the homemade Cannoli, and a Cappuccino, sooo yummmy! I will definitely be going back to try the Cheese Raviolis!!!! I LOVED IT!!!
author: Nikki S.

description:
I came in on a Tuesday night, but the place was still pretty full, so it must be good right? Well, the food was tasty, but nothing to phone home about.

I had the Pasta Primavera w/ tomato sauce (pesto was the other option). I was told it's vegan without the eggplant, so I went for it without the eggplant. It was pretty good, a little oily. My friend had the chicken parmesan and she was still really hungry after (small portion, she said).

The other problem with the place was the owner was drunk and loud.

The Good: taste of the pasta primavera. The Bad: can't be too healthy, and as other reviewers said the table bread isn't that great. The Ugly: It's already loud enough without the owner screaming at people. I'm glad he didn't try to mingle with our table.
author: Andrew d.

description: Amazing! This is my new go to place in Northbeach. between the warmth of the family that runs it and the incredible homemade pasta, i was impressed.
author: Simon b.

description: I dream about the gnocchi....so delicious...little balls of delight!  Their pesto sauce was very good, and the service was fantastic.  The owners are very friendly, and they obviously care a lot about the quality of the food.  Small-ish place, so it was intimate and comfy.  Can't wait to go back and try some of the other dishes!
author: Jessica F.

description: Italian food is not my favorite (can't you make most of this stuff at home?) but this place is really something that people need to know about.  I had the gnocchi, so good.  Everything was fresh and prepared perfectly.  The best Italian food ever!!
author: Michael T.

description:
If you want to be apart of an Italian famiy or get to know why Italians are so great, bo here! Besides great service and family owned and run.... the food is amazing.  The best Italian restaurant in North Beach- 
I've been to them all!
author: katie c.

description: I moved to the city a few months ago but generally work too much to go explore good food in the city. My mom was in town and I wanted to take her to a cute italian spot but didn't really know where to go other than rollin' through Little Italy. We randomly stopped at Franchino, and it was the cutest place ever. It's totally family owned and there were little grandkids sitting nearby eating at a table. You could tell that the entire family runs that place and has probably their entire lives. It was really sweet. The food was BOMB and the price was super decent.
