The older man (who I imagine owns the place) just kicks it and drinks beers and sings loudly to the music playing. The environment is super cozy.  It was a great experience and I will definitely go back.
author: citygirls f.

description: Of all of the great Italian restaurants in North Beach, this is not one of them.  The doorman, whoever he is, is obnoxious.  My heart goes out to the wife (who now supposedly owns it).  The food was fresh and quite good but the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired.  The best dish, by far, was the gnocchi.  If you're looking in North Beach for good Italian restaurants avoid this one.  We live in the area and know most of them.
author: Marlene W.

description:
A wonderful cozy restaurant.  The owner is extremely friendly and a little drunken. I felt like I'm eating at the restaurant in Italy! I recommend their homemade gnocchi.
It's soooo yummy!
author: Rio R.

description: Cute, Quaint little place in Little Italy.  Family owned by Italians, which adds a fun flavor!  Service was quick, and the food was great!  Gnocchi was super fresh, and the penne a'amartacci (or something like that) was really good.  Overall an awesome place for great Italian food!
author: Whitney T.

description: read some of the reviews here and went and tried it.. Service was great but everything was straight from the steam table and tasted worse than my college dining room.  I was amazed that Italians could possibly serve such stuff and call it Italian food.. What ever happened to natinoal pride?  Save your money. This place is only for one time tourists..
author: ira l.

description: Fun place, great food.  I had the calamari appetizer with veal scaloppini - and it was amazing.  The place is  a bit crowded, but that is part of the charm.  I was there with one other person...and we actually ended up sharing a table with two strangers.  Not a fine dining place, but lots of locally owned charm.
author: David A.

description: Heard about this place from Yelp. First time, it was fantastic. Keep coming back & it only gets better. Family run, it is as friendly as can be - you are treated like old friends. Everything I've ever had has been fresh & incredibly tasty. Cannot recommend this place more highly. Warning though - it is small, recommend reservations.
author: Ronald S. C.

description:
So I feel somewhat bad about writing a negative review for this place since I generally love family-run businesses such as this one.  My experience was so bad tonight, though, that I feel like I have no choice.

My boyfriend and I ordered the carbonara and the gnocchi with pesto.  The gnocchi with pesto was really good - well cooked and great pesto sauce.  Unfortunately, the serving size was fit for a small child.  The carbonara was awful.  We have had a LOT of carbonara and this was one of the worst!

None of those things were really the problem, though.  Our main issue was how terrible the waitresses made us feel for not ordering an appetizer, dessert or wine.  I understand that they are paid with tips which come largely from the size of the bill, but I would think customer service is always the most important thing.  They continously asked us whether we were getting anything else and generally made us feel really uncomfortable.  We had plans to go to dessert somewhere else, and I almost felt like I had to justify myself!

Again, the family seems nice.  This is a true family run Italian place (the owner goes around singing loudly in Italian which we were surprised by but some people really enjoyed).  However, I don't like to feel THAT uncomfortable as a customer.
author: Holly S.

description: I went here last weekend, I had the pasta of the day and it was absolutely delicious.  The sauce was so good it was all I could do to not pick up my plate and lick it clean.  The service was excellent, the only thing I would improve would be the bread, it would be nice to have warm bread fresh from the oven.  But overall I have not had a pasta dish that good in quite awhile, the mushrooms and tomato's were so flavorful.
author: Nolan E.

description:
This is quite possibly, the best Italian I've ever had (albeit, I have yet to go to Italy).  Anyhoo, I came here with my secret lover and we shared the Gnocci w/ Pesto sauce and also the night's special dish, freshly made fetticini tossed with homemade italian sausage, mushrooms, and red sauce.  Both were very, very good...especially the fetticini dish.  We ate it like they did on Lady and the Tramp (I wasn't the tramp by the way).  I wish I could go back in time and eat that dish again....WHOA BABY!  Then as if I wasn't stuffed enough we walked to the nearby gelato place (had to complete the italian experience!) where I got to stare at the  gelato scooper with the cute smile as he beautifully pronounced the flavor names that I was butchering like it was my job....I hoped my date wouldn't get jealous but truth is I would have let him serve me creamy gelato any day....

....anyway, Franchino....good stuff, good stuff...
author: C S.

description: I found this place on Yelp when I wanted to take my Mom and Grandma out to good italian food.  The people who work there are great and can even stand my mom who asks a million questions about the menu and takes 10 minutes to order.  The bread was alright but it was followed by great food.  I personally got calamari and pasta, both with the same red sauce so it was a little much for me but my relatives' plates were delicious.  Also the calamari isnt fried here and I didn't know that, haha my mistake, great atmopshere for a family dinner
author: Bobby G.

description: The food is definitely good, but unless you want to be squished into a tiny table, forget this place and go elsewhere.  We had a party for 3 (Sat night) and were put in  tiny table for 2.  There was no way to keep bread plates, food plates & drinks on the table.  We watched as other 3's were packed into tables for 2 which pushed into the twosomes next to them.  I heard - you can't be serious when people were shown to their table (which is what I also said).   Again, food is good - maybe get it to go and eat it in the park - it would be more comfortable.
author: Anne R.

description:
Great food, atmophere, & service. 

Family owned and operated.
author: Dave H.

description: We found this restaurant by accident.  One evening upon finishing dinner, we were taking a walk up Columbus Street.  We happened to look in this restaurant and a gentlemen sitting on the table outside eating started talking to us saying that he dines there every evening and the food is great.  We went in to get a business card and the owner was so nice and friendly.  We said we would try this restaurant the next time we got together.  Had the customer not spoken to us, we would not have noticed this place.  This restaurant is stuck in between the Stinking Rose restaurant and Mona Lisa restaurant.  On Friday, we were getting together and decided to try it out.  My friends and I met at 6:30 PM and there was no one in the restaurant.  At first we were hesitant in going in because there was no one in the restaurant so we weren't sure.  We decided to try it to help out the little mom and pop family restaurant.  As we entered, the owner greeted us and was so friendly.  He made us feel at home.  We ordered Ravioli Porcini, italian wild mushroom sauce, which was a creamy sauce with meat.  The ravioli was the smaller sized ones and reminded me of the raviolis my dad use to make.  Another dish was Chicken Marsala, marsala wine and mushrooms served with pasta on the side.  The special was the pappardelle, which is their homemade flat, fat pasta with Italian sausage, tomato, mushrooms and garlic.  As we were eating, more people came in and the restaurant was slowly being filled up.  We think the waitress is the daughter.  She was nice enough to write down the name and spelling of the special pasta we had.  We all agreed the dishes were delicious and would definitely go back   Very nice family.
author: Mary C.

description: Franchino's is great!!! The food is delicious and the people are absolutely awesome! It's just like going to eat in their home, they take such good care of you. Try the seafood pasta! It's my favorite thing on the menu yum!!!! Bonus points for geography knowledge... The first time we went our waitress saw my boyfriends Italian last name on his credit card and correctly guessed exactly what part of Italy his family was from! Wow!
author: Tara T.

description: Like I always say, everyone deserves a second chance! So I went back with family this time. We had no complaints with the food. It was the service that absolutely sucked. The waitress took our order, forgot two peoples drinks and when they finally came, one of them was wrong. Ok no big deal at this point, thn our food comes... One persons soup was barely warm, and one dish came with cheese ALL over the dish and she specifically said "no cheese, I'm allergic". So the waitress gave her this "bitchfest" attitude and took the dish back and brought her the correct one. And who knows if it was spit in or something gross. So the waitress seemed a bit apprehensive about checking on us the rest of the time. A different waitress came over a couple times and SHE never offered to refill our drinks or refresh our cocktails... Bad service, and bad attitude AGAIN! cheers franchinos! You guys are horrible.
author: Maranda M.

description: Loved it!!  Closest thing we've found to Italy in San Francisco.  Atmosphere is great, food is wonderful, and the family puts a great personal touch on everything - we will definitely be going back!!
author: David L.

description: awesome! the food is amazing - the ambiance, owners and staff are dedicated. All around terrific North Beach dining experience.
author: Jane F.

description: Amazing! The gnocchi with tomato was fresh and delicious. My friend got thee eggplant parmigiano, also amazing. Friendly, attentive service and an excellent Italian atmosphere. A must go!
author: Rachael H.

description: Nice little place, stopped in late afternoon Saturday. Very friendly, great bread and had the pasta special, very tasty. Two glasses of wine and they did the job. I'd go back, owner is there to check on you and they really seem to care. Not a bargain, but in North Beach that's tough to get, but if you like a family atmosphere this is the place for you
author: Jim A.

description: Another review based on my love of both the food (phenomenal) and the owners (salt of the earth). My husband and I have been going here since we lived in the city a few years ago. Its family run, the dad is outside singing and greeting customers, mom's in the kitchen and in dining room mingling with customers, some of the daughters are waitresses and even the adorable grandchildren make occasionally make appearances. I would recommend always ordering whatever the daily special is. They have a veal and chicken penne pasta sometimes that is the stuff dreams are made of. I love love love everything about this restaurant. My husband and I briefly moved away from california two years ago, we went here a couple of nights before we left and I cried at dinner knowing how much I'd miss the food and the people here. It is a must!
author: Ann K.

description: totally awesome (and delicious) mom-n-pop restaurant.  my husband & i were visiting san fran, so we used yelp to help us figure out a place to go for his birthday.  i was in the mood for italian & it had good ratings, so it fit the bill.  it's right next to another fancy italian place & we were really tempted to go there instead since we were dressed nicer & franchino's looked a little less "nice place" in comparison.  i am SO  glad we still chose franchino.  the bruschetta was AMAZING - the bread was lightly fried so it was pliable & easy to bite too.  my husband go the fettucini alfredo (heard great things on yelp about it!) and it lived up to the expectations - buttery, creamy, delectable.  i got the special for the night - spinach-based manicotti (yum!).  then we shared the tiramisu.  that was a very different dessert from what i was expecting.  the lady fingers were very thin on the bottom with a really decadent helping of marscipone cheese.  from start to finish - franchino (who greeted us at the door, by the way) did not disappoint in any way or form.  have already recommended it to a handful of friends!!
author: katie s.

description: we walked right in on a jumpin' friday night, guided by the ever entertaining Franco, singing all the while, to a perfect 4-top.  excellent service by the daughters of the owners.  food and wine came out muy rapido and all was excellent.  delicious bruscetta and to-die-for homemade spinach ricotta with porcini mushroom sauce raviolis.  a classic north beach spot.
author: Betsy K.

description: My wife and I ate here with another couple last Saturday, and I was underwhelmed to say the least. For appetizer I had a listless plate of grilled vegetables (although presented quite well), while my wife had an adequate salad.  For entree I was torn between the Chicken Marsala and the Chicken Parm, the waitress recommended the Chicken Parm and when it arrived I was not sure what to expect. One bite and I knew I had made a tragic mistake. The overwhelming flavor was salt; bleh, think Chef Boyardee. Speaking of which, the side pasta appeared to actually be Chef Boyardee; a bland pasta in meat sauce (no warning of that the sauce would be a meat sauce, I hate meat sauce.)  My wife ordered a pasta with Shrimp and ordered it spicy; it came mild. While better than what I endured it was still not worth leaving the house. For dessert the cannoli was quite good, though I have not had coffee that bitter since the dark days of basic training at Fort Leonard Wood circa 1990. Come to think of it maybe the grounds were from Fort Leonard Wood circa 1990.  With all the competition in North Beach I can't imagine ever coming back. Where are all these super reviews coming from.  Puhleeze!!!!
author: Eric R.

description: Tried Franchinos Thursday night after a little help from Yelp. Parking on the street took apx 1/2 hr. Once inside I felt like I had walked into a family members home. The Prawns were excellent and my companion ordered the Manicotti, we were both very happy. Our server Carmela was great. Good price and I look forward to going back.
author: Bernadette M.

description: Great little southern Italian place. The owners were VERY friendly (even got a dance with the Sinatra look alike).  The fresh pasta was great and prices were good. This is the best Itallian I've had in a long time.
author: Joanna C.

description: Disappointing on Tuesday night.  We were excited about trying Franchino after reading the reviews here.  I had the cozze marinara and found it to be a little overcooked (small nuts in a big shell).  The marinara was just ok, not to dip too deeply over.  My main course was the risotto bianco (cozze and vongole in white wine sauce).  They offered me parmigiana cheese (a no no). My assessment of the risotto was a lost cause but I still had an opportunity to try what my spouse had ordered.  My spouse had gnocchi alla gorgonzola and fresh shaved parmigiana would not have rescued the sauce.  The gnocchi themselves were good, though.  Overall, the highlight were the glasses of wine.  We were offered dessert/caffe but based on the show this evening, passed, and decided to scratch Franchino off our list.
author: Ken A.

description: I hate the cafeteria feel in the back but outside or in the front window it is nice.  It's tight back there and kind of just dark.  Not my thing.  But the food is good and consistent every time.
author: Misti L.

description: The food was good at Franchino, and the service we received from the two ladies could not be faulted. I cannot say the same for the owner. My party (6 people) was having a great evening. We were finishing off our wine and dessert when the owner suddenly yanked the chair out from underneath my friend and gave it to another table. When I politely questioned why he did that, he told me to be quiet. He is also very forward with women and insisted on kissing everyone (to a point of being creepy). The owner really ruined our night and I would not recommend this restaurant because of him. He is loud and obnoxious.
author: Marcus B.

description: Tried this out on a whim on Tuesday night.  I have to say, I walked away disappointed.  The food was good for sure.  The portion is what bothered me.  I ordered a chicken dish (I don't recall which one) with prosciutto, mushrooms, and onions.  Delicious!  The problem was the amount of chicken.  Three 1/4" slices of chicken breast.  If I am going to pay $15-$20 for a chicken dish, I expect a chicken breast.  Everything else about the place was great, but I felt nickel and dimed by the half serving of chicken.  I am a big guy and like to work out and do not want to fill up on pasta.  I need my protein.  They would be well served to offer a larger portion as an option.  Good food though, and if you don't mind a small portion of meat, you'll like this place.
author: John M.

description: Over-hyped on yelp.  Many more Italian restaurants in North Beach are better.  Food was good - 4 star worthy but service was completely indifferent - 2 stars at best.  I felt like we were a burden to our server though the bus boy was much friendlier.   Won't return again.  Entrees were also about $3-5 more than better places down the street.
author: Stacy N.

description: It was good...not amazing. Think money is better spent at Ideale or E Tutto Qua. Although the family that runs this place is very kind, the food really wasn't all that good...not bad, but very run of the mill.
author: Lady L.

description: This restaurant beckoned us in with it's charming interior.  It's a bit small and the seating is very cozy.  Whenever I've come by, it seems to be the same family running the place.  The food, however, is fairy hit or miss.  I had a risotto dish and loved it.  There were bits of savory porcino mushrooms that were heavenly.  We tried the tiramaisu and that was fantastic (and home made).  The pasta dishes were mediocre, but the duck was simply disappointing.  It was flat and felt tough.  It was also tiny.  The cannoli was also fell short of our expectations.  Were it not for the lack of consistency, I wouldn't be so hesitant about going back.
author: Raz R.

description: We had a great time here! The server was very knowledgeable (I think she may have been related to the owner), and helped us make our selections even though we had a vegan among us (i.e., not Italian food-friendly). We had the best bruschetta I have ever had, it was light and clean, you can tell they had used a really great Extra Virgin Olive Oil, because it had such a fresh taste. All of the non-vegans shared our entrees (Cannelloni Della Casa, Gnocchi, Risotto with red sauce), and we all were happy with what we ordered. My cannelloni was fresh, had great sauce and cheese, and tasted authentic. We splurged on desserts (berries and mascarpone or zabaglione, I don't remember; tiramisu; and something else with berries that was awesome), which completed our meal nicely. I'm bringing my Sicilian grandmother back with me; we don't have the same cuisine but I know she would appreciate their hospitality.
author: Danielle D.

description: i love this place!  when people come to visit, this is one of the places on "the list" - it doesn't always happen, but it is always a place i intend to share with others.  the gnocchi is AMAZING!!  they have a gorgonzola cream sauce, you can do 1/2 of the cream sauce and 1/2 of their homemade pesto sauce over the gnocchi - to die!  the owner is so friendly, his daughter waits tables, his wife is there helping, sometimes a grandchild is in the mix - really great place!  highly recommended!
author: Meagan K.

description: I'd like to start out by saying that I'm an avid yelper, but this is my first time actually writing a review!  This should tell you something right off the bat.  Franchino is soooooo good, it compelled me to finally create my own log-in and spend time writing a review.  I'd also like to mention that I've lived in North Beach for 2 years now and consider myself, not officially, but informally, a "pasta connoisseur".  This is definitely tied for first as far as the best Italian I've EVER had.  I brought my mom here for her birthday and we were seated almost immediately by the daughter of this quaint family-owned restaurant.  We started off with a glass of wine each and an order of bruschetta.  Now, I've never eaten IN Italy but this has got to be the best, and probably most authentic, bruschetta I've ever tasted!!!  It was orgasmic!  We didn't let a single piece of tomato escape.  Each one was perfectly toasted with the just the right combination of garlic, olive oil and tomatoes.  Pure heaven!  Then our entrees arrived...her's the Gnocchi Gorgonzola, mine the Tortellini Alfredo.  Oh. my. goodness.  BOTH cooked to perfection.  The gnocchi literally melted in my mouth while the tortellini were perfectly al dente.  The alfredo; also incredible.  Not too thick, not too watery, with just a hint of nutmeg for utter satisfaction.  Now, I also need to mention that I eat out quite a bit and it's literally been YEARS since I've walked away WITHOUT a to-go box, but this time, I couldn't bare to leave anything untouched.  Nope, nothing this good!  I cleaned my plate, every last drop...We finished off the night with the homemade tiramisu, a very pleasant finale.  I'll admit, not the BEST I've ever had, but still wonderfully good.  Don't let that stop you from giving it a try.  All in all, I will be back; many, many, many more times.
author: Kelly H.

description: We ordered the risotto and home made pasta in tomato sauce. The pasta sauce tasted what real tomato sauce should be. The risotto had a slight ting to it and its refreshing vegetables. The ambiance of the restaurant was quaint. The only problem was getting seated. When we entered we couldn't get the host's attention to get seats. It was a bit intimidating. But once we were seated the Italian host (who I assume is the owner) for very amiable and seemed a bit tipsy. Overall, the service was hasty, the food was excellent and I would definitely go again.
author: Will S.

description: It's nice because it's not fancy or big.  The menu is large, though.  The family run aspect really does add something to the experience.  If you are looking for a place that serves a lot of pasta dishes, this is a great place to go.  It's definitely not my favorite Italian in SF, but it was very good.  I had the special, penne with chicken, mushroom, and veal and the overall flavor was great but the texture of the meats left a little something to be desired.  My grandma loved the meat lasagna and my mom ate the entire plate of chicken parm.  My husband and I shared the starter salad, which was huge and filled with veggies, so we only ate about half of our pasta.  I can't remember the name of what he had but it had ham in it, which was quite good.  Entrees run $15-20 for dinner and you get a decent sized portion for that price.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I truly LOVE Franchino's.  We stumbled upon this small family run restaurant like 9 years ago and it's really the only place we go to in North Beach anymore.  After trying "Stinking Rose" right next store and a few others, this one always wins out in every category (quality, service, noise level to name a few).  Franchino is fantastic as are his wife and daughter(s).  I also LOVE supporting one of the only family run restaurants left in North Beach.
author: Jessica H.

description: gnocchi is yummers.  layout of restaurant is a bit tight.  but the dinner had a nice family-run feel.
author: Tim C.

description: Franchino's is amazing! One of the few mom-and-pop-type places still around. The whole family runs the place with wonderful service and great recommendations. Franchino will even sing to you if you ask nicely! Amazing sampler appetizer, and great homemade desserts. The food is just amazing, really. Great wine selection as well! It's a must try if you haven't already. We've been going for two years now and have never been disappointed.
author: Alex M.

description: Superb food prepared and served by a charming family.  After reading other reviews here we were careful to arrive on time and prepared for a short wait for our table - but no problem: The very friendly owner met us out front and we 4 were seated right on time for our 7pm reservation.   My wife had the caneloni special. I had the cheese ravioli with mushroom sauce, daughter #1 had the seafood pasta and daughter #2 had the pesto gnochi.  We started with house salads and finished with a shared tiramisu. All of these were excellent - some of the best Italian I have had - and I've had plenty.
author: MJG C.

description: cool w/ it being small family run place.  bread not good.  pasta itself was fantastic but the dish i ordered wasn't my style.  more of a showplace italian destination for out of towners for sure.
author: Brian D.

description: I found this restaurant by the recommendations on Yelp. My husband and I ate here recently and really enjoyed our entire experience. It is family ran business and they take the time to get to know something about all of their customers. It is apparent that they really take care of everyone, especially their local customers, like us! After our meal we were given two complementaries glasses of port wine, an added bonus to our wonderful evening. I had the vegetable lasagna. It was very very cheesy and not a lot of vegetables so I do not think I would get it again, or I would order the meat lasagna. My husband had the Cippino, which he really enjoyed with fresh grilled vegetables and the best garlic bread (so good, I ate it). We got their at 6pm on a Friday night and were seated without any delay. We look forward to our next visit, that is for sure!
author: amy s.

description: Delicious! Love Franchino. Everything we had there was amazing. He's quite a character which adds to the dining experience. YUM!
author: alice k.

description: My in laws were in town and I thought it would be fun to take them to North Beach for some Italian food.  Instead of going to my tried and true places like Tomaso's and Sodinis, I decided to branch out.  Franchino had a lot of great reviews so I made reservations.  Franchino is facing Columbus street and has the total vibe of your basic tourist trap.  I was hoping that in spite of the lack of ambiance, the food would shine.  Not the case.  The food was very disappointing.  First off, we had some basic salads.  The tomatoes were waxy and had no flavor and it is tomato season!  For my main I had the linguini and clams which was too salty.  My mother in law had an inedible penne pasta dish that was so spicy one could only eat a few bites.  The waitress assured her beforehand that it was not really spicy at all.  My husband ordered the lasagna that was not very good either.  Rather than being smothered in a tangy meat sauce the way we prefer, it was more the kind of lasagna that is made with an overly creamy bechamel sauce.  I found it too creamy and somewhat bland.   The service was friendly,  but not great.  My main course did not arrive at that same time as everyone else's which is always awkward and annoying.   i will not go back to Franchino.
author: Denise M.
